ierome osorivs byshopp siluane portingall slaunderous inuectiues aunswere apologeticall necessary defence euangelicall doctrine veritie first taken hand walter haddon vndertaken continued iohn foxe englished iames bell esay cap shall man hurte slay holy hill sayth lord iesus christvs london printed iohn daye dwellyng ouer aldersgate anno christian reader experience hath taught gentle reader daungerous troublesome age comitt thyng printe thy behoofe farreforth hath frettyng caker carping curiosity preuailed busily pryeth euery printer shoppe wayward churle zoilus diuers variable wittes disposition age readyer breake downe open roades thorough men hedge stoppe neuer little gappe frythe owne aunswered greatest barker commonly best byters falleth parte bytesheepe curres smell cudgell gentle houndes feede croomes leaue selues whose sinister iudgement litle regarde groape prayse onely purpose profitt vnlettered english men emongest gentle natured interprete best findyng ought amisse courtesie rather correct trust carpyng condemne course labour whose onely behoofe benefitt aduentured vpon translation published printe bytternesse speache occurre first blushe may happely breede offence call remembraunce sharpenes speach vttered kyng dauid apostle paule holy one selues almost feruencie zeale agaynst enemy god aduersaries crosse christ offence lesse offensiue respect opposed aduersary whose mouth ruffleth runneth ouer euery ruffianlike rascallike tearmes agaynst dread souereigne agaynst highnesse nobilitie agaynst subiectes whole state gracious gouernemet vtter defacing gospell grace true harted englishman endure read without greeuous anguishe mynde licentious lauishenesse rayling tounge sithence outraged monstruously conuenient mette withal libertie free speache gentle prelate beyng otherwise squeymishe heare shrewde wordes might hereafter learne wryte modestly beseemyng pastorall dignitie functio geaue lesse occasion iust reproche rest commende thy gentle consideration requiryng none guerdon thy handes trauaile thy frendly acceptaunce spare thyne idle tyme employed perusing thy better instruction shalt thou encourage knowledge shall increase oportunitie serue acquaynte fruites rest labour shall hereafter vndertake conduct god holy spirite enlighten thyne hart spirituall vnderstandyng glory name establishement thy fayth farewell thy fellow seruaunt lord iames bell right honorable good lord phillippe earle arundell grace peace spirituall consolation christ iesu might iustly wondered right honorable bright sunneshyne gospell grace plentyfully ouerspreading noble island resplendisaut beames many englishe endimions could cotinue long amazedly dazeled sight able lift vpp eye sleepy affection conceaue much lesse pearce amyable closettes thereof old auncient enemy mankynd sworne aduersary true religion vigilaunt lulle securitie sluggardes willyng awakened lamentable blindnes behold happy course floorishing continuaunce sincere religio ponder vpright ballaunce vnstayned affection glorious manifestation auncient apostolicke doctrine withall looke maruelous discouery counterfaict synagogue rome could wonder blockishe sensibilitie manifest light man would haue thought though sathan hadd transformed selfe angell light yet long haue preuayled especially emongest sharpe sighted deuines cunnyng caruers scripture profoude doctor schoole thorough anatomy vsually made manner artes discipline doctrine man would haue thought knowledge heauenly doctrine christ beyng partes forcible mighty operation able selfe drawe moue stirre renew chauge men search examine cutt quicke ope filthy soares sinne launce festered impostumes fowle affection pearce inward secrett partes hart sacke subuerte kingdome sathan destroy whole armye could authoritie maiestie thereof haue stayed holden backe crushed peeces deuises attemptes cou termoyles sathans minister sort either admiration amazed might astonyed mouthes stopped might vtterly confounded strength gospell accordyng read neuer man spake like vnto man iohn yet loe carefull watchefullnesse emperour darkenesse suffer carelesse drowsinesse scribe pharisee acknowledge promised messiah though come emongest owne yea though eye see blind restored sight dumme speake deafe heare man sinne sitt chaire pestilence moyling turmoyling peruertyng subuertyng razing defacyng reuelyng ruffling maner horrible abhominations euen iewes deluded fanaticall spirite coceaued vayne foolishe opinion messiah come worldly pompe princely magnificence maner earthly potentate make lordes earth euen iewishe romanistes carryed like phancie forged vicar christ bewitched false persuasion stately royalty visible glorious synagogue haue myndes busied nothyng much magnifieng exaltyng glorifieng thereof blazing abroad world vayne glitteryng shewes stagelike ceremony friuolous tradition peltyng deuises drowsie dreames owne idle braynes deliuer ouer many oracle heauen contrary expresse word testament grace doth minister men abou dauntly thynges sufficient obteinyng euerlastyng health saluation whole earth swarmeth euery bookes wrytinges testifieng age much pestered authours notwithstandyng allready may satisfied altogether cast ouer reprobate mynde manifold au sweres many learned father faythfull seruauntes god euen full might ghostly byshopp ierome osorius vpon learned aunswere made haddon slaunderous libell presumptuously pearching highnes flattery lye haue stayed course scilece prouided wisely creditt good name otherwise hadd bene made notably infamous world rayling reply agaynst haddon bene published abroad tell whether hath pleased lord rayse vpp iambres moyses styrre vpp proude popishe holofernes notable champion romaine nabuchadnezer make prowde challenge agaynst poore cittie bethulia tell lord haue appointed semey rayle outragiously agaynst dauid tell god haue hardened hart pharao people israell might greater glory passe fromout miserable captiuitie oppressing egipt great god israell maruelous workes onely touche small rodde deuided readd sea made become drye lande passable way people retournyng waues thereof vpon pursuyng enemy vtter ouerthrowe pharao charettes hoaste gaue headd stought warriour holofernes handes seely woman caused rodd aaron eate vpp roddes thenchauntours sorcerer egipt onely breath mouth hath daunted insolencie popishe challenger beyng esteemed emongest englishe papistes notable prelate age hand weake englishe pastour discouered colour nought el vayne bablyng rhetorician full wordes altogether voyde matter notwithstanding malicious peruersenes world onely alone beareth price carryeth greatest creditt estimation writer tyme euery whose sentence reputed oracle heaue odde man whole world ierome osorius able aunswered much lesse confused protestaunt whatsoeuer hartely wished authour selfe would haue deliuered trauayles herein englishe toung vnlettered englishe man argumentes herein comprised might haue bene able stoppe mouthes wayward english cauillers supporter quarell respected ende though plausible owne countreymen yet much comodious generall common weale christendome right well perceaued though osorius roaued england name yet bent shotte agaynst generall state christianitie therefore necessary osorius made challenge knowen whole world world also might made acquainted encounter would haue sayd vtter ouerthrow benefite whereof though haue redounded many particuler person within realme yet hath bene vniuersall needefull respect multitude onely regardyng name fame man sayd scarsely persuaded may possibly aunswered passe ouer worthy prayses booke selfe iustly deserueth excellencie matter worthynes maner faythfull seruaunt christ john foxe hath handled yet dare promise boldly pronounce men may readyng embracyng beleeuing followyng doctrine conteined booke throughly furnished well especiall principall pointes christia religion namely iustificatio election regeneratio redeption onely merite meane pure precious bloudshed immaculate lambe slayne foundatios world layed singuler comfort soules also argumentes herein conteined armed pointes agaynst assaultes practizes massemoungers meritemougers pardonmoungers confessionmoungers popish rable whatsoeuer world traslation dare affirme otherwise haue trauailed therein faythfully accordying measure grace lord hath geauen doughtyng atteyne wished successe vouchsafe simplicitie eye willingnesse hart read search examine stand vpright perusing haue poore abilitie trauayled therein certes purpose profitt countrey men generally fruites labour haue thought good present dedicate honorable patronage moued hereunto comendable report opinion men coceaue honour godly zeale zealous godlynes singuler glory name vnspeakeable cofort godly well acceptyng good liking whereof iudge altogether necessary seeke circumstaunce persuadible speech enduce honour saue onely bare cosideration woderfull fruite may reaped readyng contentes namely proceedyng fro well knowen spirite godly faythfull seruaut god wherein albeit translation atteyne absolute excellencie perfection dignitie matter doth require right ought haue bene deliuered wise respect diminishe worthynes author yet much retcheth ende whereunto directed namely benefitt church god vtter ouerthrowe malignaunt church sathan minister dought honour vouchsafe thereof accordyngly iesu christ sonne heauenly eternall euerlastyng father preserue honour spirituall grace heauenly wisedome prosper proceedinges establish fayth fructifie study multiply consolation direct wayes finally blesse harte desire increase much honor world glorifieng body soule immortall glorious kyngdome heauen euer euer amen honour lord iames bell p renowmed puissaunt prince sebastian king portingall euerlasting grace peace prosperous reigne lord sauiour iesus christ hadd vndertaken enterprise beyng enduced earnest cosideration cause take hand present necessitie tyme allurement priuate commoditie presumptuous oftentation vayneglorious persuation mynde renowmed vertuous prince kyng sebastian onely haue bene accoumpted blameworthy iudgement godly also haue willfully plunged selfe deserued obloquy world beyng poore despised abiect seely wretched vnderlyng meere straunger farre seuered distaunce place without maner acquaintaunce either name title neither called comeded desert person comau ded hereunto dare boldly presume write vnto highnesse beyng mirrour princely dignitie occasion moued attempt maiestie seemed small importaunce oportunitie matter selfe yelded vnto lesse euident argument assured affiaunce audacitie though vtter apparaunce vnseemely yet pardonable trust vpon due examination cause yet besides alleadged necessitie emplyeng reasonable excuse wanted many others commendable aydes defend enterprise like example applyed like cause may allowable ierome osorius beyng priuate man lesse estraunged societie common weale professed enemy religio embrace englad prouoked either vayne glorious oftentatio greedy desire maintayne owne religion deface vnder zeale pretensed good affection borne durst bold onely write long tedious epistle royall excellent queene elizabeth also vnprouokedly aduertize highnes matter inconuenient daungerous soules health condemned insolency inflamed sincere inclinatio humble dutie towardes valiaunt prince sebastian kyng portingall lesse famous princely vertues valiaut administration power allured notable reporte incomparable bounty send humble greetyng lord iesu two three wordes maiestie recommendyng highnesse gracious protection allmightie lesse increase perfect peace tranquillitie letter inwardly wishe maiesty fro bottome hart neither see reason contrary embraced coceipte driue endeuour hauyng many notable commendation vttered euery godly personadge behalfe famous kyng sebastian renowmed eche coast excellencie prowesse noblesse dignitie sithence osorius pleasaunt blast trompe fame hath presumed farre vpon vnspeakable clemency queenes excellent maiestie neuer sawe also highnesse aboundaunt grace hath great lenitie entertayned letter osorius gently perused though otherwise perhappes vnworthy noble personadge persuade selfe obteine much yea rather princely magnificence heroicall clemency especially sithence cann credible kyng sebastian beyng man cann ioate inferiour elizabeth woma queene princely ornametes dutie humanitie peraduenture founde farre emongest v comparison make betwixt v two osorius seeme respect agreable much beyng constaunt frend true catholicke churche alleadge doth take vpon comme dable necessary cause defence say sett purpose proclaimyng ope warre agaynst aucient catholicke church agaynst sincere religion agaynst approued supremacy byshop rome hath bene allwayes hitherto atteinted iudgement monarch consent degree condemned banished ought meanes admitted courtes eares prince matter exempt protection priuiledge godly lawes obiection new thyng whereof haue long agoe well aduisedly debated selfe yea selfe thyng royall kyng wherein become preset maiesties humble suppliaunt whereof determined beseech highnesse bowel lord god whose aucthoritie person represent realme ye would vouchsafe due consideration ierome osorius byshop syluain bandyng enforcing knowledge skill agaynst professed doctrine religion publiquely receaued england hath published printe three famous libelles vnder title aunswere maister haddon reply wherof haue framed accordyng slender capacitie apology conueniently purpose haue say successe come handes lord surely garnishment phrase stile thereof haue great regard contention tendeth blazyng excellency eloquence neither treate delicacy finesse speach neither descant lyke minstrelles warblyng stringes ne yet tosse question fro vaunt brauery witte sophisters vse argue moates sunne triflyng dunsticall schooles dispute deuines matter greatest importaunce true righteousnes way eternall saluation euerlastyng damnation true woshippyng allmighty god apology aunswere quarrellsome slauderous reproches osorius simple soeuer appeare haue thought man meete presented maiestie excellet kyng sebastian humbly craue desire wittnes iudge controuersie question wherewith osorius doth inueigh agaynst v suppose allready well knowen grace therefore petition desire obteyne highnesse effect much osorius hath vttered cunnyng eloquence meanes may possibly depraue v vnhonestly reprocheth name lutheranes onely vnto maiestie prince christendome also thereby bryng v vnappeasable hatred may please royall maiestie godly prince conspire geaue sentece agaynst v matter heard debated betwixt v highnesse especially noble kyng portingall hauyng allready seene clamour brables osorius beyng best chiefest argument vseth deface order obseruation profession vouchsafe also like equitie patience minde admitte confutation thereof presence whereby eche partie beyng discouered according truth highnes may certeinly determine cause notable law othe established iudgementes auncient athenian heare eares indifferent eares open eche partie maner custome vsed dayes perplexitie cobate opinion byshops armed aucthoritie prince doe stand raunged mayne battell agaynst manifest veritie doe bende whole cosent fayth one partie libertie mutter vtterly cutte partie may contrary doubtfullnes paradueture trouble royall thought much proceedyng gracious nature whyspered godly eares subtill slaunderous practizes glaueryng glosers vnder counterfaict vysour glorious couterfaict church haue wonderfully bewitched eye eares many noble personadges vnder pretece succeeding course many yeares make glorious bragges newfangled church wherein romish byshopp enthronized onely catholicke church supremacy thereof onely obeyed alleadgyng church empresse gouernesse church right ought esteemed aboue kinges emperours ouer christ hath substituted byshopp rome sole vicar vicegerent earth therfore degree ought may safely submitt themselues aucthoritie determination churche beyng continually vpholden power blessing holy ghost neuer seene hitherto haue erred ne yet could meanes swarue one title right lyne knowen trade true fayth taught holy scripture person whatsoeuer sequestering theselues fro prescript rule cannon churche cann chuse runne headlong wandryng errours amazed blindenes extreme maddnes wherefore lutheranes hugonoughtes worthely expelled vnitie church deseruedly adiudged fier fagottes dampnable heretiques worthy fauorable protection writinges much touched ma handes bycause dare presmoute quacke agaynst supremacy angelicke ierarchy touchyng slaunderous surmise albeit nothyng cann falsely shamefully imagined sorcerous enchautementes wonder much poysoned dolldreanche hath betyppledd sences many great personadges hath long preuailed great admiration sundry estate onely ignoraunce learnyng ouermuch credulitie godly prince vntill late incomprehensible prouidence almightie god worthy arte emprintyng erected meanes whereof good letter bookes came marte printer shoppes discouered foggy darkened cloudes olde mothe eaten barbarousnes hereby came passe tedious deepe doungeons lothesome ignoraunce beyng surprised certein new cleare dawnyng day purer doctrine also liberall science beganne shyne abroade leaue trust ouerspread brighte glisteryng beames dayly vntill inaccessible brightenes thereof either thoroughly vanquishe whole kyngdome darkenes least chauge better countenaunce ende may conceaue assured hope good successe herein two thynges minister vnto v especiall comfort wherof one consisteth mearcy lord remayneth handes kynges prince next vnder god lordes watchman first haue infallible argument cann neuer deceaue assured testimony iesus christ hath prophecied holy scripture shalbe brought passe greater part whereof haue allready experimented accomplished dayes lord breath mouth shall confounde pride beast arrogantly vaunting selfe holy temple next small force meane vigilant wisedomes singuler godlynes causeth v coceaue well prince lord infinite mearcy hath ordeyned exercize chief rule gouernemet next vnder vpon face earth especially whenas selfe hath pronounced owne mouth reuelation saint iohn lende helpyng handes hereunto sayingapoca tenne horne sayth thou didst see vpon beast enne kinges shall abhorre babylonicall strampett shall make desolate naked shall deuoure fleshe burne carkasse flame fire lord hath inspired harte bring passe euen hath pleased apocal wherfore awake noble prince christian captaines march god name atchieue exployte worthy noble race longer trayned trayterous sleightes subtill sycophates pursue power godly guidyng lord hostes emongest humbly call vpon highnes singuler paterne princely royaltie ende teaze exercize cruelty agaynst viperous generation onely petition loue beare iesus christ owne soules health ye vouchsafe deliuer simple innocentes bloudy iawes rauenyng wolues horrible blouddsuckers enterchaunge thynges beyng made true pure word god may heard teacheth ye lett lowse reynes licentious insolency longer hereafter abuse iewes handle lord iesu christ whose face blindefolded beate body whippes hath bene many broyles allready emongest v christian much christian bloud hath bene spilte much crueltie horror hath bene exequuted while meane space whose power rested staye outrage either wincked bootchery least left poore innocentes succourlesse slaughter house long shall romishe nymrod vaunt throne long shall make scorne patience excellent prince royall harte noble courage daunte pride resume handes whole sword iustice better part whereof romishe russian hath bereft surcease bondeslaues vnto mighty god hath made vassalles lawfull regimet long ye suffer mouthes mooseled eye muffeled blynde errours contrary manifest light gospell question whereof ariseth controuersie harde intricate exceeded capacity would haue entruded selfe presence maner persuasion would haue referred selfe rather censure learned much religion god holy gospell professe respledisant eye eares men bright shyning sunne whott sommers day doctrine say wherewith enstructed preacheth repe taunce bruysed coscience agayne imputeth vnto penitent person free righteousnesse deliueraunce sinne fayth without workes christ iesu onely forbiddeth idolatry restrayneth adde diminish title prescript rule holy scripture forbiddeth inuocation dead prayeng strauge goddes acknowledgeth humanitie christ sonne god place right hand father approueth honest honorable estate wedlocke person indifferently hath made foode sustenaunce fishe flesh without choyse beyng receaued thankesgeuyng subiect necessary vse man taketh away confidence affiaunce vsually ascribed vnto merites workes calleth v away opinio soules health set obseruation prescribed dayes monethes reduceth v naked elementes world worshippyng signes outward ceremony say cleareth harte myndes bondage men tradition dreames doth ensure establish v mearcy grace allureth person indifferently readyng holy scripture denyeth man participation cuppe new testament bloud iesu christ abbridgeth minister word desire worldly superiority stay fro reckoning vpp rest notable manisest bright shynyng sunne mydday cann maiestie atchieue worthy beseemyng highe excellency admitt secrett closett soule euident trueth heauenly discipline highnesse yet made acquainted therewith ye know infallible true ye longer shrowde vnder protection pestilent errours allready disclosed repugnaunt knowen veritie wherewith grace may one day hereafter paraduenture desire shielded dreadfull iudgemet seate lord hostes accordyng promise iesu christ trueth sayth shall deliuer iohn highnes shalbe persuaded reformatio religion whereof haue treated doth apperteigne estate charge seculer prince doth wordes osori emporte wheras writyng gracious queene elizabeth doth carefully admonish maiestie vouchsafe especiall regard know glory christ meaneth law lord teacheth much rule sacred religio doth exact highnes whereas epistle doth learnedly pronouce speciall duty princely gouernemet ought wholy employed preseruatio true pure religion pag el otherwise grace thoroughly conceaue true gracious restitutio god holy word doth lesse cocerne furtherauce gospell preseruatio royall estate saluation subiectes humbly beseech noble kyng redoubled linke pietie wherewith first bounde vnto lord maiestie shall playnly perceaue cause entred vpon varye decline iote awrye true touchestone liuely word neuer litle highnesse excellent clemency vouchsafe aduertize bysh osorius myndfull professio behaue selfe debatyng state religion vprightenes iudgement cause requireth fro henceforth desiste fro backbyting neighbour clamorous lyeng slaunderous reproches haue rather deserued well respect offended opinion errours ought rooted church lett first couince errours gaynesayth shew selfe abler man make proofe argumet resist onely cauillyng meanes deemed profitable member church procure selfe lesse hatred easie matter euery common rascall vomitt disdaynefull name infamous person protagoras diagoras cicloppes blindsinckes epicure gortellguttes monster fitteth comlyer learned men profitable christian congregation lay aside distompered choler instruct vnlearned reclayme obstinate sounde argumentes expresse testimony scripture order obserued euery carter may soone aucthoritie clayme comon rayler methode writyng requisite osorius effectuall edifie hath vttered bookes sufficeth reuile men odious name callyng madd impudent childish infautes declame whole co mon place vsed agaynst heretiques doe know playnly confesse necessary oppugne erronious sectes heresy errour forthwith hath somewhat bitter smatclie vnsauory euery queysie stomacke neither allwayes trueth plausible eche fonde dotyng phantasie wise men ought chiefly haue considered euery man assertio framed agreablenes word god yet dayes cann tell carte sett horse preposterous frowardnes person haue brought passe bycause men shall guided gospell runne men imaginatios shall obey beare principall banner right squaryer christian fayth hath none sure foundation onely grounded vpon holy scripture dutie hadd bene direct buildyng religion lyne leuell ramme fast wallworkes hereof cemente morter cann tell come passe many worke guyte contrary despise well fenced order hauyng litle regarde meanyng purporte word rayse selues church call catholicke assigne onely guide gouernesse yet notwithstandyng make demonstration whether church christ yea nay measuryng onely title romish see swiftenesse opinio doe affirme church cann meanes goe astray whatsoeuer church doth denouce commaunde doe greedely catche whole bente fayth defende tooth nayle sincke plumped first men tradition sundry preiudiciall opinion certein vnreproueable determination call vnwritten verity leysure coferre scripture sorte whatsoeuer shall seeme serue purpose canonize inuiolable ought founde contrary expectation either submitt iudgemet church violent wrestyng racke colour suggestion hereof sprang darnell cockell errours dissension bycause many men fashion fayth frameshapen chaungelyng simple conduct word church perceaued doctrine embraced witte romish see ought supreme empresse ouer church purgatory must beleeued pardon necessary vowes made remayne vnmaried meritorious mounckery cowled profession hadd certein wonderfull perfectio image ought worshipped sainctes prayed vnto grace deseruynges iesu christ could selfe suffice attaynement saluation man could obteyne righteousnes fayth without workes christ selfe flesh bloud bone conteined sacrificed masse vnder bare accidentes lay person denied vse readyng scripture participatyng cuppe lord many like drugges though neuer could finde liuely wellsprynges holy scripture yet bycause perceaue shryned decree decretalles rome doe constauntly beleeue must autentique aucthoritie many oracle lette downe heauen hereby cometh passe vnder vysour churche sondry deformed byshapes doctrine fostered vpp church vnder pretence christ true gospell christ small daunger vtterly defaced lamentable complaynte vttered chrisostome could neuer aptly applyed age many doe walke sayth vnder name christian fewe trueth christ bycause haue debated matter osorius hereafter large deteigne royall maiestie register thereof remayneth make humble intercession almightie god father lord iesus christ immeasurable mearcy loue wherewith disdayned disclose selfe vnto mankynde sonne vouchsafe beautifie establishe mighty power outstretched arme defende make permanent errours bloudy bootchery true light holy gospell bright beames whereof hath allready enlightened earth beseeche likewise trompett dewe administration gospell kyngdome darkenesse may dayly subuerted church kyngdome sonne iesu christ may dispersed abroad ouer face earth preached thorough nation tounges lastly pray endue christian kynges prince beyng sett aucthority especially puissaunt victorious sebastian kyng portingall princely ornamentes enriche perfect absolute clemency vertue true godlynesse enlighten knowledge glorious countenaunce establishe throne settyng forth glory aduauncement church merites lord iesus christ graunt world million b romeo rome b b dot hundred hyndred b proued prouided sword word seduced enduced b b b herefore hereof therefore godly reader walter haddon sendeth greetyng lord iesu christ yeares past certeine portingall named ierome osorius wrate tedious epistle queenes maiestic imagined many monstruous errours bee frequented church reprochful rayling vnreuerently depraued professours gospel publicke quarell nature countrey troubled litle particular pointes wherof thought good aunswere although generall partly bycause wated tyme thereunto partly bycause supposed osorius deluded malicious report aduersaries therefore hoped man would haue bene somewhat satisfied myne aunswere passed ouer one year two meane tyme appointed queenes highnes agent flaunders lydgear bruges tyme one emanuell dalmada portingall borneemanuell dalmada portingall byshop angrence byshop angrence sodenly sprang vp bruxelles worshypfull prelate vndertaking defece frend ierome osorius stuffe great uolume full wounders brabbles ende booke caused certein ougly picture portrayde thereby deface personage much might perused apologie entituled cofused llipe neuer saw foolish vnsauery writing full ofskoffes absurdity two beyng taken away remained el nothyng besides whereupon debated selfe while whether might aunswere doltish asse last determined despise scely wretched dottarde one onely altogether vnlettered also dull blockysh nature many tymes voyde common sence became iestyng stocke among wiser sorte owne fraternitie two yeares sithence familiar frend thomas wilson returnyng portingall engladthom wilson brought ouer thence request osorius certein volume osorius framed three bookes wherof one deliuered seuerally vnto receiued gladly perused ouer twise trustyng osorius beyng enstalled byshop would much modest matter fell quite contrary steede liuill sober person finde friuolous sophister graue diuine page duplicate page duplicate nine childish counterfaite discrete byshop impudent rayler hereunto added store vanitie proude hawtynes respect thraso might well adiudged discret person sorrow speake much bene acceptable honesty according ordinary course commo conference haue debated matter frendly quietly rather cobat together tauntyng snatchyng sithence osorius disputeth byshop neither argue byshop neither requisite myndefull osorius estate sithence forgetteth owne myne also standeth good reason haue take pleasure euill speakyng loase euill hearyng gentle reader thought good premonishe partly thou mayest perceaue course processe writyng partly shall seeme sometymes somewhat sharpe myne aunswere thou mayest impute enforcement myne aduersarie rather bitternesse nature request two thynges thee first shall haue briefly throughly confuted foolish spitefull braules osorius thou wilt cotet therewith requiring many woordes matter small substaunce albeit osorius lunite selfe measure ende pratlyng yet temper talke neither abuse thy leysure myne owne bycause hard thyng matter rather difficultie fill whole uolumes scribling toyes odious accused yt selfe faulte wherof man doth condemne last request thou yeld thyne attentiue mynde voyde parcialitie opinion two thou graut vnto shall easely appeare trust haue lesse godly necessarily entred honest defence countrey thou also playnely perceaue maliciously wickedly england hath bene accused depraued cursed enemy osorius farewell pan aunswere walter haddon rayling inuectiues ierome osorius entrey tragedie prattling brawler hath framed long discourse shewosorius beginneth double excuse booke certeine yeares publicatio therof came hades wherein supposed finde mysticall matter though know hee receaued booke iote yt purpose whereof doe entreate though man may doubt whether writyng sold euery shoppe might foure yeares space transported portingall myne aunswere publiquely imprinted could meanes el brought osorius vnlesse worshipfull prelate angrence come ouer flauders nay surely maketh litle matter know tyme booke came sight credible wanted foure yeares imprinting doubt messegers enough would haue conueyed vnto though byshop angrence neuer sene bruxels yea though neuer bene borne therefore friuolous painted preface might haue bene spared altogether bene accompanyed two iolly mate one ye might vp meanes yeld honorable testimonie frende emanuell aduauce excellency aboue skyes come late osorius carrion emanuell departyng fro flaunders hath left behynd euident monument folly bewrayng blockyshnesse wherein alone hee hath vttered many proofes ignoraunce impudencie man beleue though extoll worthynes othe wherfore haue delight felowshyp vse rather couert owne countrey home el osorius shall neuer get honor honesty praysing emanuell secod part narration declareth laudable custome countrey bookes corrupt religion may admitted therfore emanuell durst commit myne aunswere vnto vnlesse first obteined licence thereunto heare bookes dayly infamed slaunderous accusation fraternitie yet curiously deteined fro world doth acknowledge sturdy champion romish sea exaple reason learnyng doe iustifie writer publikely inueighe agaynst ierarchy wholy couince superstition enacted canon law reason yeldeth lesse writinges aduersaries bee deliuered vnto doctours pillers churche pardye may burne broyle authours come clawes reason doth require custome hath farre forth preuailed also established doctrine yet onely portingall squeymish writynges osorius beyng himselfe couragious champion romishe facultie may handle leafe therofemanuell byshop angrence portingall popish inquisitour emanuell bishop angrence may dare send title therof familiar felow osorius though otherwise emanuell pestilet enemie gospel visitour reporteth selfe inquisitour heretiques pleasaut parasite delicate deuises tully hath pretie sentece worthy noted place sayth hee wonder ese two southsayers talkyng together refrayne fro open laughter make mentio blind superstitious opinion euen much marueile truely two worshipfull prelate ca keepe countenaunces meete together vsing fonde dotyng ceremony touchyng reiectyng bookes name comprehend two alone selfe sweete brother emanuell rest bicause know certeintie conceaue frendly reason requireth superstitious nycetie begyn declare cause moued inueigh poore defencetwo cause shewed osorius hee writeth agaynst haddog note especiall cause wherof one assigne holynesse religion beyng defiled must necessitie purifie agayne though accused religion rather defend owne though moued cotrouersie first rather prouoked vndertake defence coutrey agaynst malicious snarling except perhaps ye opinion porting borne may greater reason cauil agaynst englad english man stad succour see hereafter whereunto tendeth second cause say proceeded dutiefull charitiethe second part excuse osorius might depraue lacke modestie iudgement writinges doe represent know arrogancie seeme place ouer reache much standyng still amased myne owne coceite seeme gape frendes comendations new kinde charitie truely viperous racour wordes charge christia brother horrible crime arrogancie neuer saw knewrom paule doth detest charitie pronouncyng man inexcusable whiche iudgeth therfore redreth reason bicause saith iudgeth codemneth selfe therfore osorius hym selfe vayne arrogant bewrayeth owne beastly canckred stomacke vpbraydyng hawtines haddo especially sithece demeanour haddon testimonie trust doe know doth farre differre hawtines poysoned pamphlet osorius voyde ciuilitie shamefastnesse shall say babler captious admit one good word mouth hee vtterly disdayneth prayses geue hym denounce artificiall wordes phrase hee thinketh mocke el doe commende vtteraunce stile otherwise doe discommend lacke iudgement knowledge nyce osorius prye narrowly prayses yet cofesse truth simply reprehended thus iudged first euen iudge still plentifully flowyng apt wordes drowned haue slender vnderstandyng science neither shall neede long search discouer gallant writyng euen hand exquisite discourse vpon worde priuate whiche expresse peece meale world may discerne much skill wit osorius name priuate perso signifiethfirst repeate wordes whiche seeme reprehend saweynesse beyng priuate man meere straunger common wealth farre distaunt land sea would yet malapertly write queenes maiestie forthwith moue deepe questio desire know thought word priuate might signifie carter knoweth doubt therof must sent woman childre schoole demaud whether word reproche though time doubt hereof wherein doe erre childishly name priuate doth alwayes signifie difference degree neuer named way reproche yet contented require taught farther whether person maisters requestes ought restrained prince presence euer heard say came braynes vayne tritler seemely old yea bishop daunce thus net doth osorius openly shewe selfe vnskilfull me sight hearyng last come pricke yt seemeth rubbe gal ye vpbraide say name priuate though ye iudged word reproche owne dreame osorius fitte rotten mazer name priuate deede truly knew bee true wrote letter queenes maiestie yet purchased dignitie byshop yea long time receipt famous epistle reported bishop elect obiect name priuate reproche ye say pray whe name priuate respect contuinelious nay rather many tymes applyed selfe doe know honest honorable personage may therfore know playnly meanyng therein withall learne witte word priuate respect estate onely whe priuate person scarse peepyng cowle yet credited administration publicke functio nothing sitting personage entermedler fore prince cause especially already established firmely ratified expresse edict agreable cosent estate meanyng hereby call home vnaduised rashnes nothing seemely degree purpose thought meanes frendly aduise supposed would better bee reclaymed modestie beyng otherwise vndiscreet nature yet ye make end triflyng immediatly proceede wise though would say came clownes race fostered base villadge neuer beheld kyng face therefore committed haynous offence worthy punishmet durst presume write queene elizabeth honor due princely maiestie alwayes name gracious ye ashamed many lye couched one sentence though tooke exception birth parentage could ignoraunt sene kynges personage knowyng certeintie ye dayly conuersaunt kynges court though displeased writyng queenes maiestie whenas reprehend nothing sawey arrogancie slaunderous pen matter great importauce wherewith nothing acquainted doe impute say fault distaut seuered queene farre land sea loue owe maiesty aduertised letter highnesse matter apperteining establishment estate blamed nothing wrote bicause bent force penne maliciously slaunderously agaynst natiue countrey whiche lesse deare vnto portingall vnto herein surely noted lesse default loue defect wit knowing familiarly acquainted comicall nippe videl owne businesse nothing worth lookyng vnto home may carefully attende affaire others yea also concerne nothyng haue pleasure enough daunce nette selfe vnlesse drawe also rebuke follie makyng speake wordes neuer myne owne deuising though speach write vnto acknowledge pray vnaduised remeritie toung talke face dare presume attept queenes maiestie letter neuer trayned court neuer aduaunced office common weale altogether vnskilfull ciuill law haue tyme exhibited prince billes supplication whiche right belongeth onely thus concludyng vpon wordes doe perceaue say childish sentece must needes diudge man halfe fraticke owne foolish lying wordes properly osorius forged hammerhead first would haue yeld wordes bee myne whiche neuer knew thought vtter monstruous speaches wherof neuer dreamed much one sillable mydas would acknowledge aliue much lesse wise sober person would bluder vnlesse bene instructed therunto vayne glorious gentleman osorius tearme blockish vnderstand childish former sentece gladly yeld simply confesse selfe naturall dolt could seeme ignoraut either either reknowledging momish communication applied vnto bee doltish selfe also deuisor thereof bee wise walthams calfe doe know aud acknowledge much also abuse name colour scoffing toyes already enstalled brawlyng byshop might inuested delicate sicophant accuse one yt doth prohibite godly personage fro due accesse maiestie chargyng also ambition trust dayly conuersation cleare crime myne innocencie shall appeare greater much lesse wil venemous quarell preuaile cracke credite person knoweth seemeth also vnto man meane capacitie basenes myne estate become lofty stately lofty pray pouedo chalege selfe preeheminece others fauour authoritie dignitie yet self ashamed bragge title whe priuate man boast surmout others wit learning yet litle spare vaunt self arrogatly would god osorius would god horned cockescombe puffe vp pride seely huble bils requestes truly three inuectiues haue vomited lesse slaunders reproches denounced charitable man farre deeper diuine ye take occasion yet charge bycause affirmed accused england guiltie horrible noueltie perceiue must plucke spectacle turne owne epistle haue set downe wordes doctrine new gospell new religion brought england brought therewithall also honestie integritie life c little none performed studie new doctrine nay rather euer sithence rashnes vnshamefastnes lechery haue bene embraced place intollerable pride arrogancie haue taken suter footing seditios vprores rebellios haue bene easily raysed treason haue boldly attepted royall maiestie alledge perso particularly turne also reproch promising vndertake defence countrey without dissente mynde yet contrary promise wonderfully dissente fro may man beast iudge mad would promise differre crime cicer anthon phil2 pray syr haynous offence blockish errour neuer heard wher milde sober father chargeth wishing sobrietie litle though alwayes drunken bearyng hand though furiously mad would commit monster writyng forsooth please prelacie found two first selfe made ougly new glased religion maner filthy tautes added thereunto person throates cutte man knew selfe say syr true alledge example discouer matter clearely challenge v mainteyne kynde fayth whereby euery man settyng aside sorrow mynde regardyng good workes drowning endeuour charitie promi eth selfe hope euerlastyng saluation osor pag maner person v doth acknowledge glaueryng fayth man doth defend nay rather men doe abhorre spitte therfore fayth hammered forge owne lye cauill sithence selfe doe pursue opprobrious infamie doe selfe disfigure owne whelpe dishoneste owne creature treatise freewill bring stage certeine kynde person decked apparelled owne wordes osor pag b el say meant hereby keepe ma reason bondage bereue freedome aduisement man entangle fast snarled perpetuall chaynes whole man doe vnclothe iudgement sense turne ouer spoyled free choyse remaineth difference betwixt stone maner thynges men doe imagine braynes endeuour practise theyr action whether good bad men ascribe god authour therof doe linke together certeine fatall vnaduoydable necessitie enduryng euer tedious talke haue forged vnto v certeine new tyrauntes fearefull deede neuer haue heard mention tyme meere straungers vnto v broyle gredyerne therfore burne fagot firebrandes eloquence doe scourge none hobgoblines buggebearesosorius maketh bugge beares fighteth shadowes neuer acquaynted therfore suppose owne painted poppettes deuises owne dreames vpon whiche rushe doodgeandagger eloquence el murther shadowes forgyng man knoweth besides selfe offence shame wherewith accuse others must needes reboud vpon owne head finde haue accused take familiar example call dronkard el beleue know sober enough except scarse well aduised dronkennes therfore owne owne lye owne reproch exclame madde whiche manifestly lye wilbe adiudged owne errour owne rage owne ignoraunce perceaue length except franticke truly wrate selfe misshaped owne religion murthered person man knew besides selfe awake therfore hereafter wise deliuer gorge surfet rancour malice wherewith englutted charge dronkennes madnes respect equal myter onely excepted affirme haue wounded luther champion onely osor pag b luther falsely accused herein haue dubbed double lye whe charge luther monstruous opinion godly man neuer acquainted doe nothyng diffame luther batter downe owne credite coyning certeine newfangled diuinitie begynnyng erected first owne cauillations luther neuer allow owne counterfaite fayth say counterfaite fayth marke speake euer affirmed tyme argue fondly absurdly freewill report soeuer barke writynges hard matter espy barke one sentence vttered perhaps heate disputation may haply disagree rest processe read luther ouerluther take whole pecces marke whole doctrine remayne certeine vndoubted length yt luther hath church god god singular prouidence planted inestimable treasure christian discipline ierome osorius peruerse ouerthwarte brauler besides comendable facilitie latin toug profite comon wealth nothyng thus much briefly conceaue luther neuer vndertake defend hath notable aduocates exquisite kynde learning labour auenge cancred toung stand defence countrey persist therein long breath body although assayle wish vpon poysoned dartes venemous battry yet trust part therof recoyle backe vpon owne breast sticke fast entrailes carcasse shal neuer bee able rubbe frettyng sistula slaunderous inuectiue agaynst england second fault poreblind though would seeme poste ouer whole malice agaynst luther associate notwithstandyng endite accuse england expresse wordes rayle byshops filthy false accusation outragiously condemne subiectes generall stiffenecked crookednes iniuriously temple ceremony lawes furthermost part world seuered costes italy except gad rome pelting oracle iustifie osorius wisedome old man altogether voyde learnyng experience discretion also yea rather pope heretiques layd handes thessalonias denyeth may come passe antichrist shall come departyng fayth first somewhat straunge note place surely good tyme haue ye done euen vnshamefast imprudencie taken tardy paule pronounceth place lord iesu christ shall come departyng fayth first lord sauiour christ haue placed antichrist paules wordes thesead thessa cap let man deceaue meanes lord shall come except come departyng first sonne perdition reuealed caught osorius entangled snatch ye escape ashamed depraue paules sentence blasphemously execrable impietie horrible ignoraunce place antichrist steede christ sonne perdition place lord iesu though paule spoken deede beastly proceede confirmation babylonicall empire sentence paule pestilently peruerted profession byshop diuinitie osorius downe pecockes tayle away arrogancie collhardy write hereafter aduisedly take better regard penne lest bryng name odious contempt christendome take pleasure wordes wrest ye list handle paule discreetly learnedly plentyfull example heaping together iohn husse ierome prage martin luther many others affirmeosorius pag b haue reuolted romishe monarche set purposebycause beyng exempt fro iurisdiction might freely licentious writyng speakyng doe ye coniecture vayne southsayer men laudable conuersation voyde maner ryotte culpable notorious haynous crime therefore may duely charged suspition dissolute behauiour lyued alwayes discreetly soberly trifle defame fewe person name rushe vpon england open mouthpag though abolishyng romishe monarche forthwith caried violetly vnbridled lust false suggestion leaue syr assoone shaken foreine yoke shoulder yelded selues lawfull authoritie souereigne prince thynges went better peacibly v especially later age gospell renewed beyng copared elder yeares wherein romish prelate insolently treade vpo triumph ouer v may wel adiudged haue enioyed blessed prosperitie heauely benefite victorious ilad doth thakefully cofesse neuer haue receaued greater hand god god inestimable mercy graunt may permanent vnto worldes end wee humbly submittyng selues naturall liege souereigne vnited together duetyfull amitie may estraunged extraordinarie babilonicall idoll turnyng ouer fraternitie euer ye runne foreward lye rehearsing rable sectes doe imagine haue entred sithence banishmet pope pag though old time great swarmes sectes wherof paul doth oft premonish v though raged wonderfully tyme godly father augustine whose hart boyle wrate great volume pestiferous errours though sacred father peter successour pope liberius mainteyner poysoned canker arrius though celestine anastase second stoute champion horrible scorpion nestorius obiect sectes age euer wanted dare boldly name sectes three romish graundsiers mighty patrones selues two pernitious errours affirme godly father maliciously belyed call forth alphonse alphonsus de castro contra haeret lib cap moncke spanyard borne ought bee credite beyng prelate portingall worthy successours peter excellent pillers christ church forsooth comit sheepe vnto wolues deliuer people god bloudy butcher yet blush nothing blame faction sectes v whiche reporte exercise perpetuall warre one diuersitie contrary opinion proceede hereof pardy bycause seruitude libertine celestines say arrians nestorian would haue contrarietie amongest later sort writer bee monstruous dissention hath burst amogest frier monckes hath euer sharper stormes bene raysed betwixt schoolemen brawlyng oftentymes moates sunnepag rush vpon lutheran zuinglians name first doe besides matter bycause defend stand countrey defende england vndertake cause litle britaine wherein abide while breath body prouoke enemyes el doubt shall easely finde yet meane space recite wordes whereby men may know manifest iniuries vomite agaynst soules sweete personage vsually blunder aduenture whatsoeuer franticke braynes doe imagine proceede accusation zuinglians doe inueighe agaynst lutheran anabaptistes keepe continuall warres zuinglias osori pag b thrust also coelestianes interemistes name scismes first contradiction betwixt luther zuinglius principall pointes christian religion doe differ sacrament eucharistie substaunce thereof maner presence christ yet perhaps quarell wordes matter haue onely wickedly transubstatiated speake like schooleman sauiour iesus christ bread monstruous deuises also thrust vpon v vj hundred lye euery one contrary while amaze eares myndes christian absurde newfangled doctrine therfore graund captaine schoolemen peter lobard peter lombarde doubtfull conflict broyling turmoyling selfe throughly wearied mockery doth conclude last transubstantiation ought bee inuiolable autenticke authoritie church rome ca founde scripture anabaptistes name without reason ignoraut vniuersall consent church haue condemned vnto luther zuinglius earnest enemy maistershyp brotherhoode surely common wealth reteine footyng coutrey know ca heare maner men celestianes would fayne learne durtie copanion angrence bycause haue geuen name first farre perceaue sortes interemistes name gesse notyng men make certeine qualification religion haue patched vp certeine booke peeuishe romish dregges haue entituled name interim true came braynes reckon two souldiours graundcaptaines vnder banner commentarie interim say owne owne doctours whole doctrine tractable tyme mariage priestes receauyng sacrament vsing necessitie present tyme rest much gorgiously garnishe romish kyngdome therefore last place fondly foolishe affirme owne chieftaines displayed banner vnder enemyes enseignes truly either memory slipperie wittes went wollgatheryng ouer earnest slaunderous imagination yet much miscontented men likewise bycause seeme varie amongest selues correct vse intricate wordes leaue alter turne blotte old make new place c name place suppose meane common place scripture litle bookes common place ought haue remembred grecian prouerbe secod determination accopted wiser first neither thyng resemble christian modesty nearely amend selues neede requireth haue notable example hereof aurel augustine made booke errours entitled retractation retractation august predicament say apprentice addicted bondslaues drowsie dreames dayly practize whereof hath betwitched sens stregth truth ca mollifie hart cloyed altogether phantasticall puddle schoolemyre howsoeuer shall remaine stiffenecked selues ought yet reproue modestie others whiche fashion selues nearest christian simplicitie neither exaple tyme comendable church christ augustine see stinckyng reward haue gotten pursuyte sectary yet besturred stumpes hadsomely triumph wordes replie generall consent betwixt sprang luther disagreement contradiction opinion much better bene haue reuerenced lead whereat scorne much haue opened gappe mostruous pestiferours errours aunswere metie question concerne nothyng english man lutherane stand england luther agaynst yet pronouce also generall consent amongest lutheransthere disagreement amogest lutheran disagreement contradiction opinion sticke fast augustine cofession suffer selues drawen confession say allow neither matter question maner confession howsoeuer certeine lutheran perseuer stedfastly thereincoelest anabap interem rest whiche heape together either fayned coyned banished men well v el owne sweete sworne brother sauyng haue somewhat modestie discretion therfore slender argumet enduce reuerence lead except leaddish nature sithence haue shronke tackle forsaken leaden bulles monarche succourlesse shipwracke without helme cable dispayred perplexitie esteemed onely leadden woodden durtie aduocate also romish monarchie least thyng may filthy durte yet ye may better proceede spitte handes take hold wordes came thundercracke eares heauenly authoritie sacred scripture made conscience afrayde compelled v abandonne forsake men tradition putte whole confidence onely freemercy god well acknowledge speache myne owne yea gladly also finde nothyng therein blameworthy sayth osorius grace doe ye say gramercy luther sayth hee linked fast singular benefite abandonne fearefulnes matter lord planet hath distempered haue nothyng luther doctrine fayth shewed conscience terrified authoritie sacred scripture constrained flee free mercy god say luther hath written erroniously touchyng fayth forsooth two hang together like sicke man dreame man would argue wise osorius impudent rayler ergo companion angrence perfect logician ashamed cite whole sentence writer beyng vnable frame probable obiections agaynst one concernyng luther albeit haue vndertaken defende haue oftentymes protected yet doe suppose neither interpretour yt scripture ought bee admitted vpon euery particular assertion haue relation whole discourse meanyng authour especiall regard bee vnto luther deede ought shalbe founde profounde scholemaster fayth good workes farre excell learnyng ye shall worthy beare bookes howsoeuer delight selfe gnaw vpon wordes vnaduisedly throwen heate disputation way stuble also straw myne bycause wrate haue forsaken reiected tradition men many gglyng wordes challenge v beholdyng herein luther zuinglius melancthon bucer caluin peter martyr ouer tedious toylesome lucke hoped dispute learned discrete diuine would without good grounde haue blamed nothyng vsed cauillatios finde contrary pestered fonde brabblyng clatterer delightyng altogether vncessaunt chatteryng snatcheth snarleth thynges ratified approued men therfore constrayned play child agayne principle diuinitie doth question must debated wherof man hauyng skill ignoraunt maner therfore haue cast away traditios men lord sauiour iesu christ hath pronounced gospell vnder person esay propet vayne worshyppe teachyng doctrine tradition men lord iesu litle rebuked phariseismath haue made frustrate sayth commaundement god owne tradition geue eare vnto men men one teach contrary god despise set naught enen doe allow luther bucer rest long explane mystery sacred scripture vnto v wherein famous men haue oftentymes trauailed comendably though iangle neuer much agaynst beggerly fragmentes man inuention beyng without couer scripture yea rather contrary though also doe warraunt vnto v receaue taught sufficiently enough thinke haue forsaken peltyng phantasy men likewise conceaue notable learned father whose workes wilbe thakefully embraced while world doth endure though slauderously barcke neuer much yet deny subiect sinne errours happened also auncient father augustine tertullian origine cyprian sometymes wandred way estranged truth yet compare time heretofore compare ate writer auncient father cauill agaynst iudge beseemeth professe seruauntes god whereas vpbrayde v maner lyfe reportes cursed enemyes follow herein owne gyddy brayne true innocencie neuer desire better witness filthy slaunderous backbyters wherin request pardoned much vnreasonable much boldly defend without regarde grauitie byshop naturall duetie honest man scattered rumour rashly conceaued headles report steede well knowen approued offence also seeme mislike matter intollerable commende prosperous raigne queenes maiestie herein cousell see tyme come troublesome estate prince queenes highnes belike without aduise osorius coceaue matter wherof man ignoraunt meanely practized dayly action ma life haue eye owne charge siluan ye carefull maiestie surmountyng knowledge wisedome regardeth peeuishe dotyng counsell especially beyng conceaued rather malice true religion loue safetie ye keepe great sturre tumultes fraunce complayne much treason conspired agaynst kyng safetie person aduersaries required bloud onely whole bloud royall rooted fraunce licencious venemous toug worthy pluckt rootes execrable mouth except recant tyme dare presume impudently make guiltie cruell horrible treason many worthy personage ye florishyng realme namely kyng selfe open proclamation acknowledged agaynst rayle pestiferously deare kinsman beloued subiectes beyng armes concerned generall safetie frauce many variable vnciuill malicious rumour haue bene blowen abroad many place touchyng ciuill warres neuer man heard haue spoken blockishly barbarously voyde reason monstruously gentleman speaketh beyng byshop old man therfore shall lesse wonder rashnesse impudencie controuersie religio hereafter seyng sauadge boldnesse detestable bloudy accusation greater part fraunce without cause without reason without proofe matter reason doe openly fayle wrangle wordes bycause named luther doctrine agaynst stand stoutely doe deadly hate shall say captious bussardly sophister terme though defend bycause depraue bycause peruert iumble lyeng discerned haue mishapen whereas otherwise selfe comfortable treasure gospell somewhat infected poysoned contagio childish errours latter dayes inestimable benefite god discouered clensed commendable industrie singular learned diuines luther bucer caluin melanchton others though despise pleasure yet whe osorius shalbe dead rotten name reuerend prelate portingall remembraunceosorius ignoraunce iudgement triflyng word name wilbe commended eternitie immortall prayse man esteeme besides foolish vnskilfull handlyng matter wherof entreate altogether ignoraunt proprietie wordes wherein may seeme make pretie shewe thinke spoke vnproperly videl sluggishnes awakened dulnes pricked forward say drousie prelate truly sleape soudly yt snorte agayne ca deny kynde speach may awakened sleape pricked forward beyng dull learne gospell blynd see lame doe walke leaper cleansed deafe heare dead ryse agayne luce wordes sauiour doe argue blynd see lame doe walke whiche blynde lame restored sight walkyng learne againe cicero cicero pro mar coelio speaketh wise let youg men obserue boundes owne chastitie lest defile chastitie others lest consume patrimonie deuoured wt debt let offer force virgines dishonestie chast infamie ye vertuous c virgines defloured surely long virgines allurement may carried fro shamefastnes ca chast defiled truely yet chastitie may seduced processe tyme loosenesse learne last old prouerbe emplyeth whereby forbidden pricke foreward willyng prouerbe admit also spoken properly enough dull bee pricked foreward sluggish awakened neither would haue euer gaynsayd vnlesse malice owe vnto drowned sences good sooth ashamed osorius haue bene log agoe neither would contend bluntish blockish person determined open euidetly senselesse aduersary holy father england hath vnmeasurable bragger besides vayne sounde friuolous wordes mettall founde hereafter therfore spende litle labour may willyng touche ought huge lumpe idle wordes scattered abroad euery without reason measure necessitie cause require haue waded accustomed grosse rayling agaynst lyfe preache imputyng vnto maner wickednesse sinagogue swarmeth euidently recite last certeine wordes vouched augustine followeth augustine doth greuously coplayne tyme rabble beggerly ceremony ouerwhelme churche christian estate iewes much tollerableosori fol osorius affirmeth neuer read sentence augustine well cite augustine owne wordes theseaugust epist19 although bee founde agaynst fayth yet doe ouerwhelme religion selfe mercy god willed freely exercised vnder fewe euident sacramentes seruile burden estate iewes much tollerable though knew tyme libertie subiect onely ordinaunces law men constitution say haue cited augustine malicious shamelesse impudencie raunged tyme certeine outragious burnyng feauer infected estate ye realme amogest restthe death queene mary shortned liues richest honorable personage tyme queene mary many thing commendable monethes dyed disease like maner cardinall poole death cardinal poole excellent learned beyng sicke quartan departed world tyme demaunde ery mala ertly matter manifest confessed whether vnderstode thyng conspiracie wherewith wicked men practized destruction queene mary cardinall poole ueryly simply confesse neuer matter spoken writte fayned surmised vnlesse madde dogges selfe arrogancie passeth measure accompt sufficient pinche saely abiect grashopper dalmada chase let v returne henry scottish king affirme cruelly murthered high treason miserable murthering henry scottish famous iland deare natiue countrey vnmeasurable shamefull rayling luther golden couple father martyr bucer well enough shielded owne armour vertue pietie whose estimation bycause could meanes empaire notable father esteemyng one dayes conference vayne glorious pompe hawty lordlynes two worthy personage farre surmout wisedome learnyng caluish dole dalmada inferiour eloquence cleanesse stile passeouer person godly disposed regarde accordyng deseruings neither hereafter trace tracke durtie cauillations firrett folly errours finde end endlesse maze nowe prye cunnyng diuinitie herein wrestle plucke bycause bragge lustely skill though man able wynne coller point charge inconstancie bycause sayd preacher alleadge scripture onely yet within while added vouche authoritie father also ashamed holy father beyng old man byshop lye manifestlyin epistle queene pag poast ouer fayned imagination vnto owne lye say whelpe owne lytter often snarlyng agaynst currishe speaches beaten backe agayne throwen owne bosome myne aunswerein myne aunswere pag conferre place gentle reader pray thee thou shalt see osorius bewrayeth obliuious dotage deny writer vrge scripture onely cauill sayd alledge doctours defence also appeareth playnly bookes enterlaced withall writer vsed scripture onely followed herein example iesu christ apostle sayth graue father forsoth preacheth much diuine power christ sauiour mynde wisedome father accomplisher law make new ordinaunces religion expressed whole course old law first vnweldie old man perceiueth hee hath ouerthrowen selfe owne turne christ mynde wisedome father hath truely sayd hereupon consequently followeth particular testimony christ speciall oracle truth particular sayinges ought engrauen hart heauenly oracle heauenly father pronounce vnto moyses moyses declared vnto people wordesdeut lorde thy god rayse vp prophet lyke vnto among ouer thy brother shall ye barken vnto wherfore must harken vnto christ vnto moyses bounde necessarely preceptes ordinaunces moyses behold playnly yet gospellmath iesus beyng baptised came forth water behold heauens opened saw spirite god descendyng doue standyng ouer loe came voyce heauen welbeloued sonne well pleased therfore sith authoritie iesu christ sealed vnto v mouth almighty god greater maiestie scripture may pronouced ye scripture taught imagined excellent doctrineiam iames doth recorde lord sauiour iesu christ onely lawmaker saue destroy wherfore onely right interest partly establishe new lawes partly amend old partly expoude obscure partly restore worne mynde partly abolishe receaued maketh purpose lord iesus doth vse scripture doth alledge sacred testimony old testament could otherwise bee say doth vouche interpreter holy ghost sent downe heauen needed notiohn say god hath sent speaketh wordes god god doth geue spirite measure father loueth sonne hath yelded thynges vnto hand true saying iohn concernyng christ beyng deede must bee also true whiche enterlaced iesus christ beyng contented testimonie holy scripture alleadged none interpretour besides selfe also vndoubted true last vnskilfull blockishe deuine whiche professing knowledge god wauder erroniously nature power god sift example particularly haue taked together purpose finde altogether voyde maner probabilitie stuffed full grosse errours two onely shake amongest rest shall condemne disguised maskyng deny sentence founde law prophet psalmes way narrow leadeth saluatio must turne left checke hath striken right exact wordes play yt sophister require substauce sentence affirme found euery law prophetes psalmes old law hath expresse commaundement shall bow right hand left hand deut adde law diminishe apparaunt therfore placed straightes truly dauid perceaued wellpsal beyng kyng prophet chosen yt singular prouidence god gouerne people israell yet doth greuously complayne hee partly placed narrowe straightes partly forsaken darkepsal sometymes maketh humble supplication god direct feete right waypsal often confesseth word lord lanterne feete light pathes needeth lanterne combersome narrow straightes man may easely goe amasked ignoraunt place doe ye vnderstand requisite deuine byshop ye know dissemble wayward likewise obiect saying geuyng blow cheekes wordes employ nothyng el commauded patient patience learnedly conteined first speciall commaundement god thou shalt loue thy neighbour thy selfe offer iniurie selfe matter wherfore ought wrong neighbour ca haue thyng plainly spoken vngratefull people israell exclame rage agaynst good mild paynfull guide moyses sometyme secret conspiracy sometimes open exclamation many tymes threatnynges ofte wicked cursinges might gentle captaine doe meane space beyng stricken yea buffeted also vpon cheeke doth hee turne ouer cheeke el pray meant hereby doth often pray vnto god cursed caytiues enemy doth earnestly vehemently cry god either forgeue themexod blotte name booke life require yet notable example patience behold lord iesus christ prefigured vnto v esay prophet drawen vnto death lambe slayne beyng rayled vpon euery sideesai vexed iewes buffeted fistes face held peace sheepe shearer neuer opened mouth may thought whole history iob conquest patience miserable calamitie ioyfull triumphe thereof yet veepe deuine voyde common sense vtterly deuyeth sentence founde scripture touchyng patient sufferaunce enemyes wronges say haue passed ouer many thyngs bene better truely passed ouer thynges thynges malice foule speakyng turne catte panne wordes neither finde head foote stand vpon explane nothyng soundly coclude nothyng duely proue nothyng effectually rauge rayling brawle bare affirmatiues pratlyng past measure pester peruert myndes eares men quarell paule demaunde learned person restrained communion societie christian retayned circu cision hee learne christ new lawgeuer recited beforeiaco hee learne holy ghost singular benefite godact knew yt reuealer truth hee learne god especiall callyng chosen preache gospellad galat say alledge therfore old law effect though man madde besides selfe mainteine sundry senteces alledged old testamet conteined say meanyng verifie lord iesus christ obserue order continually enlargyng gospell witte vouche testimony law prophetes order also continued apostle vndoubted true onely deuines byshops mower also carter child woman know confesse haue either selues handled heard gospell preached others yet graue grayheaded prelate manifest light cauillously quarelleth though matter doubtfull stuffeth whole leaues toyes gayly knittyng vp knot length wise sayth fulfilled shall annexe hereunto example needeth say matter euident also manifest doe wickedly abuse holy scripture peruert ye truth gospell demaunde litle dare bold say auncient father dyd adde nothyng gouernement church founde scripture likewise demaunde came braynes beyng old man byshop reuerend father burden wordes neuer spake neuer wrate neuer thought vpon shame nothyng make open lye manifest viewe world behaue selfe matter diuinitie wherein vnleattered people haue iudgement affirmed auncient father primitiue church vouch scripture holy ghost acknowledge wordes myne owne tosse tumble ye list ye gnawe vpon teeth edge councels whereunto leane much hatched neither interpretours yet fully plumed two wherof made mention onely soude foudations pillers namely holy ghost scripture whole flockes interpretours flusht generally condene neither iust cause contetion bene betwixt v matter vnmeasurably quarellsome wheras set downe playne wordes late deuines produce assertion father bookes euidently appeareth monumentes neede prouoke tedious vnnecessary aunswere plunge selfe question partly false partly impertinent haue heretofore declared gentle byshop vnmeasurably geuen chatteryng wherein delighteth beyond reason willyngly permit nothyng proceede order though altogether contrary purporce disputation corruption mynde commeth passe deny lust rebellion outrage reckoned sinnes v say reuerend father accoupt lust rebellion outrage sinnes affirme wordes aske questio one crume shamefastnes humanitie wit modestie would foule slaunders dissame kynde people liuyng world yet foule foolish nothyng ca imagined foolish rayle absurdely aswell without shew likelyhode truth pause while osorius ponder well vndiscreet accusation henceforth write aduisedly except meane bewray monckes sold owne behoofe affirmed playnly house sold vse weale publique whiche wordes man could haue wrested monstruously brablyng rascall paraduenture seeme great fault call byshop rascall confesse rabble wo meeaten picture portraictes dead bodyes worshipped haue instructed rude vnlettered people men traditious haue vtterly drowned holy scripture beyng pleasaunt plentyfull foode soule ouerflowyng puddle stinckyng ceremony true osorius yea true beyng byshop distributer holy misteries god shall intollerable anguish mynde feele true shalbe sommoned dreadfull iudgement seate lord whence shalbe throwen euerlasting tormentes ye amende tyme droppe sounde sober witte amyddes disputation touchyng worshyppyng god sodenly skippe matter returne wonted shiftes demaunde v wee haue founde selues inclinable praye sith abolishyng image first concerneth controuersie anythyng hath authorised beyng portingall iudge inquisitour ouer v englishman enquire ye demeanour owne people siluain let v alone owne byshops greeueth much reliques thomas cauterbury defacedthomas canterbury pleaseth call holy man beyng deede exectable traytour goodly doctour church require v worshyp rotten stinckyng carkase pielde trayterous priest persuade el england woman child naturall fooles detest stincking rames crauyne idolatrous shryne rebellious traytour neither pleased bycause rubbe schoolemen gall sacred societie credite pure pillers christian religio agreeyng consentyng auncient apostle tryed owne trinckettesof schoole diuinitie wilbe founded pestilent generation uipers full vnsauory brabbles corrupt doctrine altogether boyde witte addicted superstitio discreet person amongest aduersaries hath smatche founde learnyng except fewe doe vtterly detest reiect filthy puddle schooleme yet sir ierome suppose bolster uphold sowsie ragged rabble wt stout countenauce come late labour lost without reason noted haw huge heapes picture offcombe vnsauory schoolekitchen neither erre notyng certeine limitation whelpyng cease old cankred custome cauilling scarse one minute houre flee ouer councell nice inuincible bulwarkethe second coucell nice though soeuer councell doth thrust vpon v ought holden v inuiolable deede filthy vnmaryed life crawled first churche maner also friuolous sophisticall transubstantiation commaunded begynnyng let v scanne deuine decree councell touchyng image vttered second nicene coucell vnder wordes image ought worshipped reueretly god worshipped admit true trowosori fol el opinion image picture remaine viewed onely worship set apart wherein neuertheles disagree selfe also place tell v tale robinhoode alledgyng miracle withall witte bloud hath bene seene gush image perdy certeine uertue healyng hath issued fro cause ought worshypped hereby meanyng proue whiche litle earst admitted neither grossenesse osorius ouersight forgetfulnesse selfe owne wordes reporte eusychius behold image apostle exquisitely paynted hereof commendation paynters good osorius prayse picture yet notwithstadyng though made fayre speake affirme without cotrouersie image apostle tyme whence doe persuade osorius good argument proue image uisited apostle tyme bycause inuectiue come end whiche man plucke awaye outrage cauillyng venemous scoldyng superfluous sentence surely litle remayne wherein learned reader may desirous spend tyme second booke ashamed say vse many wordes confutatio booke modestly done confesse fault vnmeasurable braulyng hath altogether weryed opinion others also haue seene writyng one cosent woderfully condene idle superfluitie toung old man yet see amendement ye proceede many fable vtter wherby men may perceaue induced writyng iudgement discretion enflamed excessiue malice violet outrage neither yt person grayheaded yeares ought wise bee acquainted whereas reporte seeme haue taken wonderfull pleasure litle booke herein follow example wayward men whiche esteemyng men affection owne opinion scarse el well disposed bycause bee vndiscreete selues begyn quarell ouerthrowe sacramentes wherewith say also seeme somwhat displeasaunt therfore commend scoffe lesse vnpleasaunt vnsauory mocke spare trauayle contumelious wordes bryng deuineswhereunto apologie haddon especiall regard vndertooke defend slaundered england stoode defence ye therfore might well haue referred contention touchyng doctrine selues yet presume say much way clappyng handes quayled osorius haue obteined better footyng deeper roote hart learnyng vertue able remoue penne though bee neuer cruell bootcherly crueltie side neuer sauadge fire fagot cosume myndes selues dauid named bee acceptable sacrifice god heare acknowledge owne wordes lord neuer heard thyng vttered blockish matter shalbe made manifest example dauid selfe alledge dauid beyng patriarche disciple christ matter referred ended also god wherof haue manifest example gospell ought onely enter eares also pearce harte well disposed person luce lost prodigall sonne riotously consumed wasted haue sinned agaynst heauen thee worthy called thy sonne make one thy hired seruauntes truly humble lowly confession sentence wonderfully effectuall whit tedious wordes yet came passe hereupo myld father ioyous clothed sonne gorgiously rendryng therof reason sonne dead aliue lost founde agayne behold pure gospel like confession passe death vnto life destruction saluatio therfore instructed godly preceptes ought obey holy ghost teacheth v mouth paule thatheb haue high priest hath pearced heauens euen iesus sonne god boldly approch throne grace affiaunce thence may obteine mercy grace finde necessarie relief yet great proctour confession speaketh faceth matter endeuouryng fetch petigree therof prophecy esay demaundeth thinke place esay must vnderstode esay come passe birth christ suckling babe thrust hand denne cockatrice draw thence first let v heare famous interpretation reuerend father interpret place sayth becommeth christian child must vnderstand person christ hath geuen power treade downe serpentes scorpion say sauadgenes wickednesse deceites deuils crueltie lurkyng dennes soules although person childishe simplicitie yet endued force strength may easely kill viper beyng baled inward entrailes soules marke reader deepe interpretatio graue father byshop deuine shall reprehend old dotterell first resembleth confessours sucklyng babe reason resemblaunce likelyhoode paul doth enforme minister farre otherwise hee requireth amongest thynges1 tim hold fast mysterie faith pure conscience triall first admitted ministerie farre beyond age childish simplicitie power treade vpo serpentesthe place esay wrongfully wrested osorius scorpion grauted disciple christ apperteinyng bodyes soules dayly conuersaut amongest poyson without empairyng health euen doth lord iesus promise behold geue power tread vpon serpets scorpion vpon force enemie nothing shall hurt luke paule shake hand fier uiper chaunce stacke fast vpo beyng selfe safe whole men looke hee haue swollen burst peeces wherfore promise christ whereby health apostle preserued nothyng might hurt bee mistourned wrested edifieng soules confessio vnlesse schoolemen mydday ouerspread thynges cloudes disguise thynges licentiously owne whiche chauge white blacke blacke white meanes yt peeuishe cold inuentions commetaries may imputed vnto charge like maner bycause god place firmamentone great light lesse oueresay prophecy knit together phrase wordes shall spring braunche roote lesse ae blossome shall grow roote c vpon spirite lord shall rest c litle wolfe shall dwell lambe leoparde shall lye downe agaynst soule peter martyr osori prolopopo ia agaynst peter martyr thou wicked came thy mynde handle sacred mysterie would god sweete peter alyue agayne heare franticke slaunder agaynst forsooth would easely suppres brawlyng toung chaynes holy scriptres tame waywardnes therfore albeit god hath called hence vnto selfe let v imagine hee alyue fewe wordes confutyng cursed declamation maner first allthe aunswere peter martyr agaynst prolopopo ia osorius may take reuerend prelate beyng old man deuine byshop first choppe call wicked man whereas knowen vnto haue euer bene sene haue deserued euill brotherly loue christ requireth disciple mildnesse modestie byshop wherof paule maketh mention haue written confesse haue spoken commo argument religio seemed good vnto haue offeded thyng neither haue disputation touchyng matter religion neither contention betwixt v tyme wherfore doe storme agaynst vnciuilie ye call wicked duely charge wickednes maners naturally euill disposed inclination ye choose oppresse brother infamous reproches duetie ought gently haue admonished beyng errour ye haynously offende cause whiche haue vndertake must needes stampe manifest lye begynnyng ye write sacrament euchariste defaced defiled peruerted false herein iniurious slaunderous call witnes myne owne bookes let brought forth perused shall euidently appeare haue beautified excellent sacrament honorable title haue spoken therof alwayes greatest reuerence whereas demaunde maisters face durst attempt execrable fact contrary many former age also demaude many martyr many religious men haue strayed truth onely haue seene truth truely ca coniecture maisters martyr religious men doe meane neither doe presume thyng vpon selfe derogate man neither ca iudge sober enough matter nothyng ca gush sea idle word pitthily peter martyr hath aunswered thyngs whose soule would haue teazed quarell witte worthely esteemed excellent deuine amongest chiefest deuines age whose scholer might haue bene knowledge squeymish therfore comedations godly learned men especiall frendes martin bucer peter martyr loued lyued forget beyng dead frequeted familiaritie while lyued much might name remebrauce though dead defende much may alyue would esteeme whole yeares conference one day conuersation certeine discreete pleasauntnes conference wholesome wisedome ye whole course demeanour absolute paterne honestie godlynesse throughly persuaded nothing could haue aduaunced estimation myne acquaintaunce familiaritie two godly father come length church order whereof captiously snatch ye disorderly stame ringly men may iudge ye roaue dreame rather dispute beyng awake affirmed fayth came hearyng say sayd also preacher sent abroad coastes realme teach comon people duty thynges deny done matter manifest exclaime say preacher lutheran bucerans caluinistes first know true let name goe confute doctrine lesson learned cowled coockowes braule alwayes bare name whe ca ouerthrow sillable doctrine maister shyp allow parliamet publicke assemblie realme entermedle matter religion herein ye suppose dignitie priestes empayred first thyng publiquely receaued vnlesse proclaymed publique authoritie prelate ecclesiasticall father propoude rule religion prince consent whole estate ratifie may done orderly circumspectly custome obserued tyme kynges israell vsage preuayled counseils vntill romishe ierarche
