whence troublesome contention opinion raysed church shew contention satisfie request ca hold toug wicked rayler require beleued onely affirmatiues sake deale maner charge siluain ye shall obteine nothyng meare force argument affirme likewise1 cor deuine seruice ministred v mother vulgare toug accordyng paules doctrine approued custome apostolicke churcheof vnknowe straunge tounges church say forsooth like bycause repugnant ordinauce rome yet well deny manifest truth paule establish doctrine holy ghost many strog argumetes though hee euen foresee mynde erronious botch would infect religion yt meanes might blot vtterly extinguish church fruitefull worshyppyng god beyng foundation christian godlynes therfore godly maibidem excellent seruaunt god paul trauaileth earnestly place partly swarmes schooleiaglers frier couled generation conspire together able abyde force strength disputation therefore osorius craftely cloakyng matter slydeth away thence vice men sayth preacher puffed vp pride science many entangled snare difficulty doubtfull questios true also true great rable false christias amogest doctour ierome seemeth chieftaine standard bearer call light darkenes darkenesse congregation edified practize destroy them1 cor paule infinite loue commaunde thynges expounded church interpretour tyranie procure thynges kept couert church people bee defrauded thynges without interpretour speaketh paul1 cor man speake tounges let done two three turnes let one interprete interpretour let holde peace congregation let speake selfe god saint paule commaundeth straunge laguages silent congregation interpretour let v therfore obey rather holy ghost speakyng humilitie banish v chatteryng chough language confessours cowled generation driue away vnportunate fleshfly fro ye godly banguets soules alwayes bussing last fleeth desperate cario doctrine paule tyme enioyned receaued corinthian v bycause apte taught therein also inc inable arrogancie doth kynde expositio otherwise searche scripture sayth beare recorde shall searche whiche vnderstand shall receaue testimonie toung vnknowen vnto v commaundement god father heauenluke beloued sonne heare ye shall heare example ye finde fault sequele thyngs none greater assured finally ye reiect sayinges meere false falseshoode wherof ye endeuour one sillable much discouer vnlesse paraduenture opinion bare braules reclaimeth agaynst wordes gospel enterdityng syr ierome set vp bristle although know meaning yet mooseleth wordes accuseth expresse myne meanyng sensibly say osorius ye sodenly fallen old doctour diuinitie punie scholer carper wordes ye sodenly disgraded reuerend prelate become malitious hungry fawconer title sillables grauitie beseeming byshop fuctio agreable gray heares let v view matter selfe ought lacke papane monarchie gospell interdityngit yt say bycause gospel doth enterdite forbid comau deth ye contrary letteth hindereth withstadeth resisteth openly exclaymeth yt monarchie admitted speake ye latin phrase doth euery wordes properly playnly expresse thynges meane enquire amongest massemongers betlehead dalmada familiar companion condemne tomme trifler sweet piggesnye emanuell smoyle close sleaue somewhat founde world last exceedes filthy commentary blockishnesse aristarchus proceedeth notwithstadyng peacocklyke requireth proofe whereby countermaunde may manifest subiect onely great vicare christ first aunswere sufficient deny thing bare nay affirmeth thing bare yea differece authority betwixt estate ye urisdictio bishop whiche may hold charge siluain consent toucheth therefore packt together tedious epistle queenes maiestie full reproches slaunders vttered cankred malice agaynst professours true religion yet while vsed thereunto neither proofe probabilitie sufficed haue confuted pestilent inuectiue fortified bare affirmatiues onely euen contrary therof witte bare negatiues asmuch haue stopt vp fewe shardes last tedious commentary though hardly quyte purpose yet well could thought good reply likewise argumentes thereby ouertake euery loupe hoale haue entagled snarled fast coupe lordly ierarchy force holy scripture eue ye tooles beleued haue erected established neede nothing doubt ye consent ye godly yt fully satisfied herein nothyng content yt captious title wordes slippe diuinitie extreme sophistrie affirmed italian monarche could aptly ruler ouer v alledged cause wordes head ca conueniently distaunt member farre asunder osorius playeth man vttereth skill brunt beleueth monster ca tell lurketh wordes therfore rusheth vpon pretie young question must ye taught speake latine sayth hee meaneth couenietly distaut agreeth selfe doth dissent wherfore say one thing conueniently distaunt conueniently distaunt ye doe speake true latine vse monstruous kynde latine phrase listen hereunto agayne prattlyng sophister doe affirme thyng doth conueniently disagree doe maliciously imagine playnly deny head ca conueniently distaunt fro member beyng ignoraunt difference betwixt affirmatiue negatiue proposition must turned downe agayne behinde schoolehouse doore amongest apsie boyes learne lesson agayne bycause grosse coceauyng ye ca perceaue thyng spoken briefly aptly rehearse wordes agayne apply hereunto phrase lyke effect men may know childishe blockeheaded aduersary haue therefore head conueniently bee distaunt member farre say conuenient head bee farre asunder member frend doth conueniently disagree frend scholer maister seruaunt lord ne yet wife husband say conueniet frend frend scholer maister seruaunt lord wife disagree husband say osorius spoken latine phrase vttered playnly properly doe ye conceaue negatiue affirmatiue ashamed doe ye blush nothyng manifest fault marke follie haue boye sixten yeares age keepe grammar schoole shoulde haue felt smarte hereof hee made foule escape grammer principle truely wery long sithence gentle reader bee childishly occupyed siftyng title sillables wordes maner may note amazednesse ouerthwartenes myne aduersary fault must imputed accordyng reason beyng bussardly blynd ponderyng bare wordes also fondly franticke senselesse substaunce thynges doth altogether deny difference farre euer sunder head bee separated member vnited one fayth surely experience hath onely taught v england practize natios also doth playnly bewray singular ignorauce blockishnesse seuered italy farre distaunce region matter religion iustice equitie could bee ministred must bee procured immesurable charge tedious pursuite many yeares whiche inconuenieces good remedy prouided speciall goodnesse god haue owne realme iudges consistory reuerend father ca disgest meanes queenes maiestie entermedle ye churche long friuolous preamble accustomed maner length choppeth downe sentence myne videl queenes maiestie lord ouer maner person england dominari wordes supposeth spoken barbarously bycause gouernement kyng force tyranny tendeth keepe coutrey people hath vndertake defende fatherly loue seruile subiection referred consideration owne profite publicke sauetie subiectes therfore sayth false kyng doth rule lord vnlesse take tyraunt rather kyng harken pray harken vnto alderma brable harken vnto subtill corrector latine toung neuer valla varro tyme notorious prelate doth farre surmount vallaes varroes fine pythe polished iudgement hath fishte poole caught foole new sharpenesse witte hath espied wherof man could euer conceaue much shadow dreame say lord byshop doth rule lord except tyraunt ergo man lord vnlesse tyraut least bare rule truly neede helleborous purge calues braynesrom lord iesus christ sayd sometymes bee lord quicke dead sometymes lord heauen earth holy scripture throughout called name lord therefore blasphemous horrible grammar distinction ought accompted tyraut denied becommeth old byshop vtter mockery beyng prelate either fury maddenesse frame shappenly translated bee openly franticke make selfe laughyng stocke litle boyes truely ashamed behalfe neuer see great foule monstruous absurdity yeares hath bene life long conuersaunt learnynga miserable distinction osorius afterwardes make subtill distinction promise authoritie kynges yt say though gouerne subiectes yet lordes ouer cause yes deede good sir lordes ouer cause aswel ecclesiasticall temporall may seeme apperteine good gouernemet comon wealthhow far cause kynges doe beane rule yet minister person matter ecclesiasticall wrate doe assigne authorise magistrate vnder may execute euery thyng due order like maner albeit emperours onely chief armyes yet haue vnder centurians lieutenauts serieauntes corporal meaner officer trayne due order exercize whole affaire rest souldiours doe maisters nauies shippes appointe vnder mate boateswaynes meaner degree seuerall office meanes preserue course better seaboorde whereby appeareth chief authoritie resiaunt alwayes chief knowen estate trauaile toyle execution order ministred inferiour magistrate ye require make demonstration thing first question worthy bee scorned beyng voyde reason haue euident demonstration made thynges common course man lyfe dayly practize common weales may assure neuer voide sense satisfie captious grossehead matter wt three wordes affirme authoritie kynges aboue yet kyngs selues minister ecclesiasticall matter two manifestly proued aswell gouernement kyngs old testamet also later age tyme new testament dauid salomon losias ezechias godly kynges amongest people israell commaunde priestes matter religion yet entermedle execution thyng tyme gospell paule great teacher gentile comau deth intercession publicke prayer bee made fayth truth first kinges others set authoritie timo peter also excellent elder name apostle elder hee neuer acknowledge howsoeuer couey false papisticall see fro peter say open expresse wordes doth verifie sayingpeter geueth commaundement wise submit selues euery humane creature lordes sake whether ee king excellent magistrate sent assigning punishement wicked doer laude prayse doe well w god beholde haue proposition peter first chief excellent authoritie kinges ruler magistrate sent assigned kinges punishment vngodly cofort godly lastly heare also god meanes executio iustice may duly proceeed wherfo cast away cauillations beyng el r selfe bee wise geue attentiue speedy eare peter elder thunder malicious slaunders agaynst demeanour ignoraunce byshops discharge venemous stomacke agaynst vnhappely chaunced ye begyn talke wt extreme incongruitie yea redoubling ye skill il nefor thus ye write poore speach though otherwise cleane pure latin auswere filthy accusatio agaynst byshopsofori rayling agaynst bishop england timo replenished ornamentes true byshops wherof paule made mention timothe especially rage beastly agaynst brother ye neuer haue seene know paule co maundeth byshop bee vnreprouable onely reproue maliciously deface estimatio byshops haue neuer offended word deede pray good sir cleare reprehension fault cakred choler lauishly vomited agaynst graue father know demaunde also byshops vndertake defence religion agaynst meanes crept thereunto beyng ciuilian truly franckely proceeded captious sophister rather gray headed byshop say rumour goeth abroad byshops chosen end especially beyng contented portion reuenewes byshoprickes rest confiscate vnto possession cleare gayne sentence herein much plentyfullrom prince sayth fearefull well doer wicked wilt thou feare power doe well thou shalt haue prayse minister god appointed thy wealth thou doe euill feare thou beare sworde vayne bee minister god take vengeauce euill say could speach paule touch nero respect whiche embrued sword ye bloud innumerable christias alwayes oppressed innocentes wallowed lyfe long maner soule subiection hygher power amongest kyng chiefestrom math uce therfore ye byshops together soeuer ecclesiasticall order holden subiect vnder authoritie kyng vnlesse ye bee without soules perhappes reduce good order happely ye neglect dueties behaue selfe vnseemely function approued authoritie old new testament oftetimes repeated cofirme assertio bryng example core dathan abyron singular blockishnesse ignoraunce made rebellion agaynst moses vse wordes holy scripture gathered together agaynst moses aaronnumb sayd vnto ye take enough much vppon seyng multitude holy euery one lorde amongest lifte selues vppe aboue congregation lord behold execrable speach ouer besides pernitious rebellion heare also one onely equabilitie degree asmuch therefore abrogate maner authoritie magistrate beyng appointed god anabaptistes age practize accordyng desert swallowed vp ye gapyng gulfe prouided god purpose ye thrust person stage ca occupy part play doe neither entreate rebellion trayterous suppression magistrate comunication tendeth ende whether kynges haue lawfull gouernement ouer ecclesiastical person lesse foolishly haue ye patcht purpose oza ozias balthesar ye affirme haue bene greuously plagued lord bicause rashly handle holy thynges thus ye say done accordyng deserte likewise kynges worthely punished lord would vndertake minister baptisme infantes would owne accordyng sundry euerlastyng testimony old new testament vnto whiche peter paule expresse wordes subscribe whereunto comedable antiquity approued aucientie haue willingly yelded agreable cosent hath alwayes exercized gouernement well disposed moderation beyng contented owne limites territory hath licentiously presumed vnlawfull clayme ouer worlde arrogant chaire pestilece doth challenge whose vnsatiable greedy gapyng filthy lucre heauens earth hell selfe able satisfie affirmed epistle abolishyng canon feare care vtterly rooted harte made aunswere many men wonderfully enriched canon fewe enduced haue especiall regarde feare god ye knowledge trustyng discredite myne aunswere demaunde question whether ciuill law doe instruct men feare god whiche albeit doe say yet monumentes therof ought consumed fire matter osorius hanges together question moued canon lawes eche parte vbrayde agaynst v ciuill law communication concernyng feare god deny ciuill lawes ought burnt ye starcke dronke doe ye bable dreame ye ashamed monstruous talke truely irkesome throughly tyred blockish aduersary affirmed authoritie canon lawes dyd farre forth preuayle v founde agreable godlynes iustice ministred decree therof ecclesiasticall courtes maruaile ca true much luther already burnte first demaunde question ye maruaile thyng earste ye constauntly deny wtout shame dissemble matter euident wherewithall neither portingall maistershyp could bee acquainted consideryng dayly entercourse continuall traffique betwixt v agayne moueth name luther herein uerely partes haue name luther great admiration firmely beleue might likewise haue easely bene scholer diuinitie notwithstandyng name selues lutheranes christian neither doe iudge man absolutely perfect amongest whole ofspryng adam whose wordes deedes may accoumpt without exception vnreproueable furthermore founde fault bycause accused preacher though taught publicke sermon vnpunishable libertie sinning herein likened saucie malapertenes martyr peter martyr familiarly acquainted know auncient godly father exquisite vertue learnyng much furmountyng diuinitie excell drawlatche derlyng dalmada deintie delicacie ye latin toug sithence hath pleased grosse foolish lye forge new god worshyp bold leaue disclose idollthe idoll rome maugre teeth ye shall deny selfe doe worshyp deuine honour meane romishe prelate papall see whiche asmuch accordyng owne saying hath authoritie dispence sinnes vertue bulles day moneth yeare onely euer euer also keepeth keyes heauen pleasure wherewith geueth kyngdome heauen vnto person others locketh fast inuested fulnesse power ye vndoubted uicare god whose royall maiestie euery power magistrate must humble yeld submit selues whereas say allowe title dignitie onely teache defend vnbridled insolecy also lustely couragiously vaute rayse vp crest doe el blazyng brauerie speach coyne selfe others manifest idoll may worshyp may prostrate selfe lowly humbly make intercessio vnto therfore dissemble ierome ye liste yet romish idoll selfe also manifest idolatour must willyngly endure trauaile neuer hard attaine fauour blessyng god perhappes may picke vp crommes thereby promoted highe ye may nearely behold yt earthly god enstalled vnder elbow palace wherin may sacrifice vnto maiestie say prouoke disputation vntrue prouoke confute false accusation wherewith charge v mainteinours fayth voyde vertue religion euer amog thrust name luther perteineth v cast challenge one deuine england namethe bookes osorius de iustitia tenne shall see quickly take vp gloue labour crush sophisticall cane peeces wish peruse bookes entitled de iustitia say may throughly satisfie selfe touchyng iustifyeng fayth truly haue perused uolumes deuided three bookes entitled de iustitia first wherof ye speake much commendation fayth therein vse testimony argumentes doth reprehend herein pray yet endeuour hath obteined shewe selfe vnnecessary arguer vndoubted controuersie stampe also second booke wherein commend much worthynes good workes herein nothing dissent aduaunce much wish v thyrd booke almost altogether pelagian beyng throughly poysoned heresy greeke church doth blasphemously inueighe agaynst free mercy god father christ iesu namely agaynst augustine vnvanquishable patrone heauely grace therfore gaye poppet gorgiously paynted whiche liketh selfe well partly friuolous ouerwhelmed much tattlyng partly wicked execrable while practizeth trasforme v naturall men almost god neither alone opinion cardinall poole also part iudgement although rome maruailously disguised yet men knew farre better man liuyng much expert diuinitie alwayes withstand attempt publishyng printe delicate impe louyngly embrace great estimatio owne derlyng accomptyng perillous pestiferous gaue famous verdit thereof worthy deepely engrauen entrailes christian hartescardinall poole iudgement osorius bookes possible sayth cardinall poole possible yelde much mercy god abase strength man much much grace haue conceaued emprinted braynes doctrine humilitie abacement would neuer haue nakedly stripped christ grace hautely arrogantly enhaunced power man ne yet proudely boldly reproued despised augustine worde osor signifieth bolde portingall toung aschambut dare osorius doe accordyng nature name dare boldly presume vpo thyngs peradue ture demaunde knew pooles mynde herein tell familiar fred vnknowen vnto ascham sondry tymes aduertize therof affirmyng yt heare ye vttered mouth cardinall selfe also doth trouble much bycause affirmed errour imagined braynsicke mazer would falsely lay others charge say truth herein owne lye owne haynous acte owne slaunder yea owne errour fayned coyned imagined selfe though afterwardes would poast ouer others without cause yet spare pinche cruelly saying amongest scornes reproche stammeryng speach though speake playnly meane while wryng selfe nose geue selfe two foule blowes first matter selfe euen el haue declared sufficiently maner speache steede barbarous endytyng ye reprehende stammeryng toung neuer person would doe hath bene enured write pure cleane latine surely syr speake playnly distinctly inestimable benefite godstameryng toug turned vpo osorius necke toug doth stammer stutte report true haue conference blemish bycause proceedeth nature would neuer haue obiected first vpbrayded ye fault wherewith selfe naturally encombred length entred treaty iustification first ye snatche sentence scripturesof cause iustification haue set downe without reason certeine cotinuall crooked vsage cauillyng ye writhe wrest ouerthwartely therfore bid adewe vnmeasurable captious sophistry sift diuinitie while wil appeare say foolish detestably corrupt rehearse writing eue workes vnprofitable iustification yet ought despised bycause paule doth seeme verifie position let v see doctour ierome sayth sooth raungeth abroad originall sinne altogether besides cushian doth cruelly accuse luther caluine melancthon bycause codemne workes holy men copared glory god could forgeuen merites iesu christ doth paul affirme truly iewes getiles cocluded vnder sinne doth ye propheticall kyng dauid likewise log pronouce trulypsal one righteous person one one vnderstand one seeke god gone way together become vnprofitable one doth good one one righteous much one shalbe come worthynes workes yea euen amogest perfect godly bee man vnderstand also best workes godly value seeke god duly performed person haue declined way haue walked perfectly right way lastly person doth good whether excellent workemaisters vanished god name say well iewes ge tile say generally concluded vnder sinne pretie holy men bee founde ye needes haue paule vtterly none sinne one man sinne poured vpon fleshe condemnation expresse wordes paule admitte startyng hole yet mastershyp notwithstandyng vrge certeine perfection workes contrary manifest authoritie sacred scripture prelate doth make accompt wordes christ sauiour saying sayth lord lord doth father shal enter kingdome heauen hee demaundeth yoke sinne bee alwayes fastened vnto shoulder meanes remoued may obteine state righteousnesse grace goodnesse christ selfe haue told wise man truely euen grace goodnes christ haue named therfore dauid full ye holy ghost lifting hades vp vnto god cryeth manerpsal wash throughly wickednes clense fro sinne knowledge faultes sinne euer desire bee washed welter filthy puddle sinnes require bee clensed throughly purified corrupted wholy defiled ye stinckyng dregges sinnerom fall one sayth paule sinne deriued way propaganacio vpon men vnto condenation euen righteousnesse one good extended vnto men iustification life agayne paulerom god hath shut vp men vnder vnbelief might haue mercy vpon fro selues therfore proceedeth euill vnto damnatio god commeth iustification vnto lyfe selues riseth vnbelief mercy issueth god let v heare lord sauiour iesus christ selfe sweetely cofortyng v wordesmath come vnto ye doe trauaile heauy laden refresh therfore anguish grief sinne burden trespass wherewith ouerladen haled onely groude euen hell gate spryng owne selues euen asswagyng sorrowes ease importable burden come iesu christ onely bee ignorant sentence good syr wherewith holy scripture doe euery swarme plentyfully pray vnderstand gospell doe know doe ye maliciously inueighe agaynst learned men singular seruauntes god without cause especially departed life agaynst could speake selues ye durst mutter one worde beyng compared let passe vndertake defend extreme amazednesse rehearse wordes cull purpose carpe glauce away luther caluin quarell let alone ye liste striue also cauill doth reason require request allowable surely extreme maddenesse challenge vnto barrier sckyppe ouer away others pursue venymous toung say seemeth maisters doctrine pleaseth tearme force sinne yet extinguished v bloud christ truely may acknowledge men whose name recite maisters diuinitie onely practize pietie also whereas ye would haue teache force sinne yet extinguised bloud christ doe expresse owne wordes onely horrible shamelesse slauder agaynst vnto marke alwayes bent whole endeuour expresse vnto iesu christ liuely eye also crucified emprint throughly bowel soules precious bloud iesu christ shed v vpon ye crossegallat preach vnto v remission sinnes bitter death passion beate blind deafe eares world glad tydyngs gospell beyng ouerwhelmed oppressed couled generatio massemongers confessours men tradition altogether choaked buried vnder grounde silence holy scripture disclose agayne abroad open light put miserable captiues remembraunce sayd doctrine beyng vtterly subuerted tyrannous trechery gallauntes therfore sermon lesson writynges vsed like speaches1 iohn bloud iesu christ doth clense v fro sinne know redemed vayne conuersation receaued traditio forefather transitorie thyngs gold siluer peter precious bloud vndefiled lambe c apoc neither whoremogers worshipper image adulterer c shall inherite kingdome god cor ye clensed sanctified iustified name iesu christ spirite god heare men clensed sinne redeemed vayne conuersation washed sanctified iustified bloud iesu christ ye know likewise men take vpon alwayes infinite labour trauaile establishyng enlargyng gospell christ ashamed obtrude vnto grosse errour whiche ech euidently conuinced whole discourse gospell treatise holy scripture cakred malice hath onely blinded osorius bewitched sens ye see truth selfe yet arrogaunt waywardnesse frowardly kicke agaynst preacher truth rom yet notwithstading true sinne doth alwayes dwell within v alwayes law lurking mebers rebellyng agaynst law mynde draweth v bondeslaues sinnyng lord doth deliuer v body death bloud iesu christ rootyng sinne v altogether christes sake pardonyng sinnes repent hereof arise comfortable reioysinges faythfull spared onely begotten sonne deliuered slayne v bee possible geue v thynges together rom agayne shall accuse elect god thirdly lord doth iustifie shall condemne v spoken end set innocencie perfection whereunto aspire while pilgrimes miserable fleshluke doe expresse vnto v god doth geue v free remission iesu christ set whole affiaunce hope vpon pronounceth selfe hee sent righteous sinner bycause repent amende lyues well disgest sayinges lord beyng old byshop allow scripture haue bounde selfe apprentice bussardly schooledregges yet confidence death bloud christ rayse v vp heauen dreadfull day couled generation peltyng trinkettes superstitious workes shalbe throwen headlong hell vnlesse ye repent tyme doe assuredly knowe confesse mouthes lord iesus beleue stedfastly hart god hath raysed death lyfe shalbe saued rom hart beleue vnto righteousnesse mouth confesse saluation yet confession fayth doth neuerthelesse want testimonie good workes withall alwayes accompanied indebted fleshe walke accordyng flesh liue accordyng fleshe shall dye spirite mortifie sinnes body shall liue guided spirite god sonnes god rom wherfore renouce length lothsome communicatio withall lyke filthy hogge mooselyng durtie swynesty epicure vse wickedly scorne deride faythfull seruauntes christ ye write maner thought good case enough acceptable vnto god fayth wherfore righteous peter paule yea holy mother god ye goe amasked altogether osorius faythfull minister christ doe acquainte selues vnsauory hautie spirite pride rather doe earnestly call remembraunce sayinges paulerom night passed day come nye let v therefore cast awaye workes darkenesse let v put armour light let v walke honestly day light eating drinking nother chambring wantonnesse c let v put iesu christ make prouision fleshe fulfill lustes thereof c hitherto walter haddon residue aunswered f begynnyng maister haddon left agaynst osorius apelles famous painter worldeplinius lib cap endeuouryng curious exquisite maner expresse feature venus coe greecethat say comyng sea called greeke nonlatin alphabet preuented death plinie reporteth whe yet drawen halfe ye portrait thereby copelled relinquishe residue vnperformed man arte neuer expert durst tyme presume pencill pursue president like lot albeit vnlike endeuour ouertooke apelles amiddes blazing beautie venus seemeth haue encountred noble gentleman walter haddon displaying veritie gospell hee vndertaken commendable prayse worthy defence truth agaynst ierome osorius albeit neither obteined beautifie part begon accomplish purpose rest yeldyng ouer nature amyddes race constrained surcease exploite yet hath hee poolished part whiche hee left vnfinished apelles pencill say hath framed singular paterne excellencie arte sight therof whole posteritie may afrayde set hand attempt determinyng selfe aunswere slaunderous inuectiues ierome osorius compiled three bookes although graunted performe whole yet hath singularely endited one booke halfe agaynst confuted reason none discouered lye whiche shamelesse daunted hauty pride vtterly discomfited vaine glorious peacocklike rhetoricke grauitie wisedome well disposed stile supply made truth gospell beyng selfe otherwise vnuanquishable might seeme haue neede patronage wherefore long enioyed lyfe excellent learned man selfe endured amongest v churche christ worthy valiaunt captaine osorius also couragious puissaunt enconterer meete conquerour monster sithence taken v albeit veritie selfe haue iust cause dispayre yet chose vnderfully dismayed haddons sake yet losse chiefly concernyng haddon hee happy estate god good prouidence hath mercyfully traslated furious wretched world blessed quyet calme euen especially beyng conuersaunt race perfect godlynes employed vertuous endeuour sacred cause neither ierome osorius braulyng barker henceforth disquyet molest himthe decease haddon greater cause rather moue v learned much sorrow grief mynde haue lost great learned ryngleader learning losse doth much encrease heauynes respect present entreprise vndertaken agaynst osorius chiefly much feele selues bereft singular patrone altogether dispoyled herein without wonderfull difficultie scarse person knowledge wilbe founde able supply rest aunswere like successe commedation matter great importaunce easie refell reason osorius wherin substaunce triflyng toyes manifold also despise slaunders wherewith ouerlauishe bycause person easily hee founde suppose learned haddon dare presume entermedle cause ioyne owne deuises haddons writynges feare haddon dead wil come passe discourse plutarch maketh relation certeine well thought rashly youthfully seemeth couteruaile politicke prowesse themystocles bycause atteyne haddons actiuitie shall therfore like dastardes flee field leaue truth gospell succourles campe enemy quarell much apperteignyng haddon almightie god selfe suffer shame preuaile v pietie godlynesse bycause one champion take barrier approued assayes shall therfore yeld ouer conquest whole challenge osorius permit glorious thraso triumph treade downe cowardize bycause preferre haddon first onset armes shall therefore beare brunte battell shall valiaunt attempt rather teaze prouoke v pricke courage yet neither speake thinke wise though either mistrust tyme wittes age plentyfully florishyng season especially wherein doe know many skilfull enough mainteyne quarell would either vouchsafe yeld endeuour thereto could persuaded thinke trauaile would counteruaile study yet albeit happely may founde one nymble mynde endued learning iudge selfe able enough performe yet scarse shall ye finde beyng otherwise exercized weightyer affaire litle esteeme losse tyme vnprofitable contention snarlyng snatchyng spend one houre vpon osorius osoria melancholycke brauler say vpon wayward melancholicke aduersary beyng nothyng el raylyng brabler whereby neither profite may redounde reader prayse victor cause therfore getle reader thou shouldst require handes exact absolute furniture supply commyng forth haue bene perfited haddon either bycause easie matter reach vnto exquisite plot singular presidet table apelles el bycause chiefest aduersaries argument haue bene sondry person long sithence crushte peeces already effect deserue rather discretion scorned reason scanned touch onely certeine chief place controuersie scattered come ye chase see auayle challenge reteinyng selfe within lystes neoptolemus law say briefly summary pointes touch away neither doe thinke needefull stay long vpon debatyng euery particular point especially bycause three wordes onely may suffice ouerthrow whole battrye three inuectiues neuer tedious forasmuch authour hath vttered nothyng confused worke el sauoreth lyesthe summe osorius worke briefly co prehended three wordes slaunders errours reasonable aunswere may discreet person require three wordes onely haue spoken shalbe thought haue expressed wordes soeuer huge rable scoldyng triflyng sophister doth conteine mentiris doe lye maledicis slaunder falleris doe erre end shall bee sayd charge lewde deuise myne owne imagination cotrary truth matter alledge certeine euident proofes although infinite labour number sandes sea whereby diliget reader may easily descry wonderfull vanitie lyeng execrable wickednes slaunderyng monstruous blindnes diuinitie first one place offereth selfe viewe wherein two especiall pointes full haynous accusation contained say two detestable lye whelped one lytter pregnant worme one wherof hee doth accuse martin luther though hee wickedly teache extreme desperation bold presumptuous confidence saluation truely greuous perillous accusation true afterwardes two monstruous falsely forged proposition stampeth conclusion forth lesse false malicious wherein exclameth luther exclamat osorius agaynst luther onely subuertour vertue studious industrie carefull endeuour wondred osorius doth argue wise whereas euen begynnyng booke hath accustomed selfe nothyng el cotinuall course lyeng maruell great deale hee would altogether chaunge typpet vnlyke selfe begyn speake thyng truly matter goeth well luther workes extaunt yet vsually frequented whiche true witness doctrine ca testifie truely maisters innocencie herein whereupon two thyngs may easily coniectured whereof one great likelyhode suspected either osor hath neuer read thynges whereat hee cauilleth nature hee notably shaped sicophauntosorius pag martin luther sayth doth teach extreme desperation would fayne know whence haue pyked luther preached many sermon copiled many bookes published owne coutrey laguage many also turned latine toung readyng perusing hath recouered many person doubt standyng vpon brincke desperation greeuous anguish mynde amongest vnfained simple humble conscience thankefully acknowledge god selfe bee one neuer heare one person much hath perished desperation readyng luther bookesthe doctrine desperation whether proper papistes lutheran hearing doctrine contrary part diuers monumentes history replenished example haue runne headlong vtter dispayre haue gaynesayd withdrawen selues doctrine luther touchyng frauncisce spira reuolted participation doctrine whiche receaued luther preachyng bycause recorde thereof somewhat old present omit remaineth history willyngly vse fresher example later age yet ingenerall needeth neither one man able doe rehearse notable first certeine called iacobus latomus man sometymes wellbe seene amongest deuines louayne tell whether selfe knew osorius liued mainteinyng quarell wherein turmoyle selfe agaynst luther reported departe life selfe desperatio whereof make mention last gaspes brayeng horrible feareful roaring noyse vttered none sounde eares men heard vtterly damned forsaken god hope saluation layed vp store bycause hee wilfully resiste manifest truth knew true couple two others hym fraternitie guarlacke reader diuinitie lecture amogest gertrudianes arnolde bomelye scholer tilman first sayd euen last panges death spake maner liued desperately could endure iudgemet god bycause acknowledge sinnes greater could obteyne geuenesse hauyng fully gorged selfe doctrine desperatio wherein instructed schoolemaister distrust surprised legth intollerable gnawyng conscience practised first kill selfe owne dagger last beyng wholy swallowed vp desperation dyd cut owne bowelles body man knife shall amisse ioyne vnto sadolet cardinall rome sondry disputation mainteined agaynst luther gaue vp ghost without horrible trembling torment conscience suppose also ignoraunt like happened cardinall crescentius legate apostolique see president tridentine councell beyng astonyed sodeine horrour troublesome abashement mynde citie iohn sledan hath made relation commentary shall speake castellane archbyshop aurelia ponchere archbyshop turone procured selues god indignation vengeaunce appeared wonderfull fearefull passios wherewith oppressed tyme death bicause heare luther read bookes bycause cruelly persecute doctrine ye beadroll may reckoned remebrauce iohn eckius iohn eckius others whose whole course lyfe nothyng el continuall mortall combate agaynst luther yeldyng nature altogether voyde spirituall consolation euen last gaspes hee vttered wordes money certeine thousand crownes neede rehearse recordes aucient chronicle minerius cassianus renestenses martinus miserable mocke called romanus prattes lysettes rusius morines beyng horribly plagued seuere iustice god may sufficiet presidentes teach insolently kicke agaynst pricke god vnsearcheable prouidence history french kyng henry ye secondhenry second frech kyng death yet freshe memory deepely emprinted myndes onely eye also men extremely boylyng inward hatred agaynst doctrine receaued deathes wounde selfe eye wherewith determined view execution others forced selfe become manifest spectacle god iustice world could bathe eye bloud ye innocet long sayd henry followed also kyng nauarre procured vnto selfe iust cause onely desperation death also none occasion persecutyng doctrine doe slaunderously reproche doctrine desperation could make register infinite nober englad onely region also receaued wonderfull cofort ye sweete iuyce doctrine call lutherane fell headlong miserable anguishe gnawyng conscience reuoltyng doctrine could neuer attayne one sparckle quyet mynde reclaymed selues first apostasie last many thousandes men wemen child young old age truely recorde haue shewed selues willyng yeld carcass fier fagottes sword rackyngs maner horrible torture rather would recante renounce comfortable doctrine enstructed suppose would neuer haue done suspected neuer small embres desperation haue lurked therein perceaue osorius doth meane word desperation could either expresse mynde aptly distinctly willyng deale simply playnly ende therefore may frame myne auswere hauing regarde meanyng man rather speach examine maner disputyng somewhat aduisedly affiaunce assurauce saluation wherein placed luther doth teach sayth ought place affiaunce righteousnes merites good workes goe concluded hereof therfore luther doth teach doctrine desperation new founde strauge maner argument framed perhappes rule concludeth staffe corner suppose men syluane vse kynde arguyng wooddy forrests make aunswere argument god determined saluation haue bene purchased godly action vertuous endeuour man life altogether without reason osorius doth speake much hope confidence limited within boundes fayth christ foundation thereof builded vpon rocke onely suppose surely person doth allure v home vnto christ confidence workes teacheth v repose whole trust onely sanctuary shoteanker saluation doth declare rather true way assured hope abolishe neither doth rende sunder sinewes man endeuour doth embace disable part ma power doth properly apperteine sonne god thinke discouereth rather well sprynges comfortable glad tydynges gospell lysten pray osorius disputation wonder while deepe insight logicke matter past recouery sayth assured confidece man wilbe enduced rayse vp mynde earnestly vertuous endeuour haue geuen v right rhetoricall position marke concludyng determination catholicke ergo saith whereas luther doth partly dispoile v hope righteousnesse partly doth place wholy righteousnesse christ hope ought proper peculiar ech person doth herein el vtterly subuerte extinguishe dueties endeuours godlynesse v truely deny maner enterprise happen vsuall dayly practize well conceauyng hope doth minister wonderfull courage mynde man whole force lyuelynes wherof desperatio distrust many tymes vtterly daunted purpose alledged agaynst luther whose teachyng lesson tende onely marke much instruct v rule good lyfe onely peculiar office law lead v know whether ought good workes repose affiaunce elles ascribe wholy free mercy god iesu christ bycause godly endeuours vertuous workes prayseworthy whether workes great estimation may satisfie god iudgement deserue eternall lyfe establishe conscieces sauetie grounde principall point controuersie ought place decided much therforetwo kynd desperation two kyndes desperation haue sayd behoued osorius haue distinguished raysed battrye agaynst luther person doe vtterly dispayre forgeuenes sinnes mercy god towardes example desperation cain saul esau antiochus iudas minerius latomus sadolete others kynde desperatio belongeth properly vngodly wicked whiche altogether estraunged god nothyng agreable luther doctrine besides kynde desperation attempt enterprise man wholy discomfited attaine maistrie foremost yet bee discouraged wil employ abilitie much lieth may second left archer shooteth somewhat neare sticke deserueth prayse though hitt pricke lyke manner euery one v doe marche onwarde paynefully warrefarre god law runnyng game trye maistric wherein albeit neuer founde man whiche could lyfe assure selfe attayne appointed goale yet therewith throwen downe conceite bee dispayre saluation neither ought interprete law though practise guidyng thereof onely meanes elles could obteine euerlastyng lyfe law hath purpose endes direct v vnto whiche osorius might haue learned paule augustine diuers others would wittyngly wilfully haue bene blyndthe ende office law first rule vse law represent vnto v inestimable righteousnesse creatour whose image created next condemne vnrighteousnesse abate pride bee tyme steede schoolemaister lead v christ whiche albeit could selfe geue full righteousnes people vnto deliuered first might neuertheles meane space wholesome seueritie hold backe keepe feare restrayne vnbrideled licentiousnesse fleshe orderly comlynesse lestthey runne headlong execrable wicked impietie truly seeme bee principall v law absolute exact perfection wherof neuer man race hetherto able satisfie though vpholde altogether gracious ayde god osorius remember one man sithence tyme sonne god onely except hath throughly performed euery part duetie required law beseech name ca name one ofspryng ada hath perfectly accomplished whole law moueth furiously rage agaynst luther teacheth righteousnes vnperfect hath likewise affirmed truth righteousnesse onely vnperfect condemned righteousnesse lothsome defilynges foule menstruous clothe euen esay prophet accordyng saying lord iesus christ hee adiudged onely deedes wordes soeuer though neuer precisely handled tyme old law onely commyng christ also neither v alone rude vnlettered multitude euen apostle selues performed bee altogether vnauaylable purchasing eternall lyfe yea selues also better plighte condition seruauntes vnprofitable bondeslaues sturre would da haue kept sithence man ignoraunt manifest saying christ apostle either must osorius cite felowes vnto chapter house together lutheran acquyte must henceforth quarell luther cause agayne lord gospell doth promise teacherthe lawe vnprofitable saluation holy ghost couince world sinne righteousnesse shall thinke mente sendyng teacher hee purposed establishe two thynges especially osorius doth seeke chiefly discredite say godly harte beyng enlightened inspiration holy ghost may bee instructed feele owne weakenesse selues fro owne power haue hope saluation attainement thereof nothyng wanteth christ iesu without christ euer haue dispayred casea wholesome kynde trust mistrust thynges rest safe assured one wherof ariseth vnto v cofortable desperation floweth holy affiaunce desperation say one doth exclude true trust iesu christ doth abrogate vayne confidence workes onely neither doe meane confidence whiche doth let louse reynes licentious boldnes vnpunishable libertie confidence doth minister necessary comfortable gladsomnes godly afflicted conscience porting wise allow confidence fearyng thyng forsooth lest way swift osori pag easie attaynement saluation whiche drawe awaye variable mynde man labour slouthfulnesse therfore much better euery man beyng vncertaine owne sauetie holden still feare rather perhappes might seeme haue spoken without reason eternall lyfe thyng depend vpon couenaunt condition workes whereas consisteth wholy free mercy god whiche neither deceaue hath respect worthynesse receaueth gracethe trust saluatio depedeth vpo promise vpo law ergo assured resteth vpon onely credite hym promiseth apportioned good workes freely geuen whiche deserue vnto doe beleue doth iustifie vngodly remayneth osorius must either strippe scripture naked god promise towardes v necessitie conclude trust assured affiaunce vnder promise selfe vtterly ignoraunt promise gospell purporteth bewraye singular blockishnesse herein whiche rather likely bee true would haue first make aunswere vnto whether god haue made v promise allpromise made law without law whether promise law selfe thyng ordeined besides law hereof paule seemeth bee fitte interpretour reporteth promise first geuen abraha ii c xxx yeares lawe published therefore could meanes make frustrate testament geuen first inheritauce came law promise galat thinke good beleue paule rather osorius promise saluation free simple without conditionthese thinges beyng graunted demaunde gentleman vouchsafe teach v kynde couenaunt promised inheritauce vnto v whether confesse free free deny free paule forthwith cry agaynst doth ascribe promise made vnto abraham blessyng seede inheritaunce kyngdome eternall lyfe vnto grace vnto law yea also onely law euen hee yet circumcision confesse needes must bare promise proceeded couenaunt made respect workes freely offred free goodnesse geuer onely reason osorius render vnto v receaue assurednesse certeine assuraunce called greeke nonlatin alphabet fayth osorius hath described bookes entituled de iustitia bee deriued hauyng affiaunce vpon may man settle affiaunce safely vpon god assuredly promiseth simply without condition certeintie promised god father almightie men without exception freely owne accorde yea fayth onely freely say whereby bountifull mercy god poured vpon fleshe may shyne liuely comfortable chearefulnesse afflicted conscience fayth say bycause thynges depende vpon one condition say beleue sonne god promise god yea amen fayth onely howe doth exclude exclude good workes adde also fayth onely bycause exclude good workes company simply though put vre sort shall esteemed bee valewe able iustifie beyng iustified exercise selues geue vnto chief preheminence iustification bycause let lowse reynes voluptuousnesse treade tract vnbrideled lust dissolue seueritie auncient godly discipline vtterly extinguish vertuous endeuours blot glory honest actios choke vp light true religion vndefiled sinceritie finally end defile commendable prayses worthy renowne vnder colour vnpunishable libertie sinnyng deede paynted florishyngs osori forge glorious glytteryngs sophisticall talke wherin simme suttle doth nothyng degender slye craftinesse predecessours neither new deuise practize whiche ouercharged argumentes whiche resolue cast vp presently smocky confused mistes wordes slaunderous reproches purpose dazell eye reader may see open light fashion tertullus aduocate iewes behaue selfe agaynst pauletertull actc whose doctrine hee could meanes emproue rusheth vpon like iolye sycophaunte slaunders reproches vttered smoathe delicate order speache lye vntrue reportes forged accusation outcryes exclaimyng agaynst troublesome man seditious raiser new sectes defiler temple euen selfe cotumelies tertullus reproch paule foelix presidet like tullian tertullus like vanitie lesse impudencie doth accuse martin luther whiche generally hee innocent cleare paule tyme araignement surely good conscience wayeng matter indifferently ca ignoraunt osorius selfe suppose deny bee willyng yelde truth neuer braynesicke thought dyd enter luther head geue scoape vngodly pursue wickednesse rather hee alwayes mynde comfort afflicted conscience discouer sure founteines consolation christ iesu crucified v whereby may perceaue vayne glorious tertully maner desperation kynde affiaunce luther doth teach affiaunce enemy saluation necessary vndoubted confidence able approue selfe allowable infallible promise god assured testimony holy scripture otherwise christian fayth fortresse whereunto might safely trustchristian peace affiaunce would fayne know peace reioysing christ iesu whereof paule doth certifie whiche beyng iustified fayth haue peace god lord iesus christ wherein stand assured reioyce hope glory god rom accesse confidence boldenesse fayth ephe accesse throne grace assured affiaunce hebr ende doth lord oft gospell encourage v conceaue couragious boldnesse vsing reason alone ouercome world behofe people iohn yet euery one v must enforced purchase selfe victory owne endeuour fulnesse ioye holy ghost employeng seruice maner bonde seruauntes child must lyue vnder law hope attayne possession inheritaunce rewarde workes thorough free adoption rathergalat spirite adoption cryeng harte abba father wherof paule doth oftentymes make mention yet satisfied sentence auswere shall make esay prophetesay foresheweth euerlasting ioye vnto beyng redeemed christ couerted syon esay cherefulnesse hart comfort steede mournyng glory steede ash oyle gladnesse steede spirite sadnesse esay promised ye behalfe messias yet come ouer prophet doth wonderfully commende feete preach peace people thyng el doth note wordes excellent glory churche aboundauntly flow affiaunce mediatour vpon beleue meaneth chearefull prophecie ieremie concernyng commyng messias comfortable consolation gospell comeierem dayes sayth hee iuda shalbe saued israell shall dwell confidence agayne prophet make dwell sauetie whereunto accordeth likewise saying prophet ezechiel prophecying raysing vp shepheard blessednesse age euen phrase speache almost doth promiseezech come passe men dwell rest securitie without feare c remayneth learne osorius sayeng dwell securitie without feare doth emporte whiche much selfe confesse haue relation fleshe must follow necessitie interprete bee spoken spirite sorte shall appeare saying must bee applyed confidence spirite whenas ye shall defraude christian fayth assurednesse affiaunce though ye would dispoyle world benefite sunne finally certeinetie confidence shall remayne doe depende say wholy vpon workes vpon fayth promise free mercy doth make promise graunt thereunto one two ye must needes confesse either ought obteyne much vprightenes workes shall auswere satisfie iudgement god neuer doe el variablenesse mynde shall alwayes stagger hether thether perpetuall amazed vncerteinetie doe ye perceaue osorius streightes diuinitie forceth goe ye therfore maister tertullus thinke self whether two either luther osorius tullianisme doe stiffely maintaine doctrine desperation surely paule teach lesson farre vnlike abrogatyng cofidence workes none least vnassured doth coclude thynges vnder fayth onelyrom therefore fayth sayth hee may knowen proceede accordyng grace thereby promise may assured whole seede wherefore pray fayth forsooth bycause proportion affiaunce must bee measured deseruynges workes farre man may possibly conceaue neuer litle hope saluation shalbe forced rather procure vnto selfe headlong downfall bottomles gulfe desperation righteousnesse law faythand therfore paul discoursing vpo sortes righteousnesse aswell law fayth hee exquisitely distinguished one bycause mutuall contrarietie disagreement betwixt wherewith varie eche doth conclude length principall substaunce whole matter dependeth vpo fayth wholy accordyng grace wherfore accordyng grace verely bycause hauyng abandoned righteousnes commeth law worketh indignation therfore engendreth vncerteinetie ye soule might established grace takyng holdfast promise fayth might attende nothyng el whence conceaue assurednesse hope attayne euerlastyng lyfe vsuall custome amongest men earnestly awayte due performauce thynges promised contrariwise thyngs graunted conditionally neuer till assured condition obserued condition might bee throughly accomplished accordyng absolute perfection fulnesse wherewith limited doubt law selfe effectuall enough saluationleuit hee doth keepe commaundementes shall lyue case standeth much nill subiect breache law creature bee founde whiche dare affirme selfe able performe condition annexed law god may bold place maistershyp one number must necessitie seeke meanes saluation law somewhere el bycause eternall lyfe must ascribed man death lyfe neither opinion workes vnto free mercy god whiche doth onely ouercome hee iudged wherein example sake let v heare dauid selfe though neuer well beloued god doth tymorously humble selfe prayer beseechyng god enter iudgement seruaut psal hee dismayed pray bycause sayth fleshe shalbe iustified thy sight thenthe affiaunce workes noble kyng worthy prophet standyng arrayned almightie god durst commit protectio cause deseruyngs workes shall osorius hosius dare bee bold doe read remayneth recorde barnarde beyng otherwise prayseworthy man foresawe ende lyfe approche summoned appeare iudgement seate eternall god began expresse wonderfull fearefulnesse bee much dismayed mynde frendes standyng would haue recomforted encouraged cheare selfe confidence good lyfe hee lead deede sayth perceauebarnard may seeme bee estimation amongest feare least iudgement god farre vnlike iudgement men truely aptly remembred barnarde albeit knew well enough paraduenture yet beyng pointe death perceaued much effectually euen see haue chaunced many others popishe brood though delite flatter selues neuer much glory merites vprightnesse workes yet death knocketh doore conscience willeth bidde adiew worlde forthwith castyng away trust merites accordyng recantation ye doctrine shrowde selues wholy death christ hereupon fasten chiefest shooteanker sauety assured hauen perfect blessednesse whereby may vnderstand ye porting prelate frame righteousnesse builded vpon deseruynges workes vnioynted shaken peeces force wherof neuer yet efficacie valew creature could onely abyde incomprehensible vnmeasurablenesse god iudgement also bee wholy appalled encoutryng death endure sight thereof must needes yelde throughly vanquished farre workes lawe come short true righteousnessemoreouer sithence place offereth selfe debate vertues would wish cosider aduisedly selfe wellknowen saying augustine doth purporte farre doth dissent contentious quarell righteousnesse whereas treatyng vertue charitie speaketh wiseaugustine uertue sayth kynde charitie wherewith loue thing ought beloued charitie appeareth others lesse also nothyng fulnes thereof whiche increased while man liueth world neuer seene log may encreased truely soeuer lesse ought admitte supply commeth default default flesh iustified sight wherein pause while pray debate throughly selfe whether charitie whiche christ an though neuer apparauntly discernable yea regeneration also lame defectiue may thought scarse appeareth meane resemblaunce thereof shalbe iudged selfe osorius chiefly amongest one sparcke much true charitie iote much humanitie seene much shall read inuectiues may easely coniecture heareth modestie osorius christian byshop rather tragicall orestes furiously ragyng vpon stage returne augustine whose iudgement diuinitie know well osorius allow truely small accoumpt made worthynesse righteousnesse could neuer haue vehemetly vttered wordesaug confes lib cap wee vpright life sayth god examine settyng mercy aside like maner gregory doth litle varie augustine wordes though nothyng sence altogether dissenteth osorius expoundyng sayeng iob theirgregor iob cap chapter videl man bee iustified beyng compared god holy man sayth hee doth perceaue deseruynges best workes faultie wayed righteous ballaunce iust iudgegregor com cap xi chapter redoublyng selfe saying augustine bycause sayth excludyng mercy workes examined lyfe righteous wilbe founde folter faynte vnder burthen sinne hereunto may annexed consent barnarde made mention worthy notedbarnardu touchyng matter makyng long discourse vnrighteousnesse man righteousnesse demaundeth question last valew righteousnesse may sight god shall reputed filthy sayth lyke vnto foule menstruous clothe according saying prophet strickte narrow examination made therof shall righteousnesse foude vnrighteous nothyng worthe last though matter confessed without cotrouersie cocludeth saying shall become sinne whenas righteousnesse selfe hath nothyng alledge defence much therefore doctrine manifold manifest confirmed many famous authours emprinted holy writte allowed many inuincible testimony sacred scripture published approued writynges best learned interpretour established vnuanquishable authoritie holy ghost ratified common consent auncient primitiue church finally manifestly knowen experience age haynous crime osorius pag cruell offence shameles trespasse intellerable facte say bee suffered luther nay rather speake truth whece puddle haue sucked ye shameles impudencie osorius singular foolishnes vnmeasurable sycopha ticall rage frantique tragicall furye cruell vnreasonable custome raylyng agaynst christian brother without cause reason haue rather deserued well euill handes know whether proceeded cankred malice lurkyng within corruption nature sure neuer learned insolencie holy scripture rule gospell ensuyng example christ apostle mylde curteous conuersation perhaps osorius hath determined selfe leaue ye posteritie especiall iewell monument eloquence cicero inuectiues called phillipica cphillipica yea bene couenient haue chosen methode treate vpon farre seemely haue bent rage penne agaynst others rather agaynst luther bucer others lyke willyng confesse truth simply doctrine doth luther bucer haddon others discourse vpon one selfe gospell teache matter paule many epistle doth earnestly enforce say ascribe ye hope saluatio iesu christ onely alone repose whole ankerhold righteousnesse selues ye sonne god law workes law fayth preceptes godly lyfe augustine witnessethaugust epist fayth iesu christ letter spirite merites good deedes mercy god finally sorte mercy accoumpt mercy mercy accordyng saying augustine vnlesse bee altogether freely geuen christias dayes straighted bramble may lawfull speake franckely congregatio selfe prophetes apostle christ selfe holy ghost purest authours auncient antiquitie haue set downe writyng partie doyng shalbe forthwith detected though hee practized subuert honestie vertuous endeuour shalbe constrayned pleade selfe arrayned como barretour committed haynous horrible execrable fact detestable high treason neither crime yet wherewith tertullian rayler doth rage raylyng crawleth foreward enceasing degreees amplificatio beyng satisfied haue accused luther vndermyner honestye vertue haue cutte peeces sinewes godly exercise vertuous endeuour besides horrible accusatio chargeth also crime passing measure intollerable bycause sayth hee doth wrest mynde wisedome paule serue owne lust pag redoublyng agayne wordes bycause seeme vnskilfull ciceronian hee addeth doth abuse testimony holy scripture establish owne vnshamefastnesse c syr pray sooth sundry place apostle especially epistle written romanes wherein bycause shall onely bee conceaued mynde also perceaued viewe disorderly luther standard bearer heritiques cabbenmate haddon counterfaites new gospell haue alwayes hetherto interpretation epistle gropyngly lyke nightowles lumpred darkenesse let v euery v open eye eares lysten new starte vp prophet while elegant tertullus sittyng high deske may instruct v blockyshe asseheades archymenides lyne vpon sande chalke v way set vp speciall markes whereby may finde lyuely naturall sence mynde meanyng epistle osori expositio vpo epistle paule romaine first concernyng gentile bycause may begyn paule doth sayth euident enough enlightened singular gift nature endued excellent vnderstadyng adorned beautified wonderfull ornamentes nature hath euer denyed goe followeth hereofpag wherefore asmuch great force nature excellencie vnderstandyng knowledge learnyng yea great worthynesse reason capacitie could auayle nothyng gentile perfect righteous liuyng exceede iniquitie outragious lust thereby appeareth playnely nature voyde ayde helpe attayne righteousnesse eternall lyfe much waye touchyng gentile apostle remoued away confidence whiche vsually ascribed law nature turneth speach forthwith iewes bycause iewes selues lyke maner place whole affiaunce shadowes outward ceremony apostle likewise yea sharpely also inueyeth agaynst declaryng ceremony law ordinaunces prescribed moyses profite nothyng whereby might bee iote restrained running headlong kynde wickednesse nothyng lesse enclined filthynesse conuersation neither myte lesse estraunged vertuous endeuour prophane gentile whereby appeareth effect paules conclusion tedeth end make manifest neither nature ceremony moses law say washyngs sacrifice clensinges circumcision like corporall ordinaunces cofidence wherof people swell puft vp pride take away sinne thyng auayle righteousnes discourse osorius doubt gentle reader thou doest sufficiently vnderstand thou bee capacitie meanyng paule whole sence disposition doctrine epistle romanes doth purporte accordyng osorius diuinitie say may learne may hope ayde towards saluatio fro nature ordinauces old law beyng grauted remaineth learne oracle great maister whence ought length seeke true way saluation poynt chiefly consisteth forsooth righteousnes saith say osorius doth define itwherin sauetie christian consisteth accordyng osorius eschewyng sinne earnestly embracyng godlynesse vertue pietie vnto righteousnesse onely ought referre surety ankerhold saluation hereupo coyned new oracle delphos boeotia forged osorius wildernes syluain worthy registred eternitie people toungespag righteousnesse onely sayth doth reconcile god mankynde man hath spoken mystery beyng exquisitely piked hidde mystery diuinitie sithence osorius requireth earnestly graunted without contradiction shall become fayth onely wherewith lutheranes bucerans prattle much selues iustified nay rather shall become fayth osorius onely righteousnesse workes doe accomplish absolute fulnesse iustification oingenious head wonderfull deepe conclusion framed conference reason apt application middle proposition first clarckely concludyng shuttyng vp one knotte together unlesse deepe deuine cunnyngly culled argument closet pope breast horsepoole within whose bosome knowledge god man enclosed vnlesse endymyon soundly snorted aristotle ethickes hill parnassus man doubt whether hee could euer haue bene able happely haue pearced inward hidden meanyng apostle doctrine great sharpenesse force witte vnderstandyng haue euer descried sence therof effectually discouered aboundauntly doe triumphauntly reioyce happynesse learnyng blessed estate catholicke people age ioyfull ye good successe notable realme portingall especially beyng otherwise renowmed great treasure trade marchadizes yet become fortunate respect inestimable iewell ye world except great darkenesse vnderstandyng gratified v wt wonderfull deuine might restore vnto haue doubted lest diuinity haue growe great perill vtter vndoing haue bene throwe vnrecouerable downfall world would haue interpreted paules epistle wise heard truely part others like vnto beyng inspired profoude deepe capacity alwayes heretofore conceaue matter maner apostle whole endeuour trauaile epistle teded none end makyng men behold greatnesse god wrath first agaynst sinne hee might better enduce perceaue feele nation people aswell heathenishe iewes also selues chiefly continuyng profession god law yet concluded vnder sinne might dispoyle matter glorye vpon hauyng humbled brought subiection god might rayse agayne comfort christ denouncyng vnto firme assured hope wherewith soeuer would beleue afterwardes obteine euerlastyng lyfe merite worke especiall grift free promise worthynesse faythes sake simply without workes promise might infallible merite none mercy god accordyng proportion singular righteousnesse whiche selues peculiar euery v accordyng righteousnesse whiche fayth christ iesu whiche god euen onely righteousnesse faythphil haue bene alwayes hetherto persuaded naturall meanyng sence paules doctrinethe true vnderstadyng iustification accordyng paule right rule iustification neither could euer gesse paule pronounceth v bee iustified fayth without deedes law part law excluded onely treate ceremony relation body apperteined soule accordyng grosse dulnesse rather conceaue saying wise alone many good men iarryng alwayes vppon stryng mistooke note opinion paule exemption exclude ceremoniall shadowishe law onely serued letter onely absolute perfect part law also indifferently whereof maketh whole discourse epistle whiche also doth note name spirituall sayth procureth wrath common iewes gentile alyke euen part law whiche commaundeth thou shalt lust rom examination whereof sinne discerned rom finally handwrityng conteyned tenne table written agaynst v rom fastened vpon crosse christ ephes bycause sayinges could bee referred ceremoniall law part law whiche conteyned preceptes maners could neuer otherwise interprete sense meanyng apostle comparison owne wordes together vntill new doctour published world new light exposition cosideryng therfore matter plight remayneth gentle reader appeale thy iudgement abyde thy verdite herein whether may seeme thee luther haue wrested mynde wordes apostle lust osorius rather haue peruerted owne folly goe thinke good note argumentes wherewith osorius iudgeth selfe strongly fenced paule sayth saydpag iewes comme dable integritie innocencie lyfe yet deedes godlynes nothyng auayle attayne vnto attende proposition sayth hee founde whole discourse paule nay rather hee doth condemne guiltie wickednesse crueltie groundworke beyng layd remayneth rame fast buildyng vp good morter maner conclusion applyed wise therfore paule doth rightly conclude affirmeth man iustified deedes law meaneth ceremony shadowes cleansinges law consisted outward obseruation dyd nothyng profite attaynemet righteousnesse passing pearcyng witte chrysippus miserable luther vtterly ouerthrowen argument goe let v ayde luther somewhat helpe vnloose gordian knotte bee possible although may vtterly deny forme argument first choppe bycause conteineth coclusion spoken premiss yet either pardonyng wynking escape let v examine substaunce first proposition paule quoth perceaued life iewes haue bene vndefiled endeuoures workes lyfe sincere perfect concluded man bene iustified workes law c deede good syr confesse bee true apostle perceaued first added also speake might happely respect haue followed haue conclucluded could bee possible osorius apostle would euer speake sorte euident god scripture impossible performeth commaundementes shall liue deut wherfore conuersation bene voyde blame like integritie could haue aunswered throughly satisfied perfect law god vnto vttermost title thereof bee doubted paule would neuer haue denyed iustified workes law lead perfect vpright life yea rather would haue affirmed spake truerom glory honour peace bee vnto euery one worketh righteousnesse iewes aswell gentile c foresaw iewes swell certeine pharisaicall opinion workes proudly vaunted selues vpon disdaynefully detestyng heathenish vngodly respect selues neither seemed stand neede mediatour therfore end might shake away pestilent persuasion owne righteousnesse force seeke succour christ hereupon vtterly dispoyle workes abilitie iustifie say taketh away affiance workes beyng partes vnperfect bycause hee may ascribe wholy fayth onely repose christ alone therfore may orderly distinctly make auswere maior beyng hypotheticall copulatiue doe intricately entangle miserably choake vp obscu e speach first must remember obseruation law hath double vnderstandynga double obseruation law one sorte christ dyd obserue law father mortall men obserue sort christ perfectly absolutely weakly rawly yea know performe portion thereof meanely whereupon ariseth double consideration righteousnesse one perfect peculiar christ onely valew god vnperfect lame properly apperteineth man perhappes carryeth resemblaunce holynesse opinion men estimation god sufficeth saluation moreouer purchasing first sincere righteousnesse man must bee furnished two principall tallentes one hee accomplish whole law part thereof defectiue hee throughly performe euery part thereof nothyng may added absolute perfection el hee may heare scripture threatenethdeut cursed persisteth wordes law doe c gallat agayne breaketh least guiltie iames much neuer man able bryng thyng passe christ onely controuersie mortall men well iewes gentile fast holden vnder curse whereupon apostle long debatyng matter concludeth man bee iustified workes law sentence yet taken though deedes law beyng sincerely perfectly done accordyng prescript rule lawe could profite thyng towardes saluation performed person christ whose life partes free altogether blemish sinne could attaynted saying paule man could bee iustified workes law iustified owne workes especially good right also might mainteine lyke challenge therein infirmitie able rayse selfe perfection christ whereupon heare apostle aptly arguyng wisegalat law sayth bene deliuered could haue geuen life doubt righteousnesse come law gallat wherefore sayd law geue lifewherefore law iustifieth bycause law wated efficacie geue life bycause destitute sufficient power accomplish perfection law otherwise bee force righteousnesse law effectuall eternall life righteousnesse least perfect nature capable righteousnesse absolutely beyng enuironed great weakenesse fleshe side beset sinnes yea sold vnder sinne endeuour yet vnperfect neither performe whole law neither comprehend small portion therof duetyfull exact righteousnesse therfore saying apostle may rightely applied vnto v wherein hee affirmeth man iustified workes law workes doe signifie paulefor osorius crooked conueyaunce doth wrest deedes law ceremoniall law altogether fonde friuolous worthy scorned beyng ouerthrowen many sounde reason first besides doth manifestly appeare whole discourse phrase epistle selfe paule treated none law morall law approued chiefly wordes apostle doth onely testifie selfe law made mention place also part law doth reason wise selfe law whiche law could bryng passe euen part wherein weake reason infirmitie flesh c part surely consisted ceremoniall law morall law ten table whereupon doe argue agaynst osorius wise man bereft righteousnesse part onely wherein offence committed iewes offended nothyng ceremoniall law onely sinned morall law manifest therfore paule spake ceremoniall law law tenne table moreouer whereas paule discourse law whiche procureth wrath rom geuen sinne might sinnefull rome sayd written harte gentile rom whiche doth discouer knowledge sinne rom forbiddeth lust called holy spirituall whiche sinne doth shewe selfe aboundauntly purchase damnation rom whiche law deliuered death christ rom called law righteousnesse rom finall full accomplishing whereof loue rom many place haue perused paules epistle desire vouchsafe read haue read beseech aunswere whether iudgement sayinges seeme concerne ceremoniall law part marke well gentle reader note aduizedly hee speaketh paul first praysed workes iewes afterwardes derogated iustification workes c uery well nation doe name men whose singular integritie lyfe study meere mercy imputeth geuen reward proportion duetie dette man imputeth duely owyng vnto let v testimony scripture cocernyng whiche imputed bycause hee thynges commaunded albeit many thynges righteousnesse operatio law onely righteousnesse grounded vpon fayth fayth christ c fayth righteousnesse cornelius god cornelius mention made actes apostle holy man feared god together whole houshold dealyng much almes poore makyng continuall intercession almighty god great glorious commendation truely excellent godlynesse sensible would say ought referred ceremoniall law morall law rather yet
