pitie shalbe sayd riche youg man gospell beyng commaunded keepe comaundementesthe riche young man gospell made aunswere hee obserued dayes lyfe shall recite example pharisae prayeng templethe pharisie praying temple vauntyng selfe proudly vppon trust workes gaue thankes god others lyued spoyle fraudulently deceaue man contractes prodigally cosume owne goodes defile neighbour wife committed adultery murtherer wrong doer neighbour neither sorte like vnto publicane fasted twise sabboth gaue tenth goodes poore c neede produce nathanaell nathaniell true israelite christ selfe acknowledge true israelite praysed vnfained simplicitie ye perceiue person besides duetyfull obseruaunce ceremoniall law vtter shewe expresse certeine resemblaunce good workes studious endeuour morall law notwithstandyng ye valewe one myte regarded sight god albeit alledge thing end would extenuate fault iewes paule affirmeth inexcusable osorius doth see groude paules accusation agaynst first apostle well forsee law god partes perfect requireth exquisite full absolute obediece conceaued could possibly performed industry neither ignoraunt vnmeasurable arrogaunt pride nation lynked lyke vanitie beyng wonderfull farre way distant meane obseruation law yet swell puft vp false glaueryng conceite owne excellency perfection though left part therof vndone persuadyng vnto theselues saluation thereby wherein much rather deserued vtter destruction incurre double offence first bycause sundry wayes horribly dishonour defile god sacred law though materiall perfitely accomplished whole law man might iustly marueile wonderfully flattered selues though trimmely behaued selues assayes seemed owne conceite bee prety holy men despising certeine pharisaicall hautines nation besides selues wherfore apostle indifferetly tenderyng miserable errour eche nation aswell gentile iewes doth earnestly debate three thynges chiefly placethe scope paules disputation romaine first might conuince iewes also gentile indifferently sinner god might remoue false opinion affiance lastly hee might emprinte true way confidence last purpose apostle osorius doth openly bewray blockishe ignoraunce swaruyng varyeng altogether entent apostle although iudgement bee sounde agreable apostle trust whiche iewes reposed law moyses lesse vayne voyde reason confidence gentile framed life law nature yet question moued touchyng assignyng true righteousnesse paule teache one thyng osorius workes ceremoniall morall law excluded fro iustificatiofor whereas paule doth bende whole force disputation onely marke excludyng deedes workes endeuours whether apperteine ceremoniall morall law rule doctrine maners hee might referre summe iustification hope saluation wholy onely fayth sonne god thyng el doth ciceronian tertullus discourse bookes entituled de iustitia wherein playeth much philosopher though ye schoole morall philosophie el doth breath practize greedely mainteine persuade v wheresoeuer paule doth exclude workes iustificationosori doth take workes excluded fro iustification ceremony law doth exempt nothyng el ceremoniall law conclusion true righteousnesse righteousnesse sight god whiche christ doth impute beleuers fayth righteousnesse euery man doth properly procure make peculiar selfe owne vertue sinceritie innocencie good conuersation offryng combate pardy paule whether quarell iustification paule shall probable argument exclude confidence workes osorius driue fayth vtter exile vnto fayth bookes leaueth maner place truly yeldeth litle credite thereunto neither maruellpag matter osorius doth reporte ought iuste god iustified godfayth hath place almost osorius righteousnesse onely doe procure fauour god reconcile god makind wherein onely ought settle sauety worthines man righteous hee keepeth lawe say iuste shall liue workes fayth iudge beseeche thee gentle reader redeemed bloud iesus christ efficacie either christes bloud shed thee may estimation thy fayth towardes christ must truly meanes osorius wt glorious eloquence may aswell plucke downe christ heauen banish fayth earth snatche paule handes roote gospell harte comfortable consolation conscience finally despoyle world light sunne may together lumper groape darkenesse blynde guide capteine darkenesse one two place paule obiected agaynst paule selfe whereby osorius may ye better mainteine challenge agaynst paule paules owne weaponspag paule sayth sharpe coflict iewes alwayes touchyng ceremony hereof doth epistle galathians protest wise ye circumcised christ doth nothyng profite confesse bee true lyke maner writyng hebrues doth say lawe doth auayle nothyng perfection meanyng ceremoniall law conclude length therfore osorius despight logicke though neuer angry ergo wheresoeuer paule doth make tion abandonyng law treatie saluatio must necessitie interprete spoke onely ceremoniall law wise morall law ueryly would much sticke herein good sir accordyng logicke may lawfull deriue conclusion part wholeosori obiection confuted kynde argument instructed frame argument sorte place osorius sporteth bitterly enough vsing rhetoricall digressios sometymes pleasauntly disposed play haddones schoolemaister nose soeuer hee enformed principle rhetoricke hee young much iust cause might take man would vse offered occasio geue counter scoffe agaynst maister quareller whosoeuer whiche nooseled youth logickeosori doth erre rule logicke taught foolishly senselesly make bald argumets fetche conclusion vnsufficient numbryng partes affirme ye whole disordered order arguyng place paule twise perhaps speakyng oftentymes law hath relation ceremoniall law ergo wheresoeuer hee maketh discourse law god meanyng tendeth construction eue whole discourse epistle nay rather vnderstand paule throughly would crookedly wrest meanyng owne grosse sensualitie ye easily perceaueosori paralogisme insufficient enumeration partes way negatiue hee doth orderly proceede surest maner arguyng whole partes vniuersall particular vniuersall proposition may iustly denyed followeth necessitie particular propositios may admitted doth say workes law iustifie ye may duely conclude hereof ergo neither ceremoniall morall naturall politicke ciuill law doth worke iustification marke osorius much doe beare doe cut much myne owne right vnto whiche could neuer bee able argument wynne handes admit foundation argument otherwise altogether false yet present tyme graunt seeme true would selfe bee paule doth reason law doth chiefly meane thereby ceremoniall law yet monstruous argument whereby ye trauaile cofirme affirmation one part ye nagation ye part wise paule doth deny ye ceremoniall law doth iustifie ye iewes ergo morall lawe doth iustifie nay rather much soundly haue reasoned turning coclusion backward ye ceremoniall law ye principall substauce moyses law doe iustifie ergo neither part law doth iustifie albeit deny swathlyng cloutes primitiue church many doubt arose amongest disciple selues touchyng reteinyng moyses ceremony much peter selfe durst bold receaue cornelius captaine felowshyp gospell comaunded heauenly oracle neither could strife ceremoniall law yet appeased amongest brethre false apostle circumcision stiffely tooth naylethe ceremony law hardly abrogated primitiue church actes defende obseruaunces ceremoniall law neither would geue consent gentile receaued cogregation vnlesse would circumcized moyses law endeuoured could charge christian ye yoke ceremoniall law vntill counsell holden ierusalem holy ghost determine gentile charged iudaicall tradition except fewe onely doubted osorius doth say paule much adoe euery place ceremoniall law yea dealt oftetymes therein without manifest perill lyfe yet while appeared much one sparckle dissention doubtfulnesse one question raysed amongest brother agaynst morall law keepyng whereof yet adiudged necessary controuersie remayned yet ceremony customes moyses law last question decided enquirie began made afterwardes part law seemed challenge chief authoritie especiall gouernement ouer conscience men morall law abrogated respect vse respect iustificatioand euen inestimable benefite god sprang vp vnto v paule first call backe controuersie question speciall particular generall vniuersall disputing onely outward ceremony whole doctrine morall law also whereunto suppose hee moued without great cause incklyng surely thyng would ensue thereof afterwardes came passe ceremoniall law beyng made altogether vneffectuall many person would wrongfully ascribe free iustification purchased bloud iesus christ workes morall law thyng paule foresee false apostle selfe wee may easily perceaue happen pharisaicall rabbynes dayes amongest osorius chiefly present wherfore doubted paule raysed vp speciall prouidence god euen purpose discoursing throughly vpon whole law vpon effect vse office end law doth fully describe vnto v much ought attribute workes much ought yelde grace god herein discouereth wellsprynges sounde doctrine finally declareth vnto v whiche false true righteousnesse sight god wherein doth consist likewise whereunto ought referredpsal workes sayth man liuyng shalbe iustified workes well workes thengalat fayth sayth iesu christ yet speaketh adding thereunto proofe yeldeth reasonrom bycause workes sayth promise maner teacheth paule learnedly playnly osorius practizeth wype away negatiue proposition paule trimme shift though paule place dischargeth workes iustification meane nothyng el man repose trust assured sauetie ceremoniall law onely uery well reason teach v whereupon grounde aff aunce veryly fayth sayth apostle paule fayth workes fayth truely spoken apostle sayth osorius ceremony ye old law altogether iewish fayth therfore neither yet wise doctrine luther uouchsafe therfore good felowshyp osorius escry one safe hauen v wherein poore forlorne abiectes may cast anker saue selues fro shipwracke forsooth workes sayth osorius keepyng prescribed rule vertuous lyfeosori iudgement iustificatio say innocencie chastitie modestie abstinence vprightnesse mynde holynesse religion feruentnesse spirite abou daunce loue god earnest endeuour godlynesse deedes righteousnesse dueties pietie geuyng much almonesse obedience keepyng peacible vnitie like ornamentes treasure wherof osorius many wordes maketh long rehearsall whiche vertues much one croome sparckle lutheran buceranes new gospeller kynde people nothyng bee named wicked nothyng thought vpon pestiferous nothyng troublesome common wealth nothyng readyly armed rayse maliciousnesse sow contentious quarelles strife enemitie nothyng pernicious procure destruction prince none geue bloudsuckyng treason beyng embrued wickednesse licentiousnesse libertie lust manner shamelessenesse crueltie madnesse outragiously rushe place whereby may thrust gospell place defile thynges filthy stenche wheresoeuer make neuer litle abode corrupt land trecherous villanies finally doe poyson ayre doe abandone chastitie geue full scope voluptuousnesse roote feare god law man law outrage promise vnpunishable libertie contrary partethe fruite good workes betwixt papistes protestates wayed indifferently meane court rome sacred citie florisheth farre maner countenaunce maiestie seuere discipline vertuous lyfe first royall hygh chief prelate renowmed monarche prelate sittyng peter owne chayre reuerend estate tridentine councell worshypfull massemongers romish church great doctours old gospel monastery dorters forgeshops pure doctrine ye chast selles holy nunnes finally sacred senate catholicke people presidentes wickednesse abhomination may bee seene spotte much corrupt infection raigneth ambition lust insolencie neither kynde malice quarellyng crueltie foule vnseemely thyng sauoryng earthly contagion discernable amongest generation whole heapes yea huge mountaines godly heauealy store doth florishe abounde vnquietnesse molestation empire princely gouernement seede plottes mortall warres shew much bloudy battell treason ouerthrowe kynges publicke authoritie seditious plate cotentious discorde finally earthly thyng secret closettes romishe court much diogenes would midday torche prye neuer narrowly able finde citie rome one harlot strumpet much conclude possible heare amogest sacred catholicke conuenticle sounde cauillation mutteryng outragious slaunders blaste cunnyngly forged lye wherof others sect cleare bookes osorius chiefly purely purged wherein appeareth smatche brabling distempered affection lyeng slaunder iarre erronious doctrine significatio mynde troubled seuered castle reason thynges debated expounded peaceble gentlenesse quyet tranquillitie mynde wonderfull lenitie mildenesse rigorous malicious wordes slaunderous carterlike reproches inuincible argumetes forcible dartes achilles hector discharged thinke guttes ye troian horse nothyng vttered ye vayne ostentatio witte reuengemet spightfull hatred triumphe victory fie beware gentle reader simple earnest desire aduaunce vertue pietie especiall cause forsooth sparkes embres honesty godlynesse luther hath raked vp buryed vtterly quenched might agayne quickened florishe sacred see rome euen samethe markes true righteousnesse among papistes bee workes ye needes know catholicke reader good deedes men wherewith doe prepare entyre true righteousnesse furnish iourney heauen wherewith ladder clymbe steppe purchase eternall inheritaunce el euen must bee right way heauen meane space many foggy thicke cloudes hath paule seruaunt god apostle iesus christ ouerwhelmed christia people deepe darkened doungeons hath drowned sens albeit rapt thyrd heauen yet conceaued incomprehensible wisedome forgeshops mysticall philosophy belike could escry throughout heauens hidden secret men iustified workes made righteous fayth sonne god fayth respect workes finally especiall meanes singular substaunce iustification sorte bee wayed may attayned el christ onely meanes fayth onely christ paule receaued doctrine heauen taught v doctrine receaued thence part osorius disputed sort ye teach paynyme common wealth ethnicke philosopher amongest iewes turkes might happely haue come passe suppose aristotlelike iustice might haue obteined least resemblaunce truth perhappes crept credite nay rather bee doubted iewes selues turkes consederate portingall argument could scarsely alledge proofes bryng forth vnto v present neither would thinke expoude ye phrase word selfe vse much contend together tully tusculane question academycall probability platoes common wealth iewishe thalmude ne yet turkes alcaron churche iesu christ surely ye ought haue regarded place chiefly ye wrate know ought haue behaued selfe whe doctrine ought haue published great auditorie personage ye doe represent countrey person common ruffian suppose byshop mary haue played part rascall vnder visor byshop pardon pray speakyng truth common barrettor rogish ruffian could vomitte shamelesse scurrilitie paule doth little esteeme credite gospell hee holdeth better accursed yea though aungell heauen doe bryng contrary one shall beare collouerthwarte osorius like vice play new founde chau gelyng make myngle mangle sacred worde lord vnsauorie subtelties peruert pure vndefiled sinceritie gospell grace like wild boare moyle vp rootes florishyng plentyfull uynearde blessed felicitie planted lord selfe blynd bussardly owle eye mynde osorius yet wrapped darkened cloude cleare light gracious mercy god shynyng aboue pearce dull dazeled sens see manifest light truth yet haue bene much seemely haue comforted holy ghost enabled better grace teache truth simply haue yelded truely behoued haue quallified rage vsed modesty least towardes dissence selfe willyng pursue true pathe heauen ye yet haue foreclosed entrye others willyng enter knowyng owne disabilitie teachyng ye yet shamefastly haue bewrayed vnskilfulnes made end legth least reteyned reasonable order rascallyke raylyng immeasurable insolencie wilfully haue rushed tragicall exclamation bene better acquainted cause tosse turmoyle selfe question though ye profession meere straunger matter wherein scarcely sauour thyng surely vnderstand little coldly senselesly man brutishly vse selfe therein disorderly outragiously fury hell could horribly must pardon osorius spake playnly franckly thinke wherein speake moued malice melancholicke affectio agaynst person wish well vnto truly beseeke god hartely graunt sound iudgemet feare osorius least within osorius dwelleth guest besides osorius hee best perhappes whatsoeuer doth continually teaze pricke foreward busie braynes poysoned pestiferous deuises wish well assured osorius loue soules sauetie wholesome cou sell wellwiller shall litle preuayle would aduertize tender vnskilfull youth posterite bowel iesus christan exhortatio reader take diligent beedefulnesse readyng osorius bookes left beyng allured sweete poysoned bayte mermaydes melody vse wordes ierome bee hooked vnwares carryed away delusion errours know plausible easie matter iudgement flesh learnedly plentyfully preach payse commedation vertue righteousnesse rule preceptes man lyfe ciuill gouernement polliticque statute ordinaunces excellencie lawes happeneth part theame swifter readynesse speach sensible sharpenesse deuise vsuall admiration worldlyngesthe prayse cicero auciet philosopher discoursing vpo vertue wherein many notable rhetorician subtill philosopher heretofore haue thought best employ endeuours whole force eloquence without great commendation witte singular prayse ingenious inuention whole laudable trauaile therein ought chuse accompt prayseworthy men desirous emparte posteritie worthy mo umentes atchieued excellencie learnyng nymblenesse capacitie seuere pursuyng vertue vertuous discipline wherewith wouderfully beautified returne osorius whose diligence also imitation doe commende hath made choyse especially may direct imitation whereas doth nothyng el affect heathenishenesse doe onely prayse vtterly disallow refuse order study herein men hauyng none commendable exercize wherein might bestow tyme meanes possible beautifie giftes ornamentes nature allure men thereby honest seemely ciuilitie worthely deserue prayse whiche earnestly pursued therfore tullius cicero hath right obteyned garland honest citizen learned philosopher bendyng power excellent vnderstandyng blazyng dueties office men lyfe defence vertue agaynst beastly swynish pleasure epicure esteemed matter worthy study trauaile wherein bestowed diligence actiuitie witte selfe neuer better theame man el could haue handled aboundauntly euen dyd accordyng necessitie present tyme singular learnyng yet besides orderly course naturall doctrine preceptes purer discipline extaunt amongest nation wherein fine nymble wittes might exercize selues therefore maruell hee beyng man endued wonderfull instinct nature embrace thyng chiefest felicitie worthy whereupon might discourse whiche sawe notable greatest prize amongest workes nature neither could rayse mynde beyonde limites nature stretche force capicitie outward righteousnesse obteyned speciall pursuite vertue state tyme altered haue receaued schoolemaister fro heauen whose maiestie surmounteth glory worldly state condition doctrine straighted within boundes nature doth disclose vnto v thynges farre passing reach nature whose scholer ought haue bene osorius especially sithence ye aduauced high dignitie church haue receaued cicero playeng rhetoricia tusculane walkes sonne god selfe bosome father beyng sent downe earth may teach v hidden secretes man philosophyethe difference betwene morall christian philosophy make discernable father vnto v define reason distinguish arte propose order morall principle prophane phisolophye albeit doth describe many tymes occasion offred commeth forth farre higher mystery instrustructing v kyngdome god eternall life true euerlastyng felicitie neither instructyng v onely doctrine powryng also blessednesse v obteyned death confirmed rising agayne doth dispose dayly raignyng ouer v doth enseale vnto v sacrament promiseth word conclude doth geue felicitie owne liberatie without respect reward freely beleue vpon name therfore since tyme altered schoolemaister chaunged order doctrine must likewise needes chaunged bycause reiect thing meane while vtterly false auncient philosopher tymes past deliuer vnto v teachyng preceptes orderly liuyng wherof debated earst concerning good maners godly action bycause euangelicall philosophye doth call v higher farre deeper mystery doctrine whereof consisteth greater better rudiment study therfore must haue regarde marke say must onely learne seriously know direct course transitory lyfe alsothe end christian philosophie meanes may attayne euerlastyng lyfe much righteousnesse auayleth sight men thyng doth iustifie v sight god beyng addicted altogether rule old maister ethnicke philosophy heape together many good commendable preceptes perfect righteousnesse wherein much misliked ye doe nothyng el selfe thyng whereof haue treated much cunnyngly plentyfully tymewhom osorius doth chiefly imitate cicero bookes office aristotle ethickes plato bookes de legibus many learned men bookes likewise herein surely ca excusable voyde blame bycause agree good preceptes whereof dispute well bycause fast tyed opinion ye skippe away christ obstinately resist gospell bycause imitate accompt learned ensuyng whole studious industry neglect much imitate prophane writer ye seeme doe nothyng el imitate though paganes would become professed pagane disputyng carefully righteousnesse good workes ye make stay rest selfe wholy whence ought haue stept degree pursued better way higher mystery matter greater importauncevertue embraced men though difference betwixt morall philosophy christian diuinitie ye racke thynges practize vertue pursuyng perfect plotte righteousnesse know huge heape wordes blaze vnto v certeine absolute portraite innocencie whereof happely ye painte shewe shadowe bookes better expresse conuersation yet much displeased imaginatiue deuise howsoeuer deuised engrauen know doe confesse together osorius whole secte auncient philosopher nothyng beautyfull amongest action man lyfe vertue nothyng estimation righteousnesse withall hartely earnestly wishe desire integritie life might throughly emprinted men maners conuersation whereof finde great mayme want new gespellers heare agayne osoriustrue innocencie mankynde loste long sithence integritie innocent vndefiled lyfe whiche require earnestly yet performe nothyng lesse lost long agoe onely whole nature mankynd generally also altogether lost neuer meanes restored good life beleeuyng onely say righteousnesse though altogether lost v may bee restored grace boutie christ many time restored faithfull ueryly would graunt vnto much ye speake osorius would either aptly define graceosor obiection cofuted whereof ye make mention rightly distinguish rigthteousnesse doubted comfortable grace christ doth purchase vnto v perfect righteousnesseby meanes doe recouer true innocencie righteousnesse ye know good syr consisteth doe procure well doyng onely forgeuyng imputed wherefore righteousnesse blessednesse whatsoeuer v grounded rather vpon remission sinnes vpon vertuous workes heare summe felicitie described vnto v knit vp wordes mysticall psalme mentioned recitall apostlepsal grace god doth geue righteousnes men blessed sayth whose sinnes forgeuen whose iniquity couered blessed man lord hath imputed offence psal furthermore mysticall melodious psalmiste doth call blessed man onely bernarde doth denounce blessed meanyng thereby thyng deede true meane ayde whence may hope eternall felicitie besides onely alone ueryly bycause whole nature mankynde ouerwhelmed sinne vnlesse continuall mercy god dyd preuent v winkyng wickednesse praye could stand iudgement yet selfe osorius haue sinned haue neede glory god yet notwithstandyng onely mercy pardoning v offence case though neuer bene committed wherein beyng old raynebeaten souldiour dare geue credite new gospell let loathe yet least heare bernarde selfe witnesse gospel iudgement herein albeit reported haue seene thing yet discerne perfectly enough thus speaketh whatsoeuer hath decreed imputebern sermo super cant though neuer hereunto addeth saying would wish note aduisedly sinne righteousnesse god righteousnesse man mercyfull indulgence god sentence hee doth reiterate agayne place selfe wordes least doth cofirme wordes much differet ye sinne sayth committed vndone yet god doe impute shalbe though neuer done c surely sinne shall accompted sinne hath bene committed shall sinner bee taken sinner hath committed sinne followeth necessaryly hereupon must needes righteous blessed whereby perceaue suppose whence sappe iuyce righteousnesse saluation springeth workes righteousnesse none onely meere mercy god free pardon hath bene declared testimony bernarde authoritie bernarde ca obteine much credite yet let fayth basile augustine origene ierome persuade auncientie moue perceaue much delighted antiquitie first ca notable wordes basilebasil psal trusteth owne good wordes neither looketh iustified deseruyng good deedes hope saluation reposeth onely meete mercy almightie god orig ad rom lib cap adioyne vnto companion iudgemet auncientie notable clarcke origene bycause thynges sayth concluded vnder sinne therfore man saluation consisteth merites workes free mercy god neither doth augustine differre treatyng ye ende last iudgement seemeth haue setled hope sauetie onely mercy godaug epi ad sixtum god crown v sayth end world mercy compassion yeldyng latine toung almost basile dyd expresse manifestly greeke toung wisebaul psal iudgemet without mercy bycause man bee founde pure immaculate without spotte sinne yea though hee infante dyeng day borne agayne augustine booke de ciuitate dei booke chapteraug de ciuit lib cap purposing declare accompt may made righteousnes transitory life affirmeth ought rather valued forgeuenesse sinnes perfection vertues agayne augustine first booke retractations chapaug retra lib cap commaundementes sayth hee reputed performed whiche left vndone pardoned know whether ierome haue declared ye euidentlyierome saluation consisteth owne righteousnesse free mercy god referryng thyngs free mercyfulnesse god forgeuyng v speaketh wise christ iesu lord haue hope accesse affiaunce faith righteousnes whose fayth sinnes forgeuen v doe stand long vpon matter ought without cotrouersie generall consent agreement learned authours antiquitie founde constaunt part consonaunt one thyng much matter therefore beyng playne remayneth two meere contrary allow one vtterly forsake ye say either doe cauill touchyng righteousnesse el doe teache v touchyng god gracious forbearyng two farre different eche admitted righteousnesse obteyned integritie workes neede haue forgeuenesse come vnto u onely free benignitie forgeuer besee loue ye beare myter integritie workes vprightenesse may make righteousnesse perfect farre gesse pardon geuen well deseruynges reward rather offred duety neither truely sayd pardon must craued offence committed ye say paraduenture imperfection doth lurcke secretly deedes though wrought grace god yet wanteth mercyfulnesse god well sayd truely doth darkyng penne cruelly rage agaynst luther franckely accorde doth professe selfe thing though wordes driue force yeld vnto whether ye say deedes vnperfect lame blynd naked altogether barren hungry vnlesse bee clothed vpholden mercy free pardon defence wilbe pleadeable iudgement seate god shalbe accompted rather place sinnes seeme deserue reward vertue ye satisfied testimony obstinately persiste opinion still workes may absolutely perfect deserue beseech make proofe therof reasonable authoritie either vouched holy scripture approued auncient authours ye make soud proofe behalfe deale yet somewhat soberly v reproches rebuke lye scoldynges outcry spyttynges cursinges glorious hauty speaches triflyng wordes make nothyng purpose part ye neither make proofe vnto v perfect righteousnesse workes demonstration owne workes el besides dare presume offer selfe iudgement tryed workes el doe ye chargyng luther sharpely ye condemne franticke braynesicke tertullus sometyme accusing paul bee seditous person sauyng accused paule one tyme penne vomityng nothyng el besides fury frensies madnes luther doth continually crawle ragyng degree seeme neuer make ende thereof vntill ye bryng selfe amongest iewes last crye crucifige vpon crucifige vpon iob euen perfect workes men valew godiob vpright lyuear stand doubtfull feare workes life esay prophet doth copare righteousnesse foule menstruous cloth christ selfe doth pronounce endeuours workes vnprofitable paule loathyng remembraunce owne righteousnespaule glorious euer work appeared yet adiudge farre distaunt true righteousnesse hee esteemed better doung dauid durst presume enter iudgement god dauid augustine feareth god behold workes shall finde offence meritesaugust psal shall deale v accordyng desertes shall finde nothyng v damnable ierome doth call v backe fro confidence deedesier esay cap boldly pronounceth cosider nature vtterly dispayre may lawfull luther vtter mynde christ godly prophetes holy apostle learned auncient father commeded old gospell spake well shall luther melancthon bucer caluin reproched scoffyng wise new foude name new gospeller bycause thinke speake selfe thyng luther kynde felow would take part epicureluther defended agaynst osorius would practize let louse reynes voluptuousnes turning men myndes vpsidowne carry away quyte vertuous endeuour loue godlynesse duetie honest trade godly lyfe lust licentiousnesse would place man felicitie corruptible body vayne ticklyng delightes therof altogether purpose ye speake osorius much blamed makyng companion epicure neither would refrayne penne christ helpe would inueigh agaynst power sharpely selfe peruse luther bookes searche sift consider ponder luther writynges exhortation doctrine lesson sermon imagination yea prye narrowly lyfe conuersation shewe say one place example one worde sillable much doth sounde agaynst loue practize vertue may seeme rende sinowes righteousnesse holynesse breede dislikyng embracyng therof doe bruyse fruites good workes weaken serious trauaile breake honest industry hinder godly enterprise doyng well maner meanes doe extenuate feare due lawes god man finally may seeme thinke lesse may bee seene perfect deuine behaue selfe dissolutely maners resembleth honest iudgement nay rather employ care possible rayse vp men euery place dewe feare god law true obedience honest conuersation earnestly emprinte sight myndes men renowne dignitie worthynesse vertue pic e godlynes shall haue conquest osori pag euen thyng say epicurus confesse true osorius ye reporte epicurus haue finely pyked cicero cicer tuscul lib doth deny thyrd booke tusculane question epicurus authour voluptuous sentence sayth vttered many soudry notable sayinges seemely enough true philosopher doe ye conclude hereof epicurus doth commende vertue place luther doth also lyke ergo luther epicurean osori accuseth luther epicurean doe ye also conclude agaynst paule hee epicurean bycause doth also selfe thyng rare singular sharpe witted chrisippus whiche altogether beene nooseled old gospell could neuer haue knitte knot together meere particular propositios neither would wo derfull logician haue euer coupled luther epicurus bycause osorius hath borowed argument cicero open iugglyng boxe fewe wordes first shew cicero speaketh next west ciceronia doth agree cicero first concernyng cicero whenas maketh metion epicurus senteces doth reprehend quicknesse nymblenes witte rather prayseth therfore onely noteth scope end doctrine neither doth condene senteces epicurus spake well bycause define chief felicitie though co sisted onely voluptuousnes herein founde fault without cause epicurus amongest sayinges wrate maner man lyfe could pleasaunt ioyned vertue denyed fortune force apall courage wise man meane lyfe poore better riche denyed also wise man also happy truely saying worthely spoken tully selfe reporteth let v see argument ciceroes ape shape pag luther sayth hee doth offer order perhappes exhorte auditory writyngs sermon dueties lyfe c luther doe osorius doth well finde fault epicurus disputyng sometymes gloriously vertue absurdely osorius doth copare luther epicurus notwithstandyng preceptes vtterly wipe away vertue euen lyke craftie conueyaunce luther doth subuerte ouerthrowe dueties vertue godlynesse speake parrotte place doth luther subuerte dueties vertue doth hee blotte honesty godly carefulnesse good men may tollerable slauders lye deface good name man neuer deserued also dead condemne writynges haue geuen cruell wounde voyde reason vnable alledge one title one place one sillable much iust accusation wherfore ye make slaunderous reproches carry shew truth let v throughly peruse begynnynges luther doctrine proceedyng dayly increasinges therof let v sift ende whole course purporte proceedyng doth forth plucke vp rootes vertue abateth affiaunce man workes ascribeth saluation onely bountie mercy god doth likewise affirme workes saintes world examined vttermost pricke able counteruaile god wrath satisfie iudgement preacheth partes neede mercy directyng v meane while true marke assured confidence man coupled epicurus though hee authour ouerthrow honesty rather shal adiudged good phisition soule one doth minister wholesome medicine agaynst poysoned errours inueigh contrary maner doctrine admitted wherof luther authourosorius studious care pietie decay hauocke bee made godly endeuour licentious liberty made free estate deede may happely chaunce amogest person ca well spoken tyme circumsplectly handled malice wicked take thereof euill occasion wrest filthy lust tyme paules preachyng wanted peruerse people like maner tooke occasion slaunder doctrine owne wordesrom videl let v doe euill good may come thereof also whiche ashamed say paule destroy law geue much scope libertie kynde people peter doth coplayne wt sinister deuises practized wrest paules writyngs crookedly confusio shall good men therfore frequent epistle euen reason osorius let flower grow spryng tyde bycause spyder doth aswell sucke poyson bee matter make theyr honnycombe bee good men doe geue vertuous necessary exhortation thynges whiche thinke worthy embraced accordyng duety profession fayth wicked men meane space starte vp betwene whiche abuse good thynges owne destruction fault teacher rather fallax accident logician terme luther falsely accused bee authour wicked boldnesse many person say take occasion wicked confidence vnpunishable libertie new gospell luther many contrary part receaue fro comfortable consolation finde selues thereby much pricked foreward pursue godlynesse carefulnesse luther teach truth shall doctrine therfore published bycause wicked men doe abuse thinke assertion erronious thales pray vouchsafe prescribe becommeth fulnesse wisedome pretie rule sounder doctrine whereunto luther might safely haue directed opinionsthe opinio schooleme papistes touchyng waye righteousnes false wicked beleue aduise haue associated selfe schoolemen monckes sacred inquisitio spayne vsed kyndes speaches videl kyngdome heauen due reward good workes otherwise vncerteine thereof bycause duetie assured proceedeth mercy vncerteine el ye require perhappes teach v hosius doth preachhosius doth affirme euerlastyng saluation obteyned deseruinges proceedyng grace god el osorius dothosorius calleth faith onely onely rashnesse boldly pronounceth meanes worthynesse saluation consisteth righteousnesse righteousnesse whiche receaue imputation christ fayth euery maketh peculiar selfe owne purchase workes el schoolemen old gospell professe bablyng much iustification haue decreed length must taken two maner wayes one way obteyned workes done grace geuen freely sayrosfenfi luther infantes beyng regenerated baptisme elder yeares great store perfectio workes say resistyng froath enticementes sinne dayly subduyng therof call phrase speach grace making acceptable acceptyng grace although good workes doe bryng passe first iustification yet geue second maner iustifieng grace god workyng together doth minister strength sufficient well worke stoutly striue agaynst stynges prickes flesh effectually may onely possible lyue cleare fro deadly sinne also atteine iustified pe congruum condignum congruum codignum conueniencie worthynes knowe well enough fayre flower osorius deceaued glorious speculatios old diuinitie whiche agreably seeme accorde old gospell know sure christ neuer knew gospell apostle neuer taught euagelistes approued auncient catholicke father euer smatche thereof nay rather christ paule apostle euagelistes auncient doctours church soeuer treated saluation lyfe euerlastyng endeuour nothyng seriously seueryng workes cause iustification altogether might dispoyle v wholy confidence owne sauetie referre v ouer onely mercy god onely geueth kyngdome heauen deseruynges promise sake onely haue sayd enough herein let v proceede cauillatios troublesome trifler though somewhat greeuous neare may ca yet let v briefly orderly cut toppes pag man geue selfe good workes haue heard luther schoolemaister c whereas luther doth take vpon person schoolemaister hath challenged selfe dignitie high deske euer taught schooles new factios euer lead trayne scholers amogest christian followed alwayes christ common schoolemaister neuer knowen haue vttered doctrine whiche receaued christ moue quarellsome doc reproch enuious title maister many good vertuous men haue heard luther preachyng man suppose acknowledged maister needed christendome uniuersities common schooles whole droues maisters scattered abroad though dropped troiane horse doe heare also whe teach teach stand discusse make estimate thereof christian sometymes heare scribe pharisee teachyng moyses chayre neither doth apostle forbyd v thess may take tast doctrine pet tast hold fast nothyng good luther teach doctrine owne imaginatio selfe refuseth beleued therin teach ye doctrine christ thynges hath sucked sweete iuyce christes gospell beseeche syr doth therfore professe selfe maister scholers scholer rather maister christ therfore scornefull title schoolemaister wherewith ye reproche scoffe fitte common ruf ian deuine surely altogether vncomely vnseemely byshop osori ibid cauill agaynst lutheran workes whereas ye pronounce luther auditory haue geuen selues good workes know bee true assured porting spayne good prouiso made hardy touch luther bookes referre assertion england germany doe litle marueile monstruous spynx cast eye ouer many sea many high mountaines great distauuce countreys curiously behold lyues men prye precisely maners vnlesse phebus haue cloured vpon mydas head eares osorius eares lolleared asse truncke wherof may catche euery blast whatsoeuer blowen abroad deuised secrete reportes whisperyng talebearer like credulous soole beleue forthwith howsoeuer lutheranes englad germany exercise selues good workes goeth well meane tyme porting spayne men lyue holy angellike beleue surely men countreys glytter sinceritie life brightenes vertues shadowes shyne darke glyster lyke aungels men men plante feete leaue behynd certeine wonderfull fragrant sauour modestie curtesie singular chastitie make heauens loue puritie sweetenes vertues goe osorius tell v length good fellowshyp cause doe geue eare luther apply selues doe good workes truely suppose bycause teacheth iustified sight god fayth onely workes therfore must infallible consequent whosoeuer attende luther doctrine forthwith abandone thought lyue vertuously yeld selfe carelesly ouer idlenesse filthynesse though honest well disposed person fatherly clemencie shall cause child sluggish duty though voyce mercy doth vtterly abolish morall vertues ende therefore doth christ much commende vnto v fatherly affection mercyfull father mentioned gospell towardes prodigall sonne also painte vnto v example doctrine free mercyfulnesse god true true ought therefore published bycause many vnchast corrupt person abuse nay rather ought net ye truth god greater reason generally openly preached necessary comfort godly neither behoueth v inquisitiue much doctrine doth worke certeine particular men rather know true doctrine selfe accordyng doe finde true constant preach accordyng capacitie hearer threefold lye osoriusbut osorius doth vrge v agayne three argumentes chiefly three square battell lyke three headed cerberus doth rushe vpon luther three sondry assautes attemptyng proue logicke luther speake doth ex irpe roote vertue honestie godly endeuour first disablyng workesdisablyng workes secondly desperation honestiedesperatio thirdly confidence false righteousnesseconfidece three wordes three lye first touchyng desperation cofidence thinke haue spoken enough haue proued falsely imputed luther doe yet acknowledge lutherafter maner luther teacheth confidence desperatio luther doth describe cofidence true confidence teacheth also desperation confesse comfortable therein teacheth nothyng el euagelistes apostle haue alwayes taught true assure confidence comfortable desperation onson unt gospell iesu christ apostle beyng full dispaire righteousnesse owne workes doe shroude selues wholy vnder mercy christ free bounty elemency say workes whiche grace christ hath wrought v v touchyng brablyng maketh despising good workes logicke hee proue cauillatio pause while good reader note passing pearcyng witte nurtured ye schoole stoicke philosophy nooseled rather suppose swynesty luther doth strippe merites workes naked fro confidence ergo luther rendeth peeces sinewes godlines setteth nought vtterly abolisheth efficacie dignitie good workes though osorius haue placed wordes order yet bent conclusion tendeth effect luther el writynges sermon cut hope workes meanes allure v take ankerhold onely ayde helpe mediatour waye choake vp vertue bury vnder groude confesse luther abolisher vertue paule also well osor doth many tymes deny assertion lutheran true righteousnes hope saluation depedeth vpo christ ye imputed v god accouted imputatio fayth onely supposeth way ouer easie hereof come passe pag man wilbe carefull studious desirous accomplish good worke deede thinke osorius mynde many person whiche vnlesse continually beaten pricked foreward lyke dull ox goades cudgel neuer yeld body labour forced threatenynges stripe drawen yoke quyte agaynst willes neuer happeneth nature mylde good disposition rather contrary le ie remembrauce receaued benefites rather encouraged chearefully doe duty bountifulnesse almighty god measured proportion man imagination neither ought regarde wicked doe interprete thereof rather christ doth comaunde preached much god permitte thynges true discipline allow know hath bene euer great store shall neuer want great number sorte people wickedly abuse thynges otherwise owne nature ought chiefly bee embraced neither reason defraude vertuous personage right abuse euill peruerse disposed person yet maner osorius disputation though man could founde would amende life embrace godlynes preachyngs gospell though nothyng ensued therof el vnbrideled licentiousnesse outragious boldnesse rushe range headlong vnpunishable libertie lust decay ouerthrowe vertue subuersion drownyng godly discipline finally sinke receptacle abhomination whiche falsely belyed vpon yet gesse end alledged vnlesse meane thereby persuade v abandone banish preachyng free mercy gospell slide backe agayne old iewishnesse scribe phariseesthe marke osorius accusation cosidered steede christ paule moyses may rule ouer conscience agayne cicero may preached church truely marke osorius rather osorius auncient enemy mankyng seemeth shoot hauyng spent shot pouder vnable last enfeeble resiste glory christ longer practizeth subtill engynes crafty lyeng slaunderous cauillations vndermyne batter doctrine bryng deuise passe findeth none fitte instrument osorius chief champion garde haue set vnto thee gentle reader substauce osorius much touchyng fayth onely neither alone first taught doctrine many famous doctours aucient antiquitie teache besides onely excell farre learnyng lyued many hundred yeares borne namely amongest paule whole epistle doth wonderfull vehemencie harpe alwayes vpo one string true righteousnes cometh man law workes law fayth christ freely without workes without workes hath often bene spoken take hold sounde probable argument proposition exponentan argument propositio exponent exclusiue exclusiue euen man disputyng would proue argument christ knowen assured head churche would argue thus besides christ none head whole church vpon earth beseech syr meaneth elles argueth christ onely ought acknowledged head whole church word onely vocable onely seeme haynous others fraternitie may admitted respect tolerable yet ye accuse luther must withall endite guiltie crime best approued doctours interpretours elder age expresse meanyng ye apostle doctrine liuely haue onely accustomed selues sundry tymes word onely commentary also deliuered posteritie vsually frequented luther shalbe founde coyne new thyng herein rather make report studious carefulnesse carefull trauaile auncient father behalfe bycause selues shall neuer cited iudgemet second workes follow fayth necessitie none otherwise fruite force nature engendred tree upon hath geuen sentence false reason alledgeth hee thereto forsooth person others lyke vnto wilfully rash throw selues carelessely manifest abhominations without respect equitie conscience consequent would aptly haue bene applyed force shall summoned iudgement seate hygh iudge accoumpt shalbe made whole course lyfe ergo wilbe carefull saluation let haue especial regard vttermost abilitie life agreable professio stand assured much lyeth testimony good conscience knit together true fayth voyde hypocrisie otherwise doe heare truth selfe speaketh haue done euill shall goe resurrection iudgement shall likewise heare paule saythcollos euen thynges sayth wrath god doth come vpon child disobedience purpose osorius alledged agaynst iustification fayth hauyng receaued fayth christ doe ioyne withall fruites obedience companion altogether pure absolutely perfect yet yeld endeuour abilitie least small proportion measure weakenesse trauaile endeuour though farre distaunt exact requireth perfection law yet neuertheles accepted place full absolute iustification sight god doth supply want workes owne free imputation fayth sake sonne onely whiche imputed righteousnesse worke beleue although horrible rebellion vngodly whiche walke spirite fleshe doe procure vnto selues iust iudgement condenation yet shall saying stand alwayes inuiolable notwithstandyng remayne assured euer righteous shall liue fayth beleueth shall dye euer iohn yet promise say doth abyde euident vnuanquishable whiche doth promise resurrection lyfe liue godly good deedes goe conclude ye hereof ergo faith onely doth iustifie v say youthe obiection cofuted nay rather neither faith onely fayth way el taken doth iustifie man auayle thyng iustification workes accordyng interpretation bee examined selues waightes ballauces god iudgement shall make full satisfaction ye conceaue amisse matter osorius therfore co clusion ilfauoredly shapen doe ye expect reason forsooth bycause fayle rule topicke whereby taught apply true proper causesfallacia causa vt causa true effectes therfore consequent faultie sophisticall cautell deriued cause proper cause let v discusse order wordes haue done well shall come sayth resurrection life c first ye perceaue workes alone treated simply person doe workes surely iudiciall courtes small obseruation vsed chiefly difference betwixt circumstaunces cause circumstaunces person seruaunt shall commit sonne shall doe although factes partes equall yet suppose sonne shall finde mercy cause father iudge seruaunt maister iudge especially iudge constreined yeld iudgement coaction expresse rigour statute law libertie vse consideration trespasse accordyng discretion eue neither thinke one christian say true christian man shall mainteine cause christ redeemer turke infidell pleade christ iudge bycause one much holpen yeldyng fayth promise hath none ayde trust vnto ye rigour law let v proceede may come last pricke shot vnderstand therfore wordes christ shalbe betyed ye last haue liued well vnto founde iudgement shall geuen possession eternall lifethe word christ expounded heare well would fayne know length cause mercyfull iudge vouchsafe reward workemen highly controuersie consisteth point reward geuen cause reward geuenthe person accepted workes sake workes person sake whether desert without desert whether proper worthynesse workes selues whiche call good rather fayth person whence workes doe obteine bee called good bee esteemed good say spring together working grace floweth vnto v founteine faythan obiection whence abilitie good deedes aboundant within v whiche receiued afterwardes bountifulnesse christ fruites holy workes issue v make v worthy iustified place v possession euerlastyng kyngdome aunswerethe aunswere ye neither speake much ye ought altogether true ye doe speake albeit confesse good whatsoeuer proceedeth bountyfull gift god yet farre wyde marke controuersie hand neither matter handlyng know whence fruites good workes spryng come vnto v ye question much auayle vnto v whether selues owne worthynesse worke iustification god whether stand destitute ayde whereby may iustified selues whether doe ye thinke workes owne nature effectuall bee able alone endure heauye burden god iudgement operation fayth beleuer rather worke doth present person together workes god free imputation accomplish iustification doe heare continuall ianglyng portingall coockoe chatteryng alwayes one maner laye myne eares pag word christ wel vnderstoode crookedly wrested osorius fayth workes sayth hee wayed ballauce god iudgement purchase either saluation damnatio vnto v finde wordes christ haue done well shall goe euerlasting life haue done euill euerlasting destruction auswere true lord speaketh vntrue osorius concludeth hereof christ comprehendyng fruites workes together whole tree ioynyng cause together person doth encourage hope eternall lyfe yeld endeuour manfully vtterest abilitie performe ye rule gospell defiuyng proportion workes doe deserue declaryng bountyfully manifoldly require labour whiche haue suffered kynde afflictio name sake osorius framyng hereof meerely false proposition doth crafty conueyaunce wrest force thynges workes selues onely whiche lord doth apply faythfull liue vertuously length turnyng awry sayosor fallax concreto ad abstractum concreto abstractum vse termes sophistry seueryng person thyngs doth conclude disorderly maner false conclusion faythfull godly christian liuing vertuously shalbe rewarded eternall lyfe ergo good workes selues wayed ballaunce god iudgement doe deserue eternall lyfe ca falsely imagined foolishly cocluded lye deede workes fruites christia fayth token cause saluation euen tree bringeth forth fruites tree good appeareth fruites bycause fruite maketh tree good bycause tree maketh fruite good lyke maner deedes godly haue nothyng selues may enable stand vpright iudgemet finde grace reward may bee ascribed owne meritemercy forgeueth ill deedes imputation acknowledgeth well doynges good partly mercy partly imputatio sonne redeemer mercy say doth forgeue euill deedes imputation whiche accepteth good workes though selues neuer vnperfect though perfect doth reward crowne glory glory hereof ascribed men god righteousnesse grace workes fayth iudgement mercy confirmation wherof seeke authoritie may require one faythfull witnesse approued authority apostle beyng sent vnto gentile proper peculiar charge doth preach vnto workes haue done sayth mercy sake hath saued v wordes may obteine credite bee spoken playnely authoritie witnesse may preuayle assured testimony sought paule speaketh selfe osorius lacketh shift descante herean obiectio osorius thinkyng thereby craze force veritie whereas paule affirmeth saued mercyes sake doth interprete saying verified sort bycause mercy doth endue v abilitie power worke hereof godly deedes pietie doe ensue wise osori doth ascribe saluatio god mercy may make v v righteous god hereof likewise commeth passe whatsoeuer true righteousnesse appeareth v doth proceede mercy bountie god nature doctrine scattereth abroad euery bookes also hath entituled de iustitia followyng herein seemeth forerunner hosius hosius maskyng like maze doth affirme life euerlastyng geue men farreforth grace god deliuered men merites issue mercy grace god augustine helpe vnlose knot easely also ye famous auncient interpretours greeke latine churche altogether one voyce doe ascribe saluatio mercy god obteined doyng good deedes corruptible body consisteth rather remission sinnes lyfe supporte needy naked weakenesse workes neuer feeble agaynst importable burden rigour law mercy augustine maketh mention wiseaugust de temp stand iudgemet lord exactyng thyngs thou hast comaunded thou enter iudgement thou shalt finde guiltie therefore haue neede thy mercy thy manifest iudgement agayne place treatyng last iudgemet shall crown thee sayth mercy compassios shall come passe dreadfull day whenas righteous kyng shall sit vpon throne render euery according workes glory hee hath pure vndefiled hart dare boast without sinne therfore necessary make mention compassion mercy lord caugust de spirit liter cap agayne somewhat playnly hee describeth maner mercy shalbe day iudgement doth set forth wise called mercy sayth bycause god doth regarde deseruynges owne goodnesse thereby forgeuyng v sinnes might promise v euerlasting life hereunto also may annexed testimonie basile lesse worthy bee noted touchyng mercyfull iudgement god towardes chosen people shal heare owne wordes iudgement god rigorous precise selfebasil psal render vnto v worthynesse accordyng workes haue done hope man bee saued loueth mercy iudgement matchyng mercy equall selfe beare chief rule regall seate iudgement bryngeth forth euery man iudgement say god iudgement proceede selfe precisely exactly requityng euery v accordyng deseruynges deedes haue done hope remayne v one person mankynde saued god loueth mercy iudgement reseruyng mercy selfe hath placed royall throne iustice chief gouernesse citeth euery man vnto iudgement see mention made mercy grace god grace onely doth engender v good workes rather whiche doth forgeue sinnes sinner bloud sonneephes thyng redemption chiefly consisteth forgeuenesse sentence effect bee pitthye sinne sayth righteousnesse godremission righteousnesse man free pardon godbernard serm cant pardon augustine litle differring bernarde maketh rehearsall wordes thou hast done good thyng sayth hee yet thy sinnes forgeuen theeaugust prima quinquagena prolog hitherto thou hearest worke mercy marke imputation thy workes examined founde faultie forthwith concluding addethpsal imputatio god require workes deseruynges surely condemne thee god doth geue thee due punishement graunteth vndeserued mercy thus much augustine euen though hee would say best deedes seeme none respect good farreforth vpholden pardon free imputation otherwise searche workes euen quicke precise rule seuere iustice hee surely finde nothing sounde best deedes many thing lothsomethe defeeco mercy doth abolish iustice wicked workes thyngs v altogether corrupt defiled wherein aduaunce mercy god iudgement though would haue partes iustice excluded thence doe mitigate rather ye frettyng wounde iustice stiffely mainteyne speache applyeng thereunto sweete wholesome playster mercyfull imputatio ca ignoraut hereof god shall iudge quicke dead iustice equitie part blind discerne bee false osorius mainteineth rakyng thynges amplifie estimation pure righteousnes doth stoutly defende pointe wordes workes force value iudgement owne nature auaylable towardes ye purchase euerlastyng inheritaunce el procure v ready downefall euerlastyng destruction deede speaketh truly respect condemnation vnfaithful vnbeleuyng person beyng estraunged fayth haue acknowledged christ world abusing fayth haue despised christ also seekyng establish righteousnesse would submit selues righteousnesse christ neither maruell god doe execute iustice somewhat sharpely agaynst persos whenas deedes beyng foude guilty haue ayde pleade may stand steede besides christill workes condene iohn christ nothyng elles seuere iudge within fortresse fayth effect gospell doth denounce vnto v hath beleued sonne wrath god dwelleth vpon iohn matter goeth farre otherwise engraffed christ faith read iohn chap beleueth sonne hath euerlasting life christ called iudge redemer wherfore christ appeareth redeemer rather iudge without castle fayth seeke rescued law contrary part shrowde selues wholy vnder assured target fayth protection sonne god shall finde christ rigorous iudge mercyfull redeemer whiche sentence doth verifie selfe testimony promise prophecyeng tyme commyng iudgementluce shall see beginning thinges sayth christ looke vp lift vp heades proceedyng yeldeth therof reason bycause redemption draweth nye marke well osorius doth say iudgement redemption draweth nye choose put disciple remembrauce redemption rather keepyng name iudgement silence ueryly bycause iudgemet condenation distinctio iudgement one part therof shall concerne damnation sequestration whereby goates shalbe seuered lambes lambes condemned goates therfore firmely beleue shall come vnto iudgement assured hope affiaunce elect shall come iudgement conde nation know shall yeld accoumpt awdite shalbe easie voyde feare vnto engraffed christ ye side rigorous dreadfull shall come forth iudgement christ weddyng garment veryly bycause fayth doth clothe roabes doth christ shield defende saue harmelesse innocentie agaynst bytternes tempestuous iudgemet though neuer appeare iudge passe presently death life truely euen innocencie christ pure righteousnesse christiansthe innocencie christ righteousnesse christian father doth none otherwise impute vnto v beleue sonne impute sonne sinnes suffred passion sinner sayth prophet beare vpon backe iniquity god imputation respect christ respect v esay contrary part refusing ankerhold christ trustyng tackle hazard sauetie soules seuere iustice god otherwise clothed weddyng garment must needes suffer shipwracke soules voyde hope recouer hauen perfect felicitie beyng turned ouer furniture store must needes bulged ouerpa sed ast buroe iustice whiche could neuer reach vnto life hereof ariseth difference betwixt ioyned christ rascall rable infidel although iust iudgement reckonyng shalbe made deedes men god likewise reward decreede vndoubtedly accordyng euery ma deseruynges yet order iudgement shall farre otherwise proceede faythfull reprobateof reckonyng made last iudgement challenge saluation due vnto obseruyng righteousnesse law thorough owne workes fayth imputatio christ surely shalbe rewarded according deserte workes vnder codition whosoeuer haue accomplished rule law absolute perfection ought haue done shall lyue accordyng decree law haue fayled one tittle performaance lesse law required may hope el accordyng sentence law holdeth men fast chayned vnder euerlasting malediction haue continually course lyfe perseuered vpright vnblameable partes therof blemish neuer litle may founde breache one iote law whiche may procure heauy matter vtter condenation vnto euen manifestly appeareth iustice god hee selfe altogether vnable atteyne perfect righteousnesse likewise wilfully refuse ye beyng offered vnto anotherthe diuersitie shal reder accompt distinguished suffer punishement owne vnrighteousnes hath cause accuse ye law iniustice must referre plague owne infidelitie part departing hence fayth repentaunce speake sinner truly penitent christ prepare selues men reposing whole righteousnesse onely innocency christ workes shall neither bee impeached sinnes whiche christ hath healed woundes yet haue done good worke shalbe rewarded ye inheritauce eternall lyfe worthynesse workes bycause free imputation doth vouchsafe weake workes bee neuer barren naked worthy obteine promised inheritaunce bycause haue deserued bycause hym selfe hath promised suppose manifold manifest saying hitherto sufficient enough declare truthin osorius writynges order wanteth distinguishyng thinges methode discouer falshoode quarell osorius nay rather shewe many sondry faultes hath couched vp one coclusion many errours hath clouted together many absurdity hee hath tombled selfe headlong endeuouryng proue agaynst lutheranes none way attayne true righteousnesse liuyng vertuously seemeth pretende colour certeine sentence pyked scripture selfe scarsely vnderstandeth hath ilfauouredly disguised make shewe maske makyng distinction meane while betwixte person thynges disposing nothyng due place order choppyng shufflyng thynges together certeine confused hotchpotte old vnformed chaos though farre distaut heauen earth iumbleth together without discretion confoundyng law wt gospell person thynges selues righteousnesse fayth righteousnesse workes neither noteth naturall cause thynges proper effectes cause disguiseth cause vnder title effectes effectes likewise misturneth cause workes properly effectes fayth neither owne nature good esteemed good iustification goyng yet osorius frameth discourse though chief especiall bullwarke righteousnesse built wholy vpo workesaccordyng workes work sake readeth scripture shall redeemer sake haue discoursed enough vpon matter remaineth pursue tracke rest disputation bycause haue spoken sufficiently suppose one two proposition calleth false whereof hee hath accused luther authour let v fyritte see vermine able defende selfe first whereas luther hath noted saying ye chief piller foundation christian doctrine man ought ascribe meane saluation thyng el onely fayth iesus christ afterwardes proceedeth pointe ye fruites good workes engendred doe issue fayth euen fruite engendred roote good tree workes doe follow fayth necessitie none otherwise fertile tree budding first greene leafe beautifull blossome doth last course force nature bryng forth fruite sentence osorius iudgeth haynous wise sufferable yet meane tyme denyeth good workes follow faythosori doth deny good work followe luther fayth cryeth ope mouth false good workes doe follow luther fayth well yet heare meane while good workes engendred fayth wise luther fayth would therfore learne osorius whose fayth beleue also speake truth suppose oracle apollo bee true oracle workes doe follow fayth say follow deede apasse great cluster bycause ye vouchsafe selfe expresse vnto v kynde workes arewhat maner described vnto thee painted table blossom pregnaunt fayth osorius doth shewe forth peruse writynges bookes especially inuectiues compiled agaynst luther haddon euer man world hath heaped together many lye vpon lye hath compacted many blasphemy slaunders hath vttered many errours hath euer writyng practize imagined expressed vomited many tauntes reproches madde wordes vanity cursinges bragges folly clense sinnes repentaunce shall become meane space righteousnesse workes confession sinnes lastly bycause doth addresse conuersation lyfe neare line leuell christes rule go let v compare platforme fayth fayth luther haddon together osorius god name doth credite christes wordes luther haddon distrusting christ hath geuen credit wordes christ osorius beleuyng christ esteemyng aright wordes gaue selfe repentaunce became good christian enured selfe thereunto hee abhorreth owne wickednesse become obedient christes commaundementes iollyfellowes haue raunged lyfe long carelesse securitie men neuer touched remorse repentauce regarde amendemet lyfe doctrine christ auaunte therefore cursed luther copanion haddon byrdes ill feather vnbelief could neuer enduced haue neither beleue christ come beleueth hath euerlasting lyfe iohn agayne iohn first many beleeued gaue power made sonnes god chapter beleeueth sonne hath lyfe euerlasting oft doe heare gospell sondry sentence notable title testimony wherewith lord doth aduauce fayth elect wonderfull commedation wherewith doth amplifie force efficacy therof thy fayth sayth hee hath saued thee vnto accordyng faith math vnto thee thou hast beleeued math feare beleeue onely mar beleeue onely thy daughter shalbe made whole luc thou canst beleeue thing possible beleuing math beleueth shall workes greater workes shall iohn doe acknowledge workes righteousnesse whenas lord dayly conuersaunt publicanes gospell reporteth doth preferre publicane pharisee mary magdalene simo banqueteth prodigall sonne sumptuously obedient brother whenas carrieth vpon shoulder scattered lost sheepe looketh narrowly lost groate bindeth vp woundes fell among theeues offereth selfe phisition sicke gladlythe righteousnesse sayth accordyng scripture sounde whole whenas hee placeth harlottes sinner kingdome god pharisee hee requiteth trauaile equall wage came worke last houre day bare brunte heate whole day vynearde hee compareth setteth last first hee promiseth paradise theefe faithes sake onely fashioneth paule deadly enemie apostle whenas doth onely receaue mercy gentile castawayes nature excluded promise voyde hope reprobate idolatrie hath greater estimation naturall sonnes hee meane el example disclose vnto v secret mystery iustification consisteth rather forgeuenesse sinnes doyng good deedes esteemed onely mercy promise god wherof take hold fast fayth wayed ye valew righteousnes merites workes therfore sithence opinion doth wholy discene kynde doctrine face affirme fayth consonaunt wordes christ luther discrepaunt apostle doth neither worketh saith hee beleeueth christ iustifieth wicked yet seemyng bee much acquainted righteousnes imputation ye dare name worde imputation doe notwithstandyng stand much owne conceite though christ commyng finde fayth osorius playne demonstration osori geueth small credite wordes christ fayth luther man might bold vneasie matter pike diuers sentence scripture whiche would quickly cracke hath prepared receaued thankes geuing doctrine deuils much lying spirite osorius doth stoutely mainteine bende force vphold latter age world besides man obstinately may thoughe el either departed
