corrupt iudgement yt ye frame selfe much speake ye truth would neuer haue patched lye amogest ye ragges leasings luther disputation cocerning faith good workes tendeth nothyng el ye scripture euery sacred spirite truth paule inspired holy ghost doe meanes reason confirme ought duetie embrace luther endeuouryng make euidet doctrine iustification comparyng good workes lawe god enforced confesse truth matter say nothing holy workes beyng owne nature respect vncleane defiled must needes vnsauorie sight god without christ bee racked exact scrutyne god seuere iudgement hereof quarell pyked forthwith agaynst luther note cauill osorius though affirme whatsoeuer workes regenerated engraffed christ selues worke nothyng el meere sinnes wickednesse bycause doth abbridge good workes part onely wherein falsely adiudged valew iustifie god osorius doth argue agaynst wise though vtterly roote man lyfe ciuill morall vertues vertuous conuersation wherein easilye determine whether doth shewe selfe iniurious luther bewray rather owne blockish grosenesse man euer taught soundlythe doctrine luther touchyng good workes man highly commended good workes luther beyng separated part doctrine iustification whereas doth extenuate force workes treatize iustification doth therein altogether derogate workes rather frendly aduertize whiche vayne confidence workes doe challenge selues righteousnesse sight god depende much vpon deseruynges workes though none fouteine whence saluation might deriued luther therfore vsing argumet agaynst person doth boldly auow workes defiled yet simply respect application beyng considered without fayth mediatour whiche beyng truely spoken luther sinisterly wrested osorius though spoken simply good commendable thyng workes nothyng acceptable god though neuer duetyfully vertuously performed cause hee concludeth last vnuanquishable argument meanes possible luther fayth could bryng forth frutefull workes like barren figge tree growyng neare vnto high way whereupon grewe nothyng leaues osorius owne conclusion luther sophisticall cauill concludyng falsely paule doubted nothing esteeme thinges sinnefull done without faith rom aug prima quinqua gena ex prologo psal lawfull augustine write wise thy workes examined sayth foude defiled doth rage furiously agaynst luther bycause doth professe deedes call good none respect daemed good bee valued fayth mediatour consideration doctrine selfe assured doth tende end osorius imagineth discourage godly myndes vertuous endeuour rather well disposed person much enflamed embrace vertue much finde selues bounde god bountyfull mercy vnderstand nature hath prouided fayth workyng loue alwayes effectuall law constrainyng feare rule paule yet beaten bussardly braynes deedes voyde prayse estimation teachyng thyng sinne wrought without faythaugust let augustine yet preuayle somewhat beleeue sayth doth iustifie wicked thy good workes may proue good workes vouchsafe call good long issue euill tree therefore sauiour selfe recityng rewardyng good deedes faythfullworkes respect accopted good sight god respect christ thorough faith doth speake maner though spake generally thou hast fedde hungry thou hast lodged harbourlesse thou hast refreshed needy clothed nacked restrainyng thynges ye fayth ought towardes hungry sayth ye fedde naked ye clothed miserie chaines emprisoned visited getly refreshed harbourlesse ye refreshed c regarded much deedes selues indifferently employed vpo relief needy esteemed fayth worketh deedes god sonnes sake name sake wherefore forasmuch vpon fayth dependeth onely iustification mankyndegood workes iustified fayth action man lyfe sight god vpon onely roote foundatio absurditie ensueth hereof say workes selues owne nature filthy sight god vnlesse sprinckled ye fayth bloud mediatour thyngs beyng agreed vpon let v returne argument osorius pag fayth luther sayth osorius meanes yeld good fruite bycause hee doth say workes seeme neuer holy infected wholy defiled go ergo liuely fruites good workes sayth hee ensue luther fayth much doyngs corrupt sinneful luther selfe witnesseth heare aunswere antecedent true consequent salfe confesse true luther hath truly alledged good deedes beyng viewed eye god iustice without fayth without mediatour selues lesse abhorred sight god wicked sinner yet osorius conclusion therefore true luther fayth wellspryng seedeplot vngodlynes reason therof euident whatsoeuer actios endeuours ma life nature blameworthy fault proceedeth fayth fro poysoned corruption weake fleshe therfore luther agreeing wel augustin comaudeth take holdfast fayth workes may thereby made good workes much whatsoeuer fayth onely shielded vnder protectio deserueth accompted good also testimony paule esteemed sight god better sinne offence argument recoyleth backe vpon osor selfe matter beyng confessed may frame argumet agaynst osorius much fitly maner much law proper effect ca nothing engender wrath purpose published sinne appeare much sinnefull followeth rather osor doctrine seemeth mainteine wt whole bent skil ye glory law good workes engendred ye law sinne rather whece plentyfull matter wrath raysed destruction luther handleth matter farre otherwise whose diuinitie howe much carefully doth enseale vnto v fayth christ onely mother nourse vertuous deedes much greater encrease good workes must necessitie spryng doctrine therefore suppose haue handsomely enough tyme wrong osorius finger choakyng bone wherewith hath kept sturre agaynst luther thrust owne throate luther fayth well spring seede plot wickednes faith founteine vertue come bolt quiuer well made wisely shotte let v behold neare marke shootes withall pag agayne bycause luther doth affirme force lust strong beleeueth man able resiste common custome perceaue amongest many person extenuate despise boldly originall sinne decay nature wordes could neuer finde one able suppresse vtterly subdue strength therof deede mortall lyfe except onely man written whiche doth accuse sinne vnlesse couple osorius next vnto make equall singular vnspeakeable courage doth fight agaynst nature stoutely thinke force naturall corruptio entycementes ticklyng lust driue state innocencie rippevp lyfe maners osorius examine force vigour argument vnioynted ioyntes shiuered sinewes therof luther doth deny man lyfe able vanquishe strength sinne vtterly raignyng fleshe ergo good workes doe proceede luther fayth ye logicke conclude likewise ergo nothyng world besides crowe blacke skill learned osor packe go let v chauge name men let matter remayne place luther let v vse name paule marke wise reason rather onely name person beyng chaunged paule complainyng sinne doth accosiber flesh doth protest yt flesh dwelleth good thing ergo good workes engedred paules fayth difference pray betwixt wordes paule luther positio ye compare together rightly whenas eche vnelagreable assent haue relation selfe vnuanquishable tyranny originall sinne let v heare necessarily consequent must follow wonderfull reason wherewith hee would seeme proue luther fayth ye vtter subuertour good workes wise crawleth forward lyeng spirite mouth much man enterprise good action vnlesse doe first utterly cut kyngdome sinnepag kyngdome sinne vtterly cut true luther teacheth remayneth therefore man able worke good deede touchyng forme argumentosori argument faultie forme perhappes punyes sophistey may somewhat allow ye behold matter thereof certes doctours diuinitie reiect faultie vnlesse sayth kyngdome sinne first vtterly cut c truly would much stand osorius first expresse vnto v apely distinctlya twosold kyngdome sinne meane worde kyngdome whereas deuines agree two sortes sinne whiche call actuall sinne whiche also doe distinguish two maners wayes sinne reigning sinne rebelling must teach v whether two meane one thyng suffer thy selfe carryed away sinne yeld thy selfe willingly captiue tyranny vanquished sinne weakenes first cometh next infirmitie many tymes ouercome sinne neither liueth flesh offendeth sometymes sondry wayes yet notwithstanding ouercome agaynst willes drawyng backe chosen seruaunts god sondry tymes cast sinne reigning mebers neuer yeld ouer wholy subiectes kyngdome uery well therfore doth paule counsell v let sinne reigne fleshly body rom rom yet paule alwayes bring passe good yt would worke many tymes euill would sinne dwellyng within thynges beyng thus opened let v search pythe argumentthe substaunce argument discussed hee denyeth vertue hath place kyngdome sinne vtterly rooted osorius meane kyngdome sinne kyng tyraunt doth reigne ouer subiectes maior proposition true minor false luther neuer teache much dreame otherwise sinne bee suppressed much possible meanyng tende end man enterprise good worke vnlesse tyranny sinne beyng first brought vnder yoke haue tamed fleshe motion much may bee felt rebell within may wounde infect conscience osorius make proofe verifieth maior confute doth obiect agaynst luther minor shall finde conquerour sinne hauyng throughly mortified sinne vtterly vanquished ragyng rebellion naturall corruption dare promise rewarde perfect righteousnesse vnto selfe iob man famous vprightenesse lyfeiob yet displeasaunt selfe hee seemed stand doubte workes esay esay doth condemne righteousnesse lothsome menstruous cloute holy acceptable god dauiddauid yet besides dare presume offer selfe iudgement beyng dismayed feare secret conscience doth spare franckely pronounce fleshe liuyng bee founde righteous sight god greate prophete daniell doubted make humble confession together people sayingdaniell sinned forefather shall speake ionasionas prophetes let passe apostle shall say paule peter iohn declaryng trespassours many thinges iohn doth exempt selfe number next apostle ensued age auncient antiquitie learned father although power might valiauntly mainteyne cotinuall battell agaynst ye assaultes sinne yet could neuer surely encampe gard selues firme grounde vndermined countermoyling outragious pyoners lyke dastardes mistrustyng owne stregth feele selues enforced sometymes forsake standyng flee rescue onely mercy forgeuenesse god onely vnpenetrable rocke saluation therfore ierome playne wordes doth note trulyiero ezec lect cap though man atteine perfection hee yet stand neede god mercy man full perfect perfection depend vpon grace vpon deseruynges c lesse effectually augustine writyng boniface touchyng perfect righteousnesse rather imperfection righteousnesseaugust ad bonif lib cap uertue sayth whiche righteous man sayd farreforth righteous vnfayned acknowledgement humble confession owne imperfection doth admitte bee perfect agayne augustine place doth accompt man haue profited much lifeaugust de spirit lit cap profityng doth feele selfe farre distaunt true perfection bycause latin church shall seeme want testimony greekes let v heare wordes basile treatyng man righteousnessebasil conc de humilit full perfect reioysing god man lifted vp righteousnes knoweth selfe empty naked true righteousnesse iustified faith onely christ iesu whereby osorius may perceaue estimate made owne righteousnesse though seeme neuer beautyfull augustine selfe adiudgeth worthy execrable curse bee examined besides mercy godaug lib cont cap bycause sayth thou doest narrowly sharpely searche offence doe hope assuredly shall obteyne place pardon thy sight needefull make register ye testimony writer ye matter especially beyng euident strongly fenced multitude authority whenas consent agreement writer one thyng generall stedfast abacyng perfection workes humbly crauyng pardon owne imperfection aug serm de temp whereupon augustine stand iudgement sayth agaynst thy seruaut requiryng thynges thou hast taught commaunded thou enter iudgement thou shalt finde guilty neede therfore thy mercyes rather thy seuere iudgement demaunde coceaue wordes augustine surely although doe thinke man voyde wonderfull willyng endeuour yet bene partes endued integritie vndefiled lyfe vtterly rooted whole kyngdome sinne concupiscence thereof obteined deemed prayse worthy respect absolute accomplishyng commaundementes god soule would neuer humbly haue disclaymed god iudgement submitted comfort pardon onely free mercy god let v annexe hereunto aurel august altogether disagreeyng osorius hee setteth downe much playnly booke de spirit liter august de spirit liter cap said quoth possible without sinne haue thereunto god assistaunce withall neuer sayd euer euer one lyfe could perfect except one onely creature shalbe quickened c force therfore wyndeshaken crooche catholicke haue scraped hosius roffensis cicero suppose upon lame cripled workes rest boldly namely man may order lyfe rotte tabernacle flesh right squarier righteousnesse assistaunce god hauyng throughly conquered kyngdome sinne may easely accomplish comaundementes law therfore aunswere word shall speake el ierome reported ctesiphon wrate agaynst heresie pelagians shall set augustine agaynst osorius ierome agaynst syr ierome ierom ad ctesiphon cotr pelag tomo thou doest say commaundements god easie sayth ierome yet thou canst name one man hath performed c ierome proceedyng foreward utter blasphemy agaynst heauens whereby thou mayst delude ye myndes simple folke wordes may graunt vnto thee man may neuer man could doe agayne ierome wisedome nay rather ought wisedome perfect simple confession vnperfect haue yet atchieued attayned full perfectionierom cotr pelag lib true wisedome man know selfe vnperfect willbe bold speake perfection best righteous while hee dwelleth fleshely doughill altogether vnperfect c neede alledge matter manifest selfe throughly confirmed testimony playnly notably discernable dayly example man life amongest rest innumerable ouerflowyng multitude sinner shalbe reply made beleeue deuine integritie one gentleman osorius wonderfull conuersation absolute holynes angelike chastitie culuerlike simplicitie linked together seraphicall humilitie incomprehensible innocencie alone amogest child woman hath beautified whole world brightnesse righteousnes carrieth vertues fast lockt sacred cheeste breste dayly numbred hath quenched boylyng froathe originall sinne hath vtterly subdued brought bondage whole empire therof euen one pushe hath partes absolutely fulfilled eche tittle comaundemets hath tamed flesh concupiscence thereof hath supressed affection hath well disposed order addressed whole course life euen haled hyghthe holy perfect life oso compared fracise certeine stretched reache mynde beyonde heauens rapted fraternitie frauncisce selfe enflamed vnquencheable desire deuine zeale hee treade awrye much wilbe blotted one spotte crime suspition crime bee neuer litle yeld temptation sathan infirmitie flesh seene blemish suspition sinne one solecisme incongruitie yet idle speache wordes disorder whole lyfe conuersation whose mouth shall issue idle word lye dare boldly say one erronious doctrine cotumelious cauill bookes rascallike slaunder sycopha ticall outrage thynges shalbe founde within attempered quallified certeine marueilous peacible modestie lenitie defect may bee founde needefull added fill vp full bushell perfect righteousnesse bycause thou shalt wonder reader meanes reuerend prelate hath climbed immesurable excellencie generall righteousnes pillers vnderproppeth learne withall auayleable effectuall sacred sacrament confession vouchsafe pray thee heare osori selfe telling owne taleosor lib cap doe call witnesse sayth iesu christ lord god meanes comfortable confession sondry time frequented great force popish cofession haue escaped infinite wickednesse wherfore haue tyme subdued lust haue forsaken voluptuous filthynesse haue bene desirous embrace chastitie haue bene enlightened sparckle godly zeale wholy ascribe effectuall operation therof sacrament whiche holy ghost hath emparted vnto great store grace c test beyng first ouerwhelmed innumerable iniquity hee haue attayned righteousnesse length vertue sacred sacrament much hath shaken yoake concupiscence hath cut throate cut head kyngdome sinne neede hath repeate cofessios oft wounde whoale neede playster surgery sinne bee abolished purpose serueth dayly custome confessio end absolution craued feele yet somewhat lurkyng within forceth betwixt while runne agayne oft confession ye drugges absolution affirmeth boldly ye kyngdome sinne wholy coquered v couragiously fightyng agaynst luther doctrine wordes whereas life agreeth altogether wt luther finally osorius dare presume stoutely vpon owne conscience hauyng vtterly crusht peeces kyngdome sinne hee acquainted therewith may preiudice may forthwith frankely iustifie selfe pharisee say thanke thee lord heauely father men like vnto publican luther seely sheepish bucerans fast twise weeke geue tenth possesse yea besides also dayly enure selfe holy cofession c hereof enough let v proceede remnaut rable raked lye follow furthermore holy vnblameable god pag euen truly voyde crime accordyng luther doctrine bee voyde crime hee denyeth sinne extinguished affirmeth flame abomination broyle therof whotte flamyng oue scorching cosumyng thing meanes whereof man bee founde vnblameable without spotte sutteltie sophisticall cauill tendeth last end god hath chosen v sayth apostle become holy vnblameable according luther doctrine man holy without fault lyfe therfore hereof ensueth vnauoydeable conclusion bycause man liuyng cleare fro offence therfore neither haddon lutheranes reckoned amongest god elect packe ye hence therefore banished outlawes ye vyle lutheranes packe ye hence torne ragged workes helles osorius damnable curse gate election opened vnto pope osorians phigianes hosianes eckyans others like lordynges whose pure choise behauiour droppe filth founde worthy reproch osorius selfe bene shamelesse beastly blaze abroad trifling argumet would haue loathed haue rehearsed place would vouchsaued aunswere thereto thought good geue reader tast blockishe ignoraunce might smile while least learne esteeme poppet reason almost booke scarsely founder matter scattered part thereof osori argumentatio discussedfirst apostle teache elected chosen become holy much consideration one hath chosen hath iustified grace hath chosen v hee sayd also haue iustified v one selfe meane one selfe ende god hath chosen v ye aske cause free mercy accordyng good pleasure ye seeke meane christ iesu ye looke ende worke good deedes good deedes sake deseruinges prayse glory grace truly none otherwise fareth matter iustification god free mercy hath chosen also hath freely iustified meanes christ iesu bycause foresawe would holy ende walke circumspectly holyly sight emporteth sayingto irreprehensible taken scripture become holy vnblameable paraduenture osorius bee opinion catharres celestines donatifies imaginyng herein full absolute regeneration renewed nature signified vnto v accomplish kynde thyng grecian call nonlatin alphabet without god election iustification could meanes consist ueryly could wishe withall hart could direct course lyfe sort accordyng puritanisme osorius endued integritie angelicke innoce cie part life might defiled blemish iust reprehension shall say condition man life weakenesse fleshe euery man hath infirmitie haue yet put nature man altogether bee forthwith transformed angel goe come passe brickle estate frayltie v doe folter falldowne therfore excluded forthwith electio haue lost benefite iustification doe thinke osorius sence shall ye electio god sayd permanent may cut haue ende shall called stedfast assured hange vpon vncerteintie frayltie true elect say fall tyme deserued rebuke shall euery one yt worthy rebuke forthwith cast fro electio good felowshyp osorius fall happe baptisme say baptisme doth washe meanes vnrebukeable say whenas elect selues free faulte luther doth say aunswere playne easie whereas luther doth denythe confutatio obiection god true elect free fro guilt seemeth therein haue regard ye frayltie ma nature making comparison therof doth set directly opposite seuere iustice god law weake nature beding force much may agaynst ye assault sinne although get vpperhad sometymes yet besides yeldeth ouer oft vaquished eue chiefly whe hath obteined maistry doth neuer yet expresse ye immaculate sinceritie vndefiled vprightenes mainteinyng ye battell default may foude perfect obedience pumples yet sticke fast ye flesh may easily espied curing wherof shalbe costreined necessitie pray ayde generall triacle church lord forgeue v sinnes c yt augustine wordes may well verified hereaugust de natura gra cap ye possibilitie nature much presumed vpon wouded maymed troubled vtterly destroyed needeth true confession false purgation c furthermore apostle maketh addition thar become holy vnder wicked rebellion voluntary yeld ouer member ye body sinne meanes bryng selfe bondage wickednes meanyng apostle suppose therfore chosen god delighted mynde cocupiscence flesh fulfill lust therof hath written cocernyng holynes luther touching naturall infirmitie repugnaunt one agaynst may admitted well enough hereof ariseth repugnauncie outward conuersation obseruyng rule function duely may reliques notable monument sithence come treatize predestination freewill let v marke well stuffe raunger hath brought forrest dogges leadeth course men game withall pof predestination freewill lvther affirmeth freewill thyng name onelyof predestinatio freewill pag name without substaunce patiet agent drawen doth purpose deliberate thyng man instrument onely sawe axe whiche god doth frame force whether whereunto pleaseth hath power stregth reserued either doe good comit wickednesse much able onely good euill also thinke thought meanes selues moreouer name luther vnderstad also withall melancthon bucer caluin rest iolly fellowes whose opinion writynges tend effect length difference may seeme betwixt man toole instrument uery good tyme syr blessed bee houre wherein come length combersome crabby treatie freewill beyng heretofore oft tost fro common schooles assembly disputation deuines many combates turmoyles hath last founde champion hope whose onely force actiuitie beyng defended shrowded vnder target aiax shall able endure withstad assaultes coutermoyles heretiques whatsoeuer whereas heretofore vnsearcheable gulfe hath encombred entangled wittes study many notable clerkes cardinalles byshops priestes bottome depth whereof could notwithstandyng neuer yet bee attayned vnto suppose onely let thereof hitherto hath bene osorius hatched produced proctour cause sithence vpstarte wrestler skipt ouer old barrier hath catcht collers hand may man doubt whole force enemy beyng vtterly discomsited compelled flee field maiestie freewill hauyng bene long tyme wounded weakened greeuous maladie yea feeblenesse euen yeldyng vp ghost shall presently recouer health stand vpon feete strong lusty gallaunt disdayneth encounter bythus sometyme bacchius ecerinus pacidianus hercules agaynst twohercules able stad agaynst two yet osorius agaynst foure horarius agaynst three brother one man hand hand onely valiaunt courage challengeth field agaynst foure choise tryed souldiours one choppe together witte luther melancthon bucer caluine yea also agaynst whole armye lutheranes agaynst neuerthelesse osorius durst haue cast gloue liued amongest v present aunswere challenge defende cause doubt iustie crake proude iacke bragger would carry small coutenaunce moue godly displeasaunt withall rake dead graues pike quarell agaynst ghostes spirites common guise euery rascall varlet discreet well disposed hath bene accompted filthy contemptuous yea abhorred osorius present discourse freewill alledgyng one thyng agaynst whiche writynges bookes fully aunswered satisfied yet though made aunswere crawleth hee foreward neuerthelesse patchyng together rotten motheaten trumperie wherein neither thyng owne inuetion new stuffe hath somewhat furbushed old rusty argumentes raynebeaten souldiours fresh glaze raylyng slaunderous tearmes like foolish choughe attiryng selfe wholy feather fowles respect also vyle lothsome doe arguyng make certeine shew reason vouched either scripture doctours wrongfully wrested part doth frame discourse rather accusing men discussing controuersie doth handle mattersosori couragious accusing arguyng one hauyng regarde rather person agaynst hee quarelleth cause ought haue bene discouered osori stinolous foolish treatyng free willthe man fully persuaded freewill ought mainteyned meanes possible choyse thyng free free man necessary difference betwixt free necessary many maner wayes necessary taken doth neither discouer definition distinguishe argument deuide partition doth declare diuersitie difference ought betwixt braunche braunche many sondry person haue stoutely maynteined quarell freewill yea wt lesse courage would haue done ye state countrey bene hazard quarell long sithence celestines pelagians kept great sturre agaynst augustin amogest many others late yeares wrate chiefly roffensis eckius agaynst luther cardinall pighius hath stuffed vp tenne inuectiues full agaynst caluine likewise many others haue written agaynst melancthon agaynst bucer others albeit preuayled litle agaynst truth yet end might easily deceaue vnder certeine visour ye truth shuffle amogest owne writynges many sentence scripture many also approued doctours osorius intendyng vphold freewill beyng great ieopardie perish doth bryngeth vttereth length elles certeine simple croppes scattered fieldes holy scripture hath gleaned together wretchedly misordereth make assertion get credite yet nothyng auayleable purpose god knoweth meane while citeth one world much autenticke monumentes auncient authours augustine altogether busied decydyng controuersie ought chiefly haue bene guided cause either bycause hath practised science read nothyng writer el bycause wicked craftely dissembleth thynges whiche hath read yet notwithstandyng portingall champion carrion leaue knowledge scripture altogether disfournished doctours persuadeth selfe man good enough may please mus beare ye whole brut battell behalfe freewill freely luther melancthon bucer caluine mayne strength onely euen proude portingall looke principall partes osor accusation reduced certeine placesbut go bycause protract long tyme reader wordes purposing wrestle somewhat osorius herein let v approche marke bycause whole force communication seemeth tend end accuse men rather open matter worthy learned much obserueth order teachyng accusing ne yet disputyng beyng violently whirled carried forcible whirlewinde accusation rau geth field without iudgement aray certeine confused maner talke doth wrappe vp mingle thynges togethers vnder one confused heape contrary part temper aunswere neare matter permit may dispose reasonable frame chief pillers argument accusation selfe hath set downe disorderly therefore simple conceite whole substaunce accusation whatsoeuer may bee gathered foure fiue principall place chiefly whiche seemeth finde fault luther doctrine matter full absurditie obiectagayust luther wise first luther affirmeth free choyse freedome man thyngs haue begynnyng absolute vnanoydeable necessitie impossible thynges commaunded god men damned thynges commit owne free voluntary motion compelled fatall necessitie god taken originall authour mischief wickednesse place short cataloge may deuided whatsoeuer comprehended huge masse osorius inuectiues beyng wise placed remaineth frame aunswere euery particularly oportunitie place shall offer discourse purge wash away much v lyeth cauillations sophisticall subtelties thus would wish thee persuaded frendly reader besides naturall scoldyng meere cauteles wordes voyde substaunce truth el nothyng whatsoeuer doth brabble discourse yea also stroakyng selfe rather vayne conceipt opinion grounded knowledge iudgement first touchyng freewill steede proofe testimonie luther owne workes yet also neither doth alledge whole fully doth hee couple first last directeth certeine place authour goe maner haynous crime god name wherewith portingall inquisitour doth charge luther greeuously cruelly forsooth dare mutter freewill saying thing tittle onely while followeth owne nature doth nothyng sinne deadly written volume luther suppose el sybilles leaues seeke reader el thou wilt reuered maister inquisitour assigneth place ye reader thinke neuer read luther thyng whereat cauilleth thinketh concerneth credite vtter whatsoeuer listeth sense wt phrase speache authoritie testimony bee bolstered somewhat bee suggested whereat hee may frame quarell proceede followeth afterwardes luther correctyng selfe sayth farther haue erred sayd hee spake vntruely freewill thyng name onely tyme graceluther assertio article haue sayd simply freewill fayned deuise tittle without substaunce luther assertion written leo tenth article well last maister inquisitour frame vnto v ergo pag luther heretique dispoyleth man freewill traueileth chiefly end affirme man mynde alwayes holden captiue fast bound power workyng taken away much neither good euill ca thinke thought much meanes doth luther teach onely melancthon also aboundauntly yea much plentyfully caluine doth debate heare osorius aunswere luther luther shall aunswere fully selfe first touchyng whiche terme man choyse whether ye conster reason surely luther neuer deny dare boldly affirme behalfe melancthon caluine also certes men neuer reasonably madde despoyle man define endued reason reason reason ca operation sequested partthe repulse cauill vse reason resteth howsoeuer nature corrupted first originall sinne yet remaineth neuerthelesse thyng certeine sort within v still receaued tree knowledge good euillwill ca seuered fro reason thus must noted chiefly wise remayneth auayle way saluation hurteth rather thereunto therfore concernyng naturall property luther neuer foolishe lutheranes exclude nature meanes nature selfe engraffed men let therfore remayne vnshaken cotrouersie touchyng substauce freewill essenciall substauce therof vnited together sensible reason doth alwayes cleaue inseparably naturethe substaunce freewill neuer seuered nature neither luther deny lutheranes euer deny say luther deny freewill tell vnderstandyng able conceaue adam created absolate freedomeit controuersie adam first creation endued wonderfull absolute freedome vpholdyng freedome grace god wantyng tyme without could stand fast good wherein created though would haue stand fast geuen left power freewill left hee would haue stoode fast hee neuer bene euill would bene euill yet neither could bee good force owne freewill without god speciall grace beyng thus left power owne freewill neither would stand fast could fall without sinne sinnyng abusing owne freedome brought passe lost cast away selfe freedome withall yet wise remained neither sense feelyng vse lost whereas immortall free hath lost freedome also immortalitie righteousnesse withall whereby came passe wretched man losing pure freedome good receaued first creation purchased selfe posteritie miserable lamentable bondage therfore beyng clogged fastened state bondage cloyed claye albeit certeine sorte reteine still power vnderstandyng appetite whereby mynde free motio able discerne betwixt sensible obiectes yet neuer selues aspire agayne vprightenesse immortalitie haue lost beyng fast yoaked sold vnder yoake seruitude doe serue seruile thraldome fleshe turne selues one side force freedome shall alwayes bondslaues sinne death vnlesse grace christ helpe v set v libertie whereby may easily perceaue osorius state condition freewill man free free witte one sense may taken altogether free agayne sense otherwise free ye call backe nature mankynd first creation demaunde generally whether free nature doe aunswere nature selfe created vpright first god good creatour endued freewill man selfe became enemy freedome destroyed ye nature vtterly proceede make question demaude kynde sinne entred man towardes naturall euill thyngs towardes deceitfull good thynges aunswere ma call freewill altogether prone enclined wicked euill thyngesthe title onely freewill haue bare title freewill demaunde ma affectioned good godly thynges luther doth affirme neither free effectuall selfe inclinable thereunto boldly confesse yt bond seruile altogether captiuate vnlesse hoipen bycause ma vnable attept thyng selfe bycause owne power able well well thyngs yt apperteine vnto godthe name freewill without effect agayne may see name freewill voyde vse substaunce concernyng proper qualitie operatio freedome albeit reteine ye name freewill ye church respect title bycause seemeth alwayes free either righteousnes free sinne yet ought alwayes holden sorte free beyng alwayes good yea rather neuer good deede vnlesse gouerned goodnesse almightie god thyng augustine doth notably expresse sayingaugust vpo wordes apost serm freewill sayth nothing worth vnlesse god doe gouerne immediately effect thy whiche called free apt sufficient ill becommeth damnable bondmayde c harken osorius bondmayde free ill bee damnable augustine reporteth selfe nothyng euill wherefore luther condemned saying freewill doth sinne deadly worketh ca selfe c selfe osorius discerne title voyde substaunce freewill wherein ca finde nothing effectuall purpose say ye worke saluation luther doth take away man freedome willfor much therefore request accuser maketh contendeth friuolously agaynst luther mooneshyne water title onely whether bycause hee taketh away men freedome touchyng substaunce matter quarell agaynst luther whole controuersie ariseth forme qualitie well luther doth deny man vnderstad freedome onely osorius yet may suffice accuser quilty shall make simple denyall onely behaueth consider diligently sense wordes deny made libertie hee meaneth maner person thyngs libertie may knowen neither doth luther vtterly abandone nature freedome though freedome though fait chayned yron roapes could moue selfe vse albeit say deny free confesse thyng name title onely yet doth affirme bee simply title though man though neuer neuer neuer free therefore article doth learnedly annexe wordes restrainte post peccatum sinne whiche wordes luther osorius doth craftely dissemble skippe ouerthe word luther touchyng title onely expounded besides also added thereunto exception tyme witte ante iustitiam gratiam righteousnesse grace whiche playne wordes might otherwise sharpewitted enough haue easely discerned freewill simply altogether taken away neither men order nature seyng state adam sinne perfect integritie freewill also seyng grace receaued freewill mighty persos made free christ rest yet stickyng fast cloyed old puddle sinne yet come bee regenerated grace person question moued freewill efficacie owne naturefreewill beyng grace while doth selfe sinneth deadly luther doth au swere truely thyng title onely sinneth deadly worketh selfe though endeuour best meanyng hereby albeit freewill continue bee called freewill first de mination state yet hath vtterly lost substaunciall operation thereof lost whatsoeuer enterprise attempt yet auayle one iote much substaunce matter vntill first nature beyng renewed fayth fashioned new new creature well haynous matter length conteineth sentece may prouoke barke cruelly haue espied freewill may auayle person godward thyng declare pray bee nothyng wherein hath luther offended perceauyng truth freewill altogether vneffectuall profite v doth therfore make small accompt therof luther hyperbolicall maner speachbut catholicke stomacke somewhat queysie perhappes sounde hyperbole luther vsually frequented schooles whereby doth embase freewill nothing el title forged fantasie amongest naturall cause touchyng luther frequentyng hyperbolicall speaches admit would somewhat yeld vnto yet sithence scripture selfe doth altogether vnacquaynte selfe kynde figure reseruyng alwayes truth thing waywardnesse men vouchsafe luther expresse certeine wordes sharpe vehemencie speachoutragious hyperbolicall speaches popish doctrine whenas selues meanewhiles either blockyshnesse doe marke malice reforme onely ye friuolous barrennes word also outragious excesse speaches wherewith whole doctrine swarmeth euery maruell luther inueighyng agaynst monstruous outrage doctrine waxe somewhat whotte sometymes certeine vehement maner speakyng man adiudge worthy reprehended respect would fayne haue man required hee vouchsafe impute heate ye vehemecie god spirite purpose good pleasure directeth instrumentes lysteth hee yet least bethinke selfe great importaunce cause wherein luther trauayled tyme weighe aduisedly manifold darkenesse errours season withall enter deepe consideration vnmeasurable iniuries aduersaries luther mainteyne iust quarell god grace mercy agaynst innumerable droues drousie monckes hauyng ouerwhelmed glorious maiestie grace gospellthe papistes neither away fayth onely grace onely incomparable shamelesse excessiue impudencie extoll aboue moone starres yea beyond compasse reason force man freewill wise nothyng might beare palme besides man merites onely workes freewill mercy god beyng vtterly banished exiled tyme admitte grace cape marchaunt freewill least might seeme vtterly exclude grace yet admitte dyd article iustification wherein vayne practize enforce one point cotinually witte fayth onely without workes could iustifie euen lyk maner question freewill would needes haue bee graunted grace god onely foundresse good workes electio seruaut rather companion freewill whose vnmeasurable errour forced martin luther vehemet sharpnesse speachluthers vehemencie whereupon began without good cause yet heate wordes man pray finde beyng otherwise lead corrupt affection cotrary naturall truth thyngs respectes faithfully agreable wt spirite wordes god scripture freewill denyed value bycause selfe nothyng respect substaunce respect operation therof sayd altogether vneffectuall worke whereunto supposed conducible much vnlike figuratiue phrase speach wherewith paule doth esteeme circumcision uncircumcision nothyng worth wherewith esay prophet doth tearme idolles idollmakers nothyng wherewith ieremy beholdyng earth open eye sayd hee saw nought man might say osorius doth say nothyng otherwise ouer lauishe toung regard wordes sillables nothyng purpose ye co sider argumentes semblably freewill called fayned deuise amongest thynges tittle without substaunce whence ariseth preiudice ma nature onely corruption nature discouered herebyaugust de grat lib bit cap vndoubted augustine truly teacheth doe worke worke able able worke bee bringeth passe v sayd god hee worketh v doe geuing effectuall power whiche sayd bring passe shall doe aud agayne placeaug booke de bono perseuerentie cap thinking sayth beleue thinking doe speake thinking doe whatsoeuer doe c loe haue tittle freewill forthwith chap attaining way righteousnesse true worshipping god altogether selues insufficient sufficiencie herein proceedeth fro god c may easily conceaue substauce selfe augustine acknowledgeth none freewill affirmeth boldly cosiste wholy god albeit neither doth luther selfe tearmeth freewill fantasie deuise thyngs simply barely affirme annexeth thereunto addition namely post peccatum ante gratiam say sinne grace whereby godly reader may vnderstand persones noted either grace christ hath vouchsafed freedome grace receaued christ crowne glory come certeine distinct difference tymes person know osorius whiche ought chiefly obseruedthe difference tymes persos must bee distinguished wherein yet vnskillfull ye may repayre lumbard lead descriptio freewill deuidyng foure braunches wherof first created ioyntly man nature man first creation sounde perfectfoure degree freewill lomband lib distinct second whiche man fall throwen downe regenerated third whiche proper peculiar godly conuersion vnto grace last shalbe accomplished shalbe glorified touchyng first last whereof deuines make question suppose agayne assigne freewill thyrd braunche luther nothyng gaynsay whose disputation concerneth person chiefly sinne conuersion beyng wounded originall sinne haue yet recouered health christ iesu triacle better grace sort people opinion state freewill ought meanes defended would fayne learne first whether ye inueste person freewill playnly perfectly whole diminished otherwise attribute freedome vnto remayneth way definition ye expounde difference betwixt state condition first man fall latter state condition fall dismember graunt vnto certeine vnperfect dregges thereof onely neither luther vary much hereinfreewill weakened fall must obserued distinctio action ye yeld distinctio thereunto vtter playnly distinctly kynde libertie meane thynges settle ought taken word freewill emporteth action man lyfe ought referred withall vnlose crabbed knottes equiuocatios wherewith ye seeke entrappe truth whereas action man lyfe one sort kynde wherof proceedyng nature selfe naturall others altogether faultie corrupt others politique apperteinyng maners morall called good agayne spirituall consiste worshyppyng god behoued make manifest vnto v whiche action meane speake first kynde certes eue vnto ye law comon nature selfe fastened boude necessitie wherby bereft ye greatest part freedome freedome bee mighty man wil preserue neuer neede sleepe alwayes watchfull neuer sicke alwayes healthy neuer receaue sustenauce disgest foode receauednaturall action prouide houshold carefull selfe family busied abroad rest home enioy ye commo ayre lyue dye performe dueties apperteinyng man lyfe whereunto forcibly drawen course nature much allurement constrainte necessitieciuill action belongyng vse common lyfe come vse handlyng ciuill trade forreine discipline dutiefull action consideration kynde dayly frequented man lyfe whiche albeit luther confesse many thynges conteined subiect vnto freewill yet otherwise graunt thereunto euen selfe ye vnderstandyng mynde many tymes deceaued defrauded freedome altogether ouerthrowen yet doe cause vtterly extinguishe freedome wrappe vp entangle mynde spoyle reason cousell dispossesse fro aunciet inheritaunce choyse howsoeuer cruell outrage sinne hath weakened wasted sinewes strength nature beyng well created first yet remayneth neuerthelesse naturall power soule onely renewed spirite also regenerate respect action especially wherof made mention beforeactions merely spirituall question remoued action belong naturall common conuersation life apperteine spirituall worshyppyng god concerne kyngdome christ easily discerne freewill receaueth grace though garnished neuer gorgeous tittle hath besides glorious tittle onely nothyng el whereby may defende selfe seruile bondage rayse selfe vp attaine true freeedome saluation doe speake freedome osorius properly opposite constrainte compulsary violece wherof vaunte vayne naturall power reasonable soule whiche seeke shake ne yet man beyng regenerated disable finally yet action wherewith sensible lyfe beautified speake affection substaunce aunswere ambrose ambros callyng ge tils lib cap iudgemet corrupted deede vtterly taken away agayne deuill spoyle man vtterly bereft soundenesse integritie although man vnderstandyng parte soule miserably corrupted originall sinne yet altogether abolished remayneth freedome doe free call respect thynges either naturally carryed motion without iudgement brute beastes whiche forced coaction agaynst nature stone therefore spoken appeareth wherewith naturally endued respect essentiall naturall disposition thereof doth alwayes remayne man nature corrupt soeuer yea remayneth wise hauyng alwayes free voluntary operation naturall cause without forreine coaction vnlesse hindered naturall sensibilitie also capacitie iustine tearmeth heauenly thyngescapacitie nonlatin alphabet holpe augustine wordes seeme emporte iudgement speakyng defence freewill vseth wordesaugust epist beleeue sayth hee holy scripture grace god without helpe whereof man neither turne vnto god profite god agayne secod epistle valentin catholicke faith doth neither deny freewill applyable good life badd life doth esteeme therof highly though value without grace god either turne fro euill good perseuer stedfast good attaine euerlasting goodnes whereas feareth left may fainte decay c agayne placeaugust de grat lib b lib cap confesse sayth hee alwayes free v alwayes good maner sayd bee alwayes free must learned augustine either free righteousnesse sayth bondslaue sinne euill free sinne handmayd righteousnesse good c appeareth therefore twofold freedome augustine man freedome twofold freedome must costrued man alwayes free good thynges euill thynges ought conceaue freedome wise hath power owne strength make choyse good euill namely spirituall matter aduersaries doe dreame accordyng augustine interpretation whe naught owne disposition naught good guided grace vnwillyngly voluntaryly without compulsionhow freewill must taken yet free notwithstandyng alwayes whether good bad bycause alwayes voluntary neuer constrained much touchyng propertie naturall disposition ma deny seemeth conceite euen one deny man reasonable creature see cause reason may sequestred man ought seuered reason two thynges vnited together certeine naturall affinitie mutually linked together inseparable knot reasonable soule reason ca neither performe exployte without enterprise thyng aduisedly without guidyng reason therefore iudgement belongeth properly reason worke apperteineth properly whether good euil one wherof respecteth ye substauce peculiar disposition therof liuely reason enclosed within certeine limittes boudes hath proper peculiar obiectes vnable rayse selfe beyond copasse naturall vitall cause vnles enlightened eue beyng straighted wtin ye limittes boudes naturall cause hath power selfe either attept atchieue spirituall good thing vnlesse holpen questfor much therefore reason doe owne right exercize actiuitie dominio naturall thyngs onely said lawfull prouinces hereof springeth thyrd question whether freedome able selfe embrace eschewe thyngs gouerned externall sens reason whereunto aunswere easiewhether free thynges whiche ruled reason bee doubted mynde wil two freewill deriued yet still reteine certein sparckes freedome euen forlorne nature mynde certeine sorte able thinke purpose take counsell iudge allow disallowthe maister sentence booke dist like maner also doth enioy certeine freedome thynges whereunto sense reason direct able wil chuse chuse desire forsake stay purpose chaunge moue hether thether certein maner exercize selfe kynde externall discipline say worke externall honest action agreable law god eschew cotrary thyng besides many thynges doe approue true well sundry example ethnicke people also whole politicall estate doth verifie true also performed without god guidyng thyng nazienzen notably aduertize expresse orationazienzenus oratione know sayth hee goale attained quyuernes person successe battell prowesse conquest whether man freewill beare stroake action meerely euil corrupt doyng whereof doth defile man sight god aunswere herein forthwith supplyed ye wordes augustine august de peccat merit lib cap god doth helpe v committe sinne sayth fall god commeth owne corruptio corrupt agayne reciteth obiectio iulian writyng agaynst ye two epistle ye pelagianes aug writyng epistle pelag booke cap freewill first man perishe therefore sayth iulian ende compell posteritie sinne flesh necessitie augustine maketh aunswere v dare say mankinde vtterly spoyled freewill sinne first man freedome perished deede sinne freedome wherewith man created paradise free enioy full righteousnes immortalitie nature man standeth neede god grace according lord selfe doth testifie saying sonne deliuer iohn shall free deede free meane liue well vprightly farre freewill altogether perishe sinner freewill men offende especially take pleasure sinne delighted loue sinne pleasure greedely folow owne lust ye chapin booke chap say report say men constrained fall sinne necessitie flesh willes growen rypenes yeares may discerne inclinatio minde finde selues fast holden sinne owne consent suffer selues carried headlong sinne sinne wilfully wittingly whiche free euill thinges wherein taketh pleasure therefore free good thing bycause made free c adde hereunto wordes augustine effect discoursing vpon wordes apostleaug wordes apostle serm doe euill thou hast freewill without helpe god albeit free soeuer man holden bounde hee bondslane agayne place fall sayth hee commeth selues sluggishenesse moreouer writyng agaynst pelagians aug wordes apostle serm person hath freewill euill sayth either sathan allureth take pleasure therein couert open suggestion persuadeth selfe thereunto finally might tarry still alledgyng ye testimony augustine ca clearer wordesde ecclesiastic dogmatibus freewill captiued hath power worke thing sinne altogether vnable worke righteousnesse vnlesse god geue free passage whereby may perceaue ma one tyme free captiuemans free free witte free doe euill much pursuyng lust voluntary delight needeth forreine coactio worke euill whiche also luther doth deny respect free good vnlesse set libertie god grace speake augustine word vnlesse guided euery good actio doyng speakyng thinkyng iolly fellowes stoutely yeld man equall freedome good euill corruptio nature yet might graunted also sort interpreted accordingly meane regenerated tollerable enough neither luther agaynst whose discourse freewill tendeth wherof mention hath bene made augustine whiche beyng without grace altogether vneffectuall owne nature doe thyng sinne hereof springeth length whole substaunce fift questio5 quest wherein chief speciall state luther discourse consisteth witte touchyng spirituall motion action touchyng heauenly thynges workes apperteinyng vnto god touchyng spirituall righteousnesse inward worshyppyngs fayth repentaunce conuersion loue new obediece c question demaunded substaunce reasonable whether fall remayne man power vnderstanding appetite thynges nature hath made subiect man witte capacitie whether man haue freedome corrupt affection rather question manerwhether nature beyng regenerated haue free motios spirituall thinges whether ma sinne reteyne still force strength freedome spirituall thyngs rehearsed effectuall selfe grace beyng holpen grace could preuayle farreforth inspirituall thynges grace naturall force freewill workyng together might become sufficient cause selfe enterprise spirituall motion put also practize thynges must duely considered osorius shew selues vpright hadsome disputers freewill debatyng question ye permit cofession coupled authoritie sacred scripture must necessitie hold rule fast whiche teacheth albeit man nature fallen integritie excellent absolute freedome yet ouerthrowen miserable state seruilitie whiche proper brute beastes neither altogether dispoyled power first creation hauyng sparkes aucient dignitie remaynyng nymblenesse mynde deuiseth many thynges vnderstadyng digesteth reasonreason comprehedeth memory debateth aduise gathereth order wisedome inuenteth artes learneth science recordeth thinges past obserueth thynges present prouideth thynges come semblably doth chusewill refuse thynges seeme either agreable reason profitable sens quality appeareth sufficiently suppose difference betwixt v brute beastes vnsensible creature action beyng naturally engraffed within v yea without grace albeit proceede voluntary motion vnderstandyng mynde yet bycause extende present lyfe perishe together mortall body serue small purpose yea euen chiefly make best accompt moreouer although bee sort free owne nature yet stand alwayes vnchaugeable integritie reason many tymes deluded great errours ouercharged waywardnesse ye power mynde suffereth many defectes almightie god many tymes secrete operation communicatyng handyworke gether actios doth apply willes men hether thether whereunto pleaseth confoudeth deuises aduaunceth endeuours free imagination men according free decree purpose much hetherto concernyng obiectes externall operatios onely concerne common preseruation present lyfe perish together freewill respect spirituall function onely weakened v altogether blotted nonlatin alphabet powerbut yet truely concernyng either enterprising accomplishyng spirituall motion operation much farre exceede capacitie man nature scripture doth vtterly deny man beyng yet regenerated naturally endued force abilitie sithence first creatio giftes vtterly lost greatnesse sinne meanes nonlatin alphabet imbecillitie weakenesse nature propagation discended vpon men nature selfe corrupted miserable faultinesse yea faultynesse onely doth exclude v euerlastyng good thynges besides also corruption nature hath succeeded steede auncient integritie certeine rebellious contumacie filthy infection diabolicall seede doth depriue v heauely knowledge carry v headlong maner abhomination whereupon ye doctrine luther vnfitly confirmed wherewt conclude augustine truly agaynst romish doctours freewill onely weakened v vtterly extinct also thoroughly defaced bee tyme enlightened sparcle regeneration ought wholy ascribed grace god freewill stregth speake wordes augustine neither wholyaug de bo perseue cap ne yet part vpon point chiefly dependeth whole variaunce betwixt v papistes touchyng freewill thyngs therfore beyng thus sort discoueredluthers proposition bonde defended ought deede haue bene distinguished first better demonstration manifold diuersitie questios returne agayne luther position doth professe freewill thyng title onely name title without substaunce wherein osorius shall iudge worde misspoken blameworthy hee must first aunswere question much freewill alike person regenerate spirite god surely luther position maketh therof mention meane naturall obiectes whiche proceede common nature whiche vsually frequented dayly practize common conuersation conduct morall reason either doyng right executyng wrong doth luther position tende action respect question bee maner much force efficacie bare choyse man may owne naturall abilitie either enterprising performyng thyngesthe bare towardes thynges apperteine vnto god haue receaued grace dead man without lyfe cause scripture many place expressing nature liuely natiue colour calleth v darkenesse blinde see deafe heare whose body dead life endued freewill able come vnto god respect howsoeuer seemed alyue iudgement men lyfe god could freewill liuely forcible dead goe dead meanes restore selfe lyfe may please heare augustine treatyng matteraug booke retract man rise againe sayth augustine owne accorde hee fell voluntaryly let v take holdfast right hand god reatcheth vnto v c would wish consider selfe aduisedly thyng whiche ought receaue christes handes without freewill first afterwardes freewill without christ ought thankefull accordyng testimony augustine aug en hirid none cause destruction greater man freewill abuse wherof man lost selfe reason proue sounde augustine affirmeth bee vtterly lost restore lyfe thyng whereunto indebted owne deathfreewill selfe vtterly lost reliefe finde towardes purchasing eternall life nature beyng vtterly dispoyled euen especially stoode perfect integritie could neither helpe selfe nay rather whiche brought selfe vtter destruction lord cryeth certein place mouth prophetos c israell thy perdition thy selfe onely thine helpe c bee helpe el lord onely vpon alone helpe dependeth left freewill miserable wretch may trust vnto ignoraunt therof maister osorius prophet forthwith declare vnto forsooth el think vtter destruction much one man one faulte onely wherein alone offended freedome whenas yet pure sounde throw headlong selfe ofspryng horrible thraldome fro absolute perfect maiestie freedome thynges osorius gape freewill sithence nature altogether defiled hath made often shypwracke freedome freewill also standyng dispayred case enforced dayly runne second table penitentiary confession relief vtter perditio vnlesse take holdfast fayth right hand god whereof augustine doth make metion therfore let great proctour freewill take good heede least while accuse luther much comit execrable fact bewray selfe deadly enemy god grace ye may seeme aduersary freewill controuersie debated touchyng merite saluation tende end onely sifte whence cause therof ariseth witte whether onely grace god whether freewill necessary vnseparable coperterner therewith truely true propheticall scripture doth truely concludethe grace god without freewill onely sounde perfect helpe consisteth onely lord selues nothing destruction see much soeuer shall please osorius establishe freewill much shall hee disployle god grace iniuriously heare colorable pretence osorius wherewith practizeth make defence carry certeine shewe truth paintyng deceauable foyle hee may seeme neither yeld grace god accordyng catholicke fayth yet errour pelagians leaue nothyng operation graceaugust de nuptijs coc p lib cap whereas deuilish doctrine pelagians taught euery endued sufficient freedome doe good without helpe god hath bene long sithence condemned hereticall accordyng testimony augustine gentleman fearyng bee deemed pelagian doth deuide assertion sort may neither seeme vtterly exclude grace altogether yet yeld ouer grace freewill must necessitie copemate grace let v heare osorius vtteryng owne wordes pag veryly cofesse true thoughtes workes deuise bring passe vertuously godly ought ascribed vnto god whose grace fauour accomplished v behold godly reader godly prelate catholicke pietie attributeth thyng grace god whiche doth ascribe godly sayinges thoughtes deedes worke god much truly neuer pelagians deny affirmed alwayes onely god must bee accompted authour onely lyfe beyng yea actios also lyfe also freewill ought referred beyng authour thereof enough osorius question demaunded whether god authour good workes man deny question whether thyngeswhether conuersion worke god onely belong purchasing conuersion saluation sight god proceede god authour therof onely grace worke ye altogether v whether freewill also doth worke thyng together grace herein consisteth chief knot controuersie shalbe debated afterwardes large place fit god grace ye meane space let v marke osorius goeth foreward vnlesse god restrayned rushyng wilfully wickednesse vnlesse god spirite forewarned cousell throw selfe headlong euerlastyng calamitie vnlesse strengthened wholesome strong protection made able worke good worke comaunded neuer haue bene able either thinke good thought doe good deede myne endeuour employed either purposing accomplishyng worke haue bene vtterly vneffectuall neede aunswere much hereunto neither could luther selfe alyue speake professe sentence godlyly man regard wordes meanyng man truely substauntially spoken freewill worke nothyng wickednesse destruction headlong ruine euerlasting wretchednes nothyng noysome thoughtes vnlawfull imagination finally nothing godly good except guided grace god grace doth restrayne wickednesse doth recouer destruction doth direct wandring doth reforme wholesome counsell bryng right way goe astray truely matter go thus altogether wordes emporte say founteine perfection actios thoughtes deuises tendyng godlynesse poured abroad lyues doe issue vnto v el onely wellspryng god grace abilitie shalbe left wretched freewill worke good worke osorius man would seeme vnprofitable naked name onely least peraduenture may seeme hyred lutheranes write effectually defence grace catholicke byshop returneth agayne patronage freewill endeuouryng proue diuinitie worke conuersion doth altogether depend vpon grace onely freewill also must play part withall bycause sayth hee power consent good counsell pag reiect beyng offered refuse courtesie wickednesse outrage treade vnder foote profered grace doth deny may nay rather el doth freewill whe worketh owne nature resistyng refusall throw headlong errour luther selfe witnessing ye credite matter augustine shall aunswere luther aunswere august de peccat merit lib cap turne selues away god sayth commeth selues euill turne vnto god except styrre vp helpe v thereunto good thus much augustin may therfore resiste say withstand holy commaundementes god accordyng operation freewill deede nothyng easie neither needeth helpe hereunto agayne geue consent vnto embrase god commaundementes also surely true grace god doe guide v god grace doe gouerne v vtterly deny augustine agreeyng v herein sinne sayth augustine holpen god august de peccat merit lib cap doe well accomplish comaundementes righteousnes throughly able except god helpe v immediatly turned god august de peccat merit lib cap proceedeth selues wise accordyng flesh god therefore doth ayde men beyng conuerted forsaketh beyng reuolted yea doth onely helpe beyng conuerted helpeth also may conuerted thus much augustine go osorius logicke conclude hereof lengthobiection forsooth euery man owne free power able dissent consent grace god appeareth freewill altogether vneffectuall effect suppose direct force argument doe aunswere agayne augustine aunswere august might construed graunted well enough spoken whose meanyng apparaunt admitte man selfe may may condiscende yeld somewhat conuersion spirituall workes yet hath man power owne naturall strength neither whole part receaueth stregth worketh man freewill hath power selfe either whole part workeand therfore reason osorius frameth reiectyng condiscendyng hee meane naturall giftes augustine doth playnely declare errour pelagius meane power grace hee gaynsayeth luther nothyng neuer dispoyle man freewill freedome beyng manumysed aduaunced god grace able much agayne neuer vphold freedome man might owne proper strength refuse grace beyng tyme offred neither luther euer dreame suppose grace necessaryly throwen vpon man couersion enforced reteine beyng offered whether would lyke marke emprinted fleshe e yron stone violently whirled crossebow generally affirmed holy spirite god doth secret operation worke effectuall influence myndes faythfull grace offreth may bee receaued vnwillyng may gladsome cheare delight embrace earnestly bent affectio happen reiected fault therof spryng corruption malice flesh osori satisfied yet vrge still argumet euery person accordyng proportion freewill may freely reteyne refuse grace god aunswere briefly resolutely disceit suttle sillogisme framed fallax fallax diuisis ad coniuncta witte diuisis ad coniuncta logician terme albeit beyng seuered god grace selfe free reiect god callyng yet sort free obey god callyng vnlesse bee altogether vpholden ayde god grace let v see remnaunt disputation stand doore sayth knockepag hee doth say breake open doores rende abroad henges doe violently rushe knocke onely say admonish foretell daunger ensuyng doe foreshew hope saluation promise geue ayde allure vnto fayre promise deede osorius hee standeth knockyng doore geuen open vnto vnlesse geuen vnto open therefore hee doth knocke proper callyng ope entrey made peculiarely ascribed election grace likewise doth heaue doores hooke rusheth forcibly yet although hee presse vpon foreine force worketh notwithstandyng secret effectualnesse draweth vnto hath chosen entirely loueth inward operation voluntary willagainst epistle pelag booke cap neither good good augustine reporteth yet haue good must grace god needes assistaunt bycause written vayne god hee worketh v accordyng good pleasure lord doth first frame fashion c therefore whereas sayd god doth knocke gate gladly yeld hereunto say doth knocke vtterly deny lyke maner whereas say hee admonisheth hee foretelleth daunger ensuyng feedeth hope promiseth ayde allureth reward truely vntruely spoken osorius ye speake much spoken therefore herein haltyng bewrayeth selfe playnely flowen fallax logician tearme ab insufficiente causaru enumeratione sutteltie argument framed yeldyng cause sufficient true grace god doth knocke doth forewarne doth allure doth grace therfore nothyng el knocke forewarne promise persuade doth also create within v cleane hart doth hee renew new spirite within bowel doth plucke fleshe stony hart engraffe steede therof fleshly hart yea doth also alter whole nature meane inward naturall quality doth hee make plyable old deformed lumpe new fashion new creature doth commaunde thynges willeth admonishyng onely callyng persuadyng onely doth god grace geue also commaundeth meanes while lurketh law written within harte faythfull heare wordes gospel man commeth vnto sonne father draweth tell v good felowshyp doth draweth nothyng el admonish call allureaugust agaynst epistle pelag booke cap sayth augustine drawen bee willyng willing lead none drawen vnwilling yet man commeth willing willingnesse doth draw v wonderfull meanes skilfull worke within euen harte men make vnwilling haue fayth frame vnwilling plyable willing c ye heauely grace inward operation make men willyng willyng would fayne learne whether grace nothyng elsgrace doth knocke alone openeth man also knocke onely go while grace knockyng within openeth freewill suppose much freewill powred person indifferently generall influence much one doe alyke open heauenly grace lord doth knocke forsooth bycause say yet doth wheale runne neuerthelesse rounde demaunde agayne seeme willyng while others vnwilling el thinke cause hereof bycause god doth open freewill first whiche open vnto god may able open otherwise could neuer ope vnto whereby may easely perceaue freewill porter let grace much gate selfe doth el open first opened meanes whiche doth knocke applyeth way el made plyable made plyable may seeme rather drawen bee lead neuer goyng grace followyng altogether speake wordes augustine august de verbis apost sermo neuer foregoer handmayden grace onely euery good worke deny true argument shall better vse agaynst wordes owne mouth meaneth el selues whenas taken maner yeld guiding workeman ye maner toole meanes called either free serueth bounde sayd doyng doth alwayes suffer driue yet doth alwayes suffer doyng neuer doth thyng selfe agayne doth que ngit say selfe thing wherein worketh ye thyng owne power worketh together others helpe doth somewhat deede thynges whiche doth wrought onely true purpose minor proposition must bee denyed freewill god minister doth neither worke preachyng word per se selfe except holpen god spirite doth proceede euen holpen outward action preachyng concernyng inward fruite preachyng namely nourishment fayth operatio conuersion action proceedeth holy ghost fro freewill seemeth bee meanyng luther luther wordes costrued witte hauyng respect thynges onely wherein freewill challenge meane effectuall operation blyng witte exhortyng take vnto feare god humblenesse mynde might hold alwayes conuersaunt good workes while made hast attaine goale saluatio finally man might cauill say vertue perseuerauce farre gayne say euery way yeldeth ye whole interest aswell former hinder partes god whether osori declaryng god worketh v bryng passe thyngs accordyng good pleasure finde meane thyng paraduenture betwixt whiche may attribute freewill euen agayne shall driuen backe whereas may heare paule pronounce god geueth increase onely originall good encrease also well doyng accomplishyng proceedyng success also flow holy ghost man say god grace doth worke v osorius obiection purpose serueth freewill naturally engraffed within v beyng holpen grace sayd doe thyng shall thinke ought accopted respect partener workyng good worke auswere wherofaunswere would wishe harke wordes speake vnto augustine true osori whatsoeuer good worke wrought v prayse thereof ought redounde wholy freewill god grace performeth whatsoeuer performed v godly worthy prayse wordes augustine emporte true humble confession doth require v say referre vnto god yet grace god doth worke whiche proper selfe selfe onely workyng v without freewill agayne neither worketh together freewill portion prayse rewarde bee ascribed freewill whatsoeuer due vnto god therefore augustine booke de gratia libero arbit affirmeaugust de grat lib arbit neither grace without freewill freewill without grace sufficient confesse true either worketh co fesse yet certeine seuerall sort grace god worketh helpeth man freewill yet worketh wise neuer wrought doth helpe freewill beyng neuer holpen freewill furthermore doth helpe alwayes free helpe fine wheas god grace doth worke effectually helpyng ma willotherwise worketh god spirite otherwise man freewill diuersitie yet worketh ma freewill sta dyng neede helpe freewill meanes rather vsing ye seruice therof state freewill farre otherwise freewill worketh together god spirite commaundyng seruice tyme alwayes wantyng assistaunce one wherof perceaue efficacie cause worketh seruice onely instrumentwill doth nothyng good thing whe holpen applyed moreouer doth worke effectually god grace directyng yea freely bycause worketh voluntaryly yet doth neuer attempt good thyng selfe without directio grace neither meanes otherwise holpen neuer helpeth grace wrought holpen yea also wrought worketh chuse worke necessitie euen seruauntes respect birth free beyng commauded maisters bounde vnto must obey whether nill necessitie like maner fareth men freewilles albeit stand plight alwayes carried free motio say voluntary motion thynges whatsoeuer yet farre able enough owne power prosecute purposed imagination would wishe selues many tymes withdrawen agaynst willesgrace doth plye neuer plyed executyng mischief whiche conceaued agayne good deedes seruauntes grace drawen chuse obey necessitie neede example matter apparautexamples ma beyng hindered euen euill whiche purposed ofte many doe finde purpose many thynges myndes notwithstandyng come farre maner end deuised beyng quite ouerthrowen onely countermaunde almightie god appeareth balaam brother ioseph first barred speakyng determined executyng deuises wonderfull prouidence god would much recite exaples metioned scripture effect pharao sennacherib hamman antiochus herode pharisee iulian innumerable others sorte example whereby may make euidetly appeare neither resteth choyse proceede euill doyng owne leaue fro doyng well beyng drawen god spirite saule breathyng forth yet slaughter threatenynges whenas persequuted christias wholy bent affection freewill obeyeth spirite god many time whether crueltie would haue executed could haue brought passe deuise throughly determined mynde could hee doe bycause freedome man freewill selfe euen workyng wickednesse beyng hindered many tymes alwayes bonde must enforced acknowledge owne weakenesse euery side let v couple paule apostle peterthe exaple paule peter cryeng vnto lord worthely know lord sayth way selfe neither man walke direct owne steppe whiche wordes seemeth luther note altogether vndiscretely whose wordes would set downe see part therof osorius would able confute sorte doth luther argueluther booke assertion art man way man steppe owne disposition shall way lord pathes lord man direction hereupon deriuyng argument comparatis tearme schooles addeth forthwith able dispose selfe good whenas able selfe make wayes euill otherwise able prophet say knew man way selfe ye booke prouerbes ye wise kyng beyng enspired ye spirite confesseth knew testifiedprouer hart man sayth purposeth way lord doth direct steppe albeit spoken end though affirme ma wayes free towardes wicked thyngesman altogether depriued free euil though many tymes stayed knoweth frayle prone disposition ma alwayes catch hold euill though doyng therof many tymes hindered comparison tendeth ende onely man freewill beyng hindered bonde seeme many tymes lesse free put executio euill thynges much lesse freedome thinke doth enioy towardes thynges vnto godlynesse much therfore appeareth bee true euident testimony scripture experimented continuall course men action conuersations let v heare osorius doth obiect agaynst haddon say thus good menpag godly men men endued heauenly giftes doe testifie sentence thine lurketh haynous wickednesse vnshamefast impudencie
