wickednesse vnshamefast impudencie detestable maddnesse execrable outrage goe foreward tell v first without lye pray haue vttered wordespag forsooth bycause stand stiffely herein man mynde alwayes holden captiue fast chayned dispoyled abilitie doe much neither doe good euill thinke good thought meanes finally effect opinion difference betwixt v toole instrument c truely haue marueiled much osorius lyeng spirite mouth wicked lippes deceitfull toung could haue vttered thyng vnto v without lye haue made lye without raylyng yea syr winde doore assigneth free voluntary power doe goodosor lyeng rayling agaynst uther mela cthon caluine c owne god grace ascribeth action especially godly direction disposition god affirmeth neither free selfe without god grace doth nothyng el sinne deadly worketh disposition owne nature doth dispoyle man naked altogether though could doe nothyng purpose nothyng though made difference betwixt man instrument toole endeuoureth proue manifestly scripture thyng chiefly thoughtes man hart sens alwayes prone inclined tymes wickednesse doth hee seeme affirme man voyde feelyng thought tell good fellowshyppe man doth owne power man doyng whiche owne power doth nothyng el sinne doth man nothyng while sinneth while imagineth mischief doth imagine nothyng pray doth luther spoyle men hee reported bynde man fast euerlastyng chaynes wise onely doe also thinke good euill osor pag luther doth deny resteth man freewill make wayes euill inconuenience sentence meanyng therof taken right sense ought befreewill powder simply absolutely make wayes euill truely wayes either good badd simply absolutely owne disposition scripture teacheth man steppe directed prophet doth deny man way owne read holy prouerbes hath prepared hart yet lord gouerneth toung often doe finde old prouerbe proue true man doth purpose one way god doth dispose way rife example person halter hand knife ready bent dispatch selues wretched liues whiche haue practized drowne selues haue accomplished wicked fact deuised euen willyng thereto surely god diuine prouidence doth wonderfully dally man thoughtes imagination deludyng ouerthrowyng makyng frustrate transposing beyond expectation man thynges haue firmely determined freedome length whiche alwayes constrained serue others appointement strongest force wherof beyng many tymes hindered must alwayes depende vpon permission commaundement hygher power whiche thyng augustine doth well declareaugust de ciuita del lib cap willes subiect sayth god bycause haue power hee graunteth cause therfore maketh made god cause doe make made created spirites chiefly endued reason agayneaug place willes farre able much god would haue bee able foreknew therfore soeuer abilitie stand vndoubtedly able soeuer shall doe shall surely bycause foreknown able whose foreknowledge deceaued c august de correp gratia agayne place neither doubted men willes resiste god must needes doe god much doth dispose willes also listeth listeth therefore nill power willeth nylleth neither goeth beyond god power hindereth many tymes hindered power god alwayes ouermaistered c somewhat hard obiected article fast bounde ca thinke euill thought meanes doth osorius cite place wherein doth first cast myste reader eye deale iniuriously luther doth neither faythfully fully rehearse wordes article also lesse iniurious melancthon caluine alledgeth partaker opinion albeit know right well doe varie luther meanyng yet alwayes purpose refrayne kynde speache melancthon euer write thynges performed vnaduoydeable necessitie caluine say freewill deuise thynges euer heard bucer say man power thinke euill bycause varied meanyng iudgement chose rather quallifie plausible kynde stile seemed propouded somewhat roughly returne agayne luther wordes doe reknowledge herein new furnished cauill osorius auncient rusty canker many others agaynst luther leo roffensis eckius iohanes coclaeus albertus phigius iohn dreidon alphansus de castro andrew vega peter canisius like neither read luther writyng iudgement neither consider meanyng coferre first last catch worde halfe gelded hast beyng sinisterly construed finde one thyng fitte quarelled withall snatch vp vrge stiffely alwayes rakyng nayles vpon scabbe prouerbe sayth bycause amongest assertion picke one sentence odious iudgement simple people woder see coyle keepe viperously gnaw turmoyle one sentence wherein sayd man hauyng lost freedome force much thinke euill thought respect surely marueile much see vndiscreete disorder chiefly singuler shamelessenes osorius albeit luther many commentary sermon bookes aunsweres doth vrge one pointe alwayes euery trauaile earnestly proue ma freewill beyng voyde grace auayleth nothyng co mitte sinne yet doth osorius frame writyng agaynst luther though luther teach man freewill could much thinke euill thought fro whence doth pike quarell wordes luther article mentioned suppose much luther doth selfe article openly professeluthers artic freewill owne nature auayleth nothyng sinne imagination hart certeine naturall inclination rushe headlong euill sense yt sayd able thinke euill thought whiche alwayes occupied imaginyng euill beleue presse vpon v luther owne wordes wherewith affirmeth selfe power thinke good thought euill thought c well let v heare conclusion logician coyne wordes man minde whether thinke well euillosorius lyeng rhethoritian grosse logician doth neither owne power ergo man mynde selfe ca neither thinke good euill thought appeale logicke osorius kynde argumet rule make cosequent bycause substaunce matter doth depend vpon first cause properly thereupo conclude secod cause therfore nothing bycause freedome doyng restreined first principall cause witte onely maiestie god therefore man cause bycause free yt therfore ca thinke ill thought meanes bycause doth owne strength libertie though thyng properly thyng done owne proper power one say reason iewes crucified lord glory shalbe sayd nothyng bycause outrage whatsoeuer kept determined god vnsearcheable cousell like maner pharao withholdyng people israell nabuchadonasor spoylyng may sayd nothyng bycause hart one hardened lord bycause leadyng armye egypt constrayned chaunge iourney bende force agaynst ierusalem likewise neither shippe while sayleth pylote within shippe thyng bycause course whether bee fortunate vnfortunate alwayes directed owne wyndes tydes driue doth luther disputation freewill enforce el may referre order doyng god free disposition onely neither doth hee dispoyle altogether doth onely disable freedome neither good consequent say bycause man denyed free therfore man altogether destitute bycause free alwayes captiuate bounde handmayde euill thyngs either alwayes seruaunt sinne good thynges handmayde grace euen instrument toole alwayes bestowing worketh withallmans freewill instrument god grace let luther may well call freewill name toole esay doth name wicked name sawes band lord well many place ezechiell harte called stoany harte lord doth promise soften mollifie grace esay ezechi cap yet much trouble osorius herein whether free vnto euill seruaunt vnto euill maketh litle present purpose stad osorius much steede vndoubtedly true man naturall strength bee free bond strong enough wickednesse stormes raysed agaynst luther needelesse also consideryng doth frankely oftentymes many place professe playne wordes man mynde alwayes prone inclined euill cogitation consideryng also doth confesse euery thinke euill properly naturall man selfe neither doth acquainte selfe thyng elles euill thoughtes thinke needefull stand much vpon name freedome especially sithence doe agree vpon truth matter may happen osorius deceaued doubtfull costruction word rather deceaueth others therewith takyng sense luther vnderstode itthis worde freedome discussed distinguished whereas thynges sayd bee free necessitie respect outward coaction free necessitie respect bodage may right well called free first maner necessitie neuer costrained vnwillyngly willeth good badd compulsary augustine sayth accordyng latter maner necessitie man hath neuer power ouer owne whiche way soeuer carried alwayes obeyeth commaudement carried albeit doth alwayes serue voluntaryly willyngly whereupon paule discoursing vpon euill whiche hee would neuerthelesse sayth imputed therof sinne dwellyng within law member force wherof greater stregth drawe bondage though hee stroue agaynst surely bondage luther meane accordyng paules sayingluther lib de r arb cap writyng bond wise man sayth sort common vse horse beast god ride vpo willeth goeth whyther god haue deuill sit vpon willeth goeth whyther deuill haue owne choyse runne either rider get either rider contend hauyng keepyng c osorius see meane betwixt two rider would fayne haue shew say perhappes betwixt two meane whereby able apply selfe augustine doth make aunswereaugust begynnyng applyeng towardes good ariseth without god good grace towardes euill springeth euill euen bernarde doth teach whole begynnyng must ascribed grace fine shutte vp matter fewe wordesthe power doyng wateth freedome power wanteth concernyng luther proposition wherein denyeth freewill power good euill selfe two thynges seeme worthy noted one concernyng power doyng concernyng freedome power enquire power effectuall may good euill owne naturall force neither luther deny propertie bee otherwise may thynges willeth neither force altogether blotted may apply applyed either good euill doth farre forth apply much either destitute grace ayded grace none sorte horse doth beare rider hee trauerseth ryng runneth race sweateth vnder rider trauaileth grounde nymble chaufeth champeth vpon bridle commeth loft porketh heeles behinde runneth rounde carryer backward foreward performeth quality property kynde subiect sens motion respect naturall qualitie force horse seeme altogether owne power ye respect libertie motio actiuitie therof appeare consiste much naturall power beast ruled power ryder doth mannage eue ought iudge man whose naturall inclination regard may doe owne stregth deny yt property able proper habilitie proceedeth habilitie cometh performe mynde conceaue habilitie doe performe augustine saythaugust de bono perseuer lib cap thinking beleeue thinking doe speake thinking doe whatsoeuer doe place augustine doth confesse nature may power onely euill also haue fayth hope charitie yet haue hee doth affirme come grace altogether august de grat christi contra pellag lib cap wherfore agree well enough together touchyng ye habilitie let passe treatie habilitie question moued touching freedome bycause hereupo hangeth cotrouersie neither enquire ye property ca properly euery man may doluther de seruo arb cap thyngs freedome owne proper luther doth auswere forthwith name freedome seemeth name maiestie ought may agree coueniently thyng properly ye onely maiestie god holy ghost hath made free grace obiectio defendours freewill taken booke hyperaspistesbut ye great proctours freewill wont obiect sense true deede power absolutely fully free onely omnipotet power god maiestie yet neuertheles call angel immortall men holy wise good though doe acknowledge god onely bee truly immortall onely wise onely good nothyng withsta deth may call men certeine maner free auswereaunswere angel deede called immortall truly bycause obteined state creatour first besides also neuer lost state immortalitie wherein placed although fell fro blessednes immortalitie freedome condition state therof farre condition kynde albeit beginnyng created free estate ye benefite creatour might haue reteigned still without contradiction would yet hee loase freedome paradise withall default turned blessed estate miserie freedome bondage beyng paradise much sequestred fro felicitie euen farre seeme cut freedome without grace redeemer shyppe wracke beyng made vniuersall blessednesse see none remedy freedome must drowned withall therefore selfe thyng whiche doth open paradise beyng shut fast agaynst v must necessitie restore freedome agayne meanes brought passe force nature power owne consisteth onely grace redeemer redeemer selfe witnesseth iohns gospelliohn sonne shall make free shall free deede notyng vnto v one thyng chiefly wordes state bondage except renewed grace redeemer nature nothyng free moreouer concernyng vsuall yet doubt yt many men may bee kinde good holy wise euen esteemed well enough howsoeuer holynesse godlynesse wisedome seemeth man iudgement yet nothyng whatsoeuer proceede grace god hast thou thou hast beginnynges neccessitie moued force internall cause inward proprietie nature thynges may called simply absolutely necessary god thynges whiche beyng chaunged emply contradiction man would say foure euen nomber foure three seuen nomber called geometricall necessitie admitte chaunge course nature necessitie called naturall necessitie albeit bee selfe begynnyng owne motion yet consisteth simple absolute estate followeth onely vsuall course owne nature maner fier sayd bourne necessitie sunne continually carried course necessitie whiche chuse doe doe accordyng proprietie naturall disposition yet doe follow naturall inclination absolutely vnauoydeably god may hinder alter dispositio make cease naturall operation kynde necessitie sinne say man clogged withall sith fall adam holy ghost grace absent selues sinne albeit let nature may bee holpen chaunged otherwise altered see come passe regenerate christ necessitie therefore whereby wicked men sayd bee lead sinne absolute vnaduoydable chuse sinne assoone holy ghost grace christ commeth necessitie vtterly cut thus much internall necessitie necessitie spryngeth externall cause also deuided two maner wayes whereof one violentnecessitie desired eschewed free freedome thyng properly perteinyng whereby voluntary appetite without foreine coaction may either good euill good cometh grace maketh doe p de ption freewill talen arg na l b foure equall nober foure three sen ber called geometricall necessitie alteration nature h admitte necessitie perteyneth nothyng luther disputation freewill simply absolutely necessary common course nature er doth burne necessitie sinne alwayes moued lyke beyng naturall thynges whiche yet necessitie may bee indered god cease operation haue externall begynnynges two maner necessity either violent whiche called necessitie externall coaction wh thynges constreyned moue contrary nature stone heauie thyngs schole men call necessitie respect consequence consequence sensu diuiso sensu composito fro necessitie freedome man vtterly exepted stable infallible reason consequence consequent sensu composito sensu diuiso necessitie consequence consequent vnderstanded thyng may bee true respect necessary aff tie proposition proposition although thyng concluded necessary selfe true sensu composito otherwise false sensu diuiso false sensu composito otherwise true sensu diuiso man say white may bee blacke distinction contrary tymes may bee true ioynyng tymes sensu composito true sinne bondage sinne whiche called freedome grace freedome attributed onely made free grace wherein meane imputation sinne true meane actuall sinne false miserie called freedome glory freedome free state innocecie shall haue much perfect hereafter state glory much freewill empayred man sinne wouded naturall quality witte reason vnderstadyng memory witte c dispoyled altogether thynges bee heauenly apperteynyng god much well agreeth doctrine luther lombard lib dist sithence haue layd foundation better furniture substaunciall argumet whereby proue say true certes present within christendome many natios many prouinces many kyngdomes many dukedomes many city common weales fauour luther doctrine wherein appeale owne conscience speake haue euer heard amongest say one commo wealth citie one litle uillage ciuill familie hath bene one iote defrauded benefite lawes become lesse prouident comon quyet countrey followyng luther doctrine although haue yet receaued fro spayne portingall common wealth bloudy lawes inquisition embrued chriscian bloud suppose also discrete common wealth euer receaue yet god inestimable prouidence bee destitute politique lawes honest science vigilaunt counsellours wherein albeit grosse capacity may seeme vnworthy bee compared fine pregnaunt wittes portingall yet howsoeuer seeme direction sufficiently enough instructed discerne betwixt limittes right wrong confounde neither haue euer confounded farre know maner hotchpot make portingall know much therefore common experience teachyng contrary doth manifestly conuince open lyeng face dare boldly affirme doctrine luther lawes subuerted counsel put silence confusion disorder right wrong haue entred whereof neuer saw proofe ne yet tell dreame much attempt practized common wealth therfore marueile kynde lesing coyne length make cauillation carry shew truth suppose veryly beyng disfurnished proofe recordes founde open lyer matter euident shrowde selfe vnder close couert pelagius witte vse law consisteth two pointes principally say aduancyng vertue punishyng vyce hereupon osorius frame argument maner forme lawes ordeined vayne vnlesse habilitie performe themosori argument habilitie performe doctrine necessitie luther threache ergo lawes ordeined vayne luther doctrine necessitie aunswere maior proposition trueaunswere bondage necessitie doth preiudice habilitie naturall owne faultynesse say bene created without habilitie nature throwen selues inextricable laberinthe yelding owne default hauyng heaped vpon selues necessitie sinnyng voluntaryly owne purchase hauyng made necessitie augustine sayth penall offence good cause therefore lawes necessitie established may lawfull meane reduce v nature least reteyne v couenable order lyfenecessitie sinnyng imputed god selues ouerpassing also withall maior treateth obedience man lawes minor necessitie luther doth teach ought referred ma lawes discipline externall lyfe obediece god law onely moreouer haue promised helpe vnderproppe osorius logicke selfe ruinous ready fall grounde refuse frame order forme remnaunt allegation argumentes reader may easily instructed aunswere make euery particularely argument osoriusthe freedome man beyng take away force lawes preceptes rule good lyfe ordinaunces ciuill discipline statute cease necessitie luther teacheth doth abolish freedome man ergo doctrine necessitie allowed lawes decay good statute ordinauces endeuour good godly lyfe extinguished aunswere freedome taken two wayesfirst maior proposition word freedome must distinguished namely taken either opposite coactio opposite bondage maior vnderstad coacted freedome maior true whosoeuer taketh away freedome man doth also dispoyle vnderstad bonde freedome euen meanes maior cleane false necessitie taken two maner wayesnext deny minor augustine wherein also word necessitie must distinguished whiche beyng deuided two partes one whiche called copul ary necessitie whiche sayd consequence ex hypothesi wherof first euer writer dyd deny none doctours deny whiche consistyng foreknowledge godthe necessitie luther teacheth doth take awaye fortune chaunce taketh awaye freedome certeine vnmoueable coniunction cause byndyng necessitie thyngs foreordeined god doth vtterly abolish fortune chaunce doth take away withstandeth freedome therof contradiction one selfe thyng may called uoluntary necessary also freedome taken away necessitie coaction example say god liueth euerlastyngly ordereth thynges vprightly doe confesse peculiar god nature necessitie forreine coactio maner booke exod whereas pharao endeuour stay child israell departyng egypt must needes confesse necessitie respect god secret appointemet deede neither could otherwisefreedome taken away coaction necessitie respect owne inclination peculiar nearest cause yt moued stay necessitie coactio forced vnwillingly uolutaryly lesse earnest willingnes mynde bring passe ye thing greedy affection willed although man may constrayned somethyng many tymes agaynst yet framed meanes thyng yt would willeth called vnwillyngnesse nay rather nothyng cause bycause thyng course nature founde therfore hath denomination vsuall name speache whereby may expressed latine sorte also argumentes touchyng artes science whereof cauilleth much maner thynges happen bee referred power god done necessitie according luther doctrineosori argument pag byndeth action men necessitie would hereupon follow science ouerthrowen endeuour vtterly frustrate industry neuer skilfull employed husbandry byeng sellyng traffique prouision familie surgery phisicke action man lyfe whatsoeuer shall profite auayleable aunswere bee truethe cofutation operation thynges ought referred prouidence god chief principall cause whiche prouidence thynges ordered necessitie necessitie taketh away habilitie endeuour men causeth onely men action chaunceable albeit thyngs god willed doe necessaryly come passe yet doth man neuertheles yeld diligent endeuour prouidence god doth take away gouerneth deede ma doth worke yea freely worketh say worketh voluntaryly coactly yet worketh god helpe worketh well god doe helpe worketh ill yet whether worke well ill alwayes worketh necessitie neither doth employ habilitie io e lesse beyng gouerned god rather encouraged worke much earnestly bycause thynges come passe necessaryly whatsoeuer god hath foreordeined bee done industry man certes saying luther vndoubtedly true nothyng happeneth action man lyfe either well euill either without god knowledge without el without direction yet bycause success thynges vncerteine vnto v therefore followyng rule reason withall obeyeng god comaundeth v endeuour apply diligece earnestly worke comending meane while selues successe trauaile tuitio almighty god whose especiall commaundement thynges come end necessaryly obey direction necessitie wherby perceaue endeuours trauailes doe nothyng lesse decrease waxe dull worke bycause foreknowen directed god much encouraged worke bycause obey god co maundeth worke therefore sophisme altogether sophisticall deceauable much vnlike whiche read origine second booke agaynst celsus sophister dissuade sicke body counsell phisickeorigene celsus booke frameth argumet thou predestinate sayth hee recouer health thou shalt surely hoale whether thou take phisicke thou predestinate dye phisition shall loase labour thou cast away thy money purpose sicke person perceauyng towardes mariadge lyke sophisme driuyng one nayle aunswereth maner thy destiny haue issue thy body thou shalt haue one whether thou marry wife marry wife thou predestinate childlesse thou shalt surely childies though thou marry wife neuer much deceite sophisme lurketh herein bycause endeuoursour actios must guded approued reason vncerteine certeinetie imagination ought depend vpo vncerteine certeintie whiche may applyable good euill indifferently vpon chaungeable aduenture successe wherof know must ordered direct assured rule reason albeit one side may come passe marryeth wife shall haue child yet part much impossible haue child without copulation man woma therfore ought yelded vnto seemed consonaunt reason ye argument concluded videl therfore must marry wife lyke maner fareth argument concernyng phisition although may come passe phisicke may helpe yet bycause agreable reason vnlesse phisicke ministred health bee recouered follow herein approued rule reason wilfully throw selfe vncerteine necessitie destiny whiche seemeth impossible least lesse agreable reason wherfore assumption false thou shalt vayne marry wife thou shalt vse phisicke vayne lyke maner aunswere osorius argument sophisticall hee argueth endeuours applyed vayne trauaile vayne well go foreward triflyng toyes sophister argument touchyng rewardes punishmentes much vertue vyce doe proceede free choyse willan suttle sophisme osorius opened pag doth bereaue freedome must also dispoyle lyfe man due reward vertue punishment vyce luther byndyng thynges necessitie doth bereaue freedome ergo luther doctrine doth come passe neither punishment shalbe executed vpon malefactours vertue aduaunced condigne reward argument pelagius long ithence vse agaynst august though selfe wordes yet one effect aunswere partes therof first concernyng freedome mentioned maior ought distinguished hath bene declared already minor respect kynde necessitie whiche forceth v yeld whether minor false touchyng reward vertue punishment vyce celestius pelagian vrged agaynst augustine wisethe obiectio celestine pelagian agaynst augustine man blamed sayth committing sinne meanes auoyde augustine maketh aunswereaug aunswere nay rather sayth man therefore faultie hee without sinne bycause ma freewill onely came passe fall necessitie sinnyng necessitie owne withstad whereby perceaue osor necessitie sinnyng neither vtterly abolished fro ma nature malefactours duely punished notwithstadyng offence reason may iustified say sithence iudgement choyse whereby fall sinne free subiect thraldome say thorough whose default seruitude came first already declared agayne whether offence committed free seruile choyse maketh litle purpose quallyfieng punishment appeare iudge fact committed willfull corrupt lust affectio say agayne offence voluntary obiection ergo therof consisteth owne power soeuer voluntary seemeth within compasse habilitie aunswereaunswere haue deede naturally v well haue habilitie seluesaugust vpo wordes apostle sermon witte able well power soundenesse ada lost receaued abuse august epistle sixtusas touchyng rewardes aunswere albeit deedes deserue rewarded yet doth god righteously reward whenas doth crowne owne giftes v neither doth follow hereupon bycause god doth reward good workes v therfore good workes proceedyng fro v owne strength habilitie bycause hath vouchsaued make giftes bycause powreth good giftes v therefore worthely good giftes rewarded owne yet neither reward geue due desert respect worthynes worke gracious liberalitie hath bountyfully powred vpon v vndeserued make v obedient vnto briefly aunswere though selfe playne manifest shall seeme small credite bryng augustine umpyer betwixt v sufficient enough trust beyng long agoe assayled obiections pelagians shall better maintenaunce owne credite fully auswere cauillations heretiques like vnto selfe pelagias obiect agaynst sort true thynges fro begynnyng determined end god foreordinaunce decreecelestius pelagian augustine me willes directed god purpose lawes made punishment ordeined malefactours men rebuked reproued reprehended accused haue receaued maruell disobediet god whe commaudeth obey hath geuen obey euen augustine hath aunswered obiection long sithence let osorius cotent selfe auswered wordesaugust de corr pt grat cap correcting vyce sayth punishment ministred two cause first bycause man euill owne default euill worketh euill voluntaryly owne accorde although ought doubted ma ought subiect god let worke best liketh much listeth frameth man worke yet cause contrary man receaue due punishement offence selfe committeth willfully seyng worker owne sinne man sinneth agaynst cause transgressours worthely punished bycause trespassours either regenerate beyng cleansed fallyng agayne former filthe owne accorde pleade defence neuer receaued grace men freewill haue made frustrate grace god receaued owne wickednesse regenerate yet damnable originall sinne worthely punished anguish punishment may conceaue desire regenerate least man chastized child promise god outward vsing meane scourge vexation chastizement may secret inspiration fashion frame obedience c thus much hetherto cocernyng lawes ordinauces rewardyng vertue punishyng vyce ciuill gouernement followeth absurditie witte sayth luther doctrine man altogether dispoyled vnderstandyng depriued iudgement bereft reason driue extremitie better naturall stoane throwen man hand osorius argument osor cauill pag attribute orderyng thynges absolute necessitie exemptyng freedome doe spoyle men vnderstandyng depriue iudgement bereue reason trafforme brute beastes stoanes luther doctrine doth bynde men action willes necessitie ergo luther doctrine doth dispoyle sens turneth stoanes aunswerei deny maior argument minor distinguish word necessitie lastly argument altogether vicious two cause either bycause osorius thinkethosori double errour necessitie byndeth thynges directed eternall prouidence ordinaunce god el supposeth necessitie must needes exclude freedome false first touchyng necessitie luther aucient writer learnedly affirmeall thyngs subiect god prouidence action man lyfe subiect fortune herein acknowledge prouidence god assigne onely principall gouernesse guide ma lyfe directeth ma purpose boweth bendeth ordereth enterprise thereof moreouer teach prouidence whiche whirled blynd sudden motion wherein place left happenynges fortune prouidence must needes depend vpon inferiour causeschaunceable thinges destiny fortune chauce excluded beyng cause action vpon necessary couplyng together cause wherein destiny excluded prouidence vnaduisedly vncerteinly tossed fro accordyng wandryng chaunces fortune wherein fortune chaunce taken away prouidence consisteth certeine assured stedfast permanent orderthe order superiour inferiour cause workyng meane while inferiour mixte cause neuerthelesse though tyed cause necessary bonde couplyng may possibly doe otherwise owne absolute free motione neither though cause could possibly doe otherwise must necessitie follow direction prouidence whereunto subiect whereby commeth passe freewill beyng occupyed meane causesfreewill neither altogether bod altogether free neither ceaseth altogether free forced forreine constraint guided owne accord yet remayneth absolutely free constrayned whether wil yeld ye direction god prouidence voluntaryly notwithstandyng coactly wherupon amongest learned necessitie called necessitas immutabilitatis aut certitud ni necessitie vnchangeable certeintie whiche though doe vrge thynges violent coaction yet much nothyng al creation nature small substance without copasse god knowledgein respect god prouidence thynges done necessitie chaunce therfore albeit many thing seeme accordyng capacity done chaunce yet respect god prouidence wee duely consider originall principall cause thynges done wee shall finde nothing done could done necessitie make hast absurdity witte osorius friuolous brabblynges sorte crawleth man lawes ciuill gouernement god lawes arguyng sort nothing auayleable good lyfe selfe nothyng sinne god lawes commaunded vayne vayne also exhortatios aduertisementes ministred vayne blessinges cursinges set downe scripturesobiection argument taken fro preceptes exhortatios god law pag man wil say comauded scripture vayne ergo doctrine luther false execrable whereby leaueth none habilitie freewill onely sinne whereby bindeth thing necessity aunswere august de gratia libero arbit cap maior must bee denyed beyng nothyng el manifest cauillation witte tendyng effect though god commaunded v doe nothyng might owne selues performe whereunto augustine aunswereth wise man commaundemet learne thou oughtest doe punishment learne thy weakenesse thyne owne default prayer learne whence thou mayest obteyne c law commaundyng forebyddyng therefore accordyng augustine come knowledge sinne infirmitie owne strength power yet law therfore comaunded vayne v aske sonnes name acknowledge infirmitie grace promised worketh v doe accordyng augustine doth recorde place let v remember hee doth say make vnto selues new hart n w spirite hath sayd geue new hart geue new spirite sayth make vnto selues new hart fayth also geue new hart doth commaunde selfe geue doth geue worker bycause geueth thyng commaundeth helpeth hee hath commaunded hee may grace commeth passe man endued good euill c therfore argument augustine appeareth word admonition exhortation rebukyng vsed scripture certeine meane instrument holy ghost doth vse conuertyng yet regenerate beautifying first issue good giftes regenerate may grow rypenesse repentaunce fayth prayer wrest logicke doth osorius gather habilitie freewill holy ordinauces seyng augustine doth many place directly gayne say especially booke agaynst two epistle pelagius assistaunce grace much augustine briefly knitte vp matter word two know end commaundementes couenaunts exhortation deliuered god learne paule augustine canot satisfie say bycause ye knowledge good euill receaued therfore vnder law necessitie bycause also vnder ye lawwhy commaundements law ordeined paule rom whether able able performe law speaketh vnto v necessitie able performe ly e despise euery mouth stopped world culpable god withall yet regenerate christ vnderstandyng much comaunded beyond habilitie power may flee prayer seeke mediatour call vpon assistaunce grace side holy ghost hath endued bountyfull giftes gracious liberalitie may wt earnest bent affection yeld selues thankefull god hath geuen strength able walke wayes whereby come passemans infirmitie doth take away necessitie law necessitie certeintie doth diminishe man endeuour neither necessitie commaundement made frustrate imbecillitie man endeuour thyng weakened necessitie infallible certeintie yet freedome disabled god prouidence falsely reporte ensue vpon doctrine luther come ye last great haynous matter chief wellspryng absurdity witte wherein luther maketh god authour mischief chargeth vnrighteous dealyng argumet sooth luther doth attribute success thingsthe foreknowledge god doth take away freedome man good euill god ye chief principall originall doth conclude thynges vnder absolute necessitie prouidence hereupon aduersary doth gather three moustruous inconueniences first meanes men haue freedome vpon owne willes second men authours owne sinne thyrd god doth execute iudgementes vpon men vniustly sinnes whereof authours god whereupon simme suttle argueth destruction consequent wise osorius argument god doth take away freedome man authour euill euery man authour owne euill neither god iniurious man executyng punishment vpon offence osorius pag ergo luther doctrine wicked haynous whiche teacheth absolute necessitie doyng good euill foreknowlede god whereby imagineth god authour wickednesse aunswerethere extant scripture many famous notable testimony touchyng truth god praedestination foreknowledge thynges come neither osorius portingall able gaynsayof truth god predestination foreknowledge whereupon necessitie al action must needes ensue respect hypothesis schooleme tearme touchyng glorious assumption haynous inconueniences concurraunt withall false first neither doth freedome man perish men may alwayes willyngly voluntaryly chuse whiche neither man charged necessitie force costraint may compell doe whiche would nothow thynges may tearmed chaunceable may come passe mentioned thinges necessary vpo hypothesis beyng done without hypothesis may seeme chauceable necessary meanes bereft freedome vnlesse paraduenture bycause god seyng man wil inclinable wickednesse doth restrayne may cause may sayd take away freedome withstandeth disputation necessitie nothyng although freedome holpen good yet remayneth neuerthelesse free wickednesse sense spoken might haue holpen say deede nothyng easie ca omnipotecie bryng passe wtout difficultie pray ergo god vnrighteous bycause whe could geue grace would truth deede god owe grace duety law auerre god boude geue grace duetie first god first creatio endue whole nature mankynd freewill also suffer mankynd aftewardes directed freewill pray vnrighteousnesse hitherto yet ye say freewill spoiled vneffectuall worke spirituall good thynges whose default pray god default man default ma default cause god accused either vniust geuyng assitauce cruell punishyng sinne euery v doe committe coaction owne voluntary besides chargeth god originall cause mischief luther falsely accused make god authour wickedness true must needes follow whiche execrable spoken wicked vnrighteously damned selfe created end damned doth punish offence whereof selfe authour procurer first osorius obiectionluthers assertion defended agaynst cauill osorius remedy whereof perceaue neede goe circumspectly worke least god disabled thyng due omnipotencie ascribed power agreable iustice moreouer want testimony scripture vtter apparaunce may seeme well inclinable either part thinke amysse vse herein ayde better discouerie thereof besides must small consideration simple vnlettered multitude hearyng god bee named authour wickednesse vnderstandyng matter aright forthwith interprete thereof though might bee lawfull forthwith rush disorder whatsoeuer vniustly punished doe euill god doth cause done whiche kynde people wishe aduertized heare direction orderyng thynges good euill ascribed vnto godan admonitio reader imagine wordes spoken though god willyng haue iniquitie committed say though god either delighted wickednesse though wicked men wickedly therein accomplishe god simply absolutelyaugust enchirid yet neither may denyed wise yt generall masse creation one thyng ca without copasse god deuine foreknowledge done without albeit must needes confesse augustine many thyngs done agaynst therefore encombred betwixt two whirlepooles shall say doth either sinne doth forbyd punish doth sinne whenas nothyng done god beyng wittyng willyng thereunto cause sinne properly ought imputed godsurely touchyng sinne god ought named authour sinne properly neither ambrose truely writeth iniquitie issue thence whence floweth righteousnesse yet god excluded direction rule sinne altogether vnlesse may thinke somethyng may chauce man lyfe almighty eye god either seeth willeth notambrose callyng gentile second booke last chapter see eternall foreknowledge thynges seeth done without knowledge euerlastyng omnipotencie worketh wherewith sayd doe thinges heaue earth shall say thencomittyng sinne neither without knowledge god without altogether reason god haue sinne sinne committed woderfully ouerflowyng haue sinne may defeded righteous sorte reasoneth osorius though righteousness god could excusable god may supposed either sinne cause procurour sinne albeit drift osori whereby cocludeth yt god willeth sinne bycause hee righteous may respect yelded vntowill distinguished god yt haue relation ye god hath discouered selfe vnto v expresse law ye schoolemen tearme voluntate sigui argue wise god righteous ergo sinner god righteousnesse selfe ergo sinne argument would hold well enough argument good sayosor drift god righteous founteine righteousnes ergo god sinne others without preiudice owne righteousnesse though god could sinne respect sinnefully secrete vnsearcheable wherewith order sweetely disposeth thynges heauen earth empayring meane space ioate righteousnes allit repugnancie god righteousnes sinne respect without sinne nay rather euen selfe cause bycause righteous kynde action sometymes burst whiche beyng committed men respect man nature sinne respect god sinne punishementes sinne powred fromout iust iudgement least office iustice punish sinne sinne necessary iudge alyke cause selues whenas one selfe action doth proceede fro diuerse cause vnlesse cause altogether correspondent action magistrate doth execute offendour cause death doth willyngly cause executed bycause delighteth death enduced onely necessitie doyng iustice doth respect rightfully necessaryly minister iustice priuate russia willyngly put death deemed murtherer parent doth chastize vnthriftie child rodde doth rightfully yea dyd sinne brother beate brother seruaunt felow seruaunt could culpable wherfore maner action regarde must onely done donethere many tymes great diuersitie cause oneselfe action must ende cause also bee considered whiche nomber many tymes many diuers one nature neuerthelesse concurre may doth oftentimes come passe yt cause beyng cocurraut one actio may great diuersitie one selfe cause may one kynde actio wicked another actio meere righteousnesse may come passe man tyme may committe robbery fall haynous wickednesse seeke cause executyng action may rightly impute frayltie man nature seeke procuryng cause draue consent doubt wicked thought corrupt mynde altogether replenished sinne neither doubted sinne engendred corrupt without anselme doth witnesse wicked action committed anselm de casu diabo li cap whereby appeareth length vncleannesse founde god therfore sacred nature meanes defiled sinne desirous learne whence corruption euillnesse mynde imaginatio doth proceede caluine selfe accuse greeuously shall aunswere owne behalfecaluine agaynst pighi lib corruption mynde sayth commeth partly procurement sathan partly frayltie nature man defile owne voluntary fall whereupon sayth cause euill sought ought seeke el selues whole blame therof must lay vpon selues luther caluines doctrine true agreable touchyng cause sinne say wordes caluine agree luther doctrine seing luther maketh god authour good euill caluine maketh man cause euill nay rather meanes forge vnto v crafty deuise iarryng vniforme agreement iudgemet betwixt luther caluine caluine supposeth cause euill ought sought el man luther teacheth righteousnesse ought sought el god onely felowes either go make man excusable god culpable vnrighteousnes meanes effect tedeth whole force osor brablyng agaynst luther though god could sinne meanes glory iustice blemished bycause man imaginyng doyng wickedly tyme imagine euill without sinne therefore osorius dreameth forthwith fareth lyke maner god vntrue nothyng withstandeth many cause semblable affection may concurre oftentymesgods measured affection ma wherein osorius doth erre nothwithstandyng may altogether powre semblable force operatio one semblable sorte therfore good argument god accordyng secrete vnsearcheable doth sometymes encline willes men committe horrible mischiefes certeine maner willeth sinne ergo god may iustly accused vnrighteousnes iniquity argument applyed behalfe man nature might seeme validitie perhappes opinion men transpose men god holde bycause great difference betwixt thynges wherof god authour thynges wherof man doer euen sinnes selues wickednesse come fro god scourge yea righteous whatsoeuer decreed either couered discouered respect holy righteous bycause god ought alwayes accompted foundatio righteousness upon matter let v heare augustine speaketh thyrd booke de trinitate euen owne wordes god chief principall cause kindes action motion aug lib de trinit nothyng done whiche proceedeth fro vnsearcheable intelligible wisedome mightie emperour accordyng iustice vnspeakeable doth almightie wisedome highest worke willeth reacheth one ende world mightely ordereth thynges sweetely doth thynges onely beyng dayly practise reason common vse much marked marueiled thynges also passing vnderstandyng capacitie whiche rarenesse vse straungenesse successe seeme marueilous ecclipses sunne moone earthquake mosters vgly deformed vnnaturall shape creature like one thyng commeth passe without god though seeme otherwise iudgement many person therfore seemed good phatasticall philosopher ascribe vnkindely operation cause beyng able discerne true cause thereof power surmounteth cause witte god higher cause god wherefore besides god none principall cause health sickenesse reward punishment blessinges recompences therfore onely chief principall cause flow thyngs whatsoeuer selfe without beginnyng endureth without endyng let v gather argumets augustine short abridgement god souereigne principall cause motios remayneth osorius must either deny sinnes motion yeld vnto necessitie motion done without god neuerthelesse must adiudged cleare reproche moreouer motion behalfe sinnefull punishementes sinne lette eue selfe sinnes seeme proceede certeine maner fro god without preiudice iustice none otherwise truely god accompted creatour monster ecclipses sunne moone vnpassable darkenes vntymely byrthes yet notwithstandyng ioate maiesty integritie empayred obiection psalm aunswerebut vrged obiection scripture sayd god god willeth iniquitie aunswere though luther perceaue saying prophet well enough impudent tyme would cotrary prophet deny sinnes raunge immoderately agaynst god rehearsed litle earst augustine somewhat may done agaynst god neuerthelesse ca happen without willagaynst god without god one part wherof vnsearcheable wisedome deuine counsell playnly discernable ye thyng naturally wicked displeasaut god eye ye thing selfe respect selfe naturally euill may become good respect god ordinauce respect end whereunto directed god worke redeption sinne death good worke god mercy man neuer haue stoode neede redeptio vnlesse death sinne happened therfore death sinne could execute malice wtout foreknowledge ordinaunce god also lesse notable worke god iustice executyng iust wrath agaynst sinner seueritie iustice neuerthelesse neuer expressed wonderfull brightnesse sinne neuer bene committed suppose osorius deny men rushe headlong wickednesse sinne god prouidence yet sufferauce least may many thynges may happen man permission permit may blamelesse notwithstandyng heare well aunswere altogether nothyng osorius doth alledge deede yet allegation comprehendeth first demaunde osorius beyng bishop suffer god flocke committed charge starue defraudyng necessary foode word duety ought cherish diligece care shepheard doe willyngly suffer ye maggotte pester sheepe maister suffer seruaunt perish whose perplexitie might haue releued puttyng hand tyme may iustly accuse osorius fraude feedyng osorius acquit selfe slipper deuise negligence behalfe comon co uersation lyfe man repell iniury may adiudged euery respect blameworthy offereth iniury selfe meanes god say doth permit sinnes done either deemed excusable respect sufferaunce onely charge v accusing iniustice bycause say doth onely permit also sinne certeine maner thyng augustine doth well declare suffer sayth augustaugust agaynst lia pelag lib cap vnder correctio doe wickedly sight must needes adiudged accessary wickednesse god doth permitte sinne raunge without measure euen eye wherein willyng surely would suffer wise yet righteous notwithstandyng c wherfore allegation bare sufferaunce doth neither helpe cause disaduantageth thyng go let v somewhat yeld word sufferaunce whereupo ye stad stoughtely yet ye deny sufferaunce god either coupled together altogether sundered fro ye confesse ye sufferaunce ioyned together god sayd either suffer thyng whiche willeth thyng wherof selfe certeine maner cause sunder sufferaunce god sufferaunce made opposite say contrary determinate cousell god bringyng thyng passe surely way bare sufferauce sufferable foolishe false ridiculous neither thyng done without god sufferaunce must done agayne nothyng soundeth agaynst conuenience reason thyng may done otherwise selfe hath decreed done ye set god sufferaunce opposite namely wherewith vouch safeth accepteth thyng veryly may one thyng may executed god sufferaunce yet altogether agaynst forget meane space sufferaunce idle fruitelesse altogether effectuall much vnlike orderly proceedynges iudgementes whenas iudge deliuereth ouer trespassour executed comonly seene sufferaunce iudge doth worke execution offendour acte executioner yet iudge altogether exempt beyng cause death though cleare blame respect therfore make conceaue meanyng effectually osorius may vnderstand premissesgods taken two maner wayes secrete god vsually called good pleasure god discouered word termed voluntas signi god taken two maner wayes either vnsearcheable manifested vnto v wherewith thynges may happen accordyng determined decree purposed cousell whereunto thynges directed sense signification doe affirme god doth thynges done nothyng done heauen earth would haue done el called omnipotent success thyngs hath decreed secundarely god may take expresse word commaundement hath reuealed vnto v beyng done accompteth acceptable sight sense faythfull godly onely execute god euen wherewith allow anythyng pure good maner fully disclosed ensealed vnto v scripture wherewith god sayd god doth sinne accordyng former hidden v neuertheles alwayes iust discouered vnto v part word nothing done without prouidence foreknowledge sense affirme willeth nothyng partes pure righteous neuer secrete euen hidden fro knowledge men shall come passe purposed appointement god shall nothyng come passe hath decreed vpon neither thyng done altogether vnwillyng thereunto finally conclude wordes whatsoeuer concerneth present discoursegod cause euill accordyng reuealed hi word god sayd properly truely cause sinne accordyng would haue reuealed vnto v scripture yet cocurrauce cause must deriued first originall surely god ought excluded altogether orderyng appointmet sinne fro whence respect meane second cause vndoubted true makynde doth perish owne default man liuyng sinneth vnwillyngly tourne eye first agent principall cause ye inferiour cause haue mouyng allso true second subordinate cause subiect eternall prouidence godgods exempt altogether orderyng cause therefore may true man destructio commeth owne default yet therein prouidence god beareth sway without preiudice iusticemas destruction commeth himselfe yet without god prouidence prouidence notwithstandyng altogether vnslayned albeit god euerlastyng purpose sayd cause sinnesiull action yet sinnes respect god acceptaunce meare righteousnesse god vpright disposed order doth sinne punish sinne therfore sinnes scourge god iustice god doth worthely execute iust iudgement agaynst although pleasure vse otherwise accordyng vnsearcheable counsell either execute iudgement vpo reprobate manifest mercy towardes elect neither iniurious ye one exactyng yt due neither culpable ye sorte forgeuyng might haue exacted two thyngs therfore especially beleued inseparable god though ma capacitie ca scarsely atteine hereunto first wickednes god secondly god hath mercy pleaseth haue mercy doth harden harte willeth hardened certayne action respect man may sinnes respect god may righteous haue spoken sufficietly defence god iustice acquited cleare quarellsome accusation retourne agayne former questiongod cause cause sinnes sundry respectes osorius doe demaunde god bee cause sinne bycause protract tyme aunswere two wordes seuerall sundry respectes cause cause let v see hang together first call cause bycause distilleth new poyson man water liquour powred empty caskes somewhere el needeth euery man ouerfloweth enough already faultynes naturall though new flame corruption kyndeled fresh bycause hee forsaketh old nature bycause withholdeth selfe renewyng v grace bycause nature beyng holpen waxeth dayly worse worse selfe without measure without end whereupon augustine debatyng man induration speaketh vnfitly wiseaugust de praedest grat cap touchyng whiche followeth hee doth harden hee force man capacitie ouerwhelmed straungenesse word must taken though god beginne harden ma hart infected hardnesse el resistaunce god commaundementes thinketh worke god bycause saying doth harden hee let beholde first beginnyng man corruption marke well commaundemet god disobedience whereof made hart offende let truely confesse whatsoeuer punishement befalleth sithence first corruption bee suffreth righteously deseruedly god sayd harden hart hee mollifie hee sayd also reiect hee call blynd enlighten hee hath predestinate hath called c blynding hardning taken god moreouer withdrawyng grace also followeth thereupon god doth righteously minister occasio sinnyng wicked reprobate maruelously enclineth harte men onely good also euill may beleue testimony augustine booke de libero arbit grat alledgyng certeine testimony apostleaug de lib arb grat cap sayd god gaue vp vyle affection rom agayne hee deliuered vp vnto reprobate mynde thessa place therfore god doth send strong delusion beleeue lye lyke testimony sacred scripture appeareth sufficiently god doth worke harte men bende encline bow willes whereunto listeth either good accordyng rich mercy wickednesse accordyng owne desertes witte iudgemet sometymes reuealed deede sometymes secret alwayes righteous must holde certeine vnshaken myndes iniquitie god cause ye read holy writte deceaued amazed hardened hart doubt hereof nothyng sinnefull deseruyngs well deserue punishment followeth c premiss considered much god doth vse peruersenes men nill purpose endes whereunto hath decreed may doubtfull hereof god ought meanes excluded disposing sinnes besides also whereas holy ghost misdoubteth speake scripture vsuall phrase speach wittethe true cause sinne properly man god god doth harden men harte doth deliuer vp reprobate myndes doth dazell blyndnesse doth make eares deafe doth lead error like shall say sinnes doe happen without god albeit neither doe say god therefore properly simply cause wickednesse whenas selues enough true page duplicate page duplicate naturall cause wickednesse therfore cause sinne seyng must necessitie subiect god directed surely may lawfull exclude god direction disposition sinnes osorius shall thinke selfe yet fully satisfied wt auswere may resolued agayne whole cause sinne resiaunt man selfe corrupt cause wherfore sinne doth become sinne must ascribed god good ordinaunce one wherof sinne punishment sinne augustine maketh mention affection ordeyned yt affectio may wicked affection notwithstandyng guidyng cause selfe hym guided good purpose end doctrine let v heare august doth selfe testifie professeaugust enchirid cap controuersie sayth god doth well euen suffering thing good good wickednes surely almightie goodnes selfe would meanes permitte done without doubt easely permit thynges ca easily thing done firmely beleue groudworke faith wherein cofesse beleue god father almighty great hassard god called omnipotet cause deede bycause able operatio whose deuine creature ca hinder preiudice meanes c much augustine bycause tedious argue vpon augustine wordes wise argument augusteuery good thyng doth proceede god authour guider therof good wickednesse ergo god author directer wickednesse commeth passe iulian pelagius sect portingall prelate osorius brawle cauill deedes wickednesse committed sufferaunce god forsakyng omnipotent power workyng meanyng hereby sure god doth permit wicked thynges done deede power forceth man doe wickedlyaugust iulyan pelagi power writeth maner god willyng shewe wrath make power knowen suffer long patience vessel wrath prepared destruction c rom afterwardes produceth many example reason taken propheticall scripture make iudgement god roboam sayd driuen harken sinister counsell bycause refuse counsell elder whece came pray written holy writte1 king ordinance lord might performe saying speake mouth prophet kynges lyke must iudged amasias fallen perill harckened ioas kyng israell shall alleadge cause harken good counsell ioas osorius runne backe againe wounted maner freewill sathan ye mouyng cause2 parillipo cap true deede respect second instrumentall cause god sacred oracle beyng accustomed searche souereigne principall cause thyngs rayse selues higher aunswere wrought god selfe dyd onely suffer hym determinate counsell directed also thereunto bycause hee would auenge selfe kyng abhominable idolatry paralipo dauid caused people nombred know sathan sayd prouoke hym thereunto read chronicle let v marke scripture speaketh el wrath lord kindeled agaynst israell stirred vp dauid nomber people paralipo nothyng withstandeth truely may bee true neither agaynst coueniecie reason augustine truly witnesseth one selfe wickednesse may punishement scourge sinne vpo wicked malicious practize deuill god iust iudgemet also seyng skilleth whether god bryng passe power seruice sathan esay prophet god sayd wise hast thou considered seruaunt iob wherefore god make motion first may appeare enemy permitted onely made minister also make triall man patience furthermore robbed spoyled goodes cattels prouidece ordereth disposeth seruice workes creation owne pleasure professeth earnestly none el dispoyled goodes gaue themiob lord gaue sayth lord hath taken blessed name lord c woderfull force vnmeasurable power god wisedome prouidence disposing thynges accordyng euerlastyng purpose outstretched copasse spreadyng selfe farre wyde abroad throughout degreees success thyngesthe meanes god prouidence detestable august calleth execrable opinio osor ye man seemes thing auoyded god doth know shall come passe assuredly necessitie must graunted doctrine prouidence necessitie beyng excluded god prouidence also rent asunder withall maner doth cicero dispute bookes de natura deorum cicero de natur deor lib thynges come saith foreknowen must needes followe euery thyng must proceede due order much nothyng done without cause therfore must due order knittyng together cause graunted necessitie whereupo must needes ensue yt thynges yt done performed vnauoydeable necessitie graunted sayth ciuill societie rooted lawes established vayne correction praysing dispraysing good counsell ministred vayne neither anye ordinaunce deuised aduauncement vertue punishement vyce serueth purpose allaugust de ciuitat dei booke cap bycause haynous daungerous absurdity tollerable weale publique therfore sayth augustine man yeld foreknowledge thyngs come meanes forceth reader inconueniences chuse one two either man force el thynges must determined vpon necessitie beyng opinion one tyme together one allowed must needes abolished leane vnto god foreknowledge prouidece must freewill haue place side mainteyne freewill foreknowledge thyngs come must banished ye while cicero beyng otherwise man woderful experience august sayth endeuoureth make v free doth bring v wtin ye copasse sacrilege horrible robber god foreknowledge beyng ignoraunt selfe vnite freedome foreknowledge together rather suffreth god despoyled wisedome men left destitute freewill errour augustine doth worthely reproue well disposed order cause alwayes vnchaungeable god directed prouidence therfore wisedome doth coprehend cause al thyngs also cause selues could ignoraunt willes foreknow cause al doyngs go let v establish certeintie god prouidence supposing stand together lyke maner osorius imaginyng selfe perpetuall vnappeasable disagreement betwixt necessitie orderyng cause man freewill meanes may argree foreknowledge god come passe operation cause precedenta suttle sophisme practizyng persuade meere absurdity perpetuall orderyng thynges foreknowledge god thyngs atteyne ye success wherunto ordeyned agayne thyngs atteyne success whereunto ordeyned god foreknowledge thynges come let v copare first suttle sophisme last execrable conclusionthe choise man free ergo god foreknowledge thynges come let osorius aduise selfe well aunswere make argument hold ciceroes opinion remayneth hee must needes condemne v sacrilege cicero doth while endeuoureth make v free know hee wil hold case deede ciceroes argument ought allowed doth discende directly argument fro proper cause proper effectes whereas freewill mainteyned one propositio cause wherefore denyed thynges done necessitie also good consequent lykewise bycause necessitie taught consiste vnchaugeable orderyng cause god foreknowledge therfore nothyng remayneth effectual freewill suttletie sophisme disclosed bycause agreeyng herein augustine doe confesse witte aswell god doth know thynges done cause ye thynges foreknowen done necessitieaugust de ciuit dei lib cap also willyngly worke whatsoeuer know feele done v without owne consentes reply luther contrary augustine doctrine leaue man lyfe altogether destitute freewill tyeng action fast bounde chaynes vnauoydeable necessitie aunswere luther doth defend euery absolute vnaduoydeable necessitieluther doth neither teache euery necessitie absolutely take away freedome men whiche spake consequence doth take away freedome neither men freedome onely set contrary opposite spirituall bondage yet doth exempt men freedome onely regenerate better grace christ iesu whosoeuer inueste person freedome vtter enemy grace lesse false also whatsoeuer couterfaite deuine doth groude selfe vpon hath hundred tymes vrged touchyng opinion necessitie wise brauleth agaynst luther caluine thyngs doe done meere necessitie decreed vpon furthest end eternitie surely whatsoeuer wickednesse committe lead owne voluntary motion drawen perpetuall constraynte bee adiudged sinne triflyng sophisme haue vtterly crusht peeces authoritie augustine neither came euer myndes luther caluine mainteyne necessitie copulsary externall coaction enforce committe wickednesse vnwillyngly man sinneth sinneth voluntaryly albeit none action destitute certeyne perpetuall directio almighty lord gouernour yea though neither sinnes selues altogether escape prouident foreknowledge god yet peruerse frowardnesse wicked thyng lesse excusable ought receaue codigne punishment accordyng wicked deseruynges whosoeuer hath voluntaryly offended deserueth punished therfore herein osorius friuolous diuinitie doth litle bewray nakednesse whereas debatyng matter sinne seemeth haue learned lesson yet augustine sinne punishmet sinne oneaugust de natur grat cap therfore mainteynyng one lye doth conclude wisely agreable equitie sithence men instrumentes onely god worker thyngs condemned malefactours onely instrumentes good reason sworde wherewith man slayne adiudged faultie perso slue man swordosorius pag whiche selfe would deny agaynst reason yt matter osor would applye euer speake dreame men instrument onely doyng wickednesse god authour worker mischief ye wordes osorius luther caluines answere false diuinitie osoriusthat wicked men sawes instrumentes many tymes handes god punishement sinne luther onely esay also doth boldly confesse go therfore coclude men nothyng el instrument tooles onely wisely warraunt deriuyng argument propositio exponent exclusiue nay rather maliciously wrestyng peruertyng thynges truth slaunderous cauillyng august doth sundry tymes witnesse men willes subiect god able withstand itaug de correp grat cap much willes selues sayth god doth fashion liketh lysteth willes auayleable god willed foresawe bee auayleable august de ciuitat dei lib cap whereby see god almighty power doth worke willes workeshoppe whe purposeth thyng doth neither traspose willes otherwise purpose ye seruice owne willes yet doth therfore follow ye men willes nothyng el iustrumentes tooles onely god handyworke ye thyng selfe doth nothyng carryed whirled hither thither without proper motio operation agent cause onely truly augustine sayth wellaug de peccatis meritis lib cap doe worke wishinges onely sayth least hereupon cauillation arise effectuall procure lyue well bycause god doth worke saluation v vnsensible stoanes thynges nature created voyde reason c deede god doth worke willes hart men yet rollyng tossyng stoanes driuyng whirlyng thynges without lyfe though enterprising attemptyng thynges myndes willes men carryed forrein constraint deuine coaction without voluntary motion intelligible mynde therfore osorius doth hereof friuolously falsely forge cankred cauillation maliciously practizeth procure doctrine luther maligned though deuise man lyke vnto stoane imagined god onely authour worker mischief oso caui bycause teach men willes subiect god wil secundary cause certes august writeth begrauted truth god cause thynges done august hys treatise vpon gen agaynst manichaeus lib cap lesse alowable luther false eche respect aug since speake one selfe sentence one iudgement therein neither therfore good consequent osor doth phantasie onely god cause sinne though man nothyng reproueable sinnyng punishable deseruyng end tendeth whole cutted conclusion osorius brabblynges haue skill know nature distinctio yet must taught one thyng permitte sinne voluntar ly thyng committe sinne voluntaryly wherof first proper god peculiar men first may done without offence bee done meanes without wickednesse whereas god sayd sinne certeyne maner sayd done accordyng call god good pleasure neither euill without truth scripture yet followeth hereupon necessaryly god onely proper cause sinnehow cause called onely proper cause accompted onely cause excludeth cause besides selfe cause called proper cause doth respect onely one end yea also last end respect wherof accompted proper cause whereas therfore sinne ye last end god man peruersenesse affirme done deede without god man proper cause therof god cause thynges must proportioned endes surely sinne ye last end god respect euill respect ye scourge plague sinne speake paules wordesrom shewyng forth god righteousnesse feare god ende nothyng better holy iniquitie cruelty god osorius misconstruyng luther wickedly maliciously fruitlesse logicke taketh fruite deuilishe spirite slaunderous cursed fury doth corrupt may seeme stand much vpon refutyng toye lettyng slippe many thynges paule haue heaped vp together thinke expedient disclose meaning paule may done orderly behoueth note diligently ende paule gathered reason together well truly cruell scourgemotto weried throughly wt whippyng poore luther miserably vnmercifully buffetyng doth length hyde rod vnder gowne beginneth creepe high desk teach somewhat god ye scripture shall neede nothyng camell daunce while assehead minstrell striketh vppe drumme therfore harken wise blinde buzardly lutheran caluish caluinistes foolish bucerans sith blockish nature selues coceaue nothing apostle doctrine ye may last warrant learne portingall thales pure sincere interpretation paules discourse touching predestination gentile reiection iewes whereof debateth three chapter vnderstanding whereof neyther luther himselfe rest deede abraham israell posteritie promise much spiritually taken restrayne selfe onely externall family alone kinred fleshe noted vnder fellowshyppe kinred israell gentile also especially endued like sincerity fayth addeth furthermore rom albeit promise concerne gentile chiefly ioyned themselues christ yet wholy translated gentile iewes beyng forsake great portio also remnaunts lametable shoulde restored agayne benefite former blessing uerily confesse interpretation osorius altogether amisse wherein see nothing yet false newly deuised moreouer nothing spoken hath long sithence bene behalfe fell themselues true righteousnes owne default people following righteousnesse whiche came fayth flattering themselues obseruing workes lawe furthermore whiche thapostle doth prophecie shall come passe concerning restoring agayne whole nation length hartily wish man suppose blockishe doth vnderstand sufficiently whatsoeuer paule hath spoken matter owne writing though osorius neuer interprete osorius pag agayne touching example isaac iacob set downe paule god election would preferred brother though elder birth deuision father patrimonye neither ignoraunt forgetfull thereof whereupon nothing disagree fro osorius conceauing thing vnder type figure person doe professe many wordes neyther prerogatiue kinred workes yet lawe god election calling grace doth make true israelite forasmuch therefore expositours poynts doctrine haue nothing hitherto swarued truth paules doctrine interpretation corrupt exposition length interpretours wherewith much offended forsooth say doe sufficiently enough conceaue ende whereunto paule referre argumentes goe sith prouoke v hereunto let v first see argumentes paule ende applied iewes challenge theselues title righteousnes obseruaunce law neuerthelesse obserue deede partely swelling pryde nobilitie race promise vnto selues certaine peculiar election god nation paule entending treate sharply agaynst insolent arrogancie doth argue agaynst forcible argumentes taken holy scripture namely substance god election neither hang vpon work law neyther vpon roialtie race yet vpon auncient parentage depend vpon onely freemercy god compassion fayth gospell make appeare euidently putteth foorth vnto example isaac ismaellexamples isaac iacob ismael esau whereof one though byrth yonger yet obtained grace first thereby aduaunced dignity inheritaunce generall issue one father abraham though one mother auoyde ye dauger scrupule might ensue reason two mother hee doth yet confirme notable exaple namely example two brother twinnes iacob esau issuing one father one mother one birth done thing good euill god translate honour birthright blessing ye yonger beare rule ouer elder whereof came free gift election whereas nothing infantes beyng yet borne might eyther deserue bee aduaunced reiected respect worthines workes seely infantes done borne whole matter depend vpon determination god vnsearcheable counsell rewarde doe men workes deserue namely whereas god spake moyses playnest maner speachrom haue mercy shew mercy haue copassion haue compassion whereunto agreeth testimony paule immediately vttered spirite willeth runneth god sheweth mercy againe alledging example pharao semblable reason cofirmeth example god seueritythe example pharao debated freemercy order argument paules discourse neyther osorius himselfe deny must diligently considered ende paule applyed reason herein consisteth whole pithe controuersie whereas luther caluine martyr companion bee opinion paule vndertooke disputation end settyng downe example god liberalitieall reward merites excluded seueritie might make manifest onely free mercy eternall election god accordyng purpose good pleasure make true israelite without helpe respect workes endeuours osori doth stoughtly withstand felowes denyeng meane while god election god callyng ne yet grace hee sayth graunt notwithstandyng election faythfull consisteth freemercy god without speciall respect workes whole force prelate diuinitie let v heare owne wordes osorius pag therfore sayth gather place paule neither dignitie parentage worke yet law doth make true israelite god election callyng grace let v see whether notable mercy god powred vpon v without deseruynges geauen v without respect workes c first bycause sufficiently conceaue osorius meane say mercy powred vpo v desertes yet geauen without respect workes would haue open meanyng distinctly god powre vpo faythfull mercy without merites say choyse doe ye want elect cosisteth god meere mercy good onely without merites thinke wise sufferable vttered reason suppose god election consiste mercy onelymaior without choyse chosen god iudgement might adiudged chaunceable vnaduised let v ioyne hereunto minor fortune vnaduisednesse imputed god iudgementminor heare paule workes calleth sayth elder shall serue younger let v conclude god name ergo god electio standeth mercy onelyconclusio choyse say without especiall discrete regarde one thyng person elected bee founde person reiected maner doth osorius define conclude sudry ridiculous vayne glorious speaches rhethoricall brauery vnprofitable scoldyng least might seeme rhetoricia onely leane logicia hath pyked somewhat rule sophistry wherein behaueth hym selfe neuerthelesse none otherwise owle amogest nightingale principall speciall pointe arte hee either atteyneth aright toucheth surely coldly may easily playnly perceaued osorius owne forme arguyng call playnly owne bycause creature ca nearely resemble sire wherein neither define rightly deuide orderly lesse foolishly heapyng together false thynges steede true thynges maner arguyng proceedyng effectes cause crabbes crawle backeward part set carte hoarse firstelection signifieth osorius logick wheras say word electio doth signifie speciall regard whereby thyng may iudged person elect wanted reprobate define election wise surely allow although man ought dought god accordyng incomprehesible wisedome euen begynnyng ignoraunt contrary dispositious euery thyng difference betwixt faithfull reprobate yet election opened sufficietly hetherto yet accordyng nature word effectes
