thing aboue others whole hope confidence saluation consisteth one thing el onely mercy god promised vnto v would fayne learne much osorius wisedome doth yeald vnto mercy while ascribeth much god iustice electio predestinationfirst touching election predestination workes foreknowne beare whole sway god election falleth vppon man whose whole course lyfe knowne hath made vnworthy honorable dignitie election place pray left mercy seeing whole worke election seemeth ascribed iustice rather iustice vouchsaffeth none good deserue euen grace mercy doe relieue none part abiectes outcaste altogether vnworthy therof vocation conuersiomoreouer concernyng vocatio couersio habilitie man freewill accordyng new maister doctour may onely worke together god may also well preuent grace god good motio follow grace none otherwise either offred vnto v vnlesse put forth willes thereunto otherwise effectuall v while stand fast tacklyng hold fast helpe offred vnto v yea encrease owne strength man holpen god willyng hopyng prayeng doth make selfe apte thereunto truly whosoeuer teach doctrine let set neuer glorious face towardes blazyng mercy wordes yet deede nothyng el rebelles god grace least mangler spoylers best part power god grace while attribute part grace part nature also adiudged worke iustification whiche though seeme exclude freemercy god altogetheriustificatio lyfe euerlastyng yet doe gelde forrible partes therof surely yeld ouer workes flowyng fro fouteyne freewill wherein also make myngle mangle ye neither graunt onely fayth worke iustification onely grace worke election meanes lastly shall say reward gloryglory immortalitie workes beyng wayed righteous ballaunces god iudgement shall procure v lyfe death osorius writeth pag agayne righteousnesse onely consisteth well doyng doth purchase god fauour mankynde pag soppe pray shalbe left mercy deale withall shall remayne wherein grace god may exercized owne wordes osorius deny themosori doth couer enemy grace vnder glorious praysing vertue dare artificiall argumet persuade v accopt enemy god grace while ye sight much vnder banner iustice yet captious coptoller wordes call name enemy grace though deede dare scarsely thinke respect sownde frende thereunto hetherto veryly yet haue declared selfe better euen owne writing sufficiently denounce agaynst yt wonder see lauish prodigall aduauncyng prayses iustice amplyfieng whereof scarse finde end meane tyme towardes commendation mercy sparyng niggard hardelaced ye seeme either conceaue wonderfully maiestie therof sufficietly el vngratefully acquainted therewith sauyng ye begyn legth preach somewhat excellency therof alsorom takyng occasion wordes paule shall say vnrighteousnesse god god forbid sayth moyses haue mercy shew mercy haue compassion haue compassion yt place say paule doth render reasonosori pag wherfore man ca meanes accuse god vnrighteousnesse doe annexe hereunto conclusion agreable enough defence defence iustice say cosisteth wholy mercy agayne mercy god doth acquite iustice free reproche whiche reason osori although perhaps might allowed respect yet doth exactly substauncially enough discusse ye naturall meanyng apostle sufficiently auswere apostle question euidently playnly appeare either apostle selfe augustine expositour apostle first note marke state question diligently truely scope wherof augustine affirmeth apostle may lay open v grace fayth ought preferred workes end might seeme abolish workes shew workes goe follow graceaugust ad simplicia lib quest make apparaunt alledgeth amongest others example iacob esau beyng yet borne world hauyng done nothyng worthy either fauored hated equabilitie estate made eche equall betwixt difference nature deseruyngs might procure aduaucement one finally whenas orderly course byrthe right first byrthe elder might haue challenged prerogatiue honour youngerthe meanyng paule opened augustine almighty god vsing vnsearcheable electio make difference betwixt whereas difference workes merites sakyng esau merite rule iustice deserued bee reiected gaue preheminece younger turnyng common order nature vpsidowne whereas younger wont subiect elder contrary kynde elder become seruaunt younger whereupon whe apostle sawe scrupule might arise imagination hearer reader therof putteth question vnder person one yt might argue agaynst whether god done thyng herein agaynst equitie right thyng could iustifie accordyng iustice distributiue whereunto selfe aunsweryng immediately doth wonderfull vehemency detest slaunderous cauill withall acquiteth god free accusation suspition vnrighteousnes wtout lawfull authoritie scripture sayth read spoke vnto moyses wise haue mercy take mercy haue copassion haue compassion besides also addyng forthwith example pharao doth conclude length wise therfore hath mercy hardeneth captious accuser yet persiste obstinacie though sufficed god pleased doth cofute manifest argument lyke comparison wise potter fashionyng vesselles either vnto honour dishonour purpose seemeth best doth offend shall lesse lawfull god shew power vpon owne creature potter vpon chalke clay therfore whether god willyng haue mercy indurate man doth nothyng herein lawfull agreable equitie perceaue therfore god iustice sufficiently enough desended suppose workes ought good right mightly defeded defeded seeen osorius vrgeth stoughtly god iustice standeth otherwise defended onely respect mercythe defece god iustice consisteth thing el onely mercy god according osorius albeit might graunted sorte yet altogether simply absolutely true reason therof pyked osorius credite rather argument paule whereas paule seemeth referre whole defence iustice mercy onely god saying god taketh mercy hardeneth albeit meane while deny election faythfull doth consist vpon mercy alone yet surely defense election vpholden god onely likewise also albeit castyng away reprobate proceede onely iustice god yet man say defence reiection consisteth mercy onely god therfore onely god doth defende mercy election iustice reiection otherwise could come passe onely mercy god defed iustice either reprobate scarse one sparckle mercy discernable el predestination faithfull wherein appeareth execution iustice therfore may defend iustice mercy onely purpose god onely wherof paule maketh mention god taketh mercy sayth taketh mercy hardeneth harden neither reiecteth mercy yet taketh copassion iustice executeth accordyng absolute good pleasure esau iacoblet v make manifest exaples whenas god sayd hate esau loue iacob beyng yet borne done yet nothyng worthy loued hated kynde mercy shew hatred one whiche may defende iustice kynde iustice loue mercy say may deliuer cleare reproche followeth hereupon therefore whole defence iustice consisteth mercy alone onely god rather doth acquite onely mercy god iustice also withall fro accusatio vnrighteous dealyng hardenyng pharaobe spoken likewise touchyng hardenyng hart pharao beyng decreed vpon secrete counsell god long droppe mercy extended vnto doe referre ye iustice induration mercy onely say god call pharao fayth obedienceosorius pag despite great bountie lyke wilde colte would licentiously raunge order agreable onely god seueritie mercy also scourge iuste plague accordyng deserte exaple othersmight reclaymed duety know ye su dry singular presidentes god clemency callyng ministred vnto deede token mercye outward meanesthe confutation osori obiection god vseth outward calling men appertayne calling onely touch election reiection nothing respect expresse defence iustice admit hardning pharao casting away esau happen righteously yet iustice therefore defended agaynst quarelling aduersary abuse lemty god afterwardes first reiected god mercy abuse powred vpo thing thus alleadged doo tend end though opinion iustice reiectio boyd defece hath certeine peculiar iust defencethe chief meanes wherewith god iustice may defended wherof osorius doth dreame seeke right defence god iustice bee iust god apperteining god hys owne properly effectually deuines tearme nothing owne nature standeth equitie iustice neither standeth neede defence soeuer god doth decree vpon though neuer farre hidde vnderstanding yet self defensible absolutely perfect enough therfore paule seeketh place refuge el agaynst terrible assault aduersary god accompteth strongest surest fort defence sayth god taketh mercy hath mercye ha den rom doth say doth harden person taketh mercy doth harden agayne hath predestinated v iesus christ according purpose sayth iustice ephes hauig deed one thing greater maiestie alleadge hys defence agaynst aduersary onely god wherewith alone aduersary might throughly satisfied osorius take exceptionan exception osorius confuted say ought vpright agreable v helpe osor haltyng logicke agayne wise shall able craule vpon feete osori obiection pag wickednesse brought passe become vessel wrath god create wickednesse ergo god doth create vessel wrath euery one maketh selfe vessell wrath thorough hys owne wicked cause would made vessell mercy aunswerefirst maior graunted simply absolutely must yelded vnto truth onely wickednesse doth make vessel wrath also taken matter confessed vpon equall relation contrary witte vertue onely doth make vessel mercy withall consisteth habilitie power euery good body vessell dishonour become vessell honour moreouer vpon matter regulated man though also necessary made vessell mercy whenas willing made vessell wrath vessell doth neuer display lightsomnesse house god thinke osori purpose belongeth saying paulrom neither willeth runneth god taketh mercy god euerlastyng decree force matter determine vpon certeintie must guided raungyng rule man much accordyng old sayd law quite agaynst heare albeit deny ye meane tyme able discerne truly betwixt vessel wrath vessel mercy good euill workes see yea cometh hereby many tymes passe sometymes seemed owne conceites selues vessel wrath beyng afterwardes endued better grace doe processe tyme feele contrary hangeth vpon cobbwebbe man dependeth wholy vpon god election beyng alwayes agreable stable selfe neuer chauged variable soeuer motios men therfore meanyng rather wont thrust vpon v make playne distinct auswere firstan answere osorius cauils nature cause selfe must bee considered must playne distinction god opened question made god scripture doth speake dispose order thyngs wt certeine secrett power yt voluntary seruiceable yeldyng atteyne last purpose whereunto god first chiefly foreordeyne direct whereby commeth passe though god selfe make person euill properly yet wicked person notwithstandyng shall accoplish godhow wicked men god accordyng euent successe properly absolutely yet accidentall meanes wise albeit destruction wicked proceede voluntary corruptio man god nearest cause yet wicked person fulfill wickednes without god much due scourge punishment sinne man punished therewith without god agayne word signified sometymes wherewith god expresse word doth notifie selfe delighted well pleased acceptable sight whiche sort thynges whiche naturally good commendable significatio god sayd wickednes death sinner thessa speaketh apostle sayth willing one side shew hys wrath make power knowne much sufferaunce lenyty beare vessel wrathe prepared vnto destruction side make knowne richesse hys glory towardes vessel mercy hath prepared glory c wordes doth easely perceaue lastthe place paule rom expounded principall ende god workmanship doth consist wicked men perish large hys heauenly mercy mightely increase saluation hys faythfull could brought passe meanes vnlesse contrary part vpon whome seueritie god iustice might exequuted seemed good therefore almighty creator creation vnspeakeable workshop whole world dispose vessel seuerall v vnto honor yet vnto dishonor made seruiceable instrumentes hys iustice meete instrument hys mercy yt created creature effect finall vtmost end hys purpose perish determined himselfe secret counsell foundation world haue mercy vpon therefore could othertherwise forsaken beyng forsaken yelded ouer themselues fall away necessitie god grace withdrawing assistaunce man imbecillity must withall needes fall ground nature nowe ouerthrowne god iustice coulde execute office punish greuously necessitie hereof co meth destruction reprobate persecutor hys peoplethe cause effecient ye efficient cause wherof cosisteth truely euery corruptionthe cause deficient cause deficient god therefore ought iudge alyke cause election damnation although certayne bra ches predestination concurre altogether one kynde one originall one end yet differ notwithstanding maner fountayne original decree god ende glory god yet election lyfe euerlasting sort reprobation destruction ishow cause election damnation differr agree betwixt selues hee hath chosen making hee doth reiect doyng somewhat rather forsaking saluation yt godly yt whol cause wholy shut vp god yt besides person cause come betwixt may challenge interest title election saluacion yt matter goeth otherwise destruction reprobate albeit perishe damned without god yet besides also yt obstinate rebellion man thrusteth self wherby worthely procure selues deserued damnation god doth neyther cast doth cast away one enforce commit filthines forsaketh euery one yeldeth ouer hys owne guiding freewill beyng nothing el fraylty feeble weakenes selfe vnable defend brickle inclination nature agaynst monsturous assaultes vnsatiable lust yeldeth selfe coward captiue euery storme suttle te tation meanes whereof commeth passe man life beyng left voyde help god ship destitute pylot tossed fro outragious wyndes waues sea self cannot withstandhow god doth behaue self elect doth easily driue self vpon rocke damnation rendes peeces hauing none guyde self estate electe sorte god hath chosen doth yeald ouer owne conduct stirreth forward force hys secret good doth drawe vnto hym self doth draw yt beyng called must needes obay moreouer doth call hee doth forwith iustifie yt called doth iustifie free bountifull mercy doth yt length glorifie hath iustified wh action saluation god grace doth accomplish euery part thereof nothing left man glory vpon much paraduenture yt may ouerthrow itthe damnation wicked ought imputed god wherupo apostle aptly sayth neither willeth runneth god taketh mercy contrary part meane shipwrack damnation man wayward peruersnes beyng left vnto self doth therin throughly play partes yt nothing wherewt may iustly accuse god neyther man condemned hys default doth purchase damnation damnation thing offer themselues meane tyme consideredin damnacion wicked two thinges cosidered onely suffereth hath deserued punished hath deserued suffereth righteouslye hee suffereth one whereof man offence declared god iustice discernable first whereof deuines call euill offence thother euill punishment paule calleth reward sinne therefore whereas man doth commit euillmalum culpae malum poenae punished euill let hym thank hymself whereas righteously punished herein let murmure god though author euill righteously done vnorderly done although punishment seeme euill suffereth yt would suffer yet author punishment bicause ought haue done moreouer neyther thing forthwith euill sight god appeareth euill man iudgement thinges therefore wayed circumstance ende euen cloudy ouerspreading darckened night doth diminish part ye cleare day light rather beautifie lightsome clearenes bright sunneshine euen persequutors church dash sometyme rock drownedhow damnation perish thorow owne default tourneth good sight god aug enchi cap aug enchi cap although euil perish properly nature yet dash rock perish respecte god ordinaunce respect end wherevnto thinges directed euill sight god tourneth good rather setting forth beautifiing hys glory augustine vnfitly good sayth hee euills neyther inconuenience euills may happen without god yet performed contrary say agaynst rule ordinaunce hymselfe doth allow commaund conclude albeit saluation elect destruction reprobate doe proceede one originall namelyhow efficient cause saluation damnation differre secret counsell almighty god yet decree neuerthelesse doth expresse selfe one maner tymes haue regarde maner operatio cause saluation saued wholy shutte vppe closett god mercy god onely alone whole onely efficient cause therof ca meanes ascribed ye damnation reprobate albeit escape knowledge secrete purpose god bycause one thyng neuer small value done without yet seeke true efficient cause therof whereunto may properly imputed sinne deuill father sinne much god doth compell man committe wickednesse rather yeldeth ouer forsaketh owne lustes hereupon doth consequetly follow first seedes originall corruptio beyng destitute grace god suckyng vppe deadly poyson ragyng lust contagious motion owne naturall willthe efficient cause cleane contrary god become meanes cause procurour owne destruction cause deficient wherof vouched augustine onely godthe deficiet cause aug lib de ciuit dei cap cause efficient co sisteth el man onely premiss considered duely examined returne question proposed whether god bare decree create creature destructionquestion made vessel wrath whether graunt promise god vniuersall whether may imagine god haue saued come knowledge truth doe aunswereanswere god promise without controuersie generall extended generally mankynde yet prouiso whosoeuer beleue shall beleue sonne god dought doth agreably condiscende promise tymes eche respect readyly bentthe promise god generall promise inclinable fauourable towardes saluation ingenerall yt vnderstad prouiso witte engraffed christ iesu fayth agayne vnder name vniuersall subiect speake augustine euery particuler generality generality euery particuler comprehededsinguli generum el haue true fayth neither promise made vnto allgunera singulorum beleue sonne god saue cast rather end creation godwardbut concerning creation end therof besought doe aunswere god create man vnto righteousnesse created good workes accordyng testimonie paule walke man abusing freedome owne contrary god witte contrary rule righteousnesse fallyng quite away righteousnesse vnrighteousnesse length vnrighteousnesse throwe selfe headlong downe vnrecouerable destructio shall say yt thyngs chaunced wtout god knowledge agaynst el wt wil regardyng ye one must graunt necessitie say agaynst shall ouerthrow omnipotecie without knowledge shall empayre excellency wisedome say regardeth beseeche difference wilbe betwixt filthy pigge epicure remaineth boldly pronouce yt work atchieued god willyng foreknowyng withall permittyng done beyng agreed vpon remaineth enquired whether sufferauce god idle fruitelesse effectuall assigne vnto god idle fruitlesse foreknowledge epicure altogether forbidde scripture graunt accoplished effectuall determinate decree god withall man able withstand shall conclude reprobate altogether excusable bycause fault reprobation resteth wholy god saying deede thus spoken might seeme somewhat paraduenture god made man perfect whe created first enioyned law rule righteousnesse strengthened wt sound freedome adding thereunto certeine seuere caution wholesome counsell fatherly forewarnyng daunger would ensue first father adam fell ouerwhelmed together within selfe downefall wise neither able shake shoulder law iustice wherewith yoaked accomplish perfection therof freedome neuer mightie therfore doth offende hath cause whereof hee ought quarell godthe prouidece god ought accused destruction reprobate hath matter contagion enough enough quarell agaynst owne lustes adam deuill whereupon conclude length thynges apperteine destruction mankynde neither escape knowledge counsell god yet prouidence god neuerthelesse voyde altogether blame reproche osorianes deny ought attributed predestination god decreehow god sufferaunce dealeth men action life hys sufferaunce onely certes doughted god doth permit suffer thinges hath decreed winne nothing thys distinction seeing fall back quauemire meanes cleare themselues first whereas god vseth sufferaunce question doth wittingly warily furthermore whereas comprehended thinges hys vnsearcheable wysedome foresaw euentes thereof must needes confesse able hys omnipotent power forbid soeuer willing done bene good pleasure haue done question would regarded swinish blockishnes epicure ought neyther admitted christian cogitation neyther retchlesnes agree gracious mercifulnes god god sufficiently able shall let hym doth lack meanes helpe thinke heathnish infidelity man say seeing fall adam might haue bene stayed onely becke god countenaunce pleasure yet least would make stay welspring sinne adamwhether god sufferaunce hys beare rule man lyfe might haue raunged infection posteritie finally doth dayly geue great scope sathan may easily restrayne premiss considered remayneth necessity yeld ye thinges foreknew would come passe restrayning razed booke election therefore become vessel wrath forsake mercye doe therfore throw away mercy offred vnto bycause beyng excluded grace electio foreappoynted ye uessels wrath castawayes osor might consider briefly opinion herein agreeyng osorius altogether speaches pighius god doth offer selfe sayth equall indifferent father person ouerspreadeth generally one selfe gladsome beames mercy clemency without differencepighius touchyng equalitie god grace towardes pighius similitude taken epistle hebrues lenitie become tractable hereby made indurate discrepaunce proceedeth fro corruption vnequallitie distribution lenitie mercy god proofe whereof takyng similitude epistle hebrues iiij chap euery land watered like bountyfulnesse heauenly dew doth yeld lyke fruite husbandman one land yeldeth forth corne thornes bramble ye one wherof blessed god ye accursed euen lesse ioyously doth mercy god shyne indifferently generall equall largesse bountie towardes vniuersally beyng set wyde open alike doth deny selfe none refuse selues turne amedemet life mercy others abuse mercy outragious licentiousnes sumyng agayne fetchyng similitude fro heate sunne whereas sunne yeldeth one selfe heate doe see earth made stiffe hard ye waxe softened made plyable hereupo pighius gathereth soeuer difference betwixt good reprobate wholy issue ye corruption men god reason pighius osor co fetedbut expositours haue sufficiently aunswered slipper deuise assertion pighius mate osorius god mercy powred alike men vtterly false absurde affirme god maketh choyse dispensation grace great difference betwixt godly vngodly deede great difference betwixt good bad deny doe ascribe principall motion efficient cause hereof man onely god onely altogether deceaued concernyng common nature mawhether god man good euill differre truly may certeintie determine equabilitie condition mankynd reteine one semblable condition qualitie free choyse much beyng created one lumpe alike poysoned alike one kynde infectio men altogether vnable selues doe thyng auayleable saluation much imbecillitie doth infect makynde alike generall pestilence appeareth therfore euidently difference standeth much vpon determination least stand vppon yet doth proceede first man callyng god whiche offereth selfe alike euery one one maner ingenerall doth diuersly drawe one sort sayd scripture haue set downe double pighius coyne hereof god word take roote none good auayleth sentence establish doctrine freewill question whether onely good receaue word eternall lyfe effectually pointe must touched whence men receaue habilitie made good nymblenesse owne callyng god therfore parable serueth purpose case beyng applied none end signifie dispensation disposition god holy word maner may aptly compared seede wh though husbandman sow vpon euery ground indifferetly yet yealdeth forth fruite fewe yea also good groundes hauing rent sunder slender trifling cob webbes aduersaries notwithstanding neuer deale persones almighty mercifull god doth nothing respectes consonaunt reason cruelty vnrighteousnes finally one thing replenished goodnes aduersaries obiections mett withallalbeit mowsy drossy chaffe long sithence blowne abroad ye eye augustine pelagianes hath bene sufficiently fanned away hys booke entituled de articulis falso impositis yet following augustine herein neede somewhat please osorius withall least exclayme agayne argumentes throughly resolued auswere wordes thys wyse cannot denyed chose many called yet goodnes god ioate impeached respect cruelty encreased first choose especiall work goodnes pleased hym proclayme generall calling participacion hys gospell men vniuersally also poynt great clemency yt called come proceeded cruelty god yet fault thereof layd hys charge vnto men disobedience sayd man fault say seeing willes god predestination withstandeth cannot able come deede men obstacle vnto come doth man affirme hereof springeth faulte yt manthat chosen doe come man god predestination seuerally work agayne saye god eternall predestination preiudice fall away surely man deny likewise predestination god estoppell must seene powringe new poyson needeth forsaking olde thus therefore man obstackle alone predestination also obstackle without man man worketh god predestination worketh ech one hys owne kynde seuerall maner operacion difference whereof osorius seeme bussardly blinde refuse open vnto hym first god predestination deede hath operation according infallible hys free decree much thinges themselues inespeciall wils men expresseth kynde operation felfe meane tyme forced none doth alwayes goe action man doth guyde gouerne will whiche direction conduct man doth atted vpon withall worketh also thing subiect vnto certaine maner owne doth moue selfe freely say doth earnest affection bed selfe willingly owne accord voluntary inclination thinges embraceth despiseth doth neyther choose thing willeth refuseth thing selfe willeth finally attempteth nothing willingly say owne accord willing minde yet altogether freely osorius surmiseth whiche deede cause osorius hys error herein drowneth hys iudgement question often heareth mencion made doth vse certaine free choyse consenting dissenting dreameth subiect direction none libertie endued full absolute power selfe whiche power greekes call nonlatin alphabet nonlatin alphabet eschew ye thinges willethselfe power libertie liue thinges willeth doth nothing necessitie might otherwise according owne pleasure agayne man make neuer little motion purpose predestination doth interprett thereof though nothing left man able conceaue reason deliberate iudgement make choyse voluntary motion enforced thinges certeine externall coaction vnauoydeable fatall necessitie wh vtterly false speake directly ye dotage osorius despoyle libertye banysh worlde raze writinges doe magnifie like idoll root nature make subiect god deny free certayne maner declare sort free free made free derogate though attemptingaug contra epist pela lib cap relenting feeling sense neyther esteeme great price though acchieued thing strength without speciall conduct god predestination moreouer doe neyther establishe thys predestination working men willes though enforced agaynst willes violently thinges would notaug de predest sancti cap cannot chose yea willingly alwayes freely soeuer doth thing willeth el whether wel otherwise well well able selfe boroweth abilitie thereunto el yet euill hath enough selfe yea without helpe doth selfe doth self bring passe freely albeit altogether freely yet freedome alwayes captiuate wt miserable thraldome bondage beyng left destitute heauely assistance subiect seruile naturall lustmans neuer free alwaies coupled necessitie ouerwhelmed wt backward affectios yt doth euill ca better self though would self able thing yt doth otherwise necessitie whereby appeareth euidently kynde freedome man enioyeth whether consent good thyngs neyther thing selfe beyng assisted agayne dissent cannot otherwise dissent necessity beyng left ouer owne strengththe stregth orignall sinne deadly infectio hath poysoned rootes whole ofspring nature neyther able good thing holpen grace much think good thought shall nothing left say power man freedome yes truely osorius spoyle man naked nothing heauenly thinges opinion tendeth rather effect god predestination appoynt certeinty humayne acccions man possesse full absolute freedome say meanes subiect scope geue god election performe nothing freely directed alwayes free conduct forren guyder whole force hereof calleth called rather according paules doctrine whole exployt thinges gouerned hym calleth onely shall become man freedome cut two asunder yealde part thereof part predestination ascribing man power abilitye little nothing god predestination instruct v distinctly much ech doth performe withall wherein diuersitie difference consisteth distinguishe duely orderly according naturall proper distinction doctrine ye teach v god predestination must needes appeare order tyme firstgods predestination elder tyme power surmonnting ma elder power alwayes mighty farre surmounting force man beyng graunted follow length man choyse bee proued length none otherwise free yt must alwaies bondage eyther god grace beyng holpen good owne lust beyng cast wickednes seemeth heare secrett whispering pelagius brood amongst chiefly osorius stought champion crew bark agaynst thys consent consent say power grace god otherwise effectuall embrace hys ayde assistaunce offered vnto vsthe obiections aduersaries wherevpon conclude length owne power eyther enterteine grace god forsake consequent deny beyng made without forme artthe aunswere also voyde ground truth concerning assenting dissenting doe confesse motiones numbred amongest residue naturall power man consider bare naked powersaug ad bonifacium lib cap de lib arb cap without obiectes assent rightly thinges whiche appertayne vnto fayth god calling augustine doth aunswere discretly vnto altogether vnable selues abilitie hereunto proceadeth wholy hym doth first bring passe vnwilling may made willing doth draw obstinate obedience creating new hart within make hys owne willing voluntary seruiceable seruauntes moreouer say grace none otherwise effectuall vnlesse doe put helping handes also together grace none holpen endeuour therunto owne accord true also reason god doth worke man anye forraygne constraynt onely vsually accustometh brute beastes stoanes man voluntary inclination motion whence voluntary motion thinges appertayning god inespecially doth arise augustine teach youaug de correp grat cap epist ad victalem doth deny grace god doth finde good v doth make will good agayne testifieth man able resort grace ayde whose stepps lord doth guyde thereunto much boldly pronounceth beginning grace euen feele want grace therefore followeth vpon proposition thus graunted whersoeuer god effectuall grace iswherein effectuall grace doth consiste defect contrary part wheresoeuer appeareth defect god grace vneffectuall comprehended ij operation namely eternall calling inward drawing receptacle grace within v deede selues grace god refusall grace v withall commeth selues yet neuerthelesse owne selues reiected god grace cannot reiect grace able selues otherwise though would neuer fayne kinde freedome shall sayd enioy kinde seruile thraldome bee miserable wretched good syr deny god accordyng inestimable goodnesse fatherly nature doth reiect tyme mercy indifferently equally layed open ingenerall hereof hath bene sufficiently discoursed yet adde one saying god grace reiect person must necessitie confesse doth make choyse like wise generally indifferently chosen respect surely man cast away agayne reiection place election choyse sayd chuse accept euery one like best choyse reiected choyse electio properly acceptaunce allowaunce rather neither tearmed choyse men grecias call nonlatin alphabet proper maner speakyng except multitude remnaunt god say hath left man destitute grace euery able selfe couerted aud embrace grace aug de gra libe arbit cap conuerted ca better vnloase knot augustine gospell preached beleue father shall say sayth bycause co uerted shall answere purpose spoken conuertyng v lord thou shalt quicken v agayne god hostes conuerte thou v c therfore augustine speaketh vnfitly place god doth helpe conuerted forsaketh forsaken conuerted god selfe helpeth c none conuerted vnto god onely selfe helpeth hereby appeareth playnly turne selues away god therfore turne away bycause turne vnto yt therfore turn rather bycause god forsaketh say bycause lord hostes conuertyng doth quicke may haue conuerted albeit deny meane while vnwillyngnesse doth proceede men selues owne freewill yet vnwillyngnesse notwithstandyng free selfe forsaken otherwise vnwillyng necessitie neither defect god effectuall grace present man good augustine witnesseth good aug contra epist pela lib cap man euill owne voluntary forsaken god neuerthelesse otherwise euill doth god forsake say doth god helpe hath created let moue counterquestion pray euen wordes aske god without knocke vnbeleuyng seeke dwell sinne repent say seyng haue freewill say admit whse default god default god create perfect first endued freedome man fault let accuse selues god ye vrge agayne doth comunicate grace denyeth others indifferently mercyfull towardes inclinable vniuersally begynnyng god created man create also nature man fully furnished integritie freedome afterwardes state innocency freedome lost also whole umpe defiled withall god might withall haue forsaken ingenerall neuerthelesse mercy doth would rather election chuse abhominable corruptio forsakyng altogether meane tyme onely denieth helpe vnto vnto boude geue assistauce though indifferently mercyfull towardes yet iniurious none heare selfe speaketh thine eye therefore wicked lawfull myne pleaseth least heare apostle man art thou contendest agaynst god whereas god doth owe thee nothyng doest thou therefore snarle bycause doyng wrong man doth enlarge richesse mercy towardes pleaseth foreward crawleth osorius inuectiueosori pag much mynde meanyng paule outragious furie madd man intoxicate withall would endeuour persuade costruction paules testimony would ouerthrow state humaine societie withall make god guiltie vnrighteousnesse sithece ye infallible meanyng paule haue heretofore confirmed ye iudgemet luther bucer caluine testimony holy scripture chiefly also osorius selfe neuer sober sounde witted neuer able confute end rendeth foolish childish exclamation proceedyng old grayheaded man whereunto serue tragicall outcryesthe complaynt osorius agaynst luther touchyng subuersion ciuill societie ruler roste ruffleth vppe trifle thundring mo struous outragies franticke exclamation doth ouerthrow sayth state men kynde estate men legth luther doth ouerthrow meane state comon weale ciuill societie herein truly many seuerall degree estate aswell office persouages prince duke knightes ye noble order citizes diuers seuerall magistrate hygh low vnder meane inferiour subiectes eue rascall rable multitude also seuerall distinction age artes handycraftes manitary occupation youg old riche poore albeit nober innumerable kynde qualitie distinct neuertheles co federate knitte together certeine generall vnitie mutuall coformitie allyed leaque certeine ciuill pollicie institutio maners beautified mutuall amitie vnited linked together god one participation religion orderly gouerned force lawes exercize mutuall traffique togethers restreined fro licenciousnes lyfe one maner generall correctio liue full perfectio vertue accordyng ye prescript rule ye lawes yet much lesse offende feare iustice iudgement syr generall regiment state thyngs persones one citie one villadge family euer made one myte ye worse luther doctrine either respect due obediece ciuill magistrate breache domesticall tranquillitie dutyfull allegiaunce prince ciuill societie tyrannicall state pope somewhat troubled lutherone onely disorderous order people hath entruded selfe vpon state humaine societie vsurpyng certeyne princely superioritie know thy meanes crept first sure neuer established god nature ne yet necessary institution pressing pearche partly fraude partly oppression chiefly ambitious arrogaunoy owne proude prelacy vndertake necessary profitable function weale publique ioyne administration office others behoofe common weale hale gouernementes vnder iurisdiction make subiect estate potentate empire vnder stately superioritie erectyng certeine new founde luciferlike monarch vpon earth romishe tyrannicall papisticall dominion meane complayne vpon incredible subtiltie craft secrete slye vnderminynges vnder commendable title church hath litle litle enhaunced selfe wonderfull loftynesse estate degree beyng enforced yeld neckes yoake must maugre beardes onely submit heades shoulder oppression tyranny also lyke miserable bondslaues must reuerence humilitie prostrate selues kysse feete imperiall throne enthronized chief aboue others triumphyng ouer estate mighty potentate monarch byshop rome next vnto principall stayes proude pillers ierarchythe pope aduaunce selues cormoraunt cardinallesthe cardinalls follow order roystyng route mytred prelatesmytred byshoppes scarlet crew rochettes shauelynges speake good vertuous byshops true minister christ hang onely vpon becke ye bysh rome last olly chapios whole droues monckesdroues monckes frier frier come tumblyng heapes together rable rascal people lazy lewde surroundyng whole world vnmeasurable warmes issue broode earth earth selfe scarse able foster vppe owne generation therefore meanyng concerne ouerthrow sorte people pointe agree osorius luther trauayled deede earnestly herein atchieued much needefull christian common wealth albeit could vtterly raze rakyng regiment romishe roysters inordinately raysing selues onely aboue empire regimentes earth also beyond whatsoeuer called god yet pretely shake pluckt vysours apish stager discouered fraude made ye world acquaynted subtill sleyghtes lyeng doctrine confuted manifest force truth finally albeit openyng light gospell could vtterly ende peeces shryne beast many hudred yeares suppressed drowned darkenes knowledge god word yet industry labour vnprofitably employed defacyng therof would god bene able onely haue defaced power outrage ye see also haue plucked vppe rootes brought memory therof vtter confusion vanished cleane ye myndes memoryes men nation euer doyng truly could haue done exployte acceptable god profitable state christianitie certes many thousandes men wome bene wonderfully preserued thereby barbarous vnspeakeable cruelty consumyng gulfe haue bene miserably swallowed vppe deuoured within yeares englad fraunce spayne scotland flaunders germany christian nation yet vnsatiable cormoraut sufficietly englutted fully gorged christia goare yet thisthe wolfe doth accuse lambe troublyng water poore seely luther accused durst boldly presume vnlade cure christia conscience cancred fistula poysoned impostume raunging carbuncle bycause dare vndertake patronadge defence truth agaynst manifest heresy palpable errours lesse layed charge hygh treason though practized vtter ouerthrowe onely christian societie state whole world also may wolfe wt good reason condenme seely lambe troublyng water let isaack also accused bycause restored philistine welles pure cleansed filthegene baggage whiche selues maliciously dammed vppe let phisition likewise endi ed murder ministring wholesome potion patient agaynst pestilence phrensie hath preserued lyfe furthermore let lawfull osorius selfe barke agaynst shynyng sunne bycause reneweth gladsome countenaunce pleasaunt dawnyng driuyng away dazelyng darkenes vgly night finally let quarrell wt christ himselfe sacred spiritthe seat beast apocali onely himselfe rayse vp luther purpose also playne foretelling many yeares prophesie ye darcknes decay ouerthrow ye self seeapoc poured hys vyall sayth vpon seate beast hys kingdome couered darckenes gnawe tongue sorrow c prophesie asmuch probable allusion applyed eyther iewes turckes let romish see bethinke selfe well kynde kingdome length foreshewed ye word holy ghost end wordes saint paule tend likewise declareth maner reuealyng sonne perdition come passe thessa proper phrase speeche nothyng sayd reuealed lye close hidden couert therfore necessitie deuine spirite christ must discoueryng couert enemy could otherwise espyed pollicy witte man certes could yt antichrist whatsoeuer must lurke shadow selfe wonderfull couertly craftely much people deceaued could reuealed detected world person sonne perdition doe present trouble braynes surely part know one person el neither application signes note circumstaunces playne demostrations wherewith paule doth painte vnto v gesse vpon counterfaite may resemble proportion besides one prelate onely lustely vauteth selfe temple god therefore thunderboltes great flash osori lightning touching ouerthrowe state christianitie touch luther lying cauillation amasias priest bethell concerne prophet amos seditious person accused hym presence ieroboam king behold sayth amos hath conspired agaynst thee euen middes house israell amos euen like lieger de mayne doth osorius vtter finely expressing vnto v wonderfull singuler sleightes papisticall subtelties catholick counterfaytes seeme long sithence haue sucked crafty wyles practizes olde comicall phormio chiefly detected crafty conueyaunce steppe forth lyke call fellowes first become accuser others supposing shall hereby acquite theselues cleare suspicion crime ca first accuse others fault whereof ought themselues impeached myne opinion selfe like vnto seemeth haue happened luther wherewith read ye wicked achab charge elia ye prophet eue like deceitfull maner3 kyngs saying thou art quoth doest trouble israell much vnlike example nero whereof history make mention hauyng himselfe sett roome fire playing singing vpon hys harpe destruction thereof homer verse while flame afterwardes lay burning thereof christian charge thend might procure though altogether innocent maligned hated persequuted people euen lyke maner osorius whenas ye papistes generatio holy father haue long sithence tourned state whole worlde conditios decree ciuill societie quite vpsidowne according owne lust pleasure yea dayly moyle turmoyle haue left nothing sound peacible order throughout whole earth continuyng still maner outrage persequutyng continually fire sword cursings bulles execrable inquisition horrible punishmentes scourge tormentes maner horrible torture triuphyng vpon ransack christian peace tranquillitie yet yee papistes neuerthelesse rayle rudely vpon luther thou art hee doest trouble israell song chaunted rather euen eares holy father pope troiane horse whose belly hath issued callamitie mischief dauus disturbeth thynges babilonicall strumpet thai bruer misery become see hereafter know hitherto surely hath behaued self may worthely called plague cancker europe may easily made manifest many sundry testimonyes although speake thereof nothing yet owne doings proceeding faythfully described historiographer deepely imprinted present view world sufficiently bewray dealingesit declared exa ples many mischiefes romishe see hath ay sed great manifolde turmoyles chaunged estate sundry vproares people schismes slaughter christias horrible disturbauces kinges kingdomes sundry alteration romayne empire chaunges translation east first west euidently declare whenas pope rome renouncing othe wherwith romaynes italianes hadd obliged selues emperour greecethe translation empire send charles martellus fraunce italie crowned hym emperour contrary auncient order election afterwardes frenchman would yealde outragious ambition practised procuring preeminence otto beyng emperoures neither amitye pope towardes germayne empire long continuance whose onely speciall practise onely bishop emperours also shoulde runne roome ye inuestiture confirmation prouided alwayes might meanes lawfull entermeddle thing pope iurisdictiothe confirming bishop taken away emperours germaynes could made plyable hereunto vpo sodeine men reuerecing dignity maiestly empire example otto auncestours willing yeald thabacing lawfull authoritie prerogatiue imperiall hereupon began incredible sturres vproares kindledthe warres hery fredericke donick bauie frederick austriche men doe ioue peace yea mainteyne peace amongest selues yet good men onely good syr haue peace alone glorius acceptable thyng soeuer peace accoumpted owne nature yea though chiefly embraced hadd greatest price good men yet peace alwayes altogether conuersaunt amongest good men onelypeace common thing good wicked entoyeng peace alone doth make men good certeyne peace amongest wicked yea pirate theeues robber haue certeine peace agreement willes neither doughted false catholiques like heretiques haue seuerall conuenticles peacyble bandes concorde consent eue false apostle false prophetes luther lutheranes luther sayth doth rende sunder peace tranquillitie church writynges preachynges doth teare peeces christes coate without seame rayseth tumultes vprores doth entagle whole christedome dissentions variety opinion luther accused portugall tertullus without reason osorius pray sooth bycause doth discouer liuely wellspringes sounde doctrine bycause doth enstruct men co ceaue wholesome souereigne grace god sonne declareth vnto true rule righteousnes true peace christ iesu bycause allureth men onely mercy god excludyng man merites vayne confidence freewill bycause bleare eyed dulnes could endure sharpenes light hence flush fluddes complaint hence rush tragicall scoldinges exclamation wherewith rhetoricall becons haue conceaued greeuous flame ragyng wise mostruous wickednesse horrible maddnesse intollerable presumption feuer doth make thee frantike haddon fury doe possesse thee luther paynes haynousnesse doe pursue thee like pleasurable ornamentes whotte eloquence scarse man read without laughyngiuuenal endure heare common outlawes complainyng sedition truly suppose osorius wordes euen maner outrage surely much vnlike herode whole nation pharisee crye whenas fame christes byrth bruted abroad saydmath herode king exceedingly troubled ierusulem also therfore accordyng logicke rhetoricke osorius let v condemne christ selfe seditious fellow bycause vnlesse child bene borne sonne bene geuen vnto v trouble neuer arisen amongest iewes shall say yt christ afterwardes beyng well growe yeares declare playne open wordes came send peace earth sword diuision fire desired one thyng earnestly fire kindeled wherfore much feared least breach peace concorde breede offence let portingall aduise selfe well whether christ shalbe accused farre forth luther bycause gospell sayd sturre vppe father agaynst sonne daughter agaynst mother stepmother agaynst daughter inlawe daughter lawe agaynst stepmother two agaynst three three ogaynst two whether luther ought acquited christ much accusation duely impeached one cryme may also aswell charged vpon christ peace catholickes disturbed dayes luther also happened pharisee old tyme meanes christ apostle yea pharisee onely also sturryng vppe natios earth vproare wherein yet fault layed vpon christ himselfe prince peace meanes vnlike selfe lyke maner lyke consideration luther doctrine deemed suppose sturre soeuer papisticall generation keepe dayes yet surely peace hindered luther yet ought accused ministred wholesome playster wound fault imputed rather whose canker vncurable could endure operation medicine therefore touchyng crime sedition troublesome disturbaunce peace layed vnto luther charge therein accusation wrongfully mistourned luther iniuriously dealt withall luther hath turned peace churche vpsidowne worldlynges osorius corrupt sense define peace churche vndoughted truth speakewhere church vnity fayth vnity church alwayes whiche wee also confesse together witte church christ one peacible delighteth nothing peace let osorius geue v peace vnder vysor whereof lurketh conspiracie agaynst lord let geue church wherein fostred enemy traitoures true church speake recken enemy ye church resiaunte within border territory pontificall ierarchye neyther luther vehement writing bent agaynst nay rather luther carpeth man person priuately inuadeth man possession seeketh losse man life onely agaynst wicked assertiones determination decree pestilent patched doctrineluther dyd inueigh agaynst priuate persones name gaynst pestiferous sectes agaynst established erroneous falshoods abhominations heresyes agaynst wicked worshipping idol breadworship stock worshippe pestiferous superstitious absurdity wherewith ye force efficacy ye euagelicall fayth well neere ouerwhelmed without manifest perill losse many thousandes christian souldiers luther vndertaking necessary patronage truth endeuoured hys skill force end would hurt man might enduce others cleare light sweete ioyce vnderstanding whiche himselfe sucked pleasaunt source holy scripture darcknes vanish cleane away view light herode withall hys ierusale troubled ye gentile frett fume people imagine vayne thinges monastery fall altogether idol shiuer peeces issue sproughts religiones neuer planted god plucked vp bottome rootes fault luther greuousnes malady rather meanes eudure launcing soare botch plague could rather handled woulde theselues burst vanish away vapour smoke landes possession long time englutted gorbelly mouncksthe ouerthrow monastery imputed luther became pray spoylers tourned better v first iniury thys impute vnto luther prince magistrate seuerall dominiones dyd establish lawfully might morcouer luther meruell byrdes pluck fethers againe gaue though let man better aduised might reuoke employ better purpose may seeme best ye thing wh foolishly wickedly lauish hereof enough long sithence throughly weryed spending much breath losse much tyme contending trifling brabler accustoming nothyng el almost lying slaundering yet amonges many notable lye heaping together many slaunders vpo slaunders hath hitherto iustified one hys lye beare euen bare resemblaunce truth agayne commeth hand shamelesse abhominable lye conning craftesman proceedeth much contendeth hymselfe yea exceedeth hymself slaunderingosorius shameles slaunder vpluther thys forsooth luther sayth doth accuse god vnrighteous god good word pray good lord place luth speaches writinges dyd euer finde worde sillable wherein hee layed cryme vnrighteousnes vpon god man may gather lesse hys assertion meruell expositor thereof selfe thing el doth venimous spyder suck sweete honnysuckles pleasaunt rose poyson go let v heare length notable collection luther doth affirme thinges doe proce de god eternall predestinatio aswell whe beyng vessells wrath damned theyr owne default also vessells mercye without desert aduaunced glory thys phrase speeche beyng founded first luther long hys dayes preached paule confirmed full consent whole scripture osorius knittyng plattyng together many absurdity false ill fauouredly placed meanes wrong misconceauing said phrase speeche come last conclude thys wyse god necessitie must accompted vnrighteousosori pag one doth vniustly punishe poore wretched miserable men euill deedes owne accord whereunto forced eternall coaction conclusio luther framed osori hymself think man aliue besides osorius euer able forge madde conclusion voide desire friuolous cauilling slaundering luther cleare reproch condemne god vnrighteous god would neuer haue patched vp paper friuolous libel vnsauory argumetes bewraying therein notorious ignoraunce matter may appeare playnly let v display vnfold whole captious argumentation hath framed entangle luther withall standing armes agaynst certeine brood ill fauoured coupled proposition sorte crawleth forth thys slipper deuise parte determined sure established decree predestinationosor creepyng sophisme shall become euery thing hath decreed soeuer hath decreed shall come passe necessary thing must boud tyed euerlasting necessitie thinges brought passe absolute necessitie must god accompted onely author workes thinges whether good badde thinges good euill ordered guyding god author thereof remayneth nothing man freewill put execution graunted followeth hereupon men rushed headlong mischiefes co mit wickednes owne accord tooles instrumentes wickednesse plyed thereunto others hand enforced merueilous coaction proposition thus argued luther thereensueth vpon beinglayed together necessary conclusionconclusio god doth deale vniustly punish man hymselfe willeth determineth done aunswere nature sorites explaned generum specierumthe logitians haue described fourme sorites doth deny kinde arguyng substaunce vnlesse part true property difference accord aunswere eche necessary coupling together kyndes formes proper effectes applied proper cause one much obserued heape wordes sentence wherein might lawfully vtter follishe skill creeping forward sorte follish childish degree proposition would hard conclude gramtyng freedome man predestistation prouident god heauen proued augustine concluded vpon cicero first doe affirme god chief principall cause thyngs graunt thing subiect erre except augustine erre discoursing vpon godaugust de trinitat lib god sayth first soueraigne cause formes motion nothing done issueth fromout secrett intelligible closett highest emperour according vnspeakeable iustice doth omnipotent wisedome god worke pleaseth hym mightely stretcheth hys power one ende worlde ordereth thinges sweetely thus much augustine necessitie coaction yet cause doth therefore enduce necessitie coactione osori doth imagine freedome remayne man nothing hys accord deserue nothing worthy punishment serue steede instrument enforced fatall coaction gouerned others power selfe bring nothyng passe wherefore ought punished asmuch luther assertion doth maintayne none become horrible accusation wherein luther sayd accuse god vnrighteousnesse agreable iustice sayth onely instrumentes wickednesseosori pag punished according luther doctrine men wickedly seeme nothing el instrumentes wickednes finde doctour haue euer besides osorius spake wise either waking sleeping sometime god prouidence doth vse seruice man punish euill doer euen god auenge hym vpon sinnes owne people babilonianes agayne take vengeaunce assirianes cirus duke persia raysed vppe god vse also malice iewes finish worke redemption vnlesse natione conspired agaynst sonne god bene redeemed deuill himselfe rodde correction hand god instrument vengeaunce ordayned punishe outragies euill doer yet doth therefore follow deuils wicked persones called instrumentes god wrath nothing el instrumentes though forced onely themselues nothing though doyng nothing themselues deserued wrath neyther imagine like vnto stoanes haue sayd though left vnto abilitie actionno sinneth without god contrary god euen mynde man vnlesse ayded selfe nothing sinne doth man sinne tyme hys owne voluntary motione sinne albeit doth commit without god yet doth commit contrary commaundement god acquired hys fault murtherer killeth men albeit seeme certeine maner exe uute god yet doth deede onely beyng minde simply serue hys god rather follow rage malice therfore neyther excusable beyng faulty god accused secrete counsell shall therefore say sinnedin death christ sauiour father consent co sent bycause worke willed murtherers dyd neither cosent absent sene ed fro crucifie sonne god ne yet ordinaunce yet generally read lykewise holy scripture necessary offence shall come necessary heresy c doughted necessitie doth issue fro ordinaunce god offence chaunce altogether besides ordinaunce god doe chaunce men will enclined hardened wickednes operation god god hath iust cause aswell god doth thinges make excellency hys power maiesty appeare glorious bee wondered also hee doth harden harte person thend thys cause ye reade holy scripture men seduced god harte hardened dought nothing haue committed offence enough ought worthely suffer c man nature selfe valiaunt defend selfe sufficiently agaynst stormes assaultes sinne wherefore doth suffer himselfe bee caryed away willingly wittingly right way doth preuent occasion temptation hee ought doth practize courage owne reason inuiteth vnto cannot euen beginning throwing ouer boorde helme god gouernement take vpon hym pylote hys owne course presume wise without god arrogant hauty lofty courage geue attempt vpon tree lyfe graspe fruit thereof contented hys owne simplicitie chose rather raunge field himselfe bridle teeth abide managing lord able gouern selfe without god assistaunce doth worthely breake hys neck fall ouer rock cannot guyde hys owne wayes eue cause worthely forsaken spoyled self cast god beyng hys ryder fro hys back whereupon good consequent must graunted necessitie eyther god cause euill yet cause nothing whiche standeth equitie iustice likewise man nothing whereof may worthely condemne hym selfe page duplicate page duplicate obiection aduersaries agaynst lutheransthe god doth worke together man sinne according lutheranes standeth therfore good reason imputed one imputed circumstaunces respect like consequent would goodaunswere circumstance beyng altered state conclusion altered also action man life gouerned disposition secret prouidence god true man also doth endeuour withall together therefore operation working partes god worketh man worketh one matter bicause god doth order thing farre meanes respecting ende men doe herein redowndeth vnto hym highest commendation power iustice aud bounty men worthely blamed beyng cause harmes ioseph solde hys brother iudas betrayed lord absalon defiled hys father concubine pharao witheld people israell semei rayled vpon dauid antiochus waxed wrothe agaynst iewes long sithence whenas antichrist euen gryndeth hys teeth agaynst seely flock christ paule breathed threatninges slaughter man deny haynous horrible factes notwithstanding one wanted singuler counsell god hys especiall prouidence whereupon could possible otherwise thinges determined come passe ende neyther doth enter man thought thing god doth shoulde neither doth man purpose thinge foreseene foreordained god shall therefore accuse god author wickednesse vngodly thinges chaunce necessitie god hath purposed shall come passe meanes altered seemeth osori conclude hys argument argue agaynst hym wise two reason first preordinaunce god whereof speake bryng necessitie externall coaction vppon men osorius doth speake man could sinne voluntaryly copelled thereunto god might seeme altogether perhaps purpose impute fault thereof god hath euer bene horribly wicked time performing treacherous deuises say constrayned agaynst hys commit facte would haue done neyther led thereunto motion selfe blynded hys owne affection moreouer although god doth work together man willaug de grat lib arb cap augustine liked rather speake whether god worke harte men apply willes whervnto pleaseth hym eyther godlines hys good mercy sake wickednes vyce according owne deseruinges whether man afflicted crosse persequution yet doth god bring passe according iust iudgement sometimes open manifest alwayes righteous sitteth iustice punish offender tame suppresse outragious pryde rebellious nature forasmuch workes god directed chiefly one ende whence may man take large occasion magnifie extoll iustice god hys owne work therefore though wee confesse one selfe work wrought god man yet selfe worke god worketh way ende namely putting vre worke hys iustice men workes pryde luste wrath couetousnes hereupon commeth passe sinne worthely imputed vnto god remayning alwayes righteous good notwithstanding rule holden alwayes vnshaken work god wrought best fall first parent adam hardening pharaoes hart treaso iudas persequutio paule tended good purpose perseueraunce noah fayth humblenes dauid peter denyall hys maister conuersion paule soeuer wrought god doth alwayes tourne glorifiing hys power magnifieng hys iustice hys iustice sinne doth punish sinne righteously hys power whe hys mighty hand onstretched arme doth aduaunce deliuer wonderfull mercy sake hys free liberalitie pleaseth hym vouchsaue osorius wylypye destitute starting hoale seeke escape chynk moushoole doth perceaue god power canot vtterly sequestred action men like olde tryed shifter collour matter applye workes god haue rehearsed god foreknowledge subtill distinction whereunto aduersaryes flee defence aduersaries dally god prouidencethey say prouidence god may enduce necessitie doth go cause men sinne onely god foreknow would deed god foreknow would rather therefore foreknowe inclination aduersaryes make mencion foreknoweledge godaunswere doe altogether lye poynte true maiestye god doth behold present view thinges haue bene shalbe though present hys eye herein go amisse practize establish foreknowledge permission god firmely would haue hys vnchaungeable prouidence seuered cannot possibly meanes may man thinke god doe foreknow permitte wickednes raigne able turne away hys power able mercy father hard harted seeing childe ready receaue harme call ye perill may say doth wickedly also doth consent thereunto one predicament therfore absurde thing confesse god omnipotent thing done cannot false also say thing wt god permitted wtout hys knowledge agaynst hys howe shall conceaue god doth permitte thing done hys shall done whereupon may frame argument agaynst persones reiecting necessary doctrine predestination flee onely god permission wise god permitte sinne doth eyther hys agaynst hys doth permitte agaynst hys nothing done agaynst godargument sufferaunce followeth god doth willingly permitte sinne stay hinder beyng graunted obiection hath dubble error first take away sinne altogether god casting wholy bpon hys permission next feare least god iustice blemished beyng opinion witte god worke harte wicked sinne must taken confessed cause sinne shalbe forthwith imputed god withall men shall hereof take iust occasion excuse selues easily confuted first whereas sayd god worketh harte men encline willes whereunto pleaseth hym eyther doth thrust vpo men outward calamity straunge disease cruell warres flame fire c bryngeth vpon men inward griefes seruice sathan exequutioner hys wrathe famine hys holy word ignoraunce blindenes vnderstanding hardnes hart appeareth euidently scripture pray meane whiche reade iudgesiudges sufficietly whence spryng head mischief burst first surely luther crowbyrde chayre pestilence osorius soeuer goe let v heare dronken eloquence gallaunt counterfaite swart rutter doth gushe vnto v haue spoken thyng agaynst luther haryshe eloquece nay rather osori selfe starke madde kynde maddnes rage accusatios ye tell v wherfore let lawfull luther aunswere selfe agayne like speeche germaine ruffler porting byshop might reproue agayn contrarywise maner osorius ye accuse ye guiltelesseluthers au swere osorius rhetoricall fyctione doe ye keepe sturre franticke well wittes would neuer reproche madnesse haue haue done haue deserued bycause would encline ye furious disorder ye rebellious dyd euer much moue finger towardes cause reproue forthwith penne speache instauntly euer man earnestly bende force arme agaynst writing would haue harkened counsell continuall admonition matter neuer proceeded much bloudshead shall receaue recompence good meanyng towardes accoumpted madd man
