denyed thinke good euill owne hereof pray respect wordes applyable countrey boores rebellion doth man open gappe licentiousnesse seditious treachery husbandman doth abate freedome man doyng atchieuyng enterprise deuines falsely challenge proper therfore lawfull wicked bycause many tymes men hindered agaynst will puttyng mischief executio shall therfore wicked doyng wickedly bycause free enforced yeld necessary seruilitie selfe able shake away wicked spirite therfore excused bycause doyng euill doth much freedome necessitie shall sayd free amiddes race rudenes restrayned agaynst lord owne much doyng euill yet doth beyng free selfe nothyng withstad continue euill still sayd wicked selfe free euery way captiue bonde therfore imputed god forthwith men whatsoeuer shall wickedly though men thinke committe euill compelled thereunto agaynst willes willyngly owne motion chiefly drawen thereunto confesse saying true god worketh yet doth bryng passe nothyng surely without owne will euill cause god accused euery man must laye fault owne folly wilfulnes owne charge say much god doth lead men willes hereunto osori pag reason ca ye couple stabilitie doctrine defence god iustice aunswereaunswere first ioyne singuler prouidence god workyng action man lyfe set forth thynges may referred primer cause efficient doth worke properly respect ye last end thinges much god owne nature best perfect hereupon commeth passe hath ordeined thynges selfe respect cause euill touchyng middle cause whereas man doth fall owne default procurement sathan shalbe reason therfore man seeke cause sinne without selfe complayne god yet admit action man lyfe gouerned without prouident circumspect direction god alone inclineth men willes whither listeth yet neuerthelesse euen applyeth willes hath enclosed also willes within certeyne limittes lawes enuironed certeine hedge boudes whether accomplish seyng hath made god manifestly discernable vnto v certeinly onely sufficietly acquite cleare iustice also aboundantly commende lastly though neuer vnable performaunce ordinaunces yet iust accusation quarell framed agaynst god faulte must wholy imputed vnto men worthely would beastly flesh beyng throughly fortified begynnyng vnder safe keepyng god vnderstadyng become carter owne carriadge guide owne flitteryng lyfe afterwardes refusing conduct leadyng god gouerne selfe rightly deede ought let god name enioy owne knowledge otherwise yet god iustice sufficiently enough defended euen cause bycause first forewarned perill ensuyng good reason acquited crime standeth agreable iustice punish sinnes sinnes crushe downe sharpe bitter correction proude rebellious arrogancie agaynst high god creator luther falsely accused seditionbut howsoeuer matter goeth maruell meane while fayth face one place vrged much maketh nothyng sedition whenas many thynges may gathered bookes euery manifestly profitable preseruation peace tranquislitie el doe bookes preachynges earnestly emporte necessary instruction fayth beyng established ye multitude rascall rable ruder boores together christian conforme lyues altogether patience desire concorde though oppressed neuer many iniuries euer worde writyng teaze man armes euer geue much crooked looke agaynst magistrate nay rather euer esteemed gouernours honorably taught duetie subiectes prince holy scripture earnestly faythfully euer carefully aduauce call backe former dignitie ciuill gouernours magistrate vtterly suppressed almost romish pontificall tyranny whose mynde penne dyd euer hatefully abhorre disorderous vprores outragious rebellios writynges behauiour doe witnesse true speake contended reproche registred amongest beadroll osorius lesinges light gospell restoredluther purged fro crime sedition carolostadius began plucke downe image make innouation many thynges matter beyng duely wayed selfe commendable enough yet bycause attempted violence vprore magistrate beyng made priuy vnto withstoode lyke attempt made zuinglius oecolampadius matter sacrament doe debate truth cause yet one thyng restrayned much subscribyng assertitions dought broyles feared would afterwardes haue ensued adde also somewhat selfe counsell called wormes beyng cited publique authoritie appeare emperiall seate dyd refuse certainly daunger assured apparaunt beyng aduertized iourney haue regarde sauety tyme thought better put lyfe hassard susteine reproche disobediece beyng ouercome last scripture power comitted cause mercy lord authoritie emperour onely defended cause constauntly bene lewde disposition foreward sedition suspect osorius wanted tyme prince frendshyp fautoures cause yea perhappes tyme good enough put practize euer prince subiect encouraged meanes moue discension beyng done long deede boores countrey began raunge outrage afterwardes muncer phyfer takyng partes withall brake lyke maddnesse common weale beyng thus deuided disquieted greatly greeued withall meanes vsed agaynst accordyng duety aunswere made article reason refuted counsell gaue exhortation commo quyet christian obedience myne owne writynges extaunt yet doe testifie hystories therof doe sufficiently declare osorius selfe doth deny yet takyng occasion writynges shameth make authour rebellion complaynt boores luther framed osorius rhetoricall fictioand sayth haue learned able selues doe good euill hereof conceaued foolehardynesse cause moued v boores armes notable argument cocluded clownes clownish surely suppose coridon selfe could haue done rustically take occasion argue agaynst might haue learned writyngs ye boores ye enstructed maner magistrate ought reuereced obey lesson often teach rebellion must eschued meanes possible priuate man auenge owne iniuries lawfull christian auenge priuate wrong christ neede warlyke guarrison maiestie gospell able strong enough selfe mainteyne owne quarell could forcible victory truth pure doctrine atchieued sufferaunce patience nature pursued forcibly would preuayle learned ye follow lesson lastly ye armes dereygned field sound trumpet published article requestes hygher power much dyd moyle turmoyle selfe reduce order reclayme attemptes teachyng holy scripture conuincyng aduertizyng chidyng beseechyng perswadyng threatnyng finally omittyng part duety vntouched whereby might reclayme hurly burly peace tranquillitie doctrine authoritie shut vppe eares master lessones betooke selues armes occasion one sentence wrongfully vnderstoode misconstrued dyd ye forsake field many exhortatios notable exclamation contrary go osorius bycause vnder person boores complaynte vehemently wrest false suggestion mischief agaynst deny assumpsit able proue perhappes heare say amongest clownes liuyng dead poore clownes lyued drawen execution tormented stretched vpon rackes extremitie men wont part vtter know one much whole rable muttered euer halfe sillable carterlyke senselesse imagination hath deuised agaynst willyngly yeld accusation suspitio occasion say tumult might haue bene raysed easily might blacke moore chauge skinne osor also might leaue lyeng thynges done may done onward proue might haue bene bycause say god worketh v accordyng luther assertion instrumentes onely applyed wrest handes hereupon followeth therefore sithe god onely raysed vppe tumultes onely procurour deuisour accomplisher sturre boores necessitie must guiltlesse innocet hereof go ye suppose osorius wordes whole seedeplotte rebellion shall say read paul god worketh ephes agayne worketh according purpose amos prophet amos euill citie lord hath done agayne whe heare euery side aswell amongest prophetes apostle men made blinde god deliuered ouer reprobate mynde might boores haue taken occasion wordes aswell myne go writte wordes also namely power freewill dispose selues whereunto lyst either make selues earthen vessel golden vessel house lord would boores haue sooner bene quieted cause yet generall proclamation notorious see rome dispersed throughout catholicke nation doe recordes canon noyse abroad wheresoeuer crawle yea many yeares luther borne also doth osorius write day portingall many lyke fraternitie elles neuer comotions therfore rude multitude luther borne portingall none italy germany fraunce england cycill nation could portio scripture doctrine eue bridle affection vnruly would one tyme burst outragious extremity adde moreouer admit wordes beyng either misconceaued misconstrued might suggest matter euill occasio shall lesse lawfull therfore beare testimony truth bycause beastly brutish mishandle wordes deedes others neuer well spoken reason away bible bycause parte heretiques haue sucked poyson dyd paule therfore commende iustice god aright vnrighteousnesse bycause wanted would abuse saying occasion euill let v doe euill say good may come thereby auncient godly christian wont assemble together sing psalmes day light receaue sacrament bread wyne hereupon began rumour scattered abroad christias dyd worshyp rysing sunne dyd sacrifice cere bacohus hath bene well spoken established tyme peeuishenesse peruerse froward person depraue lyst pyke quarell slaunder good wordes well doynges men came passe augustine selfe pelagians brought name commendation graceaugust agaynst iulia pelag booke cap hereupon forthwith began quarell though affirme men made good fatall necessitie agayne denyed grace distributed accordyng me deseruyngs saying gnawed though say endeuour ought looked man contrary saying gospell lord spake aske shalbe geuen seeke ye shall finde knocke shalbe opened vnto euery one doth aske shall receaue c haue debated euen truth counterfaite imagination hath deuised witte originall rebellious insolencie come yt pynche true defence namely deny euer boore germany euer iustifie slaunder agaynst neuer speeche boore rude vnshamefastnesse osorius voyde matter probabilitie make authour mischief authour wherof yet know would fayne know deede tell briefly yet truly osorius sathan perceaued kyngdome pride ready haue fallwhat cause authour vprore germany romishe prelate could longer mainteyne erroneous sacriledges agaynst glorious excellency gladsome gospell entred notable pollicie deuise vnder pretence gospell tickle vppe madd braynes thereby bryng gospell obloquy infamy ouerthrow whereof perceaued past compasse longer able withstand also vnlesse lying osorius sett selfe forth especiall instrument wyly serpent vpon whose shauen sconse much herebreadth may founde growing honest sober man ye would neuer haue filthyly infamed good reporte credite honest personage standyng defence gospell many slaunderous lye cursed reproches luther vse lyke counterbuffe accordyng frankenes speeche agaynst rusty clownish illfauored false diuinitie aske could answere agayne osorius feare rather least seeme speake sufficiently honest defence selfe respect deserte able vtter enough agaynst ye adde moreouer demaunde honest reason luther doth ioyne constancy hys discipline defence god iustice answere briefly certes much honester reason bloudy bishop skraping catchpolles hauing embrued rotchets much christian bloud play butcher like byshops ioyne pryde vayneglorious tytles pompe arrogancy cruelty tyranny treason lust lechery opinion heresy determination intollerable canones man tradition together peter paule christ hys gospell speake rest secret abhominations osor glorious triumphyng haddoni come length triumphaunt end glorious booke leauing luther field sounding ye retrai great battell freewill osor doth furbush hys furniture triumph agaynst poore gualter haddo without cause quarelling ciuilia little yelde ouer preeminence eloquence osorius confessed chiefe carpenter speach named hym also scholer cicero many tymes seemeth variable vnconstant nowhaddon inconstant dare affirme osorius writing vnsauory voyde likelyhoode truth without sense argument proofe haddon childishe hys style haddon infant speache making skarse anye semblaunce witte hys vtteraunce deserueth commendation witte seemeth stand darckenesse speach finally whereas doth oftentimes obiect agaynst osorius name cicero way reproche selfe carefully foresee man shoulde able reproche hym name cicero haddon hath ioate ciceroes fynesse speaketh nothing eloquently nothing playnely nothing distinctly nothing pitthely nothing substancially nothing loftely soeuer pleaseth hym hath thrust hys wrytinge also doth confirme reason argument skolding lauishnes tongue lastly hys whole wryting bluntish base colde moueth osorius pity rather hate cause osorius cannot according hys promise condiscend hart mynde hys opinion promised would could winne victory cause vndertooke apte conuenient argument sithence hath done sithece hath brought argument vsed proofe purpose sithence also hys reason haue force mayntayne credite rather doe disclose token miserable frensye hereof therefore commeth passe seemeth acquited hys promise hee remayne yet hys opinion vnuanquished therefore haddon vaynely take hand wryte lesse vndiscretely set hym worke moreouer neyther hys schoolemaister voyde blame whosoeuer instruct hym first place forme ought apply interrogation making substaunce matter nowe hast thou gentle reader last acte osorius fable whether may tearme comicall tragicall well tell seemeth myne opinion resemble rather shape comedye neerely glorious thraso pray could euer haue handled hys part vppon stage rufflingly moue beholder lowd laughter pleasauntly haue whole fruition sweet pigsnye cicero thai phillida sturr doth keepe perceaueth haddon hath fansie hys mynion maketh stand feare least wil beguile hatefully despightfully doth exclame vpon driue countenaunce onely treading hym vnder hys feete furiouslye boyling agaynst hym parasiticall gallaunt england hys cogging companion sanga handfull catholicke monkes uerely beleue would thraso pretended agaynst thai also burst open gate vpon doth thrust downe belfry amongest boyes one deserueth title good word witt neyther force setence likelihood truth whose writing example finally haddo reseblance ciceroes delectable pronuciatio doth appeare certayn piteous stamering speach vttred hys writing vntowardnes childishnes disputig obscure certein vnskilfull applicatio rhetoricall interrogatios learned vnskilfull maister one skarse expresse hys meaning vtteraunce hath pertaking ciceroes finesse cometh much thing neere maiesty cicero expresseth nothing purely nothing playnly nothig distinctly nothing substacially nothing loftely finally vttereth nothyng vayne sound foolishe wordes woulde pittie man see wherefore wretched man thou art poore stammering haddon piteous estate seely phedria meane tyme thys vayneglorious proud pecocke bedeckt distritch feather glittering plume wrapt vp together great brush perdie want thing nowe gyering gnato may lowt thraso hys paynted coate go let thinges passe osorius although vnbrydeled cottquenelike maner scolding lauishnes toung doth right require shoulde likewise blaze braynsicknesse right colour make mockery boyes yet dismissing last toyes merry conceites dame deynty wherewith hath say besmeared haddons lip deale earnest therefore let v see wherewith reproche haddon vnmanerly sayd ciceroes scholler conning coyner word euill afterwardes himselfe doth confesse writinges vnsauorye without reason wherin sayd amisse meaning effect think busye selfe straunge matter though raking moone wherein ye neyther sauour thing able teache willing learne doe slaunder certayne godly learned personage england yea euen queene despightfully ye call nickname new gospeller thus ye eyther reason wise onely exchaunge name made would easily appliable vnto forger counterfayte stager romish gospell yea would accord much fittely accuse moreouer say vttereth nothing purely nothing playnely nothing pitthily nothing substancially good grace man el besides osorius speake perhappes might credited shall discrete indifferet man iudge opinio herein merucile practise meanes possible deface ye credite aduersary agaynst writeth yet men may easily see yt haue great stoare modesty discretion ouerladen wt rule principle rhetorick skilfull rhetoricke wont extoll aduaunce ye power excellency ye aduer agaynst mayntaine quarrell th end make theselues famous thereby happely gett ye victory come part thaccusacion concerneth forme phrase hys style wherein cannot wonder enough exceeding childish pardo pray osor womanishe malepartnes sorte hoyes wont brawle nuttes woman ierome reporteth goshipping speake ill absent crake lustely ouer men stronger take goodly matter resemble cicero eloquence finesse phrase least come neere think inough treate christ gospell holy thinges sacred religion aptely soundly learnedly vnlesse man paynt glorious brauery ciceroes eloquence bicause haddons style doth rayse selfe ciceroes loftynes sufficiently iudge therfore accompted worthy sitte amongst punyes yet fitt scholler ciceroes schoole one vttereth nothing purely nothing playnly nothig pitthily nothig loftely c whe wise men say shall read word iudgemet cocerning haddo esteeme secret conceiptes think smile sleaues folly laugh openly men clapp hand spitt singuler inhumanity thys portugall wrangler abhorre detestable shamelessenesse ye say haddon speaketh nothing purely nothing playnly c anye man hath euer read haddons writinges vnshamefast besides osorius onely would say yee nothing ashamed manifest vanity ye altogether dispoyled feeling modesty humanity barraine scripture voyde iudgement whereas ietting shadow contented bountifully bestow best fayrest vpon selfe ye finde hart empart nothing poore ragges others confesse deede haddon reache grace dexteritie phrase cicero ye therefore yelde commendation latine style much anye meane knowledge therin yet suffer copany beare name poore scholler ciceroes schoole hath made vsher pray pepositour ciceroes schoole man may admitted fellowship vnles allowe hym yet respect friuolous title matter maketh beare name kynde discourtesy embase haddon ornamentes artificiall rhethorician throw amongest apsy boyes leaue nothing babishnes stammering speache withall condemne hym doltish rascall wryter yee cannot choose meruayle also collpixe bewitched hym make writer ye ought haue marueled meruelous man others rather posted ouer taunting check rather ouer many whose pelting workes flowne abroad cloysters ye worlde mosy vnsauory harshe vnpleasaunt ye learned enforced many tymes turne ouer stomackes reading vnlearned suck nothing smoake puddle notwithstanding would squeimish rudenes barbarous grossenesse speach euen excellent writinges might found cary resemblaunce sound doctrine sauoring wholesome knowledge least disorderous substance matter grosse speache otherwise concerning exquisite excellency eloquence asmuch neyther cicero graund captayne eloquence himselfe doth time speak exquisitely neither forceth much altogether artificiall philosopher maners doctrine substanciall cause contraryexquisite eloquence carefully required philosipher may want therof borne withall deuine defect thereof deuine may well bee borne withall simplicitie hys speach agree truth cleare barbarous grossenesse want eloquence supplyed soundnes truth vnreasonable communication osorius courteously allow vnsauory vnpleasaunt ianglers shew self whotte censor haddon onely ye affirme write nothing eloquently yet able expresse meaning thing playnely yet truely whereunto soeuer haddon fitte vnfitte whatsoeuer haddon cannot certayne true want eloquence matter rubbes gall extremely haddon therfore expelled ciceroes colledge cannot expresse ciceroes finesse liuely enough selfe cannot finely though ye would burst asunder osorius thing yea thing deede padde straw cannot easily perceiue puddle bubling froathe doth issue whereunto tendeth haddo may seeme worthy named ciceroniane ciceroniane bicause romayne writeth scarse plainely connigly ye orator rome bicause taketh part bishop rome blindfolde himselfe osorius doth sufficiently expresse elegancy romanes eloquence would attempt penne agaynst osorius doctrine rome take vpon fauour cleare veritie gospell apply minde defence true religion hereupon ariseth reproche stammering tongue childish speach vnskilfull style cannot well conceaue meaning osor according rule wryters attayne cleane pure elegancy cicero seeme iudgement childishe stammerer vayne haue augustine ierome ciprian ambrose gregory bernard vayne haue romish prelate expositours greeke latine church vayne haue angrensis dalmata alphonsus turianus andradius bestowed great paynfull labour writig whose style forme phrase throughly viewed considered peraduenture part found differre farre finesse cicero haddon doth may bolde make mencio scotus sotus lobardus gratiane thomas de aquino raphaell gabriell like trasshe yea many may pyke amongst famous true christian deuines sett purpose haue abased stile could write loftely thinges yt esteeme ga ly minde hawty loftinesse affected eloquenceieromes epistle pamachius woulde agree ye naturall simplicitie gospell whereupon ierom writing pammachius seemeth respecte haue estimacio despised cicero respect christ farther also iudgement yt expositio scripture nycetye speache ought onely dissimuled also vtterly eschuedluke might profitable ingenerallesay christ sauiour accompteth high great thinges worlde execrable abhominable sight god prophet esay doth wonderfull manacing threaten manasses day lord agaynst thing fayre beautifull florishing thing world paule enlarging knowledge euangelicall doctrine durst beginne high lofty rhetoricall speache furnishe wordes humayne eloquence hard listed chose rather refrayne1 cor least crosse christ sayth might made voyde none effect speake would haue men tyed necessitie dayes example namely sithe ye gospell christ doth florish euery though might lawfull dayes wt soeuer ornamentes yea greattest estimatio beautifie ye speache applye vse christes congregatio yet must modest discretio vsed truely plato opinion yt last end eloquence deliuer vtter thing acceptable god much ye required deuine aud therefore concerning grace dexteritie cicero whatsoeuer eyther nature emplant industry attayne despise rather well like wonder excellent gift god agayne reprehend man immitate imitation ioyned christian simplicitie done hawke proud estimation worlde vayne glorious ostentation witte anye priuate glory finally applyed discret imitation may clearely voyde vayne affectation nowe shall say reiecting teacher maners doctrine employ endeuour file vpp tongue addict themselues altogether cicero alone amazedly dote vpon onely thinke lesse fault christian almost ciceronian iudge hym scarse worthy reading though neuer christian wryter doth frame hys stile ciceroes patterne sauor altogether hys delicate speache cause suppose osorius doth recken haddon doth wryte nothing purely nothing playnly hath corruptly fasly written seemeth osori yt hath written like ciceronian hee doth throughly resemble dexteritie loftines although deede farre behinde hym therfore sweete man doth woder waywardnes minde forced bold wryte agaynst osorius osor comaundeth learne please mus hawty vehement interrogation must applyed place fitte last steade rhetoricall acclamation concluding satyricall skoffe doth aduertize hym procede writing franckly hym listeth encourage hym wryte franckly freely telleth may freely wryte without daunger man iudgement skill blame respect addicted cicero needefull sense feelyng right wrong body reason vnmanerly tauntes rascallike scoffes osorius could acquite lyke could contented space vnto haddons behalfe much speach aboundautly replenished vanitie folly better doe accordyng counsell wise manprouer aunswere foole accordyng foolishnesse briefly therfore bycause make hast end booke au swere argumentes deede none aunswere scoffes nyppyng conceiptes altogether vnpleasauntly yet neuerthelesse somewhat truly surely geue harty thankes osorius myne owne cause onely publicke name learned generally thynges wh haue taught v hetherto notable book haue taught merry receaue singuler delight doynges absteine laughing shall heare disputyng vpon matter wh seeme behaue self aptly though blind man discerne betwixt colour camell iudge dauncing take vpon determine franckly betwixt true false religio hautely proudely yet much impudently yet shal easie matter finde much relligion tully office yea true relligion haue gloriously painted bookes hetherto fewe sparckles onely except likewise also throughout whole course rest discourse often haue friuolous confused argumentes moued myrth laughter thrust selfe stoughtly matter iustification predestination kinde doctrine notwtstadyng seeme meere strauger though came new fro india neither dare much bookes name mouth tearme iustification predestination yea truly maruell also ye durst name name christ also amogest writyngs sith cicero neuer made mention therof bookes ridiculous silenus doth neuer play part pleasauntly whenas takyng rodde sittyng schoolemaisters chayre calleth forth poore seely haddon middes schoole comaundeth harken learne maister maruell full comaundementes good osorius must beare poore haddo behalfe occupied matter come schoole could preset would foolish yet though otherwise eloquece neuer childishly ignoraut much afrayde vgly buggebeare lyon skynne would sooner espye asse lollyng eares lyon pawes wherfore keepe maisterly preceptes selfe may length shame enough lay vpon others neckes haue selfe learned vse well lysted set downe viewe oft reason argumentes fayle vndiscretly fayntly roaue raunge vnseasonable exclamation vntymely scornefull braggynges braying madd man cause triumphyng victory yea many tymes aduersary stoughtly sometymes ye stad incogruitie could easily shew faultes carpe haddon ca applyable fitly selfe whereas adde last man iudgement blame haddon addicted cicero needefull ignoraunt whereunto vnsauory foolishe scoffe tendeth sufficiently coniecture malicious bragge name ciceronian emulation speache emporte amogest christias part iudge rashly meanyng may ye write agaynst haddon much true knowledge vnlade cholericke humour yet geue leaue tell care thinke thinke haue writte mynde deede certeinly hidden vnder couerte meanyng thyng lurkyng heathenish infidelitie carried wonderfull admiration cicero ye thinke worthy noted infamous enough addicted cicero doe wordes emporte ou contrary part thinke also speciall poynt hyghe commedation man whole bent affection endeuour become ciceronian pray glory christ mynde knoweth reioyce thyng crosse lord sauiour iesu christ lord gospell doth playnly deny man may serue two maisters ye apostle doth exhorte one place alone frame selues fashio world say wordes mammon vnderstaded deede ergo addicted ouermuch vnto mammon deny ye seruaunt iesu christ shall ye seruaut christ yt addicted cicero enough prayseworthy imitate ye gorgeous neattnes ciceroes speach worthy great comedatio matche excellecy thyng preiudiciall christes glory christ glorified wise ye simplicity ye gospell admit pyrlyd pyked delicate speech yt synesius spake young manfine poolished speach alwayes impudent may aptly verified speach yt say fine poolished speach alwayes impudet eloquece alwayes great estimatio amongest men say though yt whatsoeuer vnlike vnto ciceroes phrase barbarous though cicero selfe aliue agayne would vse phrase speach ye doctrine ye scripture vsed yt tyme suppose one cicero accomplish maner learnyng neither one phrase speach meete applyable person cause argumets maister osorius maner matter hand lyue world yt may occupy wittes much ye poolishyng speach rather wt earnest bent affectios seeke life euerlasting remissio sinnes kyngdome god learne turne away seueritie god wrath iudgemet fro v yt day surely hageth ouer heades shall bring v either euerlastyng glory el euerlasting destruction must well aduized shall auswere yt parliament iudgemet seate ye iudge may dealt withall wt floorishyng wordes wt substaunciall matter must care endeuour hereunto must enforce ye power soules measurably aboundautly toung may framed pretie coceiptes loftely style mayaduauced meanes ye terrible coutenauce god may pacified thynges whatsoeuer shadowes though delight prophane eye world neuer glorious spectackles undoughtedly whosoeuer stricke earnest feare god whose soule beyng terrified wt multitude haynous sinnes doth inward harty sorrow sighe scrytche vnto christ holy ghost hath endued true liuely contemplation transitory worldan exquisite affectation eloquence much regarded deuines hath hart mynde vtterly renouced world pompe therof finally vnmeasurable magnificence vnspeakeable maiestie kyngdome sonne god doth wholy possesse shall regarde lofty grace cicero ye proude stately wordes phrase mynio deuises toyes speake purely plainly lightsomely directly purpose speach cleane ioyned meane comlynesse needes aboundaunce required man speaketh lyke ciceronian veryly christ selfe spake like ciceronian yea although spoken haue profited lesse commeth passe tell secret operation influence thinges humilitie crosse consisteth wholy deuine inspiration agree hauty lofty kynde man vtteraunce one thyng deuine debate vpon holy mystery play mynstrell musonius spake sometyme certeine philosopher therfore doe differre much iudgement herein although attributed enough vnto cicero yet much set purpose absteine fro affectation speache although could haue attayned thereunto gaue selfe rather yet soude proportionable pitthy lesse effeminate naturall lesse fleshly spirituall kynde speache yet doth man diminish thing commendation excellent giftes tully eloquence perhappes seemeth vnseemely osorius iudgemet speake like ciceronian speake like christian therefore portingall pasquill doth giere haddon way mockage saying sounde iudgemet euer blame enough addicted cicero c though haddon applyed selfe ciceroes phrase needefull wise men would haue geuen commendation rather haue turned reproche condemned follye much haddon gaue selfe affectatio cicero much neither greatly regarde well acquainted withall neither knew man maner study considering man viewe conference bookes writyngs seemeth iudgement addicted lesse cleare ciceronian scabbe could haue wished iudgementes others presse v withall know ciceronians doe greatly regard blinde like vnto selfe tearme iudgementes foreiudgementes rather wont whose iudgementes grounded vpon reason vpon affectios ierome certeine place doth say udgemetes louers blind dare affirme enuy malice much daungerously blinde tell curteous christian iudgementes make doubt iudge right well haddones cause pleadeth necessary quarell churche commendable defence countrey moreouer handleth matter argumentes reason seemeth onely haue cofuted osorius also haue crusht peeces let men iudge stile disposition writyng shall like best gaynsay truly may bold leaue iudifferent reader subscribe men iudgementes though great estimation shall speake yet speake neuerthelesse franckly thinke haddon onely haddon withall aunswere vnto osorius haddones pasquill iudge vnlesse grosse heathenishe iudgement osorius much differre christ christian modestie haddones maner writyng iudgement truely doth differre ciceroes commendable vertues would neuer haue set forth selfe blinde ignoraunce rayling bookes open gaze world mocked derided hissed great cleare lightsomnesse gospell christ pthe thyrd booke hauyng striken two heades monstruous hydre already mangled gobbettes reasonably well terrible serpent neuerthelesse beyng yet throughly vanquished remaineth yet one head booke wherein vgly vermine besturreth selfe freshe assaultes betaketh new threateninges casteth new poyson yea whole flouddes slaunderous reproches lye agaynst new gospell tearmeth like old serpent long sithence agaynst woman child chiefly agaynst litle england yet doth vse matter would seeme enuemine whole ilande contagious fleing infectio doth know saythpag lad many good catholicke neuer shronke away fro vowes othes made pope rome many englishe nation haue willyngly runne countrey also nomber tarry still home persistyng neuerthelesse opinion romish relligion restrayned vtteryng conscieces feare osori inueighed englad agaynst zeale beare new gospell moreouer also many noble yea many whole shyres england enformed certeine portingall marchaunt frend coathed yet lutheran moraine therfore accusation bent agaynst whole englad neither agaynst particular person place haddon doth misconster agaynst lutheranes new gospeller onely sort people doth louyngly aduertize queene elizabeth good harty affection osori pag take good heede warely circumspect end may foresee prouidently foreshewe vnto certeine markes token beyng guided theseus clewe threede shall mysse discerne difference betwixt true relligion false betwixt true prophetes false prophetes markes one may easily discouered haue proposition booke rest patched togetherwhat osorius doth promise booke processe whole worke tendeth euen effect almost first maketh promise set downe certeine signes token make manifest difference betwixt true relligion false betwixt true prophetes false afterwardes annexing description church doth display abroad curiously maner fayre beautyfull picture painted table viewed next vnto maketh coparison betwixt two church magnifieng owne church wonderfull prayses comendations possible aduaunce highly agaynst embasing thrustyng downe vnder foote p stiferous sectes lutheranes may worthely hate detest god permission shalbe spoken hereafter place fitte first commeth hand infringible argument osorius agayne repeated letter written queene elizabeth bycause braggeth confuted haddon much behoueth v note aduisedly wonderfull skill vttered knittyng vppe knotte therof able vnlose haddon least stand maruelously amazed inscrutable ingeniousnes man determinyng selfe make playne demonstration new gospeller calleth wise harkened vnto banished common weales common plague maisters misrule wickednesse frameth argument vpon pointeosori argument able resolued whereas tooke vpon restore auncient puritie gospell infinite mischiefes doe reigne notwithstandyng amongest auditories teacher keepe schoole make whole coutrey worse haddones auswere osori argument sophisticall quicke haddo makyng auswere affirmeth neither true osorius fableth yt waywardnesse people neither yet though true preiudiciall defence cause hand controuersie doth concerne properly matter relligion conuersations professours correspondet seedes christes gospell fall vpon ye fruitefullest grounde altogether choaked vppe thornes corne ouergrowen cockell tare fault therof word people humane actios neuer good successe world greater sorte alwayes delighted worst worst part many tymes preuayled beyond best came passe long sithence onely tyme christ apostle age holy martyr also doth likewise happen certeine continuall order enterchaunged course world dayly hourely onely preacher word church rome selfe neuer wanteth matter sufficient great greeuous complaintes albeit maners men ca kerd peeuishnes wayward frowardes sacred word god euill spoken amongest paganes infidelles yet matter debated amongest wise discrete personage thought matter reasonable thyngs nature good called question condemned naughty behauiour naughty packes abusing therfore osor amisse herein wrest whole state question maners euill conuersation onely concerne matter relligion moreouer also though neuer straight inquisitio made life maners professours worde yet behoued osorius bende selfe sharpely agaynst preacher accusation throughly acquited least wise aunswered griefes complaintes many others catholickes much haynous worthy speedy reformation reason haddon let v heare osorius doth say dispute open mouth cry first vaunteth triumpheth argument resolued afterwardes gallant glorious thraso doth meruaile much face haddon may deny trew seeing poreblinde see common euery barbours shoppe sealed testimony men yea wherewith siopodes well acquainted also sayth merueile man could shameles deny trueosor pag doth onely coceaue imagination also behold hys eye yea feele whole body great griefe hys hart luste doth raunge euery allowed vnbrydeled licenciousnesse pestereth euery corner vnpunished sanctuary religious house lye tumbling blo temple church robbed spoyled treason practised agaynst prince gouernours finally place whersoeuer doctours teach schoole tumult vproare forasmuch haddon doth onely heare report onely conferece history also behould hys eye openly vsually frequented say thing neuer done march couragiously dexteritie sharpnes witte benedicte go let v cosider awhiles ye force ingeniouse man whersoeuer new preacher sayth plant themselues teache may see thinges polluted filthy bramble cockell darnell man hath spoken shall knowe true ye speake osorius sooth past shame denyeth pray matter knowen published abroad euery natios countryes ilandes people finally bruted abroad ratified report behold gentle reader woderfull euident demonstration concluded wt argument silogismes men wont dispute ye schooles chrisippus cratippus ratified yea sealed also oratours vse verifie cause iudges testimonye publique seales witness yea report maner ye people calecute suppose ye massagets antipode men new world yea beyond herring say farre wide doth prelate knowledge thinges outstretch selfe test vpon hys finger endes men euery speake heare may require credite christian reader sithence worlde self whole compasse produced wittnesse againste newe prophettes lutheranes testimony world agaynst lutheraneswhich might speak altogether one mouth woulde vse testimony thinke whatsoeuer disorder mischiefes whatsoeuer lust vnpunished licenciousnes whatsoeuer outragious sacrilege whatsoeuer treacherous treason conspiracy euer hard amongest people chiefly aboue others frequented raigne especially amongst comon weales lutheranes doctrine preaching prophettes witnesse whereof euery v many liue world doe set seales ratifie confirme true handes worlde selfe think could speake would speake otherwise forsooth cannot speake selfe hath appoynted osorius proctor cause speake matter therefore manifest approued fealed impudent haddon dare deny ye may wonder yet great deale rhetoricall amplification proueth true onely ye suffrage dumme men cyteth witnesse agaynst haddon himselfe owne eye eares ye see sayth eye rebou ding argument agaynst osor haddon see eye ye ask osorius doughtles might see many horrible vnspeakeable abhominations liued nowe blinde cannot see impudent denye place ouerladen forlorne villanies lechery murthers robbery treason uproares conspiracy inquisition made speciall place abhominations raigne place may poynt vnto notorious rome selfe mother see catholicke church harlottes bawdryes howses stewes brothell house kyndes filthy lechery opely haunted onely punished made also gainfull marketts pope treasory appoynt chiefe see whole religion may boldly great reaso approue yt caruell botche true religion metropolitane citie abhominations butcherow shamble christian bloud sincke thefte auarice forge schoolehouse treason trecheries seditiones abhominations bodyes mortall men temple liuing god hath vyolated defiled temple god fire fagotte goare bishoppes rome good tyme vproare germany remembred place might lawfull bryng forth could history recordes reportes easy matter one perticuler example onely notwithstanding altogether impertinent religion spread abroad whole decade iliades sedition tumultes schismes easily might poynt name tyme place onely practises conspiracy agaynst prince cruell murthers poysoninges banishmentes famishings procured one ye neck briefly countrey soeuer droues monckes nunnes build nestes el shall man see thinges polluted contaminated filthy shamefull villanies stench yea ye whole world bearing witnesse tell beseech good holy father whose doctrin si non caste tamen caute chastely yet warely luther one profession maketh marketts incestuous marriage alioweth concubine priestes hys commoditie pleasure persequuteth lawfull marriage priestes fire sword leaue ouer meane space vnspeakeable abuse misteries couert paphia couert consideration couled cofessioners priuie partaker hidde abhominations passe ouer withall ye crementines beneuantanes peter aloisianes casianes cacus rather onely commendation whose vnspeakeable filthines opely proclaimed denouce yt stincking lechery notpunished also highly rewarded osorius hath found prety starting hoale escape sithe perceaueth himselfe vrged narrowly necessitie must pleade honesty church beyng neyther able hyde excuse filthines wringeth himselfe moushoole although denyosor pag societie course man lyfe fruitfullest corne stincking weed iniquitie grow euery among yet doth neuertheles empayre force argument meaneth place make comparison men set maners agaynst maners affirmeth ground argument witte whereas preacher new gospell luther bucer zuinglius martyr vndertake vpon weede corne cleane chaffe pluck vp noysome weedes rootes bryng ioate promise passe nay rather whereas wickednes hath bene seene buddle vpp fresh meanes trimme reason osor hereupon doth conclude vauntage doctrine men onely vnprofitable osor pag also pestiferous noysome beleued wise side witte catholique chur although auarice ambition doe raigne many sinowes luste altogether rooted yet amongst newe prophet doth arise thys wise taking vpon hym great charge restore former primitiue bewty apostolicke nea tnes decayd church doctrine ouermuch weakened therefore argument like force agaynst effect almost doth osorius frame talke word ouerlauish inough matter nakedly coldly loath aunswere summe conclusion tendeth effect new prophet arise amogst would take vpo make reformation corrupt maners church auciet purity gospell brig passe according promise credite geue prophet luther bucer phillip caluine martyr take vpon reforme maners church made thinges worsseosor argument co futed ergo ought beleeued saint sophistry kynde sophisme new prophet arise would endeuour meanes possible reduce amendement life able could atchieue desire ought therfore taken prophett think true hee could preuayle wt many shall forthwith accepted prophett go hys preaching entred yea none almost profited therebythe spirite prophettes measured nomber beleuers yee think reason yt estimation preacher measured according number beleuers vnbeleuers rather according spirite truth hys embassye noah eighth prophet preacher righteousnes neuer cease calling cryeng vpon people thend hee might allure amendment lifemoah yet eight person onely reserued generall destruction mankinde moses sent egiptiansmoses many whole multitude became heare bredth better preaching nay rather waxed indurate esay prophett doth cry vnder person christesay haue beleued teaching measure god prophetts rule shall say ieremyieremy rest prophetts shall say ye apostle steuenstephen paules paule coplayned bitterly saken fallen away vanity present lyfe ensueth minor sillogisme luther melancton zuinglius bucer caluine took vppo charge yet reaped fruit agayn innocecy lyfe charitie amongst co uersaunt withall c first would fayne learne men take vpon doe call backe life corrupt maners men age perfect rule gospell truely vndertooke hard charge farr exceeding humayne power abilitie go luther zuinglius rest make promise themselues word sillable word much time surely haue perused many work yet could neuer finde thing hitherto haue glaunced vpon anye thing chaunce set place openly reader may perceaue deale forged lye good matter desire cauill vpright iudgement coldly lyengly simply playnely keeping iangling vnsauory speaches forged vntruthes many men blame wise may seeme haue made plaine demonstration true iust reporte true vpright minde haue truth knowne true proues testimony mock delude men fable surely wished good men christian profession name would meanes possible leade lyues truely christianlike poyntes agreable doctrine professe doughted new gospeller call wishe theyr harte wishing could haue auayled bryng passe neuer power neuer enter couenaunt euer obliged themselues promise priuy aperte would accomplishe wherin much deceaued luther much ye speake also self ye coniecture hereby whereas luther professe substaunce man saluation consist life maners men ye onely fayth sonne god doth agree together yt little earst accused subuertour honest accions vertuous endeuour nowe take vpon stoare enriche lyues conuersacions christian aboundance vertuous plantes seedes godlines albeit neuer lacked certayne godly carefullnesse exhort honest endeuours yet neuer franticke make glorious bragges reformation lyfe trauelled earnestly euery one according abilitie beseemed godly well disposed personage much could haue wished yet much geuen holy ghost attayned nought el yet atchieued surely though coulde restore ye pure simplicitie ye euagelicall life yet brought passe men reading comparing holy scripture beganne haue euident feeling thorough taste corrupt stincking matter absurde filthy pernitious doctrine durty puddle wherof albeit mistrusted able clense throughly vnmeasurable tyranny aucthoritie power yet thought conuenient credite function bare suffer longer cloaked dissembled wtall therefore stept forth amongst rest martine luther first beginning luther yet neyther first yet long agoe neyther much owne voluntary necessarily relieng duety hope lucre ne yet pamper vp paunch hosius belieth neyther hope purchase authority osorius mistaketh forced thereunto importunacy others yea without manifest perill lyfe whereupon thinge chaunced afterwardes contrary expectation ye iustly accuse man selues first author flaming beacon heate whereof doth parch skinnes backes cause occasion thereof neither history obscure tell playnly tyme farre spent may easily call minde time season whenas leo pope rome sending abroad hys commissioner receipt plating treasories throughout dominion europe appoynted generall marte raking hys marchandize together whereupon diuers holy cloyster marchauntes arriued germany amongst certayne fryer dominick order named tetcelius deede mony marchaunt regrator pope markett laden pardon bulles proclayming generall fayres vtteraunce wherein remission sinnes kingdome heauen free liberty feede fish flesh bought penny proclamation seeming little iniurious people tending ouerthrow gospell grace mouing godly conscience small griefe displeasaunce mynde without iust cause luther man continually exercized inward agonyes vnquiet passion conscience thought wise tollerable part permit horrible erroneous impietie directly agaynst conscience manifest truth gladsome gospell husht vppe past ouer tymerous fearfull ilence albeit well assured stincking contagious weed could touched without present perill life wherefore beganne make show himselfe meaning defend ye quarrell gospell sleder slight attempt first propoundeth certayn propositios onely principle question agaynst gainefull marketts pardon bulles vayne desire concontend dispute without humble maner submission cause thincking nothing lesse successe thereof would see come passe contrary part like moderation tempered affection eyther cotented themselues saying nothing haue yealded truth haue sought aduauncement christ glory rather haue serued pope pompe ambition smale sparckles neuer burst great flame meanes owne waywardnes came passe part falleth common brabblers hauing many tymes worst ende staffe hauing right deede part thereof striue long till last lose euery inche thereof shutting vppe catch rappe labour agaynst pardones openly burned framed article agaynst man exclamed open mouth agaynst ought burnt like hereticke bycause pope power destitute frendes matter great importaunce immediately started vp one prierias prouost frier like lordlike fellow challengeth luther field stept forth thyrd crew iames hochstratus espyeng fit tyme purchase credite fame would ieopard ioynte amongest though wanted furniture sufficient enough mainteyne challenge thrust coales fire teazed vp uniuersities paris coleyne louaine agaynst poore luther condemne luther beyng thus vexed ye madd outrage frier driuen issue letter pope leo tenth alledgyng excuse published proposition touchyng pardon euill malice towards grace onely way disputatio wherof hath treated large therfore would humbly beseech vouchsaue benyngly read accept touchyng owne person affected towardes see would willingly submit authoritie therof onely writing sauetie life also withall humilitie lowlynesse whatsoeuer maiestie determine thereupon would lesse reuerently esteeme decree chief uicare christ vnto acknowledge obedience due earth next vnder christ humble lowly submission prostrate person weightie matter wholesome counsell uicare christ heyre successour peter behaued selfe doe make great inquiry one thyng aske demaunde osorius would vouchsafe aunswere thinke would christ selfe peter haue done case first would christ selfe haue throwen grounde money table bowthes chopper chaungers scourged vagaraunt regrators cruelly byeng sellyng temple god whippes knotted cordes would euer haue suffered church appointed prayer preachyng tourned denne theeues bowthe brothells market auarice would peter haue done whose successours byshops challenge selues tyme keepyng right course gospell therfore reproued paule yelded humbly would haue refused offered obediece humble submission would haue vouchsaued gently el would haue thanked partie gentle remembraunce frendly counsellpope leo proude insolency agaynst luther humble submission humble seruaunt seruauts god vpo earth representeth vnto v person christ maiesticall chayre peter insolently outragiously dealt matter tragedy raysed thunderboltes wildefire threw bloudy turrettes agaynst luther life needelesse make mention place sithence faythfully set downe history men remember well enough euen begynnynges troublesome tempest ganne spread selfe abroad euery coast whereby may easily vnderstand suppose luther thought vpo nothyng lesse first heare innouatio alteratio customes ceremony enduced partly necessitie matter partly prouocation peeuishe waywardes onely set downe proposition wherein gaue attempt agaynst state romishe see neither yet vtterly abandone pardon bulles required onely moderation vsed doughted vnsatiable greedynesse vnspeakeable crueltie aduersaries could haue restrayned selfe within boundes limittes modestie measure luther would haue holden peace appeareth letter directed bishop rome cardinall caietane signifieng vnto vnfayned scilece therein aduersaries mouthes might stopped also request onely reasonable agreable also pietie men profession especially much luther assertion conteyned nothyng preiudiciall byshop rome matter yet gone farre forth might haue bene easily husht vp least could otherwise finde harte yeld manifest truth pontificall courage byshop would daunted neither could vnmeasurable mawe greedy cormorauntes easily satisfied last old prouerbe gold good chaffer howsoeuer come bare bell away huble maner therfore assoone luther propouded ye sayd question prierias gaue ye first onset agaynst preste place diuers coronelles captaines band rusht whole route monckes frier hoeboobe people flewe article restraintes curse booke bell candell countermandes finally byshops rome thunderboltes terrible bull linkte thereunto perplexitie would fayne learne osorius would vouchsafe tell luther say luther haue entermedled cause man reasonable iudgemet could ought endure horrible impiette whe saw could preuayle haue forsaken tackle meanes must haue put conscience dauger drownyng yet least haue behaued selfe matter somewhat modestly could haue expressed humblenes modestie haue submitted selfe cause tribunall seat pope herein part duetie left vndone humble submission could haue auayled thyng truth wherof end may apparaut vnto reader also harken pray secod letter luther written pope selfe endited euerlasting aduersaries disputation scattered farther abroad euer thought would haue bene withall deepely rooted harte many men easily pluckt vp agayne besides also sithence countrey germany doth woderfully floorish day pregnaunt wittes sounde iudgementes aboundaunce learnyng perceaue doe honor ye church rome must throughly aduised make recantation maner recant nothyng el contaminate defile churche rome shamefull abhominable idolatry egypt haue wrought mischief outrage wt v germany though villany enough accuse withstoode monstruous beggyng authour misdemeanour holynes holy father doe protest god world neither willyng present willyng impeach maiestie churche rome authoritie holynesse meanes colourable practize deface doe freely frankely confesse iurisdiction churchluthers protestation aboue deuised agaynst poore luther one thing able herein vowe holines say surcease dealing matter pardos become altogether mute mine aduersaries likewise lay glorious reprochefull slaunders raysed agaynst publish instrument scilence herein comon people may know acknowledge dignitie ye church rome yeald due reuerence impute rashnes beggarly pardoner honorable see imitate ye sharpenes haue vsed rather haue abused agaynst see apostolicke wherein somewhat ouerlauish agaynst lewde lurdeynes doe hope disorder rashly raysed may god grace meanes alayed agayne possible doyng myne onely endeuour mother churche rome might infamed men couetousnes vnlettered people might carried errour perswaded set lesse stoare charitie pardon thynges beyng matter indifferent make great accompt besides thyng learne otherwise please holynesse yeld selfe vnfaynedly commaundement christ preserue holynes euer fro aldenburghe iij marche beseech osorius myldly written letter luther beseemyng godly well disposed mynde partes duetyfull respect humanitie thought amysse set downe place shamelesse slaunder hosius might made apparaunt hereby produceth luther ye open stage standyng agaynst ye whole world entryng combate none cause greedy desire purchase credite hauke glory worlde plye pauche one pricked buttocke wt boddkynne whe perceaued market pardon come question amongest dominicke frier motion brother fraternitie bega therfore sturre coales iustifieth true wordes vttered owne mouth whenas ye beginnyng disputation agaynst eckius seemed somewhat passe boudes modesty aduertized therof somestanislaus hosius first booke heresy yt god cause moderate selfe ye spirit lenitie affirmeth brake speaches namely yt disputatios neither begon god sake could ended god sake wordes either falsely imagine vpon luther aduersaries neuer spoke el vttered sense alledged hosius matter selfe doth expresse wt open euident proofes yet may luther spake truly iudged lesse eckius knew notable parasite ye pope yt wayeng duely glorious insolency eckius manifest perill luther dought hereof yt broyles neuer vnder taken eckius god sake begun ended also onely pope sake surely respect construed vpo luther probable coniecture much considering eckius forced disputatio much agaynst speake hosius tyme god permissio returne osorius much luther demeaned selfe humbly see prostrated selfe wholy euen vnder feete pope would haue doe el osorius suppose veryly haue done namely haue recated fallen vpon knee boyes wont feare rodd haue yelded fault none nay rather dyd pope rather throw away proude ambition filthy iucre embrace wholesome counsell brother sithence disdayned mathe pope seruaut seruautes god figure called antiphrasis douch afe yeld truth humble seruaunt seruauntes god name title professeth shamed harken vnto godly man learned doctour graue deuine onely teachyng truth also castyng selfe downe humbly nay rather shamed abuse name christ gospell false filthy matter shamed blind eye people smoakes delude christ shedd precious bloud craftely finally durst spurne malapertly agaynst expresse authoritie word much nothyng valour excellet life free remission forgeuenesse sinnes enioy onely bloud sonne god pestilent practize lyeng deceite could haue bene imagined ought adiudged el enemy man saluation betrayeng v precious iewell world doth sell vnto v smoake dead coales steede true perfect treasure thynges beyng manifest clearethe cause luther honest nothyng ca manifest cleare much also luther defended honest rightfull cause man euer better whereunto allured owne affectio forced rather peeuishe frowardnesse manifold iniuries others euen agaynst also could neither recant without haynous offence mainteyne without perill lyfe ianglers slaunder luther sought meanes selfe disturbe alter ceremony rayle much pray osorius set vppe schoole make thynges abhominable finally new gospeller vayne gloriously tooke vpo restoare puritie god pure euangely nay rather shamefastnesse honesty wrate logicke whe ouerflowed monstruously filthy lye steede true honest argumentes simple witted may foude ca see great mayme want iudgement kynde logicke shall view read wynde shaken rotten argumentes assumption ye vouche maner truth yet assumption one hangeth agreably first begynnyng manifestlye assume wise prophetes say apostle tooke vppon osori conclusios false sophistry bounde selues oathe would restore pure liuely wellsprynges gospell false dyd vtter promise word halfe sillable word much doe assume hereof nothyng ameded church endeuour hereof shall see proofe hereafter goe conclude length therefore new gospeller god wonderfully concluded confused argument argumentes el may permitted builde scattered cobbewebbes together without morter lyme may lawfully argue wise ierome osorius bishop siluano hath taken vpon hym confute lutheranes attempt hath little preuayled vnlesse make cause manifest ergo purest elleborus doth grow antycyra let v proceede haue taken pleasure hitherto wt gospeller teacher reasonably well syr ierome may bold enquire likewise gospeller great doctours haue performed legth fruites notable marchaundizes haue enriched people withall aunswere make neuer promise thing say beleue demaund promised performed howe much profited restoring puritie churche ought haue done thing aske suppose haue well acquited themselues testimonye neuer made vaunt themselues bring thyng passe euen thougha comparison betwixt professoures true gospell papisticall friend shall stad destitute helpe care naked leaue yt binde selfe vnto parcell promise opinion reason haue profited giuen hope profiting help towardes restitution puritie churche say expostulate pure doctrine ordayned instituted christ himselfe behoofe ratified ye prophet apostle wisely deliuered ouer vnto v elder wholy altogether surely part therof say conuerted vtterly subuerted haue obtruded vpo v estate church neyther christ apostle nowe aliue would euer acknowledge man dought whether true whence shall better certified throughly peruse shape lyuely image romish church self represent vnto v comparing samewith true apostolique auncient romaine church many yeares agoe therefore let v harcken osorius preaching hys owne churchosor pag prayle romish church osor first sayth haue neyther gospel luther melancthon carolostadius zuinglius caluine bucer firmelye retaine gospells mathew marke luke iohn c well done indeede true say wolde god would god osor woulde stande faste vnremoueable within limytts bowndes doctryne actes wrytinges apostle euangelistes haue deliuered ouer vnto v beyng contented gospelles would seeke meanes saluation sacred scripture ensealed vnto v finger holy ghost cause yee defraud godly gospelles hyde darcknes ouerwhelm vnder bushell onely fagott also fire meanes possible el consume say renounce gospelles luther melachton caluine truely doe wonderfully commend stoughtnes herein neuer chaunced see anye gospellesa fifth euerlasting gospell made tyme dominick fryer parise ambition three hundered yeares gifte phoca emperour although deede sparckles thys venemous ambitio began kindled heades diuers pope whereas vrsinus deacon practized bee promoted popedome came passe tumult raysed fell together eareswhen name vniuersalitie order cardinalles beganne tryeng whether pope yealding voyces onely euen playne handistrokes euen minister sicimus whiche skirmishe continued prouerbe may applyed like lyke cooke platter mattereth much whether part haue preeminence councell pope conspired agaynst direct decree god word generall consentyng treachery condemned iohn husse ierome prague two holy martyr christ burnt ash long martine shewyng selfe minister christ warlike chapion impe bloudy bellona sharpen set edge germaine swordes agaynst bohemian whenas emperour sigismu de councell vse much treaty pope reformation well inordinate maners presumptuous pride clergy ye rebellious con macie licentiousnes laytiemartin vicare christ bellona pleased holy father much debatyng matter haue article reformation maners differred vntill tyme forthwith brake vp councell whether emperour would made quicke dispatch rome volaterane recordeth yeare martine eugenius bare stroke whose entrey popedome began small broyle arise betwixt cardinalles columnens whose procurement strong battell foughtengenius chicken bellona wherein many slayne many taken prisoner pope escaped takyng heeles afterwardes peace proclaymed platin tyme yeare coucell basile coucell called basile eugenius despising councell raysed vp contrary councell first bonnony ferrara anone florence amongest thynges decree constance determined councell authoritie pope reuoked made frustrate therefore eugenius refusing come councell basile deposedeugenius schismatick deposed popedome place adopted amadeus foelix yeare whereupo sprag vp new schisme enclinyng foelix holding fast eugenius germaines called newtralles schisme endured yeares councell basile mentioned sigismunde dead wrath lord afflict wonderfull calamity death iohn husse fredericke chosen crowned emperour whose authoritie councell basile confirmed allowed agayne cotrary decree eugenius season hu garians cotrary othe fidelitie raysed armye agaynst amurathes turkishe emperour ouerthrowne battell much christian bloud spilt king hungary ayne also iuliane cardinall huniades himselfe ouercome great decay christendome reproche christian name thence turk enuadeth peloponesus subdued brought vnder subiection egna meanes one bloudshed turkish victory chiefly power christianes much weakened euer treachery pope especiallythe battell agaynst heluetians basileans procuremet eugenuius eugenius teazed lewes dolphine fraunce wage battaile agaynst heluetians basileanes mighty cruell battell fought while eugenius kept sturre councell basile proceeded neuerthelesse cannon pragma agreed vpon confirmed published whole councell testimony rob gagni hys booke whereunto constant phrigio addeth furtherrob gaguinus phrigio saying would god fayth bene hitherto obserued kept whatsoeuer hath smack sounde doctrine abolished thus much also may annexed thom rhedones thomas redon thorough pope tyranny burned antonius others frenchman carmelite frier martyr wrate hereof sayd rome many abhominations church needed much reformation vnlawfull cursinges pope ought feared many torture burned rome tyme eugenius yeare antonine partes title cap suppose man doth playnely perceaue see though would surcesse prosequute men may duely vprightly esteeme whole see pontificall religion whiche seemeth purpose erected discorde rayse vppe vproares tumultes whereupon seemeth much straunge osorius dare shamelesly impudent obiect sectes sedicious trouble church sithence himselfe cannot honesty deny many cruell mortall diuisions faction many contentious sedition mutines haue sprong vp continued euen innermost bowells sacred see also log continuance himselfe cannot meanes blotte speake nothing meane time sectes error wicked doctrine moyling turmoyling one agaynst vnmeasurable quantitie skattered abroad skarse one thing wherein agree amongst selues differ v flee cleane away v onely christ himselfe also let passe sectes faction romanistes tourne agayne obiections properly touche v thus doth osorius contend agaynst v accusing gospell professe wise though yelded none fruit sectes troublesome comotios thys affirmeth commeth passe none cause haue shaken authoritie pope neuer bene banished might restored auncient estimation church tumultes either neuer bene el might haue easily bene pacified tend hereunto laste witte humbly submit selues bondage pope pleasaunt bayte whereat osorius would haue v fayne hooked whole practise endeuour hee shall able allure v must furnishe hys hooke agayne fresher bayte somewhat handsomely couched touchangle may fishe good catch foole last go let v eyther imagyne confesse vnto sectes diuisions opinion waxe somewhat rawe many place romish authoritie neglected shall winne thereby doth surmise matter sufficient make v forsake ye gospell christ knitt ye romishe halter vpon neckes agayne doth iudge reasonable matter want place ouer greedely geuen sectes deuisions may therefore lawfull others teache sound doctrine professe boldly people rule order good honest lyfe hath osorius gone schoole logick sophistry rather frame argument whiche cause though verye cause conclude meere fallaxe accidenta non causa vt causa true knowne matter maner disputation may admitted see cause contrary reason orator tertullus might seeme hane good challenge long sithence agaynst apostle tullian rhetorician doth mayntayne agaynst lutheranes apostle tyme neither wated stoare false apostle false brother dogges euill workman philetians hermoginistes simonistes nicholaitans neyther lack faccious fyrebrads amogst corinthian practize withdraw galathians simplicitie engraffed word fayning themselues iewes deede nothing lesse ensued chorinthians denyed christ come flesh many antichristes libertine seuerianes nouatianes sabellianes nepotianes manichean arryans pelagianes cataphrigianes donatistes yet thisthe fallaxe accident christia religio ought neuer ye worsse esteemed reason sect troublesome faccions wherewith entangled one age church euer without entruding themselues among godly teacher minister church would minister much matter discention deuision one maner wheate doth fructifie alike euery soyle none pregnaut earth found ye good carefull husbandman shall sow pure cleane corne euangelicall wheate neuer carefully enuious man forthwith creepe throw amongst noysome darnell hurtfull weedes neither doth wheate cease therefore wheate intermedled chaffe darnell euen hurtfull wilfull ouerthwart waywardnes cotrary sectes ye sound doctrine ye pure truth nay rather could appeare true church vnlesse assaulted kynde batterye dissentions opinion nowe onely peepe abroad eyther luther author anye hys allowance obiection perhappes might serue purpose hath euer earnestly effectually oppugned phanaticall faccions opinious luther hath done let accusation osorius filed vppe amongst hys false reproches lye vnlesse ye writinges speaches luther euery yea experience self iustifie saying true euer sharpely rebuke ye seditious vproares muster luth seriously zelously confute ye frantick article vnreasonable request ye boores germany wheas one generation opened mouth contrary luther appeased pacified tumultes protestantes lutheranesluther speciall aduersary sedition writing emportaunce luther agaynst confederate mu ster sprong vpp also secte laweles luther industry trauell wryting husht vppe ye author thereof reclaimed well enough known meanes vsed ye suppressing teptes carolastadius suenfeldians zuinglius hys booke entitled elenchus contra catabaptistas caluin de hereticis bullenger tiguirine hys inuectiue agaynst sectes time basileanes georgianes heluetianes people sauoye lumbardie seuere earnest pursuer rooting wicked opinion estraunged alienated desire faccions say haue geuen vnto v notable presidets example therof speak nothing church hath bene done england long sithence yea late also towardes ouerthrowing confuting erroneous opinion let portugall marchaut certifie letter notary soeuer corner soeuer yee lurcke suppose sent ouer england purpose become osor hys spye go ye experience osorius wh hath found luther sayth many sectes diuersities opinion name sect neuer bene raked vp together sound euer haue bene heard tyme abode bene made fayth pope romanistes likewise also suppose wee bene diliuered ethnick paganisme old idolatrye botche neuer infected church neyther ierusalem bene euer troubled anye tyme vnlesse christ bene borne neyther great many swarmes heretickes flusht abroad vnlesse apostle preached gospell therefore weltered back agayn puddle paganisme iewishnes hauing shaken away shoulder sincere pure religion christ according choppe logicke osorius wee may shroud selues safely company wilde faccious sectes daungerous diuisions osorius though fallen away last tackle man experience hath gathered courage yet vnto hym takyng handfast ankerholde christ owne wordes proofe pope chayre nowe see seemeth humayne terrestryall heauenly angelicallosor pag affirming power established ordinauce man chiefly word ordinaunce lord sauiour christ himselfe surely osorius perswade true shall beare bell away reason make apparaunt vnto v one simple naked reason double horned argument shall cutt like sworde besides authority holy scripture testimonyes auncient antiquitie also whereof boasteth himselfe litle skilfull affirmeth knoweth true experience go remayneth declare vnto v authoritie sacred scripture length wherein testimony auncient antiquitie found thou must needes attend while perhappes tell thee hereafter gentle reader osor leysure tell thee let suffice thee ye man hath spoken vouchsafe present interprete hys speaches oracle sweete honny much hitherto touching maiesty see rome rom nistes obedience rowardes princesthe next vnto hath placed order obedience yelde vnto prince maruell man reade laugh also beleue sure osor himselfe could stay laugh himselfe el doughtles disposed dally v wrate wordes pleasauntly deuised cunningly couleredpag sayth refuse aucthoritie lawfull power howe truely speak herein reueretly esteeme prince obediently behaue selues higher authoritie hubly acknowledge refuse commaundement magistrate wee take taste please conference faythfull historiographer course affayres experience whereof actes monument prince doe make mencion finally search antiquitie selfe whereof make selfe experte well beseene beginne first empire greecethe empero translated grecyanes frenchman pope contrary oathes lawfull succession whereof contynued constantine founder thereof yeares lesse ye bishop rome yt tyme would haue refused subiect authoritie higher power hadriane leo hauing rooted kingdome desiderius lombardes contrary faith allegiaunce presume hardye pluck away imperiall maiesty afterwardes right true heyres vnto whiche aswell bishop theselues also italiane natio submitted obliged selues othe lesse greekes theyr owne appointemente traslate fro greekes frenche nacion although charles selfcharles great vnto diademe imperiall geuen seeme worthy registred amongst vertuous famous prince one endued church rome greatest treasure possession liberty yet cause sufficient wherefore maiestie sacred empyre bee vyolated oppressed manifest iniuries namely sithes ouerthrow state could choose draw wonderfull trouble rancour harte thing happened deed long euen meanes thereof chiefly came passe yt emperours east west enflamed agaynst ech perpetuall deadly vnquenchable hartburning hatred enmity also greece left naked helpes became open road turkes sarracens suppressing whose power recouery countreythe creek inuaded turkes knowe whether whole power ye romanistes haue retched vttermost euer able preuayle admitte translation empyre came either speciall prouidence god attribute worthines carolus necessitie tymes mittigate matter plausible colourable excuse yet excrable sawcines romish bishopps sufficiently accquited hereby durst presumptuously arrogant tyme pope present imagine authoritie claime peter may priuileadge insolent vsurpacion ouer kingdomes earth theyr iniurious transposing liste doth waraunt shamelesse challenge lineall succession authoritie deriued peter himselfe vnto successor release quarrell let v proceede doth ensue state greece therefore wise rent torne sunder maiesty french empire begann thenceforth aduaunce selfe whiche yet free tyranny pope preserue royaltye maiestye owne prowesse well enough yet could gard selfe altogether safely circumuerted fraudulent crampes iniurious practises sacred see whereas established auncient ordinaunce euen tyme constantine great lawfull anye persone throughout christendome take vpon hym dignitie bishop vnlesse imperiall maiesty beyng thereunto sollicited ratified electionan auncient ordinaunce right emperour pope whereas also ordinaunce concluded vpon confirmed betwixt hadrian charles great pope hold contented byshoppely preminence authoritie ouer clergye administer thinges appertayned fuction bishoppe preaching sound doctrine regyment direction ecclesiasticall discipline interest authoritie choosing appoynting bishoppes shoulde specially resyant reserued imperiall maiesty hys posteritie according receaued approued constitucion hys predecessor election bishop much pope hymselfe adiudged legitimate vnles emperour geuen hys consent might likewise lawfull pope beyng chosen call cou sell bishop make anye innouacion alteration rite ceremonyes church neyther yet determine thing without aduise ratification emperour say auncient custome long time constantine great approued custome established iudgement enacted law decreed vpon afterward full cosent assent partes wtout ye publique voyces full acclamacions whole synode recorded also especiall decree sacred councell coulde euer haue beleaued bishoppes doe owe humble duetifull reuerence higher power would enfring swarue one title much owne decree beyng cleare manifest notoriously concluded vpon tyme nothing coulde make bee myndefull duety reason prescription antiquitie shame oathe fidelitie would attempt first picke quarrell agayust decree deliuered constantine concluded vpon charles great carefulnes seueritte mayntayned successor charles immediately death charles afterwardes vyoletly breake thea sunder maugre ye power maiesty emperours hath bene aboundantly declared stephen pascalis hadriane martine hadriane many successours sayd hadrian although fraunce seemed behalfe somewhat better courage constancy brydlyng insolency pope germanie wasthe maiestye empyre translated fraunce germany pope afterwardes whole ofspring charles lyne beyng co tinuaunce time cleane worne maiestie ye empire turned ouer vnto saxon condition couenauntes reuiued emperours otto first otto thryd extaunt yet decree remainyng recorde amongest pope canones pope example hadrian doth say doth geue full power vnto otto emperour elect pope establishe see apostolicke confirme bishop denounceth withall great greeuous penaltie vpon would hardy consecrate bishop without authoritie emperour thereunto first obteined wherefore predecessours charles great successours good emperours euen vntill tyme otto thryd preserued selues chief onely iurisdiction pope byshops election inuiolable withall conueyed state empire vnto selues either lawfull succession approued election without authoritie byshop rome wherof decree chiefly otto thyrd concluded vpon gregory playne euident demonstration whereby generally proclaimed thenceforth right iurisdiction electing romaine emperour remaine germaines onelya degree gregory concluded vpon otho thyrd emperour lawfull byshoppe rome create emperour ye state germanie aduaunce dignitie thynges thought good recite touchyng lawfull election emperours byshops end reader may lesse difficultie conceaue iudge aright shall hereafter spoken whole substaunce pontificall obedience first whereas osorius doth say power mainteyned ordinaunce appointement christ selfe easily confuted edictes emperours mentioned enacted election byshops ought none otherwise ratified legitimate confirmation maiestie imperiall touchyng hath annexed prayse commendation pope obedience refuse ordinauce lawfull authoritie herein seemeth speaketh altogether though neuer read antiquity former age monumentes history otherwise vouchsafe diligently peruse actes pope especially succeeded otto henry thyrd pollitique enterprise counsel proude contention emporte sauor whereunto tende denounce nay rather proclaime testifie peruerse waywardnesse continuall bent rebellion agaynst lawfull power prince earth although arrogaunt insole cy beyng long tyme reasonably well snafled greeke frenche emperours would yeld prerogatiue auncient constitution permitted vnto themthe wayward rebellion pope alwayes agaynst imperiall maiestie could raunge licentiously hawtynesse might whereafter hunted yet neuerthelesse takyng yoake subiection greeuously foreclose passable way largesse maiesty whereby hope oppresse emperours left occasion vnsought flackt oportunitie offered might minister vnto matter title clayme translate vnto selues dispensation cause ecclesiasticall election byshops could bring passe knew would matter difficultie either hinder election emperouran olde grudge pope agaynst emperours bestowyng ecclesiasticall promotion proceede otherwise listed depose elected liked hauing attempted deuise sundry tymes vayne last death emperour henry crept couertly occasion colorable entraunce effectuall plausible enough supposed whereunto dishinherite empire withall aduaunce place peter kyng hungary presentyng vnto precious owch set cappe petra dedit romam petro tibi papa coronam rocke gaue rome vnto peter pope crowne vnto thee henry enough emperour cited rome defende cause pope adiudged penaunce namely renouncyng imperiall dignitie doe penaunce dayly space one whole yeare church doore peter paulerodolphe suborned agaynst lord emperour practize treason pope yea besides also barefooted barelegged personally crooch creepe kisse pope feete while pageaunt playeng meane rodolphe duke saxon suborned inuade empire vnto diademe sent inscription petra dedit petro petrus diadema rodolpho rocke gaue vnto peter peter geueth diademe vnto rodolph young emperour vnderstandyng matter dispatcheth away germany rodolphe beyng fiue battels disconfited put flight while laye dyeng presented right hand lost battel beheld spake byshops stoode maner right wherewith vowed fayth ye emperour hand become witnes testimony breach fidelity
