conrande henry grosse echarde sonne ecbert vdo geberde others suffered lyke punishmentes emperours good fortune alwayes preuailyng pope surceased practize neuerthelessethe pope beyng firebrand seditio doth prouoke sonnes rebell agaynst father sufficed teaze straugers treason vnlesse seduced naturall sonnes emperour witte conrade first immediatly decease henry sonne agaynst father wherepon ensued afterwardes horrible broyles length death emperour also yet vnhappy conspiracy henry sonne ioyning pope agaynst henry father happened happely side afterwardesgods iust iudgement executed vpon sonne rebelled agaynst father henry sonne withstad inordinate article ye byshops father refused lotharius pricked forewardes agaynst new practizes pope eue lotharius agaynst father made duke saxon mainteining ye quarell ye pope vanquished ye army henry ye emperour left destitute fredes throughly weried continuall trechery byshops constrayned relent yeld ouer right emperours therfore beyng thus weakened part brought vnder subiectio immediatly began spryng vp absolute power monarchy popethe pope absolute power yeare speciall practize hildebrand vrbane forbyd man thenceforth receaue ecclesiasticall promotio call inuestiture temporall authoritie whe accomplished effect began attempt matter much waighty witte byshops owe due obedience become pope uassalles stand courtesie wheras byshops subiect ye emperour hitherto election pope could holden legitimate emperour ratified agayne whereas alwayes heretofore lawfull authoritie imperiall succession deriued father sonnes without graunt allowaunce confirmation pope sacred holy father outragiously boylyng inward charitable zeale vnlade prince heauy burden authoritie lay vpon owne shoulder forsooth vnder colour false surmise horrible agaynst god outragiously presumptuous agaynst men pretende yt authoritie erect set vppe earthly empire kyngdomes dispose traspose pleasure listed geue cast vpon fro aboue terrene ordinaunce euen christ selfe lawfull man clymbe state imperiall lawfull election pope hereof many decree extaunt abroad shamefully forged much shamefully countenaunced faced maiestie imperiall subdued subiect popesthe maiestie empire beyng thus brought subiectio worne quite countenaunce intollerable arrogancy byshops grew outrage contented haue pluckt owne neckes colier lawfull obedience drew also vnto selues emperours interest lawfull authoritie creatyng pope enstallyng byshops callyng councels disposing ecclesiasticall promotios finally administryng ecclesiasticall matter emperours selues beyng thus made subiect vnto execrable sort moyle turmoyle oppresse enforcyng onely sweare allegeaunce obediece vnto prostrate selues kisse euen stinkyng feete also extollyng magnifieng owne absolute power monarchy meane space aboue kyngdomes earth gloriously vauntyng imperiall maiesty seuety tymes seuen tymes inferiour baser glory popedome wasde maior obedi cap insolitae de maior cap vnam sanctam alledging similitude speciall argument god sayd created two great lightes firmament creation heauen earth two begynnynges one begynnyng euen left nothyng emperour lowest sphere world wherein might beare preeminence whole chaos power generally seemed fast locke vp ensealed within one onely begynnyng pope rome onely may beleeue pope parasiteswhat kinde obediece pope vse towardes magistrate must lord lordes kyng kynges due fulnes power princely authoritie ouer maner subiectes beyng vndoughtedly true ratified generall consent historiographer man able deny beseech osorius beautyfull foreheaded haue rubbed shamefastnes away shame become fayth catholicke obedience many tymes bragged vpon wherewith affirme boldly refuse commaudement lawfull authoritie cofutation wordes shall say vnto much liues defend bewray great lyar though held peace chronicle hystories full example complainyng one thyng greeuously certeine singular continuall vnappeasable rebellion holy order agaynst lawfull magistrate call remembraunce osorius discretly humbly pope iohn conspiracie iohn abhominably practized otto emperour name behaued selfe conspiryng first berengarius afterwardes agayne sonne betwixt emperoures pope afterwardescontentio raysed betwixt emperours pope rehearsed hystories touche runne ouer many shall suffice present purpose first shall speake gregory neuer speake sufficiently practized afterwardes whereby might bryng passe haue empire vtterly troden vnder feete selues miserably wasted taken emperours handes withall might reteigne vnto selues authoritie ye keyes whole italy part traytorous reuolte confederacie conspired also part cardinalles together popethe troublesome sedition hadria pope himselfe skattereth abroad terrible flash flaming excommunication finally conspiracye ratified solemne oathe namely pope dye none admitted election except confederate faction meanes whereof knotte sacred societie might neuer seuered loe straunge chaunce while holy father busie hys excommunication cursinges flye slippyng downe hys throatehadrian choaked flye stopt vppe hys pypes choaked death yeare death adriane sentence cursse remainyng yet force frederick addresseth neuerthelesse contented humble submission themperour besides treadeth contumeliously vpon themperors necke hys feetethe vnspeakeable pride seditious pope commaunding bee proclaymed super aspidem basiliscum ambulabis c albeit neyther emperour humble submission could altogether suppresse hys heroicall courage vttering agayn singular president worthy personadge answered ye pope wise non tibi sed petro noting hereby honor soeuer humbly offereda president pope pryde farre passing tarquines pride done feare hee tyraunt reuerence owe vnto peter pope open mouth entercepted arrogantly saying et mihi petro done yeare beseech hartily syr ierome neuer haue reade monumentes knowledge antiquity whereof ye bragge much confesse haue read maner obedience higher power whereof write refuse could bee added expresse ye singuler lenitie humilitie thone monstrous luciferlike insolency arrogancy possible finde notable paterne vnspeakeable pryde kyng tarquin leo ye proud finally mighty speachiudas let lord rebuke sayth hee lawfull michaell speak reprochefully deuill shall say vnto blushe onely speake euill cursse higher power emperor whome authoritie maiesty ow due reuerence authoritie higher power ought duety assubiect themselues presume proudly pearch intollerable pryde make theselues coequalles speaking wise property euill seruauntes renounce mastershippe rebell agaynst superioritye superiour degree make fellowlyke vnto themselues nazianzen oration vpon holy penthecost would nazianzen haue sayd bene present theodore marque beholden goodly spectackle highe authoritie maiestie selfe onely prostrate pope feete troden vpon also durty heeles proud caterpiller would hee haue cryed open mouth troubled strau genesse matter antichrist come playnly personally seene haue spoken frederick first much vnlike vnto may troublesome estate frederick second adiudgedthe incredible fury outrage innocent honor gregory agrynst frederick sauing thone seemed entangled two leopardes onely endured continuall assaultes three venemous uypers immediately death innocent honor like warelike hackster setteth vpon themperour ruffleth agaynst hys cruell bulles excomunication gregory proud man helhound whelped none purpose sowe treachery treason frederick addressing supply asia necessary defence christianes agaynst saracen calleth back fro iourney immagineth deuises lettes pyketh quarrells agaynst hym accuseth knowe crymes forceth make hys purgation rome putteth pennaunce stirreth vppe vnspeakeable conspiraces agaynst hym wrappeth horrible curse finally raged outrage agaynst depart without taking leaue fininishing hys pennaunce sent countermaund ye christian armye syria renounce hym emperour followe hys conduct finally hee graunted suche would fight agaynst lyfe euerlasting emperour thus miserably circumueted ye cruell cramp pope hindered hys iourney coulde intercession released blinde ridicoulous course payment hundred xx thousand ounce goldethe filthy gaynes pope stopt throate vnsatiable prelate rather haue sayd rauening wolfe yeare may spoken innocetius doth sette vpon frederick emperour nothing degenerating gregorius madnes doth himselfe also lesse insolently ryde vpon frederick rayseth vproares agaynst flying lyon fraunce doth likewise thunder new stormes curse hym afterwardes forceth seuen electours choose new emperour yeare like rage vrbane men nickname called turbanus beyng enflamed cause frenchman make roade italy agaynst successor sayd fredericke yeare successours frederick vrbane clement kept warre enterlude beyng played caused hym leade strong armie italy ye nephewes ye frederick manfredus beyng slayne charles authoritie clement pope proclaymed king sicille ierusalem vnder condicio pay pope euery yeare thousand franckes beyng done conradinus sonne conrade true inheritour king sicile challenging ye kingdome auncestorsthe pope clement doth conspire death conrade frydericke marcheth forward certayne en gnes germaynes long coast viterbia pope holines beholding spake openly lead like lambe slaughterhouse hereupon trumpet sounding allarme armyes ioyning fight traytours discouering treacherye conradinus fredericke austriche taken prisoner pope beyng demaunded would haue done conradine aunswered like horrible tyger lyfe conradine quoth death charles whereupon conradine fredericke sundrye reprochefull skornes villanies cutte shorter heades commaundement pope yeare nicholas doth sowe seedes discention betwixt charles king sycile peter kyng arragonthus much charles clement thrust kingdome sicile sicile whereupon long followed wonderfull slaughter conspiracy agaynst frenchman watchword geuen sound bell slayne sicile men woman child slaughter though performed tyme martyne next successor yet michaell paloeologus raysed warres agaynst fryollers yeare shall sayd honorius also doth excommunicate peter arragon king sicile sturring vp agaynst phillippe king spaigne battell peter wounded dyed agayne bonifacethe seditiouse trouble boniface agaynst celestine agaynst family columne agaynst phillyppe frenche kyng agaynst albert emperour first excommunicated phillippe frenche king also sundry tymes proudly put back albert emperour making great suite hys confirmation neyther would wise confirme promised couenaunt yt conquer fraunce thrust phillippe hys kingdome maruell pope could ouerthrow kinges forasmuch challenged ye prerogatiue gouernemets spirituall temporall appeareth sixt booke decretalles whiche amongest others gratiane hath patched together yeare moreouer shall say clement doth prescribe lawes emperours farre acknowledging obedience ye lawfull magistrate amongst decree enacted themperours chosen electours might called kinges romaynes could wise become emperours receaued name dignitie imperiall pope besides also death euery emperour ye meane regiment vntill confirmation new ought order disposicion pope hys successours onely next thys clemet succeeded clemet endued sparcke clemecy hys predecessour vngentle nature fierce full trouble shamefully abused ludouicke theperourludouick emperour shamefully abused clement desturbed ye imperiall state vnmeasurably excommunicate byshops prince held themperour deposed fro ye electorship arch mentz fauored innocency themperour displaced fro byshoppricke enforced ye archbishoppes treuers saxone determine vpo emperour chosen themperour sent embassadours pope receaued fauour pope drew instrumet coditions annexed witte confesse error heresy prince cytties none depart fro empyre committe hymselfe child goodes possession hys mercy thenceforth neuer meddle without hys permissio sufferace article albeit theperour vnwilling yealde vnto yet pope perceaued state empyre woulde accepte hys owne sacred holynes vpon easter day appoynteth emperour charles appoynted emperour agaynst ludouick true emperour procuremet clement last ludouick beyng poysoned without procurement practize mercifull clement departed thys lyfe ierome marius doth record within yeare election charles yeare length charles pope annoynted emperour contrary ordinaunce state thend confirme dignitie imperiall hys sonne hys successor ioyneth league elector fayre promise bribe passeth ouer reuenewes thempyre elector establishe succession hym hys posteritie aeneas siluius doth report agayne elector bound sayd charles oathe shoulde neuer require restitution reuenewes agayne elector enioy euen day meanes whereof came passe romayne empyre beyng thus embased reuenewes empayred turkishe outrage hath long sithence freely possessed great part christendome without resistaunce like preuayle yet much power force christianes beyng rent asunder skattered abroad none power potetate eyther able dare adueture withstand mighty puyssaunce outragious furye verye cause mischiefes haue part issued fro pestilent sincke rome building hys rauenous neast none furniture scrappes hee skrapeth together violent seditious partaking faction dissentions prince hath brought christendome small handful ye last yt christian prince iarring alwaies emogest theselues seeme yt neuer willig one agree togethers prouisio made turckes able tyme make partyes good agaynst cotinuall inuasuones roades whiche tyraunt doth dayly make christendome haue shewed recordes example sufficient whiche true let osorius himselfe confute hys antiquitie whereof vauteth singuler skill true deede shall neuer able disproue become wonderfull obedience lawfull magistrate consideration maiestie sayth refuseth ordinaunce higher power doth yelde vnto cesar belongeth cesar yt vnto god yt due vnto god addeth moreouer beleeue according testimony paule lawfull magistrate established ordinaunce god resisteth lawfull aucthoritie outh adiudged much resiste man resiste god himselfe wordes hartyly vnfaynedly vttered professe honorably wordes meruayle fro whece came cruell rebellionthe onely pope rome common pestilence christianes europe ecclesiasticall seignorie agaynst superiour power whence mostruous turmoyles empire execrable alteration state many hundred yeares came first principall cause whiche tumultes commotios alteration prang el fromout boyling fornace pope canckered contumacye agaynst liege lordes emperoures hence came warres emperour henry fridericke hence battell ludowicke bauiere ludowicke austriche vproares maiestie kyngdomes onely violated power weakened prince combatyng ech like brother cadmus destroyed church also miserably torne many godly conscience driuen greeuous anguish minde perillous staggering vncerteintie outragies byshops extoll enlarge false forged dominion conceaued false forged opinio effect canker botch church europe besides stroake shall authority paule forbiddeth resistauce beare amongest ruffling prelate delightyng sporting selues priuely see prince subiectes together eareshow little romish obedience doth agree rule paules obedience rende teare sunder common weales publique peace tranquilitie church ciuill discentios seditious bulles pestilent libelles priuiledges immunity exemptyng selues publique iustice ciuill lawes vse abuse monarch tetrarches lyke bondeslaues owne lust pleasure blesse curse commaunde intreate rewarde punish allow disallow set vp set downe treade vpon heeles yea papane power maiesticall prerogatiue cast downe hell betray poyson true report grecian frech germany emperours playne patternes fury doe euidently aboundauntly declarechilpericke french kyng smart therof felt chilpericke french kyng pope deposed kingdome thrust monckery henry kyng engladhenry kyng england iohn kyng england whose princely crowne take fro head reteigned space foure dayes iohn kyng england first driuen kyngdome pope innocent length poysoned monke henry emperour germany ye destroyed poyson ye victor likewisevictor byshoppe whose lyfe also certeine relligious lozell owne order cut short white blacke moncke dominicane friar ministryng vnto sacrament dypped deadly poyson shall say phillippe french kyngphillippe french kyng agaynst pope boniface procure edward kyng england mainteyne mortall warres shall speake henry emperour emperour rome agaynst rebelles reuolted byshop collen leodicensis tumult leodicensis slayne breuities sake passe ouer infinite duke prince sycile arragon tuscane calaber naples venice germany fraunce england boheme italy rome emperours kynges prince marquestes duke counsellours senatours consul dare auow neuer horribly molested whole lyues malice trechery holy father fraternitie whole see may seeme haue attayned loftyness absolute power sole superioritie none end teare rende abroad dissipate lawfull authority potentate magistrate established ordinaunce almighty god happened late dayes attept pius thinke yet slipt remebrauncewicked practize pius agaynst emperour would graut cofirmation bishop iseberg vnlesse would promise ye bishop mentz neuer assemble ye electours pope made acquainted yea gaue cosent thereto pope might haue copassed doughtlesse wonne spurres suppressing authoritie electours euer insolecy byshop iseberg stiffely oppugne beyng scorched horrible lightening pope curse deposed byshoppricke palatine fridericke vndertooke defend righteous lawfull causeout recordes germany apperteinyng state electours sauety germany meanes wherof matter came handy stroakes iust righteous cause preuailed beseeche osorius challenge vnto selues lieutenauntshyp one citie onely whole world teach emperours reigne selues vnder pope affirme right create kynges prince doth belong vnto selues person euer mynde geue due honor high power whenas acknowledge power earth aboue selues whenas late yeares pope clement kyng englad excommunicated pope clement bent thunderboltes excommunication agaynst henry kyng england whenas also late pope pius keepeth sturre agaynst elizabeth queene england waxed wroch agaynst souereigne lady queene elizabeth threw agaynst truell curse seditious bull whenas cutteth fro regall dignitie congregation christian assaulteth slaunders reproches nameth pretensed queene proclaimeth refuge runneagates whenas procureth subiectes become traytours teazeth armes agaynst naturall princesse yea whenas releaseth behalfe oathe allegeaunce prelate obey counsell paule wherein euery soule commaunded submitte selfe highe power place paule chrisostome interpretyng doth say onely byshoppes prophetes euangelistes also apostle selues subiect law let v briefly runne ouer remnaunt osorius fableosori pag b hereof cometh passe doe decree onely cannon byshops also ordinaunces prince beyng directly contrary lawes god ought obeyed duetyfully end tendeth talke witte holy father may seeme nonlatin alphabet warre god whosoeuer resisteth lawfull magistrate resisteth god therfore decree ordinaunces lawes prince beyng contrary lawes god ought duely obserued pope decree may pype vppe kynde caterbrawle osorius yet well acquainted catholick masking world please noua hispania el calecute v thinke finde foolish follow fantasticall deuise credite affirmatios ouermuch enured ingglyngs sufficiently instructed wyly beguilye well acquainted ambitious hawtynes continuall cruell combattes prince suppressing kynges exemption politique ciuill lawes many hundred yeares haue brought passe vnmeasurable vnsatiable tyrannythe maner popishe obediece prince monarch chief potentate world become subiectes vassalles vnder authoritie daryng mutter much hisse agaynst comaundementes vnlesse fatherhoodes gape vpon osor like fine man steppeth forth endeuouryng persuade wt sweete eloquece ye packe popish priesthoode already trussed vpp offereth selfe alwayes humbly applyable ordinau ce commaudemetes prince higher power repugnaunt agaynst lawes ordinauces god come let v take tast seraphicall obedience let v set example may come passe hereafter least hartely wished come passe deede put case noble sebastian kyng portingall reuerence beare name puissaunt prince geue expresse commaundement idolles picture image pluckt church surely commaundement nothyng disagreable ordinaunce god beseech tell would osorius would obey commaundemetes dare scarsely beleeue matter commaunded kyng shall euer commaunded prince shall hereafter neither doe know selfe osorius neither inquisitiue knowe whereabout noble kyng portingall doth bestew tyme preset speake ought lord whose handes harte prince secret inspiration holy ghost enduce comaunde one tyme pope say would permit yea syr beleeue deede therfore ye king adueture geue attempt though wholy bent thereunto neither would osor obey though yet surely word god would permit though pope cardinalles spurne kicke agaynst meane tyme wonderfull authoritie kynges nation miraculous obedience catholickes whereas neither prince libertie enact establish owne common weales ought lawfull subiectes obey prince lawes matter approued word god vnlesse pope authoritie beyng farre higher either authoritie man power god obteyned first whose crafty deuises lordes prince forced issue may lawfull institute ordinaunce shall please byshops priestes shauelynges elbow execute whatsoeuer prince commaunde whenas prince may commaunde thyng deede shalbe guided lead lippe owne subiectes singuler superexcellent obedience subiectes towardes magistrate departyng while fro portingall let v turne penne towardes spayne though swaruyng litle fro question many monethes agoe arriued english shyppe richly laden english ware besides sundry passenger xx mariner lesse beyng vnder sayle seaborde worshyp lord countrey manerthe horrible crueltie spanish inquisitours english marchauntes owne mother toung shyppe whether carried right course forced tempest arriued length vpon coast spayne shippe scarse thrust nose hauen occasion know holy inquisitours beyng flocked together flew shyppe sommon mariner appeare inquisition constraint oathe enforced shew bookes common prayer hereupon threw prison queene elizabeth hauyng intelligece matter addresseth letter vnto kyng phillippe deliuery subiectes kyng desirous graunt request made aunswere wanted good might vttermost also power princely authoritie entreated earnestlythe king spayne subiect owne subiectes inquisitours maiestie sacred inquisition kingdome force selfe must needes obedient vnto ye see notable kyng osorius may commaunde nothing kyngdome shall like subiectes ye wont sorte obey commaundement kyngs yes ye obey deede ordinaunces selues makehow catholicks obedient subiectes owne kynges commaunde ye otherwise obey may serue owne turnes list selues fiue hundred yeares sithence lesse fewe kyngs haue bene litle brittaine haue bene greeuously molested beggerly monckes amogest others monckes cauterbury chiefly insolently anselme withstand william rufus anselme henry kynges englad proudly theobald behaue selfe counsell set libertie vnpunished must also become confederate queene isabels conspiracy agaynst kyng edward passeouer ye meane space sundry outragies conspiracy sedition agaynst owne prince ludeines coate euer beggerly moncke lowsie cowled lozell supported pope authoritie armed granneshotte excommunicatio would quickely contemne set nought potentate magistrate neuer mighty whereas auncient custome established solemne consent amongest auncient antiquitie byshopprickes dignity possessios ecclesiasticall disposed geuen speciall co firmation kynges prince appeale made pope rome cause without kyngs consent popish ambition preuailed farre forth immediately enthronizyng hildebrand kynges called kynges onely name rule order administratio cause caught away kynges remaine monckes like shauelynges would rule roast game becker slayne kyng henry made earnest intercession cappe hand monckes caunterbury priour wherof one odo sake would vouchsafe archb admittaunce withall nominated credite catholickes worthy commendation ready diligent performing kynges commaundementes matter doth sufficiently declare selfe farre pope would yeld iote kynges requestes seemed grow great choller matter agayne picture crosse must worshippedbesides rable couled generation neuer sufficiently commended added also amplifie royaltye romishe sinagogue ornamentes small emportaunce first aboue others honorable signe crosse aduaunced temple house onely sette abroad also high wayes crossed vpon men foreheades also ouer besides crucifixe man memory shall want matter occupyed vpon prouision made innumerable image picture goddes shee goddes likewise placed church catholickesimages sainctes sanctus e holy remembraunces holy saintes warrant whose picture doe onely worshippe religiously vpon earth inuocate saintes themselues heauen make patrones proctours heauen neede shall require men prouident circuumspect surely intercession christ alone sheeding precious bloud fayle happely finde fauour hys father shall forthwith steppe forth help neede become mediator sinnes people emongst saincts dwelleth sainct tho beckett archbishop canterburylord bloud thomas graunte prayer wend c whose blouds sake church doth desire prayer may wend place tho ascend also dwelleth anselme sainct dunstane sainct christopher sainct margarete killdragon saincte george great nomber like vnto euery blinde man may easily see many famous history yt traytoures factious seditious yea also neuer borne yet braynesicke imagination men pield deuises olde dottards onely occupy idle heades withall osorius doth stoughtly defend idolles necessary helpes meanes rayse vppe men forgetfulnes herein meete two occurrantes whiche neuer wonder sufficientlyno nation world hath picture grauen image church papistes onely first whenas picture maner grauen image farre learne seene temple sinagogues ye iewes turcks sarracenes moore moscouites tartareanes asie aphricke europe finally part whole worlde much temple infidells eyther liuing dead much maruayle howe papistes onely dazeled monstruous blindenes vnderstanding drowned bottomeles gulfe phanaticall forgettfulnesse seeme owne conceiptes skarse religious vnlesse bedawbe temple euery side picture poppettes moreouer mawmettes signes sainctes erected church none ende put beholder remembraunce saincts themselues osorius doth stoughtly mayntayne meruell meaneosorius doth defend picture kalenders remebraunce church papistes rude vnlettered multitude christianes permitted euen day prostrate themselues sett vp burning taper cense franckencense perfume catholicke description witte thinges appertayne fayth workes sacramentes sacred mother church neyther fayth catholickes playnly seen heretiques doth eyther diminishe hope attayning honest lyfe vtterly feare afety osorius pag doth worke thys rather make men willyng embrace vertue yet desiste neuerthelesse stand meane tyme alwayes feare seueritie god iudgement pray whosoeuer caried ardent fayth vnto christhow fayth catholickes ioyned hope feare doth beautifie aboudant stoare vertue moreouer whenas men know christ seuere iudge hys commaundementes alwayes continuall feare well whereunto tendeth osorius maisterly debated touching fayth hope feare co fesse playnely dul capacitie able co ceaue asse vnlesse open thinges ye treate vpon distincktly playnely except ye come length somewhat nearer matter whereupon debate meane thus fayth doth weaken man hope may ought god assistaunce lyue godly vertuously worlde gaynesay herein nay rather one thing doth ye fayth gospell emprinte v deepely desire lyue godly doth teach carefully good worke coupled fayth begonne fayth sence meaning wordes tend ende ye thinke force fayth consiste onely thisconfidence workes osor fayth open euery man hope attayn perfectio lyfe workes sake may make v righteouse sight god altogether agaynst dare boldly affirme voyce byshoppe deuyne filthy heretique moreouer annexe feare hereunto vnderstand thus christian fayth ought alwayes lincked together feare god man deny racke feare god seuere iudgement adding distinction extremityhow feare ought ioined fayth gospell leaue vnto v assuraunce sauetye deteigne men wauering mammering ye seeme affirmacion emplye thus much scripture promise euen though god would deale elect onely rigour law promise grace lesse blockishe also marcheth next rancke touchyng workesof workes wherein dignitie church deserueth singuler wonderfull commendation true beleeued true churchosorius pag catholickes beleue sayth good workes godly personage defiled leste infection vncomelynesse partes vpright holy make men righteous holy exercized touchyng matter matter freewill also hath bene spoken sufficiently already ceremonyes sacrament pag next fable ensueth concerneth ceremony sacramentes holy mother churche rome doth obserue order beleueth holynes ceremony religio sacrament newly instituted yet deuised witte fine man haddon auncient greatest antiquitie preserued full generall consent holy father ought purely reuerently worshypped c man may dare bold without singuler impudencie much grudge agaynst ceremony holy aunciet long continuaunce euen age euander suppose instituted sayth wonderfull trauaile holy father established autenticke cosent though otherwise growen neuer huge quantitie may seeme ouerwhelme christian people vnmeasurable rable albeit many christian wedded vnto yt bidding adiew christian fayth small nomber repose chief ankerhold holynesse righteousnes trinckets yea though also striue preserue much stoughtly couragiously law selfe commaundementes god runnyng lightly ouer ceremony presseth foreward sacramentes confession first next euchariste whe fall sayth first meaneth word falle consideration righteousnesse settled interrupted course liuyng well giftes holynes righteousnesse powred euen christ selfe assertio doth emporte reason falles spottes filthy life stand together great many ornamentes righteousnes receaued christ selfe great righteousnesse needeth confession much men let v ascribe frayltie man natu e men may lumper trippe go sanctuary ye afterwardes flee reliefe forsooth rotten plancke may saue man amyddes swallowyng gulfe beyng throwen ouer boorde seaof confession iudgement priest say vnto christ ratherosori pag forsooth bycause absence entreaty made proctours aduocates christ absent whenas iohn doth send v backe agayne vnto notwithstandyng speakyng wise1 iohn haue sinned haue aduocate father christ iesu propiciatory sacrifice sinnes say haue priest vpon earth either first second table besides iesus christ onely deede worketh embassadours sometyme taught mouth apostle wrought miracle euen also proclaimeth gospell godly minister yet doth neuerthelesse worke heauen continually though worke minister earth furthermore neither doth vse seruice seruauntes minister thynges whose externall ministery necessaryly employeth many thynges though could selfe doe nothyng without seruice lastly true embassadours forreine badge cognizaunce doe vaunt selues embassadours let v proceede doe ye ye tumble heapes together confesse selues priest honorable vmpier doth geue lengthpag making first straight inquisition sinnes doth force wisedome searche wounde beyng disclosed applyeth playster thereunto accordyng qualitie grief seemeth conuenient happe vpon priest dayes ouer many much vnlike vnto plautus doth describe certeine placeplaut bacchid fooles wittlesse naturalles blockisse doltishe ass dronckardes c let v admitte priest worthy function priest accordyng capacitie wisedome considering ye qualitie ye trespasse plaister doth apply ye soare wholesome one warraut accordyng ye dignitie person representeth person christ pardoneth absolueth offendour cleane sinne yet enioyning certeine penaunce new clensed soule trespassour may vnderstad bounde make satisfaction ye trespasse doyng maruell enough manifest giddynesse idle brayne beyng barreine onely discretion voyde also altogether common sence feelyng almost offendour say acquited absolution priest undoughtedly absolued priest gay iewell true true deede god doth geue absolution first assure v tell truth ye alledge scripture forsooth wordes gospellluke heareth heareth despiseth despiseth heare acknowledge wordes wordes christ must returne againe principall pointe questio shall assured priest trnly nomber christ doth point vnto v pronowne youthe charecter priest say shauen crowne ought sufficient warraunt vnto v ueryly neither doe reiect outward vocation made men neither ought expect maner embassadours sent christ fent apostle heretofore yet much beast mentioned ye apocalips character beast apocalips hath proper peculiar marke christ doth curse shew better marke priest bald scraped scalpe sithence christ sendeth v cosideration fruites spirituall markes doctrine truth much striue let crowes white let absolution marked priest vndoughted oracle also pointe stand vpon demaunde whenas trespassour doth obtaine priest absolutio wherof spake whece doth absolution receaue effectuall operation priest marke fayth repentaunt rather priest marke onely doth fayth baptisme worke v whereunto serueth article creede beleeue remission sinnes agayne depend vpon onely fayth repentaunt purpose priestly confession couple together imagination one force without kynde couple agree doctrine makyng curious exact distinction partes penaunce sacrament leaue chinker fayth peepe acquainted name fayth part therof iew turke sorrowfull cotrite hart ioyne confession mouth withall satisfaction guilt terme sinnes washed cleane away therfore thinke christia man beyng endued pure fayth bewaylyng offence vnfaynedly withall hart lookyng vpon christ eye fayth vpon brasen serpent craue pardon without hochpotte priestly confessio shall obteine salue soare deny lombardine questioner would fayne learne priestly confession first instituted innocent thrust church frequeted vnaduoydeable necessitie whe christ spake vnto woman thy faith hath saued thee math place speakyng woman forgaue many sinnes bycause loued much luke agayne excludyng helpes willed maister synagoge beleeue onely mar sayd vnto thing possible doth beleeue mar sicke palsey sinnes forgeuen thee luke without openyng mouth confession shall say sinnes therfore forgeuen bycause word confession neuer heard shall say god hath heard confession bycause wanted priestes tyme suffice open secretes hart vnto god wordes chrisostome emporte writyng vpo psalme homel vpon psalme homel thou ashamed sayth confesse thy sinnes confesse dayly thy hart bidd thee confesse thy fellow seruaunt may reproche thee cofesse thee may heale thee agayne place bidd thee come people thou accuse thy selfe others haue thee follow wordes prophet saying open thy sinnes vnto lord confesse thy faultes therfore vnto god open thyne offence vnto true iudge harty prayer thy toug remorse consciece c yet speake though priuate confession sinnes ought receaued church vnprofitable whereas counsell godly minister desired consolation required troubled conscience exercize priuate absolution word gospell authoritie gospell vttered minister yet doe allow name priuate confession wherewith haue wickedly entangled godly conscience may neither participate wt nature sacrament deliuered comauded god law moreouer neither necessary tymes though without sinnes forgeuen contrite sorowfull hart groudyng selues vpon infallible fortresse fayth wherfore farre loue sacred eare co fessio osori may god name go priest ofte much ye liste content selues washed ye bloud iesu christ repose hope affiaunce whatsoeuer alone trouble v hinder v beseech thus directed authoritie scripture beleeue dypped ouer head care comfortable sacred fonte sufficient clensing purgyng sinnes agayne neither blessed bloud iesu christ wayes effectuall vnto v appliable comfort wayes fayth onely beleeue name whatsoeuer resemblaunce truth decree expresse vnto v doughtlesse scripture cannot lyeactes wherein taught harte washed cleane fayth remission sinnes receaued fayth christ iesu actes addyng moreouer testimony prophetes must come passe many beleeue iesu christ shall obteine forgeuenesse sinnes actes needelesse stole catholicke confessours altogether fruteles towardes cleansing conscience meane space soule afflicted greeuous scrupule wherein brotherly consolation may seeme requisite gaynsay man goe godly learned minister nay rather hartely allow therof selues also many tymes yet repaire togethers tendeth rather seeke counsell comfort necessitie craue pardon sinnesthe reformation confession neither compell man make speake chrisostomes owne wordes necessitie freedome neither make sacrament therof yet require beadroll sinnes neither doe enforce person state tymes yeare finally burdeine clogge satisfactory penaunce horrible wherein wonder see fallen vpon rest catholickes osorius thinke veryly dame folly selfe could speake toung would neuer vtter wittles foolerythe superstition satisfactio hauing first pardoned acquited offendour cleare crime enioyne afterwardes penauce whereby compelled pardon receaued make satisfaction notwithstandyng send purgatory must satisfie vttermost far thyng beseech right reuered father honor great wisedome filthynes conscience thoroughly clensed first confession purpose serue satisfactory penall lawes offence beyng pardon remaineth nought satisfied throughly clensed whereunto auayleth priestly stole priestly crossing becommeth absolution promise euer say offence forgeuen must forced make satisfaction maner composition moreouer christ haue made full satisfaction sinnesa poena culpa satisfaction generall release punishmet crime neede humaine satisfaction agayne christes satisfaction full satisfaction must enioyned temporall punishment demaunde priestes stole crossing pope pardon ca geue releasing punishment crime bloud iesu christ sonne god able geue proceede catholicke people haue spunge penaunce cleane purged spottes blottes conscience happely stay suppose steppyng foreward vertue vertue myndes beyng furnished manerosori pag doe forthwith addresse selues holy mystery miraculous euchariste rushyng rashely thereunto vnwasht handes prouerbe feare tremblyng doe humbly kneele vpon knee great reuerence open mouthes priest ready receaue heauenly banquet yt tast bread wine terrestriall matter yet substaunce see eye handle finger substaunce bread wine beyng vtterly driue away one morsell receaue swallow body christ borne virgine mary ye naturall bloud shed side though vnder forme colour kynde wine bloud contrary sense feelyng eye hades yea body deede naturally corporally substauncially present christ say full whole qualitie qua titie dimension euen sitteth right hand father christ may seeme dwell lo ger heauen haue translated selfe much precious purer tabernacle hereupon cometh passe priestes monckes bishop familiar guestes christosori pag nourished heauenly foode dayly stregthened thereby doe attaine heauenly euerlastyng treasure happely doe withstad rage lust stoughtly keepe vowed chastitie purely maruell whosoeuer nourished sacred body christ carry dayly myndes onely body also chosen necessitiefro whece holy lyfe great chastitie papistes doth proceede drousinesse sinnes must shake heauenly dawnyng cleare light must shyne must needes replenished heaue ly treasure yeld glorious fruites righteousnesse true presidentes angelicke holynes chastitie scattered abroad euery commo people tell many commendable tale doe manifestly declare let forgotten among maydenly yea poolished beautified blossomes vertue amongest one thyng chiefly happeneth straunge incredible spoken especially byshoppes massemongers beyng enuironed many comfortable sacrifice dayly glory christ sauetie people consisteth chiefly hard frosen thoroughly benommed seeme scarse warme yea altogether without sense feelyng duety towardes christ carefull regard flocke remorse conscience celebratyng memory byrth christ resurrection ascention feast pe therost also memoriall alone whereof ought myndefull euery day euery houre seekyng occasion day heare somewhat may conduce sounde pure multitude holy dayes ge sonnettes part idolatrous prayer inuocations manifestly repugnaunt iniurious glory christ vtterly abolish without cause iewes solemne holy dayes tymes past though nomber many yet prescribed god selfe also bloud offringes sacrifice fastynges easter solemnity brasen serpent wherof log folowed lawfull vse beyng certeine signes meane instrument shadowes leadyng endes whereunto instituted acceptable enough vnto god turnyng catte ye panne placed chief worshyppyng god principall marke true religion thynges owne nature last least valew horrible execrable became sight god man signes except snch signes onely owne nature appropried thinges selfe haue alwayes perpetuall necessary cause consequence coupled parentes alwayes adiudged wicked though childre vnthrifty go kinde alwayes measured owne principle groundes chiefly whence taketh roote otherwise whereas accounted christian name profession infected semblable vyces corruption follow vpon rule logick christian ye cause though stopp ianglyng cause neuerthelesse remaineth vnuaquishable much defece fortified thoroughly wt owne strength force ye truth yt may know first ought defend meane oppugne behoueth v coclude vpon point entangle discourse wt know crooked crabbed conueyaunce choppyng matter together knittyng reknittyng one thyng vpon ye neither agree selfe man el perfitly determine meanyng doe accuse haddon suppose preacher nouelty osorius doth accuse reformed church noueltye must know wherein define noueltie consiste lyfe lead doctrine professe meane lyues therein wicked may new ca auncient vyce question doctrine onely ye transpose disputatio onely instituted vpo doctrine racke ye lyues maners men last comaunde haddon deliuer vnto example auncient vertue though could forthwith condemned heretique know lyue apostolicke lyues worke miracle apostle wrought purpose haddon affirmeth may iustifie well enough church england doth vary institution apostolicque thyngthe reformed church dayes doe vary fro apostle institution doctrine meanyng doctrine fayth religion seeme true coceipt behoued oppugne doth defende defence co cerneth principle substaunciall pointes christian doctrine wherein sayth church vary nothyng institution apostle part ouerpassing matter apperteinyng doctrine writhe wreste state whole questio morall vertues owne conceipt seeme haue notably besturred selfe agaynst haddon winne much lutheranes haue attained excellencie apostolique integritie hereupon spende wast smoaky pouder miserable rhetoricke wherein bewray weakenes cause much subtill steight deepe deuise would haue pleased deale franckly sticke discouer grief minde lyfe howsoeuer matter made v heretiquesmaner lyfe thought neuer disorderous maketh heretique made catholickes maliciously incensed agaynst v filthy soeuer seeme fraternitie wollowyng weltryng abhonimation besides licentiousnesse maners bene nought el doughtles haue found fatherhoode rest profession good maisters enough onely good maisters foreward felowes mate vyces kynde abhomination besides yea fellowes onely auncientes captaines therein filthynesse liues pride ambition cruelty sauadgenes robbery disreipt violence arrogancy lust despising magistrate euer monstruous v wherein vnmeasurably exceede v therfore dissolute maners vnbridled course licentious lyfe haue made skittish forced boyle beastly rancour agaynst v surely tro pet ought much rather haue bene founded agaynst pope rome cardinalls copesmates ye crew much greeuous matter may foude quarelled reproued prick make kicke bycause breake god yeares prescription time say priestes old lawe chalenge vnto themselues lawfull right sit moyses chayre ergo man lawe doth adiudge man wrogfull dissensor able prescribe fifty yeares possession aunswere priestes old lawe doe chalenge right sitt moyses chaire respect continued prescription time doe confesse true deede yet prescription notwithstanding lord call priestes theeues murtherers agayne touching allegation wrongfull disseisor lawe prescription time doe aunswere ciuill lawe true deed god lawe yet also rule ciuill lawe wrogfull disseisor shall ohtayne though prescribe neuer long prynces duke earles equall rather exceedyng sumptuousnesse wayted vpon wyth stately trayne wheresoeuer goe ryde many also rynged chayned man may lawfully lyncke lubberly rowt monstruous mounckes false fryer stead gard finally one thing done common wealth pryncely courtes iolly rufflers haue conueyed church christ ambytious emulation kynges emperours enduced hereunto necessary preseruation theyr state doe ioyne vnto counsellor pier haue theyr ambassadours messenger haue also theyr pryuy ligiers skowtes doth pope want consistory hath holy father synodaryes doth lack legate nati legate de latere wheresoeuer sent vse lesse pompe piere potetate highest nobility yea though neuer sumptuous destitute skowtes spyes hath priuelye lurkyng euery armed wt treason pynche prince courtes theyr councels yea ye closettes pryuy chamber kynges queenes ye thinke thys comely concordaunce osorius reasonable resemblaunce chrystes lyfe commaundementes agreeable apostle euangelists auncient father wt ordinaunces primitiue church former presidet elder lord cryeth gospelliohn comparison betwixt pope kyngdome christ kyngdome lyuing father sent eue send thinke sent world establish new regyment earth like romulus builde stately emperiall rome ye thinke minister chryst sent sort sonne himselfe sent fatherluke christ proceedeth yet foreward receaue ye holye ghost sayth whosoeuer sinnes shall forgeue forgeuen whosoeuer sinnes shall retayne also shalbe retayned power neuer entitle church withall yet gaue power vnto onely purposed endue holy spirite value church christ christ owne lawes decree pope euident wordes spake vnto disciplesmar ye know seeme rule ouer nation lordes ouer theyr prince haue dominion ouer shall greatest shall humble himselfe minister rest sonne man came ministred vnto minister himselfe geue lyfe redemption many luce made iudge betwixt taught like wise paule2 cor weapon warrefare carnall mighty power god wherewith captiuate vnderstanding wisedome subiection vnto christ agayne let euery man esteeme v minister christ stewardes misteryes god cor paule place2 cor lordes ouer faith helper ioy fayth made perfect sence also peter1 pet lordes ouer clergy sayth agayne thyrd chapter epistle meaning expresse efficacy gospell doth call ministery flesh spirite therefore end may make v spirituallrom doth wisely forbidde minister onely generally alike fashioned present word would saythe shape romish ierarchy beholde shape vgly deformity romish church hee aduised well royaltyes peter fulnes power authority swordes keyes church stollen away hanged vpon romish bunch toppe gallaut pontificall maiesty cardinalles legate preuayling aboue prynces empalled mytred byshoppes order shauelings swarmes mounckes fryer lawes bulles decree vse forcible ca non shotte theyr might power fearefull yea terrible also prince lord hymselfe cryeth mightely gospell kingdome world canne away thinges mighty earth pontificall prelate storme waxe wroth ye world enioy thyng subiect vnto power ierarchy meane while wordlythe counte faite authoritie pope fayne god church whose becke sight gorgones vgly face make astonyed monarch tetrarches earth haue magnified name catholicke forsooththe church wickedly defined papistes vertue name haue notyfied congregation dispersed vpon face whole earth agreeing together one conformity doctryne worshypping christ whyche doth make true catholicke church meane hereby onely ierarchy haue tyed fast ye romyshe see hereunto greater aduauncement authority haue deuised trymme tytle antiquity behold say euer church ye church rome church glorying vpon tytle antiquitye whereas neuer one thing doth differre antiquity wherein romish skippiacks seeme conceit much lyke litle boyes playing comedyes plautus vpon stage one playeth part chremes menedemus cremilus beyng yet come hoary grayheaded course yeares sette graue countenauce vpon matter seeme olde men gazers vpon skaffoldes put vpon counterfayt trynckets witte white hoary beard vpon theyr chynne gray white locke vpon theyr heades counterfayting theyr gate stooping crooching rest handes vpon staffe shaking tremblyng fashion theyr voyces bigge like olde men doyng certayne witty crafty conueyaunce counterfayting behold theyr outward handling gesture would say olde men discharge theyr roabes plucke theyr vysours shall finde nothing lesse haue fayned themselues much vnlike dottrell ierarchy rome wonder see many yeares vaunteth continuauncehow romishe stager doe counterfayt olde antiquitye wordes voyce countenaunce gesture outward resemblaunce fiftene hundreth yeares say predecessor beginne sitte chayre euen first foundatio prymitiue church erected christ himselfe established apostle confirmed co tinuall course neuer fayling succession receiued generall consent auntient father hath remayned bene deriued vnto v aperpetuall permanent deliuery succession church call euangelicall church euer seene heard time man verely vysours stagelike gugawes wherewith romish counterfaytes haue played tragicall partes wherewith haue beguiled many simple people hetherto lett v plucke theyr visor discouer bellygod pope whytes maye throughly behold manner puppette smoath apish church within fiftene hundreth yeares sithence say church wherein raygne like lordes hath vnchaunged continuaunce albeit small purpose cotinuaunce thing false altogether vntrue prescribe vpon yet age ye church great preted lette shew antiquity thinges place tymes person one apostle euangelistes one auncient father auncient church euer heare name vniuersall pope manifest declaration romish church nothing thousand yeares last past heard would permitt church law euer enforce binde church generally ordinary succession one churche euer appoynted great toppegallaunt wordes god hath taught discerne betwixt false prophettes true prophet persisted stedfast councell sayth declared wordes people surely turned people away euill way fro wicked thought wordes ieremye huckester eloquence doth make huge heape wordes needelesse long tedious rehearsall vertues vyces wherein might haue done much better iudgement leauing childish copye countenaunce glorious mulplying frequented apostlesthe iudiciall vse keyes yet applyed great vrgent necessitie besides tyme vsuall execution keyes commonly vse euery well ordered congregation whereas preacher doth openly proclayme authoritie word euerlastyng lyfe whosoeuer truly vnfaynedly repenting beleeuyng christ jesu doth el open kyngdome heauen key close fast agayne neede shall require euen materiall keye witnesseth thomas doores openedtho lib dist barres gynne beyng forced backe forclose passadge would enter euen hearyng word fayth ariseth blockes barres sinne turned waye keyes therfore rightly sayd comitted minister church wherewith vnlockyng locke vnloasing obstacle sinnes lead conduct sinner heaue open eye blind power paule also furnished lord selfe beyng sent vnto gentile actes thou mayest open eye sayth whereby may couerted darckenes light deliuered power sathan vnto god may attaine remission sinnes portion emongest saintes fayth christ iesu lord power keyes great geuen beseech syr could peter sent miracle great signes emongest people wherfore wordes byndyng lowsing consiste power holy ghost propagation fayth ministery reconciliation publishyng gospell aunswere myne opposed aduersary make doth byshop rome onely preach gospell onely endued power holy ghost doe byshops minister preach word well whece hath notable prelate notorious fullnes graunt much minister churche keyes commeded together byshop romewhether remissio sin church without vse keyes wherewith may deteigne release sinnes accordyng power comited vnto yet ought power narrowly streighted either one byshop onely emparted also minister wise though none remissio sinnes besides churche vnlesse come minister keyes pope pardon though man could make selfe way passable heauehow much publike keye much euery man fayth effectuall remission sinnes vnlesse admitted popish porter minister minister doth open deede yet doth open ye euery one may open also selfe owne fayth also doth voyce authoritie minister breake bandes sinnes sunder hartely repent yet neuerthelesse sentence remayneth alwayes vnreproueable iustified fayth haue peace god lord sauiour iesu christ rom luke also feare beleue onely thou art made whole thing possible doth beleue place purifiing harte fayth moreouer heare lord himselfe speaking may receiue remission sinnes portion amongest sanctified fayth math although serue great purpose church haue due consideration release made christ name ministery faythfull minister yet force effectualnesse fayth title diminished hereby may make way passable throne maiesty assured confidence neither must thinke lord gaue vnto minister large commission opening keyes remayne none meanes attayne forgeuenesse sinneswhen vse key ought ministred may sometimes come passe euen happeneth often voyce coucell minister must needes inquyred man time ouer greeuously assaulted fayth conscience miserably entangled timerous feare conscience brought dispayre greater mishappe shall happen vrge must vse keyes applyed necessity hereof came lord would vouchsafe furnish minister power opening shutting make perfect full worke iustification onelye necessarye reliefe comfort unbecillitye weakenesse thomas lib dist therefore thomas aquinas doth erre fowly deceiued many thinges notably reasoneth commetaries distinction keyes church releasing pardoning therefore committed minister able without ayde minister open thomas established error sprang vppe deceaued necessitye compulsary confession whereby christian constrayned craue pardon sinnes christ fayth priest confession speake thinke confession altogether repent end therfore doth reckon place fourth roome emongest holy one graunted also doth osorius lye hath thrust lymbum patrum osori pag purgatory reason sayth although might haue repented filthy wicked lyfe last yet ought neuerthelesse kept fast lockt within gayle purgatory vntill tyme hadd suffered sufficient punishment according appointment god wherein osorius doe say truely gloser doth lye agayne paules wordes corinthian chap1 cor osorius obiection wordes paule wherein osorius doth committ doubble errour first sence wordes next knitting vp argument whereas paul hath wordes nonlatin alphabet osorius doth expound though necessaryly spoken themosorius doth erre meaning paule doe receaue baptisme stead dead aunswere faith whereas meaning apostle doth seeme agreably appliable receauing baptisme doe putt nature condition dead men profession conuersation though lyue otherwise maner naturall liuing men therefore often man sprinckled holy founteyne sayd protest doth vtterly oportunitie offered ca applyed aptly present agreable reason kill swordes catch owne pittfall whereas chiefest substauce sacrifice especially sacrifice offred sinnes consisteth slayeng body sheadyng bloud would therfore learne reason denomination sacrifice may properly applyable popish masse whereas neither slaughter body sheadyng bloud discernable represented say memoriall sheadyng bloud graunt holy euchariste therefore doth expresse actuall killyng body actuall sheddyng bloud truth deede representeth memoriall onelythe eucharist doth forgeue sinnes doth represet memory true forgeuenesse bycause denyed say hereof commeth passe wheras remission sinnes otherwise obteined killyng body sheadyng bloud cause therefore euchariste executeth actuall sheadyng bloud representeth onely memoriall thereof selfe geue forgeuenesse sinnes onely represent vnto v memoriall true remission sinnes way representation onely accoumpt shall make pray dreadfull decree tridentine father haue hundred flash order mary mother christ bene wholy assumpted heaue would man dought rames would haue bene bragged vpon emogest whole rable mockery yet notwithstanding many reliques heare milk stick fast earth assumpted men visite heare rome ladyes church aboue mynerue also heare sauiours spayne matscoue cluniacum nuceria floure iaqueries many place milke shall begyn speakeour lady milke lett one thyng suffice reader yt blessed nourse geue much milke set forth euery abroad seene holy religious house ye temple monckes frier nunnes surely would haue bene aboundance enough haue sufficed babe sucklynges bethleem would haue geuen sucke long liued meane space recite place whereunto pilgrimes reporte visite reliques milke neither earnestly craue know may seeme credible much milke might gathered one seely uirgine preserued corruption many hundred yeares make rehearsall rest uirgines furniture playne mockery surely reckon vpp infinite peece worke first touchyng smocke one carmutum ayre germany wyde large yt couteruaileth greatnes priestes long white surplice true smocke deedeour lady smocke surely must needes woman monstrous body touchyng kerchiefesour lady kerchiefe whereof one tryers rusheth vpon poore lutheranes horrible accusation high treason pray whether life prince hath bene preserued de owred theyr practiseosori pag treason hath bene conspired agaynst theyr lyues theyr crownes vproares raysed germany agaynst charles emperour fraunce agaynst henrye kyng england edward doth affirme poysoned lutheran agaynst queene mary scotland agaynst king affirmeth horribly murthered yea syr last speake true indeed name author murther play mumme budgett yea agaynst prince onely agaynst many prynces besides osorius doth boldly say conspyracies haue bene attempted lutheranes doth emongest kynges prince germany fraunce england scotland named reckon vpp also prynces turky scithia persia india aethiopia emperor kinges potentate great sophye emperour persia moskouia prester iohn sithence taketh great delight lying doth shamelesse face exclayme lutheranes haue conspired treason procured poysons agaynst person forasmuch hys lying therein cann beare better countenaunce doth rest forasmuch slaunders wisely sufficiently aunswered mayster haddon first book labor lost abuse reader time refuting vntruthes alreadye confounded especiallye sithence cause doth neither concerne doctrine professe sithence osorius proued lyar herein person easily scottish queene selfe speake nothing meane space publique generall testimony germany fraunce england therefore passing ouer prince frame selfe part complaynt concerneth gracious queene elizabeth aboue rest beseech thee getle reader lett seeme tedious vnto thee pawse whyles thou mayst perceiue like deuine osorius doth behaue himselfe framing himselfe discourse vpon ecclesiasticall gouernement doth constantly denye meete shoulde committed creditte temporall king much lesse queene respect queenes maiesty shall take ill part though defaced part honor doth humbly craue pardon grace honorable prefaceosor pag man presume extenuate part honour rather doth wishe hys hart may partes abound vertue may shrined saynct ioyfully embrace godly modesty sweete byshopp loe found vnthankefull vnto vertues doth hartely wish gratious queene requitall curtesy doe pray god endue much heauenly grace may conuert vayneglorious papisticall babler frendly follower embracer infallible truth gospell lett v returne agayne ecclesiasticall supremacy osorius doth yoake fast byshopp onely doth vtterly exclude kinges queenes especially charge ecclesiasticallosori doth exclude prince fro ecclesiasticall gouernement verilye adiudgeth cann come greater infamy religion church ceremonyes ordinaunces church priestly dignityes holynesse subiect gouernement woman owne word wherein meaneth himselfe either doth sufficiently expresse telling tale el blockishnesse surely comprehed deepenesse doth swell hawtynesse speech while endeuoureth waxed winges flee beyond view common sence aboue bright cloudes playne grammer heat skalding braynes hath drowned himselfe deepe reaching beyond reach reacheth nothing wherefore renouncing length curious cripsing blazing brauery hawtye speech begyn last declare vnto v playne tearmes distinctly playnely rhetoryck meaneth wordes holynesse subiect gouernement woman meane thinges theselues holy deuine quarrell altogether vntrue wherewith charge queenes maiesty queene euer desire gouerne euer desire beare rule ouer holy sacred thinges holynesse whereof make mention holy ordinaunces benefice minister vnderstand personage men say minister themselues byshoppes holy thynges frequented exempt person lawfull gouernement theyr owne prince herein shew selfe lesse iniurious queene manifest rebell paule geueth farr commaundement scripture witt euery soule ought submitt selfe power owne magistrate upon place paule chrisostome making exposition doth exempt kinde people subiectionchrisost vpon romaine spareth comprehend vnder gouernement higher power person one law aswell apostle themselues prophettes euangelistes mounkes lett v peruse argumentes wherewith gentle obedient childe pope good grace doth make wordes warrantable osor pag tell pray please fayth euer reade christian prynce dyd take vpon hym office pope truely confesse trueth heare neuer neuer christian prynce shamelesse presume take vpon grat function professe himselfe head vniuersall church challenge prerogatiue consistory common god vsurpe swordes spirituall temporall compell humayne creature vpon payne damnation sweare allegeaunce yelde power authority vnder therefore may bolde demaund like question wordes pray tell v may please osorius euer discerne shamelesse impudency mortall creature tyme would presume arrogatly entrude vpo onely possession inheritauce almighty god challenge interest therein owne right besides onely high byshopp lett v heare osorius doth prosecute argumentes nay rather prince sayth embrace godlynesse iustice reuerence iudgementes priestes obay byshoppes without refusall wiselye accompt greatest part theyr honour subiect theyr commaundementes ciuill law matter equity determinable example law prince haue done haue done doth make much purpose right must decided law witt ought haue bene done auswere yt hath bene many mighty monarch whose ouermuch tendernesse lenity towardes pope byshoppes hath procured destruction vtter ruyne theyr owne e ate theyr realmes withallhow pernitious obedience pope hath alwayes bene christia prince whenas rodolph duke swelad reuolted owne emperor hery instigation pope successe obedience pope came vnto let historyes report henry fifth became traytor agaynst emperour owne father procurement pope obay fraunce vnentreatable massacre popishe obedience wherewith prince osorius doth suppose circumspectly thrust neckes vnder pope gyrdle contrary mynde beleeue veryly prince might haue demeaned selues onely rule doctrine also euill example lyues haue rooted shamefastnes modestye ciuilitye obedience first two lye chopp lett v search woundesosor pag moreouer steed fayth freedome haue bestowed vpon familiar presumptio rashnes together vnpunishable lycentiousnes sinning haue steede true righteousnes brought false deceitfull righteousnes haue made god authour wickednes decayed church promised restore auncient integritye haue defiled abhominations much man doth encline discipline much estraunged shamefastnes chastitie c old winde shaken broomes worne bare stumpes hath bene handled sufficiently haue new broomes furthermore man may easily descry nature doctrine foudacion churchosor pag pray forsooth venus cupido founder church breach lawes contempt pope haue encreased flattery lying hath supported greedy couetousnes hath established crueltye agaynst saintes hath sanctified tymerous feare men hath straightened finally doctrine men sent god sturred vpp sathan hath troublesome vndertaken ranckor malice supported earthly treasure haue bene furthered encreased speciall prouidence almighty god neither doubted bene pollicy man onely rather speciall appoyntment heauenly father accompted newe doctrine sightthe doctrine gospell first sprong vpp renewed fro log darkenes freedome lightsomnesse apoc cloathed flesh color buddeth blossomes fresh restored auncient beauty therefore call newhatcht neuer heard though neuer seene heard thirty yeares sithece shall say christ three dayes lying graue returned agayne life fro tombe therfore christ wh death read apocalips two prophetes whose bodyes throwen streetes reuiue came life agayne thee dayes halfe iij dayes halfe sayth breath life breathed god c meanyng whereof cann extended wayes thyng el vnto doctrine gospell doctryne gospell christ nowe risen agayne open world doungeon darckenesse deepe drowned blindenesse wherein hath bene long suppressed therefore gospell alwayes iohn husse ierome prage greater part boheme embrace gospell luther borne order doctrine professed england many yeares dayesthe auciet witness professours gospell time wiclef swinderbee brute others also place likewise amogest others namely valdenses albingenses grecian italian moskouites asye affricke europe betengarius bertrame peter de aliaco iohn scotus peter iohannes william de sancto amore robert frenchman hott zealous pope raked professe present confesse fayth article creede professe barnard dyscourse free iustification fayth teach doctrine luther hath vttered writing augustine disputyng vpon fayth grace agaynst free doth treat vpon matter zuinglius caluine doe treat vpon vse sacramentes haue extaunt v long treatise written saxon toung many hundred yeares thirty yeares speake witness professours doctrine fayth englishman acknowledge present cause doth enduce thinke entred vpon new gospell dare shake fro shoulder yoake subiectio vsurped papisticall see long dayes robert gostred notably learned famous beyng byshop lincolnerob grostred h lyncolne commaunded speciall letter innocetius pope enduct certein boy kinsman owne benefice within ye byshopricke lincolne unlearned unskillfull language openly resist withall sharpely inueigh agaynst pope detestable prouisions call doe alledge example men ratifying continuaunce christes gospell creditt whereof doth neither depend vpon maintenaunce man streighted within prescription tyme howsoeuer humaine action tosse frothe gospell christ true newe neuer persist one setled state certes gospell christ gospel christ deede new straunge thing haue originall author christ himselfe sonne god whereas latter dayes tongue mouthes godly preacher stopt shutt vp terror tyranny pope daring manifest themselues open congregation sett libertye boutifull mercy god restored auncient freedome shall therefore accuse gospell innouation shall rather embrace great liberalitye god wt thankfulnes mindes geue dutifull attendaunce vpon trueth wherefore whereas portingall parrot prateth much xxx xl yeares limitation herein behaueth himselfe iniuriously perceaueth new face euangelicall doctrine glister shyne farre wyde abroad ouer christendome tyme resplendisaunt lightsome tyme certeine forefather late yeares whereas neuerthelesse christ alwayes preserue embrace church lyke mercye fauour therefore accompteth gospell christ new straunge doctrine contrary christ also osorius alone supposeth many deuines wandring inlyke error maliciously wroth agaynst luther though others first deuisours coyners gospell vntrueth nothing vntruewhat chiefe cause meanes restoring trueth gospell nay rather luther neuer bene borne bucer caluine neuer taught yet could ignoraunce shamelesse error haue longer lurked darknes one singuler especiall prouidece god whereby luther sent abroad ye world inestimable benefite god blessing prepared behoofe church meane singuler excellet art emprinting meanes pleased god good mercy prouide weaknes church withall auege himselfe vpon tyrannous cruelty certein secret vnsearchable maner imediately iohn husse ierome prage ye holy martyr god horrible fury wickednes consumed ash veritye gospell suppressed tyranny could neither suffred speake franckly shew face abroad boldely eskape rauenous gaping freely skarse x yeres come gonne place two poore prophetts almighty god raysed vpp holy prophetts patriarch apostle euangelistes holy doctours church martyr confessours interpretours holy scripture certeine army heauenly knightes armed poyntes encounter outragious assaultes could permitted speake openly church tyranny begann presse reason vnreasonable insensibilytye vnsauery subtlety wryth wrest defacing doctrine haddon conceaue outward lybertye freedome preacher though doctrine better creditt longer continuaunce last thyrty yeares shamelesly many hundred yeares preferre auncienty mahumets sect knowledge gospell bene conuenient good syr haue learned diligent enquirye whether comparison sectes doe serue fittly pampered papane asmuch heathenish paganisme prophane papacye whelped nere one tymethe yeare antichrist almost within compasse one yeare yeare doe accompt reueled computation iohn sixe hu dreth sixty sixe deepe deuine hath reasonably well beaten braynes matter diuynitye doth beginne cast new floorish haue cast prosperitye stayed estate prince presuming vpon politique wisedome councell kinges queenes chiefly aboue others gracious queene elizabeth modesty ought attemper prosperous success happy tranquillitye estate trust much fawning fortune nothing certeine course lyfe osori pag many perills feared matter pleasaunt prosperous viewe thing daungerous carelesse securitye osorius exhortation queene elizabeth light followeth darkenesse calme come clowdes euen whole course lyfe hath continuall enterchaunges ioy sometymes surprised sodeyne sorrow agayne heauinesse chaunged honour thinges carryed certaine vehement whyrling vnstablenesse fleyng vane windemill forced boreas blastes thinges aloft sodenly throwen downe contrarywise thing simple base doe instant mount aloft commeth ofte passe god displeased withall ouershadow fruitfull aboundaunce vertue grace endue happy assuraunce fyue yeares onely many yeares continuaunce greater fall deeper may wound according old prouerbe higher wall greater fall briefly state honour firme sure garded wherein man may assure himselfe minute safetye doth euidently appeare example craesus vanquished cyrus prepared vpo pyle wood ready bourned cry vpo solon lowd voyce demaunded cyrus solon craesus doth declare councell long receaued solon whereupon cyrus commaunding taken downe stacke wood thereby learned bridle choler onely preserue lyue hadd great reuerence estimation farre forth osorius euen bowel hystories philosophy wherein much mislike good councell whereunto glorious flooryshes framed queene elizabeth anye potentate prince world king portingall proper pigsnye pope place hath soueraygne lady whose princely mildenes doth surmount treate cause dispute controuersies religion wherein seeme meere straunger goe groapyng lyke blyndman wandryng altogether iudgement withall professed enemy maiestie glorious gospell takyng vpon part honest friendly man thought good aduertize friendly louingly employ study trauayle kynde learnyng surceasing presumptuous boldnesse rash writyng vnaduised decyding controuersies wherewith meanely generall myslikyng auayle nothyng publique commoditie hereunto tended whole scope mynde meanyng haddon doe causelesly miscouster agaynst euen though debated catholickes doe vsually accustome old wemen poore badger carter cobbler meaner state poore christias doe prohibite horrible manacings cruell prohibitios fro ye reading sacred scripture none otherwise bookes hygh treason deede doe interprete matter farre otherwise euer haddon meane therfore place nyppyng satyricall scoffe pretily pyke horace uerses wherewithall doth dally damasippus beyng old meary conceited man resembling old dottarde silenus virgile ridiculously vnseasonably deride haddo withall goddes goddess rewarde barbour good counsell horace ser lib satir nay rather keepe barbour stoare selfe osor rascall rabble sinoath shauelynges respect first second clippyng nypping shearing shauing must needes room dayly barbours shoppes also doe accompt haynous matter weare long bearde also especified satyre say euen dishheaded dranes shauelyng cowled rowte bare scraped scalpes beyng new fangled marke circumcision haue glorified churchthe circumcision crowne amogest papistes osor pag carrying marke beast vpon crownes barbour horace whatsoeuer serue turne much fittly upon wordes poet proceede forewarde meanes doe know well euertell say haue bestowed longer tyme vpon readyng holy scripture vpon cicero demosthenes aristotle plato truly perfourme deede osorius wordes emporte much commended bookes declare otherwise howbeit nothyng mistrust busily exercized readyng scripture function dignitie requireth haddon obrayde matter litle nothyng apply perusing conference scripture also meane nothyng lesse forbidd beyng byshop say priest study practize god holy testament wherein doe vnhonestlye slaunder belye without cause therefore cann see end wordes inferre hereupon wherewith seeme fight owne shadow preuaile wise lawfull geue full liberty wemen porter osor pag carter tattle clatter without iudgement matter diuinitie skorpionlike nipping bitternesse wherein vnmeasurably lauish seeme beyond cosideratio personage owne whole discourse remayneth sufficient witnes wch doth breath bray spew nothing el flame fierbrads
