reason argumentes testimonyes refuse challenge c herewithall meane space enterla ed place pauletit whereby taught eschew company endurate heretyques twise admonition forasmuch condemned theyr owne iudgement rule ye apostle must obserued duely ought surely nothing force maintaine departure fromout papisticall see commauded authority apostle auoyde company twise warned conuerted theyr waywarde obstinacye error fellowshipp partaking ought haue conuenticle polluted many hereticall error bastardly estraunged defiled heathenish idolatry absurde tradition manifest blasphemy doth onely couple filthye stenche deuelish doctrine sciffenecked obstinate supportauce also adde thereunto pharisaicall tyrannicall persecution wherefore thinke best passe ouer eschew society henceforth therein follow owne affection osorius god name whereas geue v full skoape frett fume exclayme much lyste truely mynded affectioned rush rudely men interest seeke disfrauchise froward malapert sawcinesse whiche law armes haue valiantlye wonne field therefore shall freely without impeachment continew still possession owne proper title much rather disclayme kinde faculty doe excell mayster craft lett v heare milde byshopp reasoning vnquiet haddon neuer prouoke say word writing beyng neuer knew osori pag myne epistle doe infame slauderous railyng cleare vnseemely speech vnlesse perhappes say iust quarrell true discouery error wickednesse kinde reproche c first say somewhat touching epistle haddon shall spoken afterwardes therefore wittes distempered wyne wrate epistle haue forgotte wrate epistle haue one reprochefull word beseeche name shall geue wordes wherewith rage onely agaynst luther though dissolute perso common barretor manqueller withall agaynst congregation professe true gospell christ agaynst carried carterly kinde rayling foule mouth slaunderous tauntesosorius epistle queene elizabeth full slaunderous reproches men raging maddnesse doe rend sunder established order law religion pag frantyque preaching bookes exile shamefastnes put honesty slight treade vnder foote lawes positiue politique proclayme hauocke sinning defile temple skorne holynes support vnshamefastnesse supplat christia society horrible fierbrades discord pag whose enterprise tend none end spoyling prince theyr liues may conspyre full consentes agaynst vtter rooting theyr dignityes honour haue raught hence already poyson others doe page duplicate page duplicate practise destroy sword pag finally calleth false prophetts pag wheresoeuer sett foote ground purpose enforce theyr gospell vpon ignoraut farr reformation maners doe defile thinges muche stench found abandone ciuility geue skoape couetousnesse raunge riotously renouncing feare god graunt free libertye doe maner mischieues without cotrollement shamelesse carelessenesse seeme wish nothing rather see vtter confusion thinges pag onelye themselues estraunged honesty accompt yea ratify matter haynous also hygh treaso man dare bolde vow perpetuall chastity religion sake pag also affirme wicked sorrowfull sinne pag say sorrowfull teares emport weakenesse wat fayth pag much ye professor ye gospell let v heare blasphemous tongue touching gospell selfe ye doctrine thereof doth call ye name secte wordes beleeue gracious queene sayth secte sinnes hath inuaded many partes christendome ruine comoweales canker ciuilitie dissipation realme small destruction princely renowme pag place making mecion ye gospell doth exclame wise gospell full conspiracye false dissimulation promiseth lardge good thinges procureth present infection maketh fayre countenaunce hope freedome cloggeth yoakes intollerable bondage doth persuade glauering allurement present felicity afterwardes drowneth soule deepe doungeon dispayre preacheth direct way vnto heauen trust vpon assuraunce thereof doth throw downe headlong hell page agayne proceading ye epistle doth geue iudgemet ye doctrine gospeller affirmeth wholy patcht together craftes subtiltyes satha pag haue rehearsed owne wordes osorius least owne wordes guest best farre doe differ reprochefull slaunderous raylyng eye know conceipt appeareth none otherwise poet would rayse vp furyes hell megera alecto fiery lake lye rayle could haue imagined speaches apt appropried reprochefullnesse epistle seemeth wherefore make epistle excusable haynous slaunderyng without manyfest lye also respect true wherein doe accuse haddon cryme say neuer knowen osori pag euer prouoked euill word yet doth gnawe epistle slaunderous teeth doth rushe ragingly vpon wilde boare deadly wounded hunter speare good sooth osorius doe lyuely represent vnto v singuler patterne olde pharisee gospell briefly beholding small moate brother eye able discerne monstruous beame eye forcible dazeled blindenes selfe loue euen lyke insensibiltye doth osorius beyng himselfe cursed speaker expostulate haddon cursed speakingantithesis figure whereby one contrary ioyned say neuer prouoked deede neuer name confesse beastly epistle mostruous antithesis neuer sawe foolishely talkatiue rayle agaynst many godly personage one noumber vnder predicamet slaundered could acknowledge common quarrell iniurye others stretched also vnto himselfe therefore made aunswere owne behalfe though without owne furniture pollicye yet much modestly say became surely quietly great deale importunate aduersary deserued requisite according desert osorius haue hadd entreatable aunswerer farre maner aunswere might haue blazed armes right colour haue paynted altogether according due deseruings haddon thought better haue cosideration publique humanity owne priuate griefe yet though attempted force sharpenesse penne agaynst wonder see mounteynes rend abroade impeached saye teazed iniurious word go howe people natio england displeased must needes rage rudely agaynst rather haddon might agaynst proceade yet runneth furiously agaynst though say wylde boare deadly wounded boarspeare c furiously pray would fayne learne doth commend witt prayse dexteritye nature aduaunce eloquencea comparison betwixt haddon osorius highly esteeme bookes especially wrate nobilitye selfe cofesse lesse part madd man courteous commendation frendly wellwiller beseech thee gentle reader iudge herein indifferently difference betwixt disposition two haddon osorius wherof one doth frendly prayses aduaunce style eloquence artificiall disposition wordes osorius thother vngratefull creature man beast blynded selfe loue drowned malice swallowed vpp owne conceipt doth vouchsafe man men iudgements graue wise excellently learned one ynche much commendable place emongest learned shameth condemne euen base ignoraunce extreame childishnes one yt able expres mouth owne meaning vtter nothing purely nothing fully nothing playnely wherein doe appeale reader iudgemet whether haddon doth rage agaynst osorius lyke furyous boare whether osorius doe impudently lye agaynst haddon lyke shamelesse goate meadowes haue bene reasonably well ouerflowed alreadye thinke amisse shutt vpp hatch enterlude length come last cast wherein tourne coate getting new coape vpon back putting visor vpon face doth chaunge himselfe angell light man would veryly thinke one superexcellent seraphycall sort ix order aungells flowen downe fro heauen speaking whotte burning zeale charityeosor pag calling god himselfe wittnes iudge doth binde himselfe holy protestatio firmely beleeue vndertooke trauaile wryting agaynst haddo vrged thereuto cause earnest desire zealous affection vnto pure sincere religio haue heard affection let v harken dutyfull loue christian charity brotherly compassion lett v weepe ioy wise doth proceede know sayth great compassion take deepe desire rauished sauetye part good christian man osor charity sauety would willingly suffer losse lyfe countryman sake surely would become frendes c duetyes partes true loue charitye may valued wordes matter found vertuous minde may seeme louing fully replenished charitable zeale sauety loue greater man yeald ouer owne lyfe man safety vouchsafe compare wordes written slaunders tauntes reproches skattered euery examine osorius thoroughly within without afrayd man shall finde man proofe appeareth wordes cleane contrary conditioned man much differing shape cicero doth vnfittly decypher vnto vscicero booke duetyes kindes fraude vnrighteous dealing none pestilent sayth craft men doe deceaue handle matter may taken honest men much vnlyke hereunto seemeth haue happened osorius present hath slaundered rayled lyke common skold cage backbyting reuyling name couersations men whose lyfe neuer knew vnderstandeth doctrine yea insolent kinde sawcynesse nypping skoffing common barretor could haue fiercely exclaymed agaynst rascall world haue forged shamelesse lye tourning typpett doth beginne doe many men wont doe malice haue wounded one greuously headd thinke salue iniury agayne puttyng cappe headd telling mery tale robin hoodde semblably osorius hauing well whett owne humor vpo reproches slaunders otherwise vnsatiable cursed speaking outragiously raging manner filthynesse agaynst doth know hauyng discharged stomake gall melancholy doth endeuor perswade warres practizeth discorde scattereth continuall broyles hath wallowed many yeares agaynst chief prince potetates ye world monstruous poyson botch erronious doctrine hath vomited agaynst church floudd christian bloud hath spilte many thousand soules hath bereft life christ suffred bitter passion finally hath tourned thyngs typsy tyruye say mumme budgett alltogether speciall principle rhetoricke briefly call v churche embracying fayth christian faythfull man may meanes professe except renounce true churche christ vnlesse vtterly denye christ selfe fayth herein neither shall conuenient v agree become partaker horrible bootchery shall become require v thereunto moreouer assuredly trust christ neuer permitt v haue aunswered briefly could yet speake somewhat briefly man dare hardy chaunge counterfei peruert lawes statute autentique monumentes earthly prince testament deadd person sort canuasse word god prince would permitt treachery realme hundred gallowes torture would seeme litle haynous offence shalbe sayd hauyng mangled made hauocke euerlastyng testament god whereunto adde diminishe therefrom title lawfull vpon payne damnation treadyng vnder foote ordinaunces lord lordes hauyng chaunged counterfayted fine pure gold sacred scripture coyned vnto v drosse ofscombe religion wherein must forced lyue lawes ordinaunces christ decree decretalles beseech shall reasonable osorius allure v kynde conformitie lyfe promise v euerlastyng glory ioye company heauen wherein osorius doth expresse deede certein glorious presumption courage wonderfully fawnyng vpon owne dexteritie howbeit whatsoeuer sounde shrill trumpett osorius shall noyse forth portingall must neuerthelesse geue attentyue eare rather trumpett god marke diligently whereunto calleth v soundyng vnto v farre vnlyke marche commaundeth v wise goe raye depart auncient standarde vpon greeuous payne least partaker treason punished plaguesapoc agayne cruell manaces threatenyng shall receaue marke beast either forehead hand doth promise euerlastyng glory reioysing company heauenapocal bitter cuppe god euerlastyng wrathe myngled wyne cuppe god vengeaunce shalbe tormented sayth fire brimstone sight holy angelles face lambe smoake tormentes shall ascende world without ende apocal doe humbly hartely beseeche mercyfull lord tourne farre away v prayer come ende apologye finished ende knitting vp reader much osor haue sufficiently debated matter together remayneth vse conference godly christian reader herein would aduertize way wordes well aduised osorius malice truely vnhonest affection disquieted minde conceaued agaynst man moued hereunto necessary instinct well wishing harte respect young men altogether voyde commedable knowledge learning though perhappes otherwise well setled iudgement may easily carryed away vayne conceipt allured outward glittering brauery osorius minion eloquence seely fish caught sugred hayte vnlesse flee hidden hooke thought good admonish meaning dissuade reading osorius bookes altogether defraud osorius prayseworthy grace eloquent style extenuate glory haue deserued therein truely neither acquainted ye countenaunce man doe much regard outward foyle paynted speech howsoeuer man shall streake himselfe blazing beauty fyled tongue concerneth nothing also apperteigneth little matter thing requier namely byshopp priest deuine therfore man shall take pleasure floorishing forme osorius phrase remoued fragraunt flower osorius speech lett enioy delight god name lett read bookes ye yea doe wishe hartely euery person would reade peruse witness matter directly men may determine creditt person therefore lett reade say whosoeuer minded lett onely carry booke dayly handes lull also bosomes gaynesay therein councell onely geue reade iudgement neuerthelesse esteeme rhethoricia artificiall orator take deuine become rauished gorgeous gaze prancked peacocke fixed faste fyne feature fawning feather behold blacke feete withall lett enamored delicate deuises smoath scholemaster yt geue meane tyme creadulous eare counterfaicte craft proper pack haue allwayes minde pythy sentence epicharmus wise nonlatin alphabet light beliefe withall take especiall care haue desire imitate wryting enure themselues wise sawcy malapertnes slaundering cursed speakyng kinde contagion canker pestilent skattered abroad emongest ye conuersations christian men doe hartely wish vertuous witts studious youth may polluted crawling skabbe cann wonder sufficiently thinke frantique fury hath whirled prelate vnmeasurable outrage rayling penne matter goeth well enough side namely raunging speech agreable disordered profession lauish style coupled lewd doctrine could haue bene fitt bloudy religion bootcherly brawlyng currish cauilling lyke vnto lyke yet much commendable hadd bene withall much sitting seemely personage dignitye espying blemish wrinckle men maners error might haue bene offensiue hadd priest deuine byshopp friendly milde application persuadible scripture enduced ignoraunt better regard gentle enstruction rather rigorous rayling haue geuen simple demonstration soundnesse fayth rather haue bruted abroad beastely botch shamelesse impudencye propertye vertuous literature ciuill discipline called ciuilytye thereof reclayme raunging riott wandering wittes mildenes maners certein comely ciuilitye meeke modestye certes sauadge sawcynesse wayward wrangling whether may found emongest tyranous turkes know surely vnseemely learned men much vncomely deuines altogether blameworthy byshopps moreouer besides ye rule christian religion surely reason selfe would haue required much least yt reproching men fault mindefull owne reproue others faultes deede causelesly condene ye innocent forged crymes malicious cauillations also haue bene foreseene especiall poynt graue deuine yt sett purpose become prowling pickethanke men eskapes first peruse bookes earnest bent heedefulnes aduisedly note maner error make faythfull report accordingly foreiudging thinges knoweth carping ouer greedely thinges vnderstandeth corruptly deprauing rest well spoken osorius doth inueigh agaynst men neuer sawe doth defame lyfe neuer knew doth currishe eloquence gnaw bookes neuer handled condemning cause first partyes heard confuting first vnderstand requireth refutation much swaruing example dayes uenetians italian especially enflamed canckred malice agaynst french hugonoughtes neuer sawe demaunded paramoures vnskilfull young headds concerning qualyties disposition hugonoughts doe aunswere yt men certein mo struous shape men hauing dogges face glowing eye boares tuskes sprouting along snoughtes dragon head fowle outstretched cheekes lowling eares crowne headd bottome shoulder finally doe describe vgly mishapen deformitye kinde people deede may meanes make enuyed malitiously hated much otherwise good man osorius doth besturre himselfe agaynst lutheran first wheresoeuer may heare person named lutheran though know men themselues yet doth conceaue brayne name imagine hath paynted bookes witte outcaste churchrobbers traytours scorpion murtherers leacherous firebrandes whirlewindes world enemy mankynde spoylers prince heretiques scismatickes botch religio rooter vertue finally skarsely men vnder men countenauces nothing hellhoundes raysed vp satha himselfe agayne wheresoeuer doth heare mischieuous naughty packes treacherous villanyes common barretours infamed person reproched corruption opinion errours sectes scysmaticall deuisions heresy notorious deteitable crime execrable mischiefe doth forthwith conclude whatsoeuer vnder common name lutheranes without exception within one predicamet euen though contradiction contrariety diuersity sectes people iudgemets faction world lutheranes onely furthermore though sufficed procure maligned enough hath forged hereunto opinion false horrible blasphemous neither entred thought time euer eskaped fro mouthes writing although appeare manifestly infinite place manifest token euery yet lett one admitted example sake sayth shall beleue shall recouer healthosor lib de iustitia pag long feele selfe stricken pynched wyth gryefe sicknesse make force whether medicine applied long nourish myne owne sicknesse long mine owne wickednesse doth delight c deede beleeue doe thinke worthy beleeued pray one lutheranes euer dreame thing sleepe euer taught awake conscience shake engine distrust oftentimes happeneth amongst faithfull affliction whereas whole force mind doth imagine possible wayes meanes may counteruayle wrath indignation god lutheranes haue sett downe plaister soare taken phisick scripture namely fayth onely merites christ iesu contrary part osor vrgeth stoughtly reconciled vnto god fayth christ onely onely righteousnes workes wherein doe exercise selues thorough ayde assistauce grace true assertio appeale herein secret iudgementes learned meane space lett godly reader consider well wt slaunders iniurious accusation doth reproch godly vertuous personage whereas treate greeuous assaultes combates tormented conscience properly sinner stricken downe confounded remembraunce theyr owne sinnes vnto chiefly appertayneth comfortable promise fayth possible serious earnest repentaunce cann conceiue pleasure delight horrible wickednesse yet manifestly false forged slaunder osorius hath clowted vpp remnaunt patcheryes hence forsooth manye huge tempestes lightenynges thunderboltes many outragious exclamation tragedy earthquake raysed vpp agaynst poore abiect lutheranes lesse vnsauory shamelesse wherefore much desirous aduertyze godly zealous youth would suffer selues entangled meanes flattering fawning osorius bookes behaue themselues discrete moderation ye reading least ye serpet beguyle eue also may carryed away pure simplicity christ iesu god vayne send sonne world vayne geue especiall commaundement harken vnto moreouer vayne lykewise dyd sonne himselfe descending bosome father take vpon proclaime father heauen petition proceeding harty inward pure lo e excellent vndefiled prayer commendable conuersation life kinde vertue might haue auayled attaynment perfection saluation see cause cotrary heauenly father might haue taken away bitter cupp heauy displeasure sonne woundes could otherwise healed death deadly woudes sonne wound farr deepe deadly could curable pollicy power treasure workes action men briefly osorius hath spoken aduaunced iustice excellet integrity life skill cann yet shall neuer able bring passe contrary song dayly sing vnto christ shalbe vnuanquishable trueth thou onely art holy thou onely art holy ye thinke may gathered el creature whatsoeuer adorned neuer plausible opinion holynes neuerthelesse vncleane defiled sight god yet hereby derogate one hearebredth much ye grace god whose rich treasure confesse vnspeakeable dispersed ouer face whole earth notwithstanding also boldly professe grace wherein doth cosist highest honour perfect obedience neuer happen euer geuen vnto christ alone neede circumstauce vrge one reason agaynst osorius make end one prayer holy knitt vpp fewer wordes lordes prayer herein appeale conscience let pronounce one prayer vnto god sort faulty respect swarue thought fro absolute perfection righteousnesse whereupon doth bragg much vnremoueable conuersion mynde godward humble abacement himselfe dutyfull reuerence beseemyng vnspeakeable maiesty wyll yeld victory hartely desire wish vnto learned reader elect saynctes god whosoeuer professe name weare badge christ iesu departing iniquity gathering together one vniforme agreement sincere doctrine thenlightening inspiratio holyghost may together receiued heauenly ierusalem kingdome immortall glory eternall felicity shall neuer haue end workes righteousnesse haue done loue lord sauiour iesu christ suffered death sinnes rose agayne iustification amen london printed iohn daye dwellyng ouer aldersgate cum gratia priuilegio regiae maiestatis anno
